Hebrew: וַֽיְהִ֗י אַֽחֲרֵי֙ מ֣וֹת יְהוֹשֻׁ֔עַ וַֽיִּשְׁאֲלוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל בַּיהֹוָ֖ה לֵאמֹ֑ר מִ֣י יַעֲלֶה־לָּ֧נוּ אֶל־הַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֛י בַּתְּחִלָּ֖ה לְהִלָּ֥חֶם בּֽוֹ׃
Translated: After the death of Joshua, the Israelites inquired of G<small>OD</small>, “Which of us shall be the first to go up against the Canaanites and attack them?”
Transliteration: vayehiy acharey mvot yehvoshua vayishealu veney yisherael vayhovah lemor miy yaaleh-lanu el-hakhenaaniy vatechilah lehilachem vvo

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יְהֹוָ֖ה יְהוּדָ֣ה יַעֲלֶ֑ה הִנֵּ֛ה נָתַ֥תִּי אֶת־הָאָ֖רֶץ בְּיָדֽוֹ׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small> replied, “Let [the tribe of] Judah go up. I now deliver the land into their hands.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah yehudah yaaleh hineh natatiy et-haarets veyadvo

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהוּדָה֩ לְשִׁמְע֨וֹן אָחִ֜יו עֲלֵ֧ה אִתִּ֣י בְגֹרָלִ֗י וְנִֽלָּחֲמָה֙ בַּֽכְּנַעֲנִ֔י וְהָלַכְתִּ֧י גַם־אֲנִ֛י אִתְּךָ֖ בְּגוֹרָלֶ֑ךָ וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ אִתּ֖וֹ שִׁמְעֽוֹן׃
Translated: Judah then said to their brother-tribe Simeon, “Come up with us to our allotted territory and let us attack the Canaanites, and then we will go with you to your allotted territory.” So Simeon joined them.
Transliteration: vayomer yehudah leshimevon achiyv aleh itiy vegoraliy venilachamah vakhenaaniy vehalakhetiy gam-aniy itekha vegvoralekha vayelekhe itvo shimevon

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַל יְהוּדָ֔ה וַיִּתֵּ֧ן יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶת־הַכְּנַעֲנִ֥י וְהַפְּרִזִּ֖י בְּיָדָ֑ם וַיַּכּ֣וּם בְּבֶ֔זֶק עֲשֶׂ֥רֶת אֲלָפִ֖ים אִֽישׁ׃
Translated: When Judah advanced, G<small>OD</small> delivered the Canaanites and the Perizzites into their hands, and they defeated ten thousand of them at Bezek.
Transliteration: vayaal yehudah vayiten yehovah et-hakhenaaniy vehaferiziy veyadam vayakhum vevezek asheret alafiym iysh

Hebrew: וַֽ֠יִּמְצְא֠וּ אֶת־אֲדֹנִ֥י בֶ֙זֶק֙ בְּבֶ֔זֶק וַיִּֽלָּחֲמ֖וּ בּ֑וֹ וַיַּכּ֕וּ אֶת־הַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֖י וְאֶת־הַפְּרִזִּֽי׃
Translated: At Bezek, they encountered Adoni-bezek, engaged him in battle, and defeated the Canaanites and the Perizzites.
Transliteration: vayimetseu et-adoniy vezek vevezek vayilachamu vvo vayakhu et-hakhenaaniy veet-haferiziy

Hebrew: וַיָּ֙נׇס֙ אֲדֹ֣נִי בֶ֔זֶק וַֽיִּרְדְּפ֖וּ אַחֲרָ֑יו וַיֹּאחֲז֣וּ אוֹת֔וֹ וַֽיְקַצְּצ֔וּ אֶת־בְּהֹנ֥וֹת יָדָ֖יו וְרַגְלָֽיו׃
Translated: Adoni-bezek fled, but they pursued him and captured him; and they cut off his thumbs and his big toes.
Transliteration: vayanׇs adoniy vezek vayiredefu acharayv vayochazu votvo vayekatsetsu et-vehonvot yadayv veragelayv

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲדֹֽנִי־בֶ֗זֶק שִׁבְעִ֣ים ׀ מְלָכִ֡ים בְּֽהֹנוֹת֩ יְדֵיהֶ֨ם וְרַגְלֵיהֶ֜ם מְקֻצָּצִ֗ים הָי֤וּ מְלַקְּטִים֙ תַּ֣חַת שֻׁלְחָנִ֔י כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשִׂ֔יתִי כֵּ֥ן שִׁלַּם־לִ֖י אֱלֹהִ֑ים וַיְבִיאֻ֥הוּ יְרֽוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם וַיָּ֥מׇת שָֽׁם׃ {פ}
Translated: And Adoni-bezek said, “Seventy kings, with thumbs and big toes cut off, used to pick up scraps under my table; as I have done, so God has requited me.” They brought him to Jerusalem and he died there.
Transliteration: vayomer adoniy-vezek shiveiym melakhiym vehonvot yedeyhem verageleyhem mekutsatsiym hayu melaketiym tachat shulechaniy khaasher ashiytiy khen shilam-liy Elohim vayeviyuhu yerushala͏im vayamׇt sham {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּלָּחֲמ֤וּ בְנֵֽי־יְהוּדָה֙ בִּיר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם וַיִּלְכְּד֣וּ אוֹתָ֔הּ וַיַּכּ֖וּהָ לְפִי־חָ֑רֶב וְאֶת־הָעִ֖יר שִׁלְּח֥וּ בָאֵֽשׁ׃
Translated: The Judahites attacked Jerusalem and captured it; they put it to the sword and set the city on fire.
Transliteration: vayilachamu veney-yehudah viyrushala͏im vayilekhedu votah vayakhuha lefiy-charev veet-haiyr shilechu vaesh

Hebrew: וְאַחַ֗ר יָֽרְדוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֔ה לְהִלָּחֵ֖ם בַּֽכְּנַעֲנִ֑י יוֹשֵׁ֣ב הָהָ֔ר וְהַנֶּ֖גֶב וְהַשְּׁפֵלָֽה׃
Translated: After that the Judahites went down to attack the Canaanites who inhabited the hill country, the Negeb, and the Shephelah.
Transliteration: veachar yaredu veney yehudah lehilachem vakhenaaniy yvoshev hahar vehanegev vehashefelah

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֗ה אֶל־הַֽכְּנַעֲנִי֙ הַיּוֹשֵׁ֣ב בְּחֶבְר֔וֹן וְשֵׁם־חֶבְר֥וֹן לְפָנִ֖ים קִרְיַ֣ת אַרְבַּ֑ע וַיַּכּ֛וּ אֶת־שֵׁשַׁ֥י וְאֶת־אֲחִימַ֖ן וְאֶת־תַּלְמָֽי׃
Translated: The Judahites marched against the Canaanites who dwelt in Hebron, and they defeated Sheshai, Ahiman, and Talmai. (The name of Hebron was formerly Kiriath-arba.)
Transliteration: vayelekhe yehudah el-hakhenaaniy hayyvoshev vechevervon veshem-chevervon lefaniym kireyat areva vayakhu et-sheshay veet-achiyman veet-talemay

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֣לֶךְ מִשָּׁ֔ם אֶל־יוֹשְׁבֵ֖י דְּבִ֑יר וְשֵׁם־דְּבִ֥יר לְפָנִ֖ים קִרְיַת־סֵֽפֶר׃
Translated: From there they marched against the inhabitants of Debir (the name of Debir was formerly Kiriath-sepher).
Transliteration: vayelekhe misham el-yvoshevey deviyr veshem-deviyr lefaniym kireyat-sefer

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר כָּלֵ֔ב אֲשֶׁר־יַכֶּ֥ה אֶת־קִרְיַת־סֵ֖פֶר וּלְכָדָ֑הּ וְנָתַ֥תִּי ל֛וֹ אֶת־עַכְסָ֥ה בִתִּ֖י לְאִשָּֽׁה׃
Translated: And Caleb announced, “I will give my daughter Achsah in marriage to the man who attacks and captures Kiriath-sepher.”
Transliteration: vayomer khalev asher-yakheh et-kireyat-sefer ulekhadah venatatiy lvo et-akhesah vitiy leishah

Hebrew: וַֽיִּלְכְּדָהּ֙ עׇתְנִיאֵ֣ל בֶּן־קְנַ֔ז אֲחִ֥י כָלֵ֖ב הַקָּטֹ֣ן מִמֶּ֑נּוּ וַיִּתֶּן־ל֛וֹ אֶת־עַכְסָ֥ה בִתּ֖וֹ לְאִשָּֽׁה׃
Translated: His younger kinsman, Othniel the Kenizzite, captured it; and Caleb gave him his daughter Achsah in marriage.
Transliteration: vayilekhedah ׇteniyel ven-kenaz achiy khalev hakaton mimenu vayiten-lvo et-akhesah vitvo leishah

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י בְּבוֹאָ֗הּ וַתְּסִיתֵ֙הוּ֙ לִשְׁאֹ֤ל מֵֽאֵת־אָבִ֙יהָ֙ הַשָּׂדֶ֔ה וַתִּצְנַ֖ח מֵעַ֣ל הַחֲמ֑וֹר וַיֹּֽאמֶר־לָ֥הּ כָּלֵ֖ב מַה־לָּֽךְ׃
Translated: When she came [to him], she induced him to ask her father for some property. She dismounted from her donkey, and Caleb asked her, “What is the matter?”
Transliteration: vayehiy vevvoah vatesiytehu lisheol meet-aviyha hashadeh vatitsenach meal hachamvor vayomer-lah khalev mah-lakhe

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֨אמֶר ל֜וֹ הָֽבָה־לִּ֣י בְרָכָ֗ה כִּ֣י אֶ֤רֶץ הַנֶּ֙גֶב֙ נְתַתָּ֔נִי וְנָתַתָּ֥ה לִ֖י גֻּלֹּ֣ת מָ֑יִם וַיִּתֶּן־לָ֣הּ כָּלֵ֗ב אֵ֚ת גֻּלֹּ֣ת עִלִּ֔ית וְאֵ֖ת גֻּלֹּ֥ת תַּחְתִּֽית׃ {פ}
Translated: She replied, “Give me a present, for you have given me away as Negeb-land; give me springs of water.” And Caleb gave her Upper and Lower Gulloth.
Transliteration: vatomer lvo havah-liy verakhah khiy erets hanegev netataniy venatatah liy gulot mayiim vayiten-lah khalev et gulot iliyt veet gulot tachetiyt {f}

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י קֵינִי֩ חֹתֵ֨ן מֹשֶׁ֜ה עָל֨וּ מֵעִ֤יר הַתְּמָרִים֙ אֶת־בְּנֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֔ה מִדְבַּ֣ר יְהוּדָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֖ר בְּנֶ֣גֶב עֲרָ֑ד וַיֵּ֖לֶךְ וַיֵּ֥שֶׁב אֶת־הָעָֽם׃
Translated: The descendants of the Kenite, the father-in-law of Moses, went up with the Judahites from the City of Palms to the wilderness of Judah; and they went and settled among the people in the Negeb of Arad.
Transliteration: uveney keyniy choten mosheh alu meiyr hatemariym et-veney yehudah midevar yehudah asher venegev arad vayelekhe vayeshev et-haam

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֤לֶךְ יְהוּדָה֙ אֶת־שִׁמְע֣וֹן אָחִ֔יו וַיַּכּ֕וּ אֶת־הַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֖י יוֹשֵׁ֣ב צְפַ֑ת וַיַּחֲרִ֣ימוּ אוֹתָ֔הּ וַיִּקְרָ֥א אֶת־שֵׁם־הָעִ֖יר חׇרְמָֽה׃
Translated: And Judah with its brother-tribe Simeon went on and defeated the Canaanites who dwelt in Zephath. They proscribed it, and so the town was named Hormah.
Transliteration: vayelekhe yehudah et-shimevon achiyv vayakhu et-hakhenaaniy yvoshev tsefat vayachariymu votah vayikera et-shem-haiyr chׇremah

Hebrew: וַיִּלְכֹּ֤ד יְהוּדָה֙ אֶת־עַזָּ֣ה וְאֶת־גְּבוּלָ֔הּ וְאֶֽת־אַשְׁקְל֖וֹן וְאֶת־גְּבוּלָ֑הּ וְאֶת־עֶקְר֖וֹן וְאֶת־גְּבוּלָֽהּ׃
Translated: And Judah captured Gaza and its territory, Ashkelon and its territory, and Ekron and its territory.
Transliteration: vayilekhod yehudah et-azah veet-gevulah veet-ashekelvon veet-gevulah veet-ekervon veet-gevulah

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֤י יְהֹוָה֙ אֶת־יְהוּדָ֔ה וַיֹּ֖רֶשׁ אֶת־הָהָ֑ר כִּ֣י לֹ֤א לְהוֹרִישׁ֙ אֶת־יֹשְׁבֵ֣י הָעֵ֔מֶק כִּי־רֶ֥כֶב בַּרְזֶ֖ל לָהֶֽם׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small> was with Judah, so that they took possession of the hill country; but they were not able to dispossess the inhabitants of the plain, for they had iron chariots.
Transliteration: vayehiy yehovah et-yehudah vayoresh et-hahar khiy lo lehvoriysh et-yoshevey haemek khiy-rekhev varezel lahem

Hebrew: וַיִּתְּנ֤וּ לְכָלֵב֙ אֶת־חֶבְר֔וֹן כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר דִּבֶּ֣ר מֹשֶׁ֑ה וַיּ֣וֹרֶשׁ מִשָּׁ֔ם אֶת־שְׁלֹשָׁ֖ה בְּנֵ֥י הָעֲנָֽק׃
Translated: They gave Hebron to Caleb, as Moses had promised; and he drove the three Anakites out of there.
Transliteration: vayitenu lekhalev et-chevervon khaasher diver mosheh vayyvoresh misham et-sheloshah veney haanak

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הַיְבוּסִי֙ יֹשֵׁ֣ב יְרוּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם לֹ֥א הוֹרִ֖ישׁוּ בְּנֵ֣י בִנְיָמִ֑ן וַיֵּ֨שֶׁב הַיְבוּסִ֜י אֶת־בְּנֵ֤י בִנְיָמִן֙ בִּיר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם עַ֖ד הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: The Benjaminites did not dispossess the Jebusite inhabitants of Jerusalem; so the Jebusites have dwelt with the Benjaminites in Jerusalem to this day.
Transliteration: veet-hayevusiy yoshev yerushala͏im lo hvoriyshu veney vineyamin vayeshev hayevusiy et-veney vineyamin viyrushala͏im ad hayyvom hazeh {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲל֧וּ בֵית־יוֹסֵ֛ף גַּם־הֵ֖ם בֵּֽית־אֵ֑ל וַיהֹוָ֖ה עִמָּֽם׃
Translated: The House of Joseph, for their part, advanced against Bethel, and G<small>OD</small> was with them.
Transliteration: vayaalu veyt-yvosef gam-hem veyt-el vayhovah imam

Hebrew: וַיָּתִ֥ירוּ בֵית־יוֹסֵ֖ף בְּבֵֽית־אֵ֑ל וְשֵׁם־הָעִ֥יר לְפָנִ֖ים לֽוּז׃
Translated: While the House of Joseph were scouting at Bethel (the name of the town was formerly Luz),
Transliteration: vayatiyru veyt-yvosef veveyt-el veshem-haiyr lefaniym luz

Hebrew: וַיִּרְאוּ֙ הַשֹּׁ֣מְרִ֔ים אִ֖ישׁ יוֹצֵ֣א מִן־הָעִ֑יר וַיֹּ֣אמְרוּ ל֗וֹ הַרְאֵ֤נוּ נָא֙ אֶת־מְב֣וֹא הָעִ֔יר וְעָשִׂ֥ינוּ עִמְּךָ֖ חָֽסֶד׃
Translated: their patrols saw someone leaving the town. They said to him, “Just show us how to get into the town, and we will treat you kindly.”
Transliteration: vayireu hashomeriym iysh yvotse min-haiyr vayomeru lvo hareenu na et-mevvo haiyr veashiynu imekha chased

Hebrew: וַיַּרְאֵם֙ אֶת־מְב֣וֹא הָעִ֔יר וַיַּכּ֥וּ אֶת־הָעִ֖יר לְפִי־חָ֑רֶב וְאֶת־הָאִ֥ישׁ וְאֶת־כׇּל־מִשְׁפַּחְתּ֖וֹ שִׁלֵּֽחוּ׃
Translated: He showed them how to get into the town; they put the town to the sword, but they let the man and all his relatives go free.
Transliteration: vayareem et-mevvo haiyr vayakhu et-haiyr lefiy-charev veet-haiysh veet-khׇl-mishefachetvo shilechu

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֣לֶךְ הָאִ֔ישׁ אֶ֖רֶץ הַחִתִּ֑ים וַיִּ֣בֶן עִ֗יר וַיִּקְרָ֤א שְׁמָהּ֙ ל֔וּז ה֣וּא שְׁמָ֔הּ עַ֖ד הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: The man went to the Hittite country. He founded a city and named it Luz, and that has been its name to this day.
Transliteration: vayelekhe haiysh erets hachitiym vayiven iyr vayikera shemah luz hu shemah ad hayyvom hazeh {f}

Hebrew: וְלֹֽא־הוֹרִ֣ישׁ מְנַשֶּׁ֗ה אֶת־בֵּית־שְׁאָ֣ן וְאֶת־בְּנוֹתֶ֘יהָ֮ וְאֶת־תַּעְנַ֣ךְ וְאֶת־בְּנֹתֶ֒יהָ֒ וְאֶת־[יוֹשְׁבֵ֨י] (יושב) ד֜וֹר וְאֶת־בְּנוֹתֶ֗יהָ וְאֶת־יוֹשְׁבֵ֤י יִבְלְעָם֙ וְאֶת־בְּנֹתֶ֔יהָ וְאֶת־יוֹשְׁבֵ֥י מְגִדּ֖וֹ וְאֶת־בְּנוֹתֶ֑יהָ וַיּ֙וֹאֶל֙ הַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֔י לָשֶׁ֖בֶת בָּאָ֥רֶץ הַזֹּֽאת׃
Translated: Manasseh did not dispossess [the inhabitants of] Beth-shean and its dependencies, or [of] Taanach and its dependencies, or the inhabitants of Dor and its dependencies, or the inhabitants of Ibleam and its dependencies, or the inhabitants of Megiddo and its dependencies. The Canaanites persisted in dwelling in this region.
Transliteration: velo-hvoriysh menasheh et-veyt-shean veet-venvoteyha veet-taenakhe veet-venoteyha veet-[yvoshevey] (yvshv) dvor veet-venvoteyha veet-yvoshevey yiveleam veet-venoteyha veet-yvoshevey megidvo veet-venvoteyha vayyvoel hakhenaaniy lashevet vaarets hazot

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ כִּֽי־חָזַ֣ק יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיָּ֥שֶׂם אֶת־הַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֖י לָמַ֑ס וְהוֹרֵ֖ישׁ לֹ֥א הוֹרִישֽׁוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: And when Israel gained the upper hand, they subjected the Canaanites to forced labor; but they did not dispossess them.
Transliteration: vayehiy khiy-chazak yisherael vayashem et-hakhenaaniy lamas vehvoreysh lo hvoriyshvo {s}

Hebrew: וְאֶפְרַ֙יִם֙ לֹ֣א הוֹרִ֔ישׁ אֶת־הַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֖י הַיּוֹשֵׁ֣ב בְּגָ֑זֶר וַיֵּ֧שֶׁב הַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֛י בְּקִרְבּ֖וֹ בְּגָֽזֶר׃ {ס}
Translated: Nor did Ephraim dispossess the Canaanites who inhabited Gezer; so the Canaanites dwelt in their midst at Gezer.
Transliteration: veeferayiim lo hvoriysh et-hakhenaaniy hayyvoshev vegazer vayeshev hakhenaaniy vekirevvo vegazer {s}

Hebrew: זְבוּלֻ֗ן לֹ֤א הוֹרִישׁ֙ אֶת־יוֹשְׁבֵ֣י קִטְר֔וֹן וְאֶת־יוֹשְׁבֵ֖י נַהֲלֹ֑ל וַיֵּ֤שֶׁב הַֽכְּנַעֲנִי֙ בְּקִרְבּ֔וֹ וַיִּֽהְי֖וּ לָמַֽס׃ {ס}
Translated: Zebulun did not dispossess the inhabitants of Kitron or the inhabitants of Nahalol; so the Canaanites dwelt in their midst, but they were subjected to forced labor.
Transliteration: zevulun lo hvoriysh et-yvoshevey kitervon veet-yvoshevey nahalol vayeshev hakhenaaniy vekirevvo vayiheyu lamas {s}

Hebrew: אָשֵׁ֗ר לֹ֤א הוֹרִישׁ֙ אֶת־יֹשְׁבֵ֣י עַכּ֔וֹ וְאֶת־יוֹשְׁבֵ֖י צִיד֑וֹן וְאֶת־אַחְלָ֤ב וְאֶת־אַכְזִיב֙ וְאֶת־חֶלְבָּ֔ה וְאֶת־אֲפִ֖יק וְאֶת־רְחֹֽב׃
Translated: Asher did not dispossess the inhabitants of Acco or the inhabitants of Sidon, Ahlab, Achzib, Helbah, Aphik, and Rehob.
Transliteration: asher lo hvoriysh et-yoshevey akhvo veet-yvoshevey tsiydvon veet-achelav veet-akheziyv veet-chelevah veet-afiyk veet-rechov

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֙שֶׁב֙ הָאָ֣שֵׁרִ֔י בְּקֶ֥רֶב הַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֖י יֹשְׁבֵ֣י הָאָ֑רֶץ כִּ֖י לֹ֥א הֽוֹרִישֽׁוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: So the Asherites dwelt in the midst of the Canaanites, the inhabitants of the land, for they did not dispossess them.
Transliteration: vayeshev haasheriy vekerev hakhenaaniy yoshevey haarets khiy lo hvoriyshvo {s}

Hebrew: נַפְתָּלִ֗י לֹֽא־הוֹרִ֞ישׁ אֶת־יֹשְׁבֵ֤י בֵֽית־שֶׁ֙מֶשׁ֙ וְאֶת־יֹשְׁבֵ֣י בֵית־עֲנָ֔ת וַיֵּ֕שֶׁב בְּקֶ֥רֶב הַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֖י יֹשְׁבֵ֣י הָאָ֑רֶץ וְיֹשְׁבֵ֤י בֵֽית־שֶׁ֙מֶשׁ֙ וּבֵ֣ית עֲנָ֔ת הָי֥וּ לָהֶ֖ם לָמַֽס׃
Translated: Naphtali did not dispossess the inhabitants of Beth-shemesh or the inhabitants of Beth-anath. But they settled in the midst of the Canaanite inhabitants of the land, and the inhabitants of Beth-shemesh and Beth-anath had to perform forced labor for them.
Transliteration: nafetaliy lo-hvoriysh et-yoshevey veyt-shemesh veet-yoshevey veyt-anat vayeshev vekerev hakhenaaniy yoshevey haarets veyoshevey veyt-shemesh uveyt anat hayu lahem lamas

Hebrew: וַיִּלְחֲצ֧וּ הָאֱמֹרִ֛י אֶת־בְּנֵי־דָ֖ן הָהָ֑רָה כִּי־לֹ֥א נְתָנ֖וֹ לָרֶ֥דֶת לָעֵֽמֶק׃
Translated: The Amorites pressed the Danites into the hill country; they would not let them come down to the plain.
Transliteration: vayilechatsu haemoriy et-veney-dan haharah khiy-lo netanvo laredet laemek

Hebrew: וַיּ֤וֹאֶל הָאֱמֹרִי֙ לָשֶׁ֣בֶת בְּהַר־חֶ֔רֶס בְּאַיָּל֖וֹן וּבְשַׁעַלְבִ֑ים וַתִּכְבַּד֙ יַ֣ד בֵּית־יוֹסֵ֔ף וַיִּהְי֖וּ לָמַֽס׃
Translated: The Amorites also persisted in dwelling in Har-heres, in Aijalon, and in Shaalbim. But the hand of the House of Joseph bore heavily on them and they had to perform forced labor.
Transliteration: vayyvoel haemoriy lashevet vehar-cheres veayalvon uveshaaleviym vatikhevad yad veyt-yvosef vayiheyu lamas

Hebrew: וּגְבוּל֙ הָאֱמֹרִ֔י מִֽמַּעֲלֵ֖ה עַקְרַבִּ֑ים מֵהַסֶּ֖לַע וָמָֽעְלָה׃ {פ}
Translated: The territory of the Amorites extended from the Ascent of Akrabbim—from Sela—onward.
Transliteration: ugevul haemoriy mimaaleh akeraviym mehasela vamaelah {f}

Hebrew:
וַיַּ֧עַל מַלְאַךְ־יְהֹוָ֛ה מִן־הַגִּלְגָּ֖ל אֶל־הַבֹּכִ֑ים {פ}
וַיֹּ֩אמֶר֩ אַעֲלֶ֨ה אֶתְכֶ֜ם מִמִּצְרַ֗יִם וָאָבִ֤יא אֶתְכֶם֙ אֶל־הָאָ֗רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֤ר נִשְׁבַּ֙עְתִּי֙ לַאֲבֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם וָאֹמַ֕ר לֹֽא־אָפֵ֧ר בְּרִיתִ֛י אִתְּכֶ֖ם לְעוֹלָֽם׃
Translated: An angel of G<small>OD</small> came up from Gilgal to Bochim and said, “I brought you up from Egypt and I took you into the land that I had promised on oath to your fathers. And I said, ‘I will never break My covenant with you.
Transliteration:
vayaal maleakhe-yehovah min-hagilegal el-havokhiym {f}
vayomer aaleh etekhem mimitserayiim vaaviy etekhem el-haarets asher nishevaetiy laavoteykhem vaomar lo-afer veriytiy itekhem levolam

Hebrew: וְאַתֶּ֗ם לֹֽא־תִכְרְת֤וּ בְרִית֙ לְיֽוֹשְׁבֵי֙ הָאָ֣רֶץ הַזֹּ֔את מִזְבְּחוֹתֵיהֶ֖ם תִּתֹּצ֑וּן וְלֹא־שְׁמַעְתֶּ֥ם בְּקוֹלִ֖י מַה־זֹּ֥את עֲשִׂיתֶֽם׃
Translated: And you, for your part, must make no covenant with the inhabitants of this land; you must tear down their altars.’ But you have not obeyed Me—look what you have done!
Transliteration: veatem lo-tikheretu veriyt leyvoshevey haarets hazot mizevechvoteyhem titotsun velo-shemaetem vekvoliy mah-zot ashiytem

Hebrew: וְגַ֣ם אָמַ֔רְתִּי לֹא־אֲגָרֵ֥שׁ אוֹתָ֖ם מִפְּנֵיכֶ֑ם וְהָי֤וּ לָכֶם֙ לְצִדִּ֔ים וֵאלֹ֣הֵיהֶ֔ם יִהְי֥וּ לָכֶ֖ם לְמוֹקֵֽשׁ׃
Translated: Therefore, I have resolved not to drive them out before you; they shall become your oppressors, and their gods shall be a snare to you.”
Transliteration: vegam amaretiy lo-agaresh votam mifeneykhem vehayu lakhem letsidiym veloheyhem yiheyu lakhem lemvokesh

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י כְּדַבֵּ֞ר מַלְאַ֤ךְ יְהֹוָה֙ אֶת־הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה אֶֽל־כׇּל־בְּנֵ֖י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיִּשְׂא֥וּ הָעָ֛ם אֶת־קוֹלָ֖ם וַיִּבְכּֽוּ׃
Translated: As the angel of G<small>OD</small> spoke these words to all the Israelites, the people broke into weeping.
Transliteration: vayehiy khedaver maleakhe yehovah et-hadevariym haeleh el-khׇl-veney yisherael vayisheu haam et-kvolam vayivekhu

Hebrew: וַֽיִּקְרְא֛וּ שֵֽׁם־הַמָּק֥וֹם הַה֖וּא בֹּכִ֑ים וַיִּזְבְּחוּ־שָׁ֖ם לַיהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: So they named that place Bochim, and they offered sacrifices there to G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vayikereu shem-hamakvom hahu vokhiym vayizevechu-sham layhovah {f}

Hebrew: וַיְשַׁלַּ֥ח יְהוֹשֻׁ֖עַ אֶת־הָעָ֑ם וַיֵּלְכ֧וּ בְנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל אִ֥ישׁ לְנַחֲלָת֖וֹ לָרֶ֥שֶׁת אֶת־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: When Joshua dismissed the people, the Israelites went to their allotted territories and took possession of the land.
Transliteration: vayeshalach yehvoshua et-haam vayelekhu veney-yisherael iysh lenachalatvo lareshet et-haarets

Hebrew: וַיַּעַבְד֤וּ הָעָם֙ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֔ה כֹּ֖ל יְמֵ֣י יְהוֹשֻׁ֑עַ וְכֹ֣ל ׀ יְמֵ֣י הַזְּקֵנִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֨ר הֶאֱרִ֤יכוּ יָמִים֙ אַחֲרֵ֣י יְהוֹשׁ֔וּעַ אֲשֶׁ֣ר רָא֗וּ אֵ֣ת כׇּל־מַעֲשֵׂ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ הַגָּד֔וֹל אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשָׂ֖ה לְיִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: The people served G<small>OD</small> during the lifetime of Joshua and the lifetime of the older people who lived on after Joshua and who had witnessed all the marvelous deeds that G<small>OD</small> had wrought for Israel.
Transliteration: vayaavedu haam et-yehovah khol yemey yehvoshua vekhol yemey hazekeniym asher heeriykhu yamiym acharey yehvoshua asher rau et khׇl-maasheh yehovah hagadvol asher ashah leyisherael

Hebrew: וַיָּ֛מׇת יְהוֹשֻׁ֥עַ בִּן־נ֖וּן עֶ֣בֶד יְהֹוָ֑ה בֶּן־מֵאָ֥ה וָעֶ֖שֶׂר שָׁנִֽים׃
Translated: Joshua son of Nun, the servant of G<small>OD</small>, died at the age of one hundred and ten years,
Transliteration: vayamׇt yehvoshua vin-nun eved yehovah ven-meah vaesher shaniym

Hebrew: וַיִּקְבְּר֤וּ אוֹתוֹ֙ בִּגְב֣וּל נַחֲלָת֔וֹ בְּתִמְנַת־חֶ֖רֶס בְּהַ֣ר אֶפְרָ֑יִם מִצְּפ֖וֹן לְהַר־גָּֽעַשׁ׃
Translated: and was buried on his own property, at Timnath-heres in the hill country of Ephraim, north of Mount Gaash.
Transliteration: vayikeveru votvo vigevul nachalatvo vetimenat-cheres vehar eferayiim mitsefvon lehar-gaash

Hebrew: וְגַם֙ כׇּל־הַדּ֣וֹר הַה֔וּא נֶאֶסְפ֖וּ אֶל־אֲבוֹתָ֑יו וַיָּ֩קׇם֩ דּ֨וֹר אַחֵ֜ר אַחֲרֵיהֶ֗ם אֲשֶׁ֤ר לֹא־יָֽדְעוּ֙ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֔ה וְגַם֙ אֶת־הַֽמַּעֲשֶׂ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשָׂ֖ה לְיִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated:
And all that generation were likewise gathered to their ancestors.
Another generation arose after them, which had not experienced GOD’s deliverance or the deeds that had been wrought for Israel.
Transliteration: vegam khׇl-hadvor hahu neesefu el-avvotayv vayakׇm dvor acher achareyhem asher lo-yadeu et-yehovah vegam et-hamaasheh asher ashah leyisherael {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲשׂ֧וּ בְנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל אֶת־הָרַ֖ע בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיַּעַבְד֖וּ אֶת־הַבְּעָלִֽים׃
Translated: And the Israelites did what was offensive to G<small>OD</small>. They worshiped the Baalim
Transliteration: vayaashu veney-yisherael et-hara veeyney yehovah vayaavedu et-havealiym

Hebrew: וַיַּעַזְב֞וּ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֣ה ׀ אֱלֹהֵ֣י אֲבוֹתָ֗ם הַמּוֹצִ֣יא אוֹתָם֮ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֒יִם֒ וַיֵּלְכ֞וּ אַחֲרֵ֣י ׀ אֱלֹהִ֣ים אֲחֵרִ֗ים מֵאֱלֹהֵ֤י הָֽעַמִּים֙ אֲשֶׁר֙ סְבִיב֣וֹתֵיהֶ֔ם וַיִּֽשְׁתַּחֲו֖וּ לָהֶ֑ם וַיַּכְעִ֖סוּ אֶת־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: and forsook the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of their ancestors, who had brought them out of the land of Egypt. They followed other gods, from among the gods of the peoples around them, and bowed down to them; they provoked G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vayaazevu et-yehovah elohey avvotam hamvotsiy votam meerets mitserayiim vayelekhu acharey Elohim acheriym meelohey haamiym asher seviyvvoteyhem vayishetachavu lahem vayakheisu et-yehovah

Hebrew: וַיַּעַזְב֖וּ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיַּעַבְד֥וּ לַבַּ֖עַל וְלָעַשְׁתָּרֽוֹת׃
Translated: They forsook G<small>OD</small> and worshiped Baal and the Ashtaroth.
Transliteration: vayaazevu et-yehovah vayaavedu lavaal velaashetarvot

Hebrew: וַיִּֽחַר־אַ֤ף יְהֹוָה֙ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַֽיִּתְּנֵם֙ בְּיַד־שֹׁסִ֔ים וַיָּשֹׁ֖סּוּ אוֹתָ֑ם וַֽיִּמְכְּרֵ֞ם בְּיַ֤ד אֽוֹיְבֵיהֶם֙ מִסָּבִ֔יב וְלֹא־יָכְל֣וּ ע֔וֹד לַעֲמֹ֖ד לִפְנֵ֥י אוֹיְבֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: Having become incensed at Israel, G<small>OD</small> then handed them over to foes who plundered them, surrendering them to their enemies on all sides; they could no longer hold their own against their enemies.
Transliteration: vayichar-af yehovah veyisherael vayitenem veyad-shosiym vayashosu votam vayimekherem veyad voyeveyhem misaviyv velo-yakhelu vod laamod lifeney voyeveyhem

Hebrew: בְּכֹ֣ל ׀ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יָצְא֗וּ יַד־יְהֹוָה֙ הָֽיְתָה־בָּ֣ם לְרָעָ֔ה כַּֽאֲשֶׁר֙ דִּבֶּ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה וְכַאֲשֶׁ֛ר נִשְׁבַּ֥ע יְהֹוָ֖ה לָהֶ֑ם וַיֵּ֥צֶר לָהֶ֖ם מְאֹֽד׃
Translated: In all their campaigns, G<small>OD</small>’s hand was against them to their undoing—as G<small>OD</small> had declared and as G<small>OD</small> had sworn to them—and they were in great distress.
Transliteration: vekhol asher yatseu yad-yehovah hayetah-vam leraah khaasher diver yehovah vekhaasher nisheva yehovah lahem vayetser lahem meod

Hebrew: וַיָּ֥קֶם יְהֹוָ֖ה שֹׁפְטִ֑ים וַיּ֣וֹשִׁיע֔וּם מִיַּ֖ד שֹׁסֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: Then G<small>OD</small> raised up chieftains who delivered them from those who plundered them.
Transliteration: vayakem yehovah shofetiym vayyvoshiyum miyad shoseyhem

Hebrew: וְגַ֤ם אֶל־שֹֽׁפְטֵיהֶם֙ לֹ֣א שָׁמֵ֔עוּ כִּ֣י זָנ֗וּ אַֽחֲרֵי֙ אֱלֹהִ֣ים אֲחֵרִ֔ים וַיִּֽשְׁתַּחֲו֖וּ לָהֶ֑ם סָ֣רוּ מַהֵ֗ר מִן־הַדֶּ֜רֶךְ אֲשֶׁ֨ר הָלְכ֧וּ אֲבוֹתָ֛ם לִשְׁמֹ֥עַ מִצְוֺת־יְהֹוָ֖ה לֹא־עָ֥שׂוּ כֵֽן׃
Translated: But they did not heed their chieftains either; they went astray after other gods and bowed down to them. They were quick to turn aside from the way their ancestors had followed in obedience to G<small>OD</small>’s commandments; they did not do right.
Transliteration: vegam el-shofeteyhem lo shameu khiy zanu acharey Elohim acheriym vayishetachavu lahem saru maher min-haderekhe asher halekhu avvotam lishemoa mitsevot-yehovah lo-ashu khen

Hebrew: וְכִי־הֵקִ֨ים יְהֹוָ֥ה <small>׀</small> לָהֶם֮ שֹׁפְטִים֒ וְהָיָ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ עִם־הַשֹּׁפֵ֔ט וְהֽוֹשִׁיעָם֙ מִיַּ֣ד אֹֽיְבֵיהֶ֔ם כֹּ֖ל יְמֵ֣י הַשּׁוֹפֵ֑ט כִּֽי־יִנָּחֵ֤ם יְהֹוָה֙ מִנַּֽאֲקָתָ֔ם מִפְּנֵ֥י לֹחֲצֵיהֶ֖ם וְדֹחֲקֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: When G<small>OD</small> raised up chieftains for them, G<small>OD</small> would be with that chieftain—and would save them from their enemies during that chieftain’s lifetime; for G<small>OD</small> would be moved to pity by their moanings because of those who oppressed and crushed them.
Transliteration: vekhiy-hekiym yehovah <small></small> lahem shofetiym vehayah yehovah im-hashofet vehvoshiyam miyad oyeveyhem khol yemey hashvofet khiy-yinachem yehovah minaakatam mifeney lochatseyhem vedochakeyhem

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֣ה ׀ בְּמ֣וֹת הַשּׁוֹפֵ֗ט יָשֻׁ֙בוּ֙ וְהִשְׁחִ֣יתוּ מֵֽאֲבוֹתָ֔ם לָלֶ֗כֶת אַֽחֲרֵי֙ אֱלֹהִ֣ים אֲחֵרִ֔ים לְעׇבְדָ֖ם וּלְהִשְׁתַּחֲוֺ֣ת לָהֶ֑ם לֹ֤א הִפִּ֙ילוּ֙ מִמַּ֣עַלְלֵיהֶ֔ם וּמִדַּרְכָּ֖ם הַקָּשָֽׁה׃
Translated: But when the chieftain died, they would again act basely, even more than the preceding generation—following other gods, worshiping them, and bowing down to them; they omitted none of their practices and stubborn ways.
Transliteration: vehayah vemvot hashvofet yashuvu vehishechiytu meavvotam lalekhet acharey Elohim acheriym leׇvedam ulehishetachavot lahem lo hifiylu mimaaleleyhem umidarekham hakashah

Hebrew: וַיִּֽחַר־אַ֥ף יְהֹוָ֖ה בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיֹּ֗אמֶר יַ֩עַן֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר עָבְר֜וּ הַגּ֣וֹי הַזֶּ֗ה אֶת־בְּרִיתִי֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר צִוִּ֣יתִי אֶת־אֲבוֹתָ֔ם וְלֹ֥א שָׁמְע֖וּ לְקוֹלִֽי׃
Translated: Then G<small>OD</small>, having become incensed against Israel, said, “Since that nation has transgressed the covenant that I enjoined upon their ancestors and has not obeyed Me,
Transliteration: vayichar-af yehovah veyisherael vayomer yaan asher averu hagvoy hazeh et-veriytiy asher tsiviytiy et-avvotam velo shameu lekvoliy

Hebrew: גַּם־אֲנִי֙ לֹ֣א אוֹסִ֔יף לְהוֹרִ֥ישׁ אִ֖ישׁ מִפְּנֵיהֶ֑ם מִן־הַגּוֹיִ֛ם אֲשֶׁר־עָזַ֥ב יְהוֹשֻׁ֖עַ וַיָּמֹֽת׃
Translated: I for My part will no longer drive out before them any of the nations that Joshua left when he died.”
Transliteration: gam-aniy lo vosiyf lehvoriysh iysh mifeneyhem min-hagvoyim asher-azav yehvoshua vayamot

Hebrew: לְמַ֛עַן נַסּ֥וֹת בָּ֖ם אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל הֲשֹׁמְרִ֣ים הֵם֩ אֶת־דֶּ֨רֶךְ יְהֹוָ֜ה לָלֶ֣כֶת בָּ֗ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר שָׁמְר֥וּ אֲבוֹתָ֖ם אִם־לֹֽא׃
Translated: For it was in order to test Israel by them—[to see] whether they would faithfully walk in G<small>OD</small>’s ways, as their ancestors had done—
Transliteration: lemaan nasvot vam et-yisherael hashomeriym hem et-derekhe yehovah lalekhet vam khaasher shameru avvotam im-lo

Hebrew: וַיַּנַּ֤ח יְהֹוָה֙ אֶת־הַגּוֹיִ֣ם הָאֵ֔לֶּה לְבִלְתִּ֥י הוֹרִישָׁ֖ם מַהֵ֑ר וְלֹ֥א נְתָנָ֖ם בְּיַד־יְהוֹשֻֽׁעַ׃ {פ}
Translated: that G<small>OD</small> had left those nations, instead of driving them out at once, and had not delivered them into the hands of Joshua.
Transliteration: vayanach yehovah et-hagvoyim haeleh leviletiy hvoriysham maher velo netanam veyad-yehvoshua {f}

Hebrew: וְאֵ֤לֶּה הַגּוֹיִם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הִנִּ֣יחַ יְהֹוָ֔ה לְנַסּ֥וֹת בָּ֖ם אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אֵ֚ת כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹא־יָדְע֔וּ אֵ֖ת כׇּל־מִלְחֲמ֥וֹת כְּנָֽעַן׃
Translated: These are the nations that G<small>OD</small> left in order to test the Israelites who had not known any of the wars of Canaan,
Transliteration: veeleh hagvoyim asher hiniycha yehovah lenasvot vam et-yisherael et khׇl-asher lo-yadeu et khׇl-milechamvot khenaan

Hebrew: רַ֗ק לְמַ֙עַן֙ דַּ֚עַת דֹּר֣וֹת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לְלַמְּדָ֖ם מִלְחָמָ֑ה רַ֥ק אֲשֶׁר־לְפָנִ֖ים לֹ֥א יְדָעֽוּם׃
Translated: so that succeeding generations of Israelites might be made to experience war—but only those who had not known the former wars:
Transliteration: rak lemaan daat dorvot veney-yisherael lelamedam milechamah rak asher-lefaniym lo yedaum

Hebrew: חֲמֵ֣שֶׁת ׀ סַרְנֵ֣י פְלִשְׁתִּ֗ים וְכׇל־הַֽכְּנַעֲנִי֙ וְהַצִּ֣ידֹנִ֔י וְהַ֣חִוִּ֔י יֹשֵׁ֖ב הַ֣ר הַלְּבָנ֑וֹן מֵהַר֙ בַּ֣עַל חֶרְמ֔וֹן עַ֖ד לְב֥וֹא חֲמָֽת׃
Translated: the five principalities of the Philistines and all the Canaanites, Sidonians, and Hivites who inhabited the hill country of the Lebanon from Mount Baal-hermon to Lebo-hamath.
Transliteration: chameshet sareney felishetiym vekhׇl-hakhenaaniy vehatsiydoniy vehachiviy yoshev har halevanvon mehar vaal cheremvon ad levvo chamat

Hebrew: וַיִּהְי֕וּ לְנַסּ֥וֹת בָּ֖ם אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל לָדַ֗עַת הֲיִשְׁמְעוּ֙ אֶת־מִצְוֺ֣ת יְהֹוָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֥ה אֶת־אֲבוֹתָ֖ם בְּיַד־מֹשֶֽׁה׃
Translated: These served as a means of testing Israel, to learn whether they would obey the commandments that G<small>OD</small> had enjoined upon their ancestors through Moses.
Transliteration: vayiheyu lenasvot vam et-yisherael ladaat hayishemeu et-mitsevot yehovah asher-tsivah et-avvotam veyad-mosheh

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל יָשְׁב֖וּ בְּקֶ֣רֶב הַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֑י הַחִתִּ֤י וְהָאֱמֹרִי֙ וְהַפְּרִזִּ֔י וְהַחִוִּ֖י וְהַיְבוּסִֽי׃
Translated: The Israelites settled among the Canaanites, Hittites, Amorites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites;
Transliteration: uveney yisherael yashevu vekerev hakhenaaniy hachitiy vehaemoriy vehaferiziy vehachiviy vehayevusiy

Hebrew: וַיִּקְח֨וּ אֶת־בְּנוֹתֵיהֶ֤ם לָהֶם֙ לְנָשִׁ֔ים וְאֶת־בְּנוֹתֵיהֶ֖ם נָתְנ֣וּ לִבְנֵיהֶ֑ם וַיַּעַבְד֖וּ אֶת־אֱלֹהֵיהֶֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: they took their daughters to wife and gave their own daughters to their sons, and they worshiped their gods.
Transliteration: vayikechu et-venvoteyhem lahem lenashiym veet-venvoteyhem natenu liveneyhem vayaavedu et-eloheyhem {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲשׂ֨וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֤ל אֶת־הָרַע֙ בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה וַֽיִּשְׁכְּח֖וּ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵיהֶ֑ם וַיַּעַבְד֥וּ אֶת־הַבְּעָלִ֖ים וְאֶת־הָאֲשֵׁרֽוֹת׃
Translated: The Israelites did what was offensive to G<small>OD</small>; they ignored the E<small>TERNAL</small> their God and worshiped the Baalim and the Asheroth.
Transliteration: vayaashu veney-yisherael et-hara veeyney yehovah vayishekhechu et-yehovah eloheyhem vayaavedu et-havealiym veet-haashervot

Hebrew: וַיִּחַר־אַ֤ף יְהֹוָה֙ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַֽיִּמְכְּרֵ֗ם בְּיַד֙ כּוּשַׁ֣ן רִשְׁעָתַ֔יִם מֶ֖לֶךְ אֲרַ֣ם נַהֲרָ֑יִם וַיַּעַבְד֧וּ בְנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל אֶת־כּוּשַׁ֥ן רִשְׁעָתַ֖יִם שְׁמֹנֶ֥ה שָׁנִֽים׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small> became incensed at Israel and surrendered them to King Cushan-rishathaim of Aram-naharaim; and the Israelites were subject to Cushan-rishathaim for eight years.
Transliteration: vayichar-af yehovah veyisherael vayimekherem veyad khushan risheatayiim melekhe aram naharayiim vayaavedu veney-yisherael et-khushan risheatayiim shemoneh shaniym

Hebrew: וַיִּזְעֲק֤וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ אֶל־יְהֹוָ֔ה וַיָּ֨קֶם יְהֹוָ֥ה מוֹשִׁ֛יעַ לִבְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל וַיֹּשִׁיעֵ֑ם אֵ֚ת עׇתְנִיאֵ֣ל בֶּן־קְנַ֔ז אֲחִ֥י כָלֵ֖ב הַקָּטֹ֥ן מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃
Translated: The Israelites cried out to G<small>OD</small>, and G<small>OD</small> raised a champion for the Israelites to deliver them: Othniel the Kenizzite, a younger kinsman of Caleb.
Transliteration: vayizeaku veney-yisherael el-yehovah vayakem yehovah mvoshiya liveney yisherael vayoshiyem et ׇteniyel ven-kenaz achiy khalev hakaton mimenu

Hebrew: וַתְּהִ֨י עָלָ֥יו רֽוּחַ־יְהֹוָה֮ וַיִּשְׁפֹּ֣ט אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵל֒ וַיֵּצֵא֙ לַמִּלְחָמָ֔ה וַיִּתֵּ֤ן יְהֹוָה֙ בְּיָד֔וֹ אֶת־כּוּשַׁ֥ן רִשְׁעָתַ֖יִם מֶ֣לֶךְ אֲרָ֑ם וַתָּ֣עׇז יָד֔וֹ עַ֖ל כּוּשַׁ֥ן רִשְׁעָתָֽיִם׃
Translated: The spirit of G<small>OD</small> descended upon him and he became Israel’s chieftain. He went out to war, and G<small>OD</small> delivered King Cushan-rishathaim of Aram into his hands. He prevailed over Cushan-rishathaim,
Transliteration: vatehiy alayv rucha-yehovah vayishefot et-yisherael vayetse lamilechamah vayiten yehovah veyadvo et-khushan risheatayiim melekhe aram vataׇz yadvo al khushan risheatayiim

Hebrew: וַתִּשְׁקֹ֥ט הָאָ֖רֶץ אַרְבָּעִ֣ים שָׁנָ֑ה וַיָּ֖מׇת עׇתְנִיאֵ֥ל בֶּן־קְנַֽז׃ {פ}
Translated:
and the land had peace for forty years.
When Othniel the Kenizzite died,
Transliteration: vatishekot haarets arevaiym shanah vayamׇt ׇteniyel ven-kenaz {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּסִ֙פוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת הָרַ֖ע בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיְחַזֵּ֨ק יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶת־עֶגְל֤וֹן מֶלֶךְ־מוֹאָב֙ עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל עַ֛ל כִּי־עָשׂ֥וּ אֶת־הָרַ֖ע בְּעֵינֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: the Israelites again did what was offensive to G<small>OD</small>. And because they did what was offensive to G<small>OD</small>, G<small>OD</small> let King Eglon of Moab prevail over Israel.
Transliteration: vayosifu veney yisherael laashvot hara veeyney yehovah vayechazek yehovah et-egelvon melekhe-mvoav al-yisherael al khiy-ashu et-hara veeyney yehovah

Hebrew: וַיֶּאֱסֹ֣ף אֵלָ֔יו אֶת־בְּנֵ֥י עַמּ֖וֹן וַעֲמָלֵ֑ק וַיֵּ֗לֶךְ וַיַּךְ֙ אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיִּֽירְשׁ֖וּ אֶת־עִ֥יר הַתְּמָרִֽים׃
Translated: [Eglon] brought the Ammonites and the Amalekites together under his command, and went and defeated Israel and occupied the City of Palms.
Transliteration: vayeesof elayv et-veney amvon vaamalek vayelekhe vayakhe et-yisherael vayiyreshu et-iyr hatemariym

Hebrew: וַיַּעַבְד֤וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ אֶת־עֶגְל֣וֹן מֶלֶךְ־מוֹאָ֔ב שְׁמוֹנֶ֥ה עֶשְׂרֵ֖ה שָׁנָֽה׃
Translated: The Israelites were subject to King Eglon of Moab for eighteen years.
Transliteration: vayaavedu veney-yisherael et-egelvon melekhe-mvoav shemvoneh eshereh shanah

Hebrew: וַיִּזְעֲק֣וּ בְנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֮ אֶל־יְהֹוָה֒ וַיָּ֩קֶם֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה לָהֶ֜ם מוֹשִׁ֗יעַ אֶת־אֵה֤וּד בֶּן־גֵּרָא֙ בֶּן־הַיְמִינִ֔י אִ֥ישׁ אִטֵּ֖ר יַד־יְמִינ֑וֹ וַיִּשְׁלְח֨וּ בְנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֤ל בְּיָדוֹ֙ מִנְחָ֔ה לְעֶגְל֖וֹן מֶ֥לֶךְ מוֹאָֽב׃
Translated: Then the Israelites cried out to G<small>OD</small>, and G<small>OD</small> raised up a champion for them: the Benjaminite Ehud son of Gera, a left-handed man. It happened that the Israelites sent tribute to King Eglon of Moab through him.
Transliteration: vayizeaku veney-yisherael el-yehovah vayakem yehovah lahem mvoshiya et-ehud ven-gera ven-hayemiyniy iysh iter yad-yemiynvo vayishelechu veney-yisherael veyadvo minechah leegelvon melekhe mvoav

Hebrew: וַיַּ֩עַשׂ֩ ל֨וֹ אֵה֜וּד חֶ֗רֶב וְלָ֛הּ שְׁנֵ֥י פֵי֖וֹת גֹּ֣מֶד אׇרְכָּ֑הּ וַיַּחְגֹּ֤ר אוֹתָהּ֙ מִתַּ֣חַת לְמַדָּ֔יו עַ֖ל יֶ֥רֶךְ יְמִינֽוֹ׃
Translated: So Ehud made for himself a two-edged dagger, a gomed in length, which he girded on his right side under his cloak.
Transliteration: vayaash lvo ehud cherev velah sheney feyvot gomed ׇrekhah vayachegor votah mitachat lemadayv al yerekhe yemiynvo

Hebrew: וַיַּקְרֵב֙ אֶת־הַמִּנְחָ֔ה לְעֶגְל֖וֹן מֶ֣לֶךְ מוֹאָ֑ב וְעֶגְל֕וֹן אִ֥ישׁ בָּרִ֖יא מְאֹֽד׃
Translated: He presented the tribute to King Eglon of Moab. Now Eglon was a very stout man.
Transliteration: vayakerev et-haminechah leegelvon melekhe mvoav veegelvon iysh variy meod

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר כִּלָּ֔ה לְהַקְרִ֖יב אֶת־הַמִּנְחָ֑ה וַיְשַׁלַּח֙ אֶת־הָעָ֔ם נֹשְׂאֵ֖י הַמִּנְחָֽה׃
Translated: When [Ehud] had finished presenting the tribute, he dismissed the people who had conveyed the tribute.
Transliteration: vayehiy khaasher khilah lehakeriyv et-haminechah vayeshalach et-haam nosheey haminechah

Hebrew: וְה֣וּא שָׁ֗ב מִן־הַפְּסִילִים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אֶת־הַגִּלְגָּ֔ל וַיֹּ֕אמֶר דְּבַר־סֵ֥תֶר לִ֛י אֵלֶ֖יךָ הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר הָ֔ס וַיֵּֽצְאוּ֙ מֵעָלָ֔יו כׇּל־הָעֹמְדִ֖ים עָלָֽיו׃
Translated: But he himself returned from Pesilim, near Gilgal, and said, “Your Majesty, I have a secret message for you.” [Eglon] thereupon commanded, “Silence!” So all those in attendance left his presence;
Transliteration: vehu shav min-hafesiyliym asher et-hagilegal vayomer devar-seter liy eleykha hamelekhe vayomer has vayetseu mealayv khׇl-haomediym alayv

Hebrew: וְאֵה֣וּד ׀ בָּ֣א אֵלָ֗יו וְהֽוּא־יֹ֠שֵׁ֠ב בַּעֲלִיַּ֨ת הַמְּקֵרָ֤ה אֲשֶׁר־לוֹ֙ לְבַדּ֔וֹ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵה֔וּד דְּבַר־אֱלֹהִ֥ים לִ֖י אֵלֶ֑יךָ וַיָּ֖קׇם מֵעַ֥ל הַכִּסֵּֽא׃
Translated: and when Ehud approached him, he was sitting alone in his cool upper chamber. Ehud said, “I have a message for you from God”; whereupon he rose from his seat.
Transliteration: veehud va elayv vehu-yoshev vaaliyat hamekerah asher-lvo levadvo vayomer ehud devar-Elohim liy eleykha vayakׇm meal hakhise

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֤ח אֵהוּד֙ אֶת־יַ֣ד שְׂמֹאל֔וֹ וַיִּקַּח֙ אֶת־הַחֶ֔רֶב מֵעַ֖ל יֶ֣רֶךְ יְמִינ֑וֹ וַיִּתְקָעֶ֖הָ בְּבִטְנֽוֹ׃
Translated: Reaching with his left hand, Ehud drew the dagger from his right side and drove it into Eglon’s belly.
Transliteration: vayishelach ehud et-yad shemolvo vayikach et-hacherev meal yerekhe yemiynvo vayitekaeha vevitenvo

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֨א גַֽם־הַנִּצָּ֜ב אַחַ֣ר הַלַּ֗הַב וַיִּסְגֹּ֤ר הַחֵ֙לֶב֙ בְּעַ֣ד הַלַּ֔הַב כִּ֣י לֹ֥א שָׁלַ֛ף הַחֶ֖רֶב מִבִּטְנ֑וֹ וַיֵּצֵ֖א הַֽפַּרְשְׁדֹֽנָה׃
Translated: The fat closed over the blade and the hilt went in after the blade—for he did not pull the dagger out of his belly—and the filth came out.
Transliteration: vayavo gam-hanitsav achar halahav vayisegor hachelev vead halahav khiy lo shalaf hacherev mivitenvo vayetse hafareshedonah

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֥א אֵה֖וּד הַֽמִּסְדְּר֑וֹנָה וַיִּסְגֹּ֞ר דַּלְת֧וֹת הָעֲלִיָּ֛ה בַּעֲד֖וֹ וְנָעָֽל׃
Translated: Stepping out into the vestibule, Ehud shut the doors of the upper chamber on him and locked them.
Transliteration: vayetse ehud hamisedervonah vayisegor daletvot haaliyah vaadvo venaal

Hebrew: וְה֤וּא יָצָא֙ וַעֲבָדָ֣יו בָּ֔אוּ וַיִּרְא֕וּ וְהִנֵּ֛ה דַּלְת֥וֹת הָעֲלִיָּ֖ה נְעֻל֑וֹת וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ אַ֣ךְ מֵסִ֥יךְ ה֛וּא אֶת־רַגְלָ֖יו בַּחֲדַ֥ר הַמְּקֵרָֽה׃
Translated: After he left, the courtiers returned. When they saw that the doors of the upper chamber were locked, they thought, “He must be relieving himself in the cool chamber.”
Transliteration: vehu yatsa vaavadayv vau vayireu vehineh daletvot haaliyah neulvot vayomeru akhe mesiykhe hu et-ragelayv vachadar hamekerah

Hebrew: וַיָּחִ֣ילוּ עַד־בּ֔וֹשׁ וְהִנֵּ֛ה אֵינֶ֥נּוּ פֹתֵ֖חַ דַּלְת֣וֹת הָעֲלִיָּ֑ה וַיִּקְח֤וּ אֶת־הַמַּפְתֵּ֙חַ֙ וַיִּפְתָּ֔חוּ וְהִנֵּה֙ אֲדֹ֣נֵיהֶ֔ם נֹפֵ֥ל אַ֖רְצָה מֵֽת׃
Translated: They waited a long time; and when he did not open the doors of the chamber, they took the key and opened them—and there their master was lying dead on the floor!
Transliteration: vayachiylu ad-vvosh vehineh eynenu fotecha daletvot haaliyah vayikechu et-hamafetecha vayifetachu vehineh adoneyhem nofel aretsah met

Hebrew: וְאֵה֥וּד נִמְלַ֖ט עַ֣ד הִֽתְמַהְמְהָ֑ם וְהוּא֙ עָבַ֣ר אֶת־הַפְּסִילִ֔ים וַיִּמָּלֵ֖ט הַשְּׂעִירָֽתָה׃
Translated: But Ehud had made good his escape while they delayed; he had passed Pesilim and escaped to Seirah.
Transliteration: veehud nimelat ad hitemahemeham vehu avar et-hafesiyliym vayimalet hasheiyratah

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י בְּבוֹא֔וֹ וַיִּתְקַ֥ע בַּשּׁוֹפָ֖ר בְּהַ֣ר אֶפְרָ֑יִם וַיֵּרְד֨וּ עִמּ֧וֹ בְנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל מִן־הָהָ֖ר וְה֥וּא לִפְנֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: When he got there, he had the ram’s horn sounded through the hill country of Ephraim, and all the Israelites descended with him from the hill country; and he took the lead.
Transliteration: vayehiy vevvovo vayiteka vashvofar vehar eferayiim vayeredu imvo veney-yisherael min-hahar vehu lifeneyhem

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֲלֵהֶם֙ רִדְפ֣וּ אַחֲרַ֔י כִּֽי־נָתַ֨ן יְהֹוָ֧ה אֶת־אֹיְבֵיכֶ֛ם אֶת־מוֹאָ֖ב בְּיֶדְכֶ֑ם וַיֵּרְד֣וּ אַחֲרָ֗יו וַֽיִּלְכְּד֞וּ אֶֽת־מַעְבְּר֤וֹת הַיַּרְדֵּן֙ לְמוֹאָ֔ב וְלֹא־נָתְנ֥וּ אִ֖ישׁ לַעֲבֹֽר׃
Translated: “Follow me closely,” he said, “for G<small>OD</small> has delivered your enemies, the Moabites, into your hands.” They followed him down and seized the fords of the Jordan against the Moabites; they let no one cross.
Transliteration: vayomer alehem ridefu acharay khiy-natan yehovah et-oyeveykhem et-mvoav veyedekhem vayeredu acharayv vayilekhedu et-maevervot hayareden lemvoav velo-natenu iysh laavor

Hebrew: וַיַּכּ֨וּ אֶת־מוֹאָ֜ב בָּעֵ֣ת הַהִ֗יא כַּעֲשֶׂ֤רֶת אֲלָפִים֙ אִ֔ישׁ כׇּל־שָׁמֵ֖ן וְכׇל־אִ֣ישׁ חָ֑יִל וְלֹ֥א נִמְלַ֖ט אִֽישׁ׃
Translated: On that occasion they slew about 10,000 Moabites; they were all robust and brave men, yet not one of them escaped.
Transliteration: vayakhu et-mvoav vaet hahiy khaasheret alafiym iysh khׇl-shamen vekhׇl-iysh chayiil velo nimelat iysh

Hebrew: וַתִּכָּנַ֤ע מוֹאָב֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֔וּא תַּ֖חַת יַ֣ד יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַתִּשְׁקֹ֥ט הָאָ֖רֶץ שְׁמוֹנִ֥ים שָׁנָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: On that day, Moab submitted to Israel; and the land was tranquil for eighty years.
Transliteration: vatikhana mvoav vayyvom hahu tachat yad yisherael vatishekot haarets shemvoniym shanah {f}

Hebrew: וְאַחֲרָ֤יו הָיָה֙ שַׁמְגַּ֣ר בֶּן־עֲנָ֔ת וַיַּ֤ךְ אֶת־פְּלִשְׁתִּים֙ שֵֽׁשׁ־מֵא֣וֹת אִ֔ישׁ בְּמַלְמַ֖ד הַבָּקָ֑ר וַיּ֥וֹשַׁע גַּם־ה֖וּא אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: After him came Shamgar son of Anath, who slew six hundred Philistines with an oxgoad. He too was a champion of Israel.
Transliteration: veacharayv hayah shamegar ven-anat vayakhe et-felishetiym shesh-mevot iysh vemalemad havakar vayyvosha gam-hu et-yisherael {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּסִ֙פוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת הָרַ֖ע בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וְאֵה֖וּד מֵֽת׃
Translated: The Israelites again did what was offensive to G<small>OD</small>—Ehud now being dead.
Transliteration: vayosifu veney yisherael laashvot hara veeyney yehovah veehud met

Hebrew: וַיִּמְכְּרֵ֣ם יְהֹוָ֗ה בְּיַד֙ יָבִ֣ין מֶלֶךְ־כְּנַ֔עַן אֲשֶׁ֥ר מָלַ֖ךְ בְּחָצ֑וֹר וְשַׂר־צְבָאוֹ֙ סִֽיסְרָ֔א וְה֥וּא יוֹשֵׁ֖ב בַּחֲרֹ֥שֶׁת הַגּוֹיִֽם׃
Translated: And G<small>OD</small> surrendered them to King Jabin of Canaan, who reigned in Hazor. His army commander was Sisera, whose base was Harosheth-goiim.
Transliteration: vayimekherem yehovah veyad yaviyn melekhe-khenaan asher malakhe vechatsvor veshar-tsevavo siysera vehu yvoshev vacharoshet hagvoyim

Hebrew: וַיִּצְעֲק֥וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל אֶל־יְהֹוָ֑ה כִּ֠י תְּשַׁ֨ע מֵא֤וֹת רֶֽכֶב־בַּרְזֶל֙ ל֔וֹ וְ֠ה֠וּא לָחַ֞ץ אֶת־בְּנֵ֧י יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל בְּחׇזְקָ֖ה עֶשְׂרִ֥ים שָׁנָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: The Israelites cried out to G<small>OD</small>; for he had nine hundred iron chariots, and he had oppressed Israel ruthlessly for twenty years.
Transliteration: vayitseaku veney-yisherael el-yehovah khiy tesha mevot rekhev-varezel lvo vehu lachats et-veney yisherael vechׇzekah esheriym shanah {f}

Hebrew: וּדְבוֹרָה֙ אִשָּׁ֣ה נְבִיאָ֔ה אֵ֖שֶׁת לַפִּיד֑וֹת הִ֛יא שֹׁפְטָ֥ה אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בָּעֵ֥ת הַהִֽיא׃
Translated: Deborah, wife of Lappidoth, was a prophet; she led Israel at that time.
Transliteration: udevvorah ishah neviyah eshet lafiydvot hiy shofetah et-yisherael vaet hahiy

Hebrew: וְ֠הִ֠יא יוֹשֶׁ֨בֶת תַּחַת־תֹּ֜מֶר דְּבוֹרָ֗ה בֵּ֧ין הָרָמָ֛ה וּבֵ֥ין בֵּֽית־אֵ֖ל בְּהַ֣ר אֶפְרָ֑יִם וַיַּעֲל֥וּ אֵלֶ֛יהָ בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לַמִּשְׁפָּֽט׃
Translated: She used to sit under the Palm of Deborah, between Ramah and Bethel in the hill country of Ephraim, and the Israelites would come to her for decisions.
Transliteration: vehiy yvoshevet tachat-tomer devvorah veyn haramah uveyn veyt-el vehar eferayiim vayaalu eleyha veney yisherael lamishefat

Hebrew: וַתִּשְׁלַ֗ח וַתִּקְרָא֙ לְבָרָ֣ק בֶּן־אֲבִינֹ֔עַם מִקֶּ֖דֶשׁ נַפְתָּלִ֑י וַתֹּ֨אמֶר אֵלָ֜יו הֲלֹ֥א צִוָּ֣ה ׀ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל לֵ֤ךְ וּמָֽשַׁכְתָּ֙ בְּהַ֣ר תָּב֔וֹר וְלָקַחְתָּ֣ עִמְּךָ֗ עֲשֶׂ֤רֶת אֲלָפִים֙ אִ֔ישׁ מִבְּנֵ֥י נַפְתָּלִ֖י וּמִבְּנֵ֥י זְבֻלֽוּן׃
Translated: She summoned Barak son of Abinoam, of Kedesh in Naphtali, and said to him, “The E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Israel, has commanded: Go, march up to Mount Tabor, and take with you ten thousand men of Naphtali and Zebulun.
Transliteration: vatishelach vatikera levarak ven-aviynoam mikedesh nafetaliy vatomer elayv halo tsivah yehovah elohey-yisherael lekhe umashakheta vehar tavvor velakacheta imekha asheret alafiym iysh miveney nafetaliy umiveney zevulun

Hebrew: וּמָשַׁכְתִּ֨י אֵלֶ֜יךָ אֶל־נַ֣חַל קִישׁ֗וֹן אֶת־סִֽיסְרָא֙ שַׂר־צְבָ֣א יָבִ֔ין וְאֶת־רִכְבּ֖וֹ וְאֶת־הֲמוֹנ֑וֹ וּנְתַתִּ֖יהוּ בְּיָדֶֽךָ׃
Translated: And I will draw Sisera, Jabin’s army commander, with his chariots and his troops, toward you up to the Wadi Kishon; and I will deliver him into your hands.”
Transliteration: umashakhetiy eleykha el-nachal kiyshvon et-siysera shar-tseva yaviyn veet-rikhevvo veet-hamvonvo unetatiyhu veyadekha

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֵלֶ֙יהָ֙ בָּרָ֔ק אִם־תֵּלְכִ֥י עִמִּ֖י וְהָלָ֑כְתִּי וְאִם־לֹ֥א תֵֽלְכִ֛י עִמִּ֖י לֹ֥א אֵלֵֽךְ׃
Translated: But Barak said to her, “If you will go with me, I will go; if not, I will not go.”
Transliteration: vayomer eleyha varak im-telekhiy imiy vehalakhetiy veim-lo telekhiy imiy lo elekhe

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֜אמֶר הָלֹ֧ךְ אֵלֵ֣ךְ עִמָּ֗ךְ אֶ֚פֶס כִּי֩ לֹ֨א תִֽהְיֶ֜ה תִּֽפְאַרְתְּךָ֗ עַל־הַדֶּ֙רֶךְ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אַתָּ֣ה הוֹלֵ֔ךְ כִּ֣י בְֽיַד־אִשָּׁ֔ה יִמְכֹּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־סִֽיסְרָ֑א וַתָּ֧קׇם דְּבוֹרָ֛ה וַתֵּ֥לֶךְ עִם־בָּרָ֖ק קֶֽדְשָׁה׃
Translated: “Very well, I will go with you,” she answered. “However, there will be no glory for you in the course you are taking, for then G<small>OD</small> will deliver Sisera into the hands of a woman.” So Deborah went with Barak to Kedesh.
Transliteration: vatomer halokhe elekhe imakhe efes khiy lo tiheyeh tifearetekha al-haderekhe asher atah hvolekhe khiy veyad-ishah yimekhor yehovah et-siysera vatakׇm devvorah vatelekhe im-varak kedeshah

Hebrew: וַיַּזְעֵ֨ק בָּרָ֜ק אֶת־זְבוּלֻ֤ן וְאֶת־נַפְתָּלִי֙ קֶ֔דְשָׁה וַיַּ֣עַל בְּרַגְלָ֔יו עֲשֶׂ֥רֶת אַלְפֵ֖י אִ֑ישׁ וַתַּ֥עַל עִמּ֖וֹ דְּבוֹרָֽה׃
Translated: Barak then mustered Zebulun and Naphtali at Kedesh; ten thousand men marched up after him; and Deborah also went up with him.
Transliteration: vayazeek varak et-zevulun veet-nafetaliy kedeshah vayaal veragelayv asheret alefey iysh vataal imvo devvorah

Hebrew: וְחֶ֤בֶר הַקֵּינִי֙ נִפְרָ֣ד מִקַּ֔יִן מִבְּנֵ֥י חֹבָ֖ב חֹתֵ֣ן מֹשֶׁ֑ה וַיֵּ֣ט אׇֽהֳל֔וֹ עַד־אֵיל֥וֹן (בצענים) [בְּצַעֲנַנִּ֖ים] אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֶת־קֶֽדֶשׁ׃
Translated: Now Heber the Kenite had separated from the other Kenites, descendants of Hobab, father-in-law of Moses, and had pitched his tent at Elon-bezaanannim, which is near Kedesh.
Transliteration: vechever hakeyniy niferad mikayiin miveney chovav choten mosheh vayet ׇholvo ad-eylvon (vtsnym) [vetsaananiym] asher et-kedesh

Hebrew: וַיַּגִּ֖דוּ לְסִֽיסְרָ֑א כִּ֥י עָלָ֛ה בָּרָ֥ק בֶּן־אֲבִינֹ֖עַם הַר־תָּבֽוֹר׃
Translated: Sisera was informed that Barak son of Abinoam had gone up to Mount Tabor.
Transliteration: vayagidu lesiysera khiy alah varak ven-aviynoam har-tavvor

Hebrew: וַיַּזְעֵ֨ק סִֽיסְרָ֜א אֶת־כׇּל־רִכְבּ֗וֹ תְּשַׁ֤ע מֵאוֹת֙ רֶ֣כֶב בַּרְזֶ֔ל וְאֶת־כׇּל־הָעָ֖ם אֲשֶׁ֣ר אִתּ֑וֹ מֵחֲרֹ֥שֶׁת הַגּוֹיִ֖ם אֶל־נַ֥חַל קִישֽׁוֹן׃
Translated: So Sisera ordered all his chariots—nine hundred iron chariots—and all the troops he had to move from Harosheth-goiim to the Wadi Kishon.
Transliteration: vayazeek siysera et-khׇl-rikhevvo tesha mevot rekhev varezel veet-khׇl-haam asher itvo mecharoshet hagvoyim el-nachal kiyshvon

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֩אמֶר֩ דְּבֹרָ֨ה אֶל־בָּרָ֜ק ק֗וּם כִּ֣י זֶ֤ה הַיּוֹם֙ אֲשֶׁר֩ נָתַ֨ן יְהֹוָ֤ה אֶת־סִֽיסְרָא֙ בְּיָדֶ֔ךָ הֲלֹ֥א יְהֹוָ֖ה יָצָ֣א לְפָנֶ֑יךָ וַיֵּ֤רֶד בָּרָק֙ מֵהַ֣ר תָּב֔וֹר וַעֲשֶׂ֧רֶת אֲלָפִ֛ים אִ֖ישׁ אַחֲרָֽיו׃
Translated: Then Deborah said to Barak, “Up! This is the day on which G<small>OD</small> will deliver Sisera into your hands: G<small>OD</small> is marching before you.” Barak charged down Mount Tabor, followed by the ten thousand men,
Transliteration: vatomer devorah el-varak kum khiy zeh hayyvom asher natan yehovah et-siysera veyadekha halo yehovah yatsa lefaneykha vayered varak mehar tavvor vaasheret alafiym iysh acharayv

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣הׇם יְ֠הֹוָ֠ה אֶת־סִֽיסְרָ֨א וְאֶת־כׇּל־הָרֶ֧כֶב וְאֶת־כׇּל־הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֛ה לְפִי־חֶ֖רֶב לִפְנֵ֣י בָרָ֑ק וַיֵּ֧רֶד סִֽיסְרָ֛א מֵעַ֥ל הַמֶּרְכָּבָ֖ה וַיָּ֥נׇס בְּרַגְלָֽיו׃
Translated: and G<small>OD</small> threw Sisera and all his chariots and army into a panic before the onslaught of Barak. Sisera leaped from his chariot and fled on foot
Transliteration: vayahׇm yehovah et-siysera veet-khׇl-harekhev veet-khׇl-hamachaneh lefiy-cherev lifeney varak vayered siysera meal hamerekhavah vayanׇs veragelayv

Hebrew: וּבָרָ֗ק רָדַ֞ף אַחֲרֵ֤י הָרֶ֙כֶב֙ וְאַחֲרֵ֣י הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֔ה עַ֖ד חֲרֹ֣שֶׁת הַגּוֹיִ֑ם וַיִּפֹּ֞ל כׇּל־מַחֲנֵ֤ה סִֽיסְרָא֙ לְפִי־חֶ֔רֶב לֹ֥א נִשְׁאַ֖ר עַד־אֶחָֽד׃
Translated: as Barak pursued the chariots and the soldiers as far as Harosheth-goiim. All of Sisera’s soldiers fell by the sword; not one was left.
Transliteration: uvarak radaf acharey harekhev veacharey hamachaneh ad charoshet hagvoyim vayifol khׇl-machaneh siysera lefiy-cherev lo nishear ad-echad

Hebrew: וְסִֽיסְרָא֙ נָ֣ס בְּרַגְלָ֔יו אֶל־אֹ֣הֶל יָעֵ֔ל אֵ֖שֶׁת חֶ֣בֶר הַקֵּינִ֑י כִּ֣י שָׁל֗וֹם בֵּ֚ין יָבִ֣ין מֶלֶךְ־חָצ֔וֹר וּבֵ֕ין בֵּ֖ית חֶ֥בֶר הַקֵּינִֽי׃
Translated: Sisera, meanwhile, had fled on foot to the tent of Jael, wife of Heber the Kenite; for there was friendship between King Jabin of Hazor and the family of Heber the Kenite.
Transliteration: vesiysera nas veragelayv el-ohel yael eshet chever hakeyniy khiy shalvom veyn yaviyn melekhe-chatsvor uveyn veyt chever hakeyniy

Hebrew: וַתֵּצֵ֣א יָעֵל֮ לִקְרַ֣את סִֽיסְרָא֒ וַתֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלָ֗יו סוּרָ֧ה אֲדֹנִ֛י סוּרָ֥ה אֵלַ֖י אַל־תִּירָ֑א וַיָּ֤סַר אֵלֶ֙יהָ֙ הָאֹ֔הֱלָה וַתְּכַסֵּ֖הוּ בַּשְּׂמִיכָֽה׃
Translated: Jael came out to greet Sisera and said to him, “Come in, my lord, come in here, do not be afraid.” So he entered her tent, and she covered him with a blanket.
Transliteration: vatetse yael likerat siysera vatomer elayv surah adoniy surah elay al-tiyra vayasar eleyha haohelah vatekhasehu vashemiykhah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֧אמֶר אֵלֶ֛יהָ הַשְׁקִינִי־נָ֥א מְעַט־מַ֖יִם כִּ֣י צָמֵ֑אתִי וַתִּפְתַּ֞ח אֶת־נֹ֧אוד הֶחָלָ֛ב וַתַּשְׁקֵ֖הוּ וַתְּכַסֵּֽהוּ׃
Translated: He said to her, “Please let me have some water; I am thirsty.” She opened a skin of milk and gave him some to drink; and she covered him again.
Transliteration: vayomer eleyha hashekiyniy-na meat-mayiim khiy tsametiy vatifetach et-novd hechalav vatashekehu vatekhasehu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלֶ֔יהָ עֲמֹ֖ד פֶּ֣תַח הָאֹ֑הֶל וְהָיָה֩ אִם־אִ֨ישׁ יָבֹ֜א וּשְׁאֵלֵ֗ךְ וְאָמַ֛ר הֲיֵֽשׁ־פֹּ֥ה אִ֖ישׁ וְאָמַ֥רְתְּ אָֽיִן׃
Translated: He said to her, “Stand at the entrance of the tent. If anybody comes and asks you if there is anybody here, say ‘No.’”
Transliteration: vayomer eleyha amod fetach haohel vehayah im-iysh yavo usheelekhe veamar haeish-foh iysh veamarete ayiin

Hebrew: וַתִּקַּ֣ח יָעֵ֣ל אֵֽשֶׁת־חֶ֠בֶר אֶת־יְתַ֨ד הָאֹ֜הֶל וַתָּ֧שֶׂם אֶת־הַמַּקֶּ֣בֶת בְּיָדָ֗הּ וַתָּב֤וֹא אֵלָיו֙ בַּלָּ֔אט וַתִּתְקַ֤ע אֶת־הַיָּתֵד֙ בְּרַקָּת֔וֹ וַתִּצְנַ֖ח בָּאָ֑רֶץ וְהֽוּא־נִרְדָּ֥ם וַיָּ֖עַף וַיָּמֹֽת׃
Translated: Then Jael wife of Heber took a tent pin and grasped the mallet. When he was fast asleep from exhaustion, she approached him stealthily and drove the pin through his temple till it went down to the ground. Thus he died.
Transliteration: vatikach yael eshet-chever et-yetad haohel vatashem et-hamakevet veyadah vatavvo elayv valat vatiteka et-hayated verakatvo vatitsenach vaarets vehu-niredam vayaaf vayamot

Hebrew: וְהִנֵּ֣ה בָרָק֮ רֹדֵ֣ף אֶת־סִֽיסְרָא֒ וַתֵּצֵ֤א יָעֵל֙ לִקְרָאת֔וֹ וַתֹּ֣אמֶר ל֔וֹ לֵ֣ךְ וְאַרְאֶ֔ךָּ אֶת־הָאִ֖ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־אַתָּ֣ה מְבַקֵּ֑שׁ וַיָּבֹ֣א אֵלֶ֔יהָ וְהִנֵּ֤ה סִֽיסְרָא֙ נֹפֵ֣ל מֵ֔ת וְהַיָּתֵ֖ד בְּרַקָּתֽוֹ׃
Translated: Now Barak appeared in pursuit of Sisera. Jael went out to greet him and said, “Come, I will show you the man you are looking for.” He went inside with her, and there Sisera was lying dead, with the pin in his temple.
Transliteration: vehineh varak rodef et-siysera vatetse yael likeratvo vatomer lvo lekhe veareekha et-haiysh asher-atah mevakesh vayavo eleyha vehineh siysera nofel met vehayated verakatvo

Hebrew: וַיַּכְנַ֤ע אֱלֹהִים֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֔וּא אֵ֖ת יָבִ֣ין מֶֽלֶךְ־כְּנָ֑עַן לִפְנֵ֖י בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: On that day God subdued King Jabin of Canaan before the Israelites.
Transliteration: vayakhena Elohim vayyvom hahu et yaviyn melekhe-khenaan lifeney veney yisherael

Hebrew: וַתֵּ֜לֶךְ יַ֤ד בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ הָל֣וֹךְ וְקָשָׁ֔ה עַ֖ל יָבִ֣ין מֶלֶךְ־כְּנָ֑עַן עַ֚ד אֲשֶׁ֣ר הִכְרִ֔יתוּ אֵ֖ת יָבִ֥ין מֶלֶךְ־כְּנָֽעַן׃ {פ}
Translated: The hand of the Israelites bore harder and harder on King Jabin of Canaan, until they destroyed King Jabin of Canaan.
Transliteration: vatelekhe yad veney-yisherael halvokhe vekashah al yaviyn melekhe-khenaan ad asher hikheriytu et yaviyn melekhe-khenaan {f}

Hebrew: וַתָּ֣שַׁר דְּבוֹרָ֔ה וּבָרָ֖ק בֶּן־אֲבִינֹ֑עַם בַּיּ֥וֹם הַה֖וּא לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: On that day Deborah and Barak son of Abinoam sang:
Transliteration: vatashar devvorah uvarak ven-aviynoam vayyvom hahu lemor

Hebrew: בִּפְרֹ֤עַ פְּרָעוֹת֙ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל בְּהִתְנַדֵּ֖ב עָ֑ם בָּֽרְכ֖וּ יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
When locks go untrimmed in Israel,
When people dedicate themselves—
Bless GOD!
Transliteration: viferoa feravot veyisherael vehitenadev am varekhu yehovah

Hebrew: שִׁמְע֣וּ מְלָכִ֔ים הַאֲזִ֖ינוּ רֹֽזְנִ֑ים אָנֹכִ֗י לַֽיהֹוָה֙ אָנֹכִ֣י אָשִׁ֔ירָה אֲזַמֵּ֕ר לַֽיהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
Hear, O kings! Give ear, O potentates!
I will sing, will sing to GOD,
Will hymn the ETERNAL, the God of Israel.
Transliteration: shimeu melakhiym haaziynu rozeniym anokhiy layhovah anokhiy ashiyrah azamer layhovah elohey yisherael

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֗ה בְּצֵאתְךָ֤ מִשֵּׂעִיר֙ בְּצַעְדְּךָ֙ מִשְּׂדֵ֣ה אֱד֔וֹם אֶ֣רֶץ רָעָ֔שָׁה גַּם־שָׁמַ֖יִם נָטָ֑פוּ גַּם־עָבִ֖ים נָ֥טְפוּ מָֽיִם׃
Translated:
O GOD, when You came forth from Seir,
Advanced from the country of Edom,
The earth trembled;
The heavens dripped,
Yea, the clouds dripped water,
Transliteration: yehovah vetsetekha misheiyr vetsaedekha mishedeh edvom erets raashah gam-shamayiim natafu gam-aviym natefu mayiim

Hebrew: הָרִ֥ים נָזְל֖וּ מִפְּנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה זֶ֣ה סִינַ֔י מִפְּנֵ֕י יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
The mountains quaked because of GOD,
Yon Sinai, because of GOD—the God of Israel.
Transliteration: hariym nazelu mifeney yehovah zeh siynay mifeney yehovah elohey yisherael

Hebrew: בִּימֵ֞י שַׁמְגַּ֤ר בֶּן־עֲנָת֙ בִּימֵ֣י יָעֵ֔ל חָֽדְל֖וּ אֳרָח֑וֹת וְהֹלְכֵ֣י נְתִיב֔וֹת יֵלְכ֕וּ אֳרָח֖וֹת עֲקַלְקַלּֽוֹת׃
Translated:
In the days of Shamgar son of Anath,
In the days of Jael, caravans ceased,
And wayfarers went
By roundabout paths.
Transliteration: viymey shamegar ven-anat viymey yael chadelu orachvot veholekhey netiyvvot eilekhu orachvot akalekalvot

Hebrew: חָדְל֧וּ פְרָז֛וֹן בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל חָדֵ֑לּוּ עַ֤ד שַׁקַּ֙מְתִּי֙ דְּבוֹרָ֔ה שַׁקַּ֥מְתִּי אֵ֖ם בְּיִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
Deliverance ceased,
Ceased in Israel,
Till you arose, O Deborah,
Arose, O mother, in Israel!
Transliteration: chadelu ferazvon veyisherael chadelu ad shakametiy devvorah shakametiy em veyisherael

Hebrew: יִבְחַר֙ אֱלֹהִ֣ים חֲדָשִׁ֔ים אָ֖ז לָחֶ֣ם שְׁעָרִ֑ים מָגֵ֤ן אִם־יֵֽרָאֶה֙ וָרֹ֔מַח בְּאַרְבָּעִ֥ים אֶ֖לֶף בְּיִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
When they chose new gods,
Was there a fighter then in the gates?
No shield or spear was seen
Among forty thousand in Israel!
Transliteration: yivechar Elohim chadashiym az lachem sheariym magen im-eiraeh varomach vearevaiym elef veyisherael

Hebrew: לִבִּי֙ לְחוֹקְקֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל הַמִּֽתְנַדְּבִ֖ים בָּעָ֑ם בָּרְכ֖וּ יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
My heart is with Israel’s leaders,
With the dedicated of the people—
Bless GOD!
Transliteration: liviy lechvokekey yisherael hamitenadeviym vaam varekhu yehovah

Hebrew: רֹכְבֵי֩ אֲתֹנ֨וֹת צְחֹר֜וֹת יֹשְׁבֵ֧י עַל־מִדִּ֛ין וְהֹלְכֵ֥י עַל־דֶּ֖רֶךְ שִֽׂיחוּ׃
Translated:
You riders on tawny jennies,
You who sit on saddle rugs,
And you wayfarers, declare it!
Transliteration: rokhevey atonvot tsechorvot yoshevey al-midiyn veholekhey al-derekhe shiychu

Hebrew: מִקּ֣וֹל מְחַֽצְצִ֗ים בֵּ֚ין מַשְׁאַבִּ֔ים שָׁ֤ם יְתַנּוּ֙ צִדְק֣וֹת יְהֹוָ֔ה צִדְקֹ֥ת פִּרְזוֹנ֖וֹ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אָ֛ז יָֽרְד֥וּ לַשְּׁעָרִ֖ים עַם־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
Louder than the sound of archers,
There among the watering places
Let them chant GOD’s gracious acts—
The gracious deliverance of Israel.
Then did GOD’s people
March down to the gates!
Transliteration: mikvol mechatsetsiym veyn masheaviym sham yetanu tsidekvot yehovah tsidekot firezvonvo veyisherael az yaredu lasheariym am-yehovah

Hebrew: עוּרִ֤י עוּרִי֙ דְּבוֹרָ֔ה ע֥וּרִי ע֖וּרִי דַּבְּרִי־שִׁ֑יר ק֥וּם בָּרָ֛ק וּֽשְׁבֵ֥ה שֶׁבְיְךָ֖ בֶּן־אֲבִינֹֽעַם׃
Translated:
Awake, awake, O Deborah!
Awake, awake, strike up the chant!
Arise, O Barak;
Take your captives, O son of Abinoam!
Transliteration: uriy uriy devvorah uriy uriy daveriy-shiyr kum varak usheveh sheveyekha ven-aviynoam

Hebrew: אָ֚ז יְרַ֣ד שָׂרִ֔יד לְאַדִּירִ֖ים עָ֑ם יְהֹוָ֕ה יְרַד־לִ֖י בַּגִּבּוֹרִֽים׃
Translated:
Then was the remnant made victor over the mighty,
GOD ’s people won my victory over the warriors.
Transliteration: az yerad shariyd leadiyriym am yehovah yerad-liy vagivvoriym

Hebrew: מִנִּ֣י אֶפְרַ֗יִם שׇׁרְשָׁם֙ בַּעֲמָלֵ֔ק אַחֲרֶ֥יךָ בִנְיָמִ֖ין בַּעֲמָמֶ֑יךָ מִנִּ֣י מָכִ֗יר יָֽרְדוּ֙ מְחֹ֣קְקִ֔ים וּמִ֨זְּבוּלֻ֔ן מֹשְׁכִ֖ים בְּשֵׁ֥בֶט סֹפֵֽר׃
Translated:
From Ephraim came they whose roots are in Amalek;
After you, your kin Benjamin;
From Machir came down leaders,
From Zebulun such as hold the marshal’s staff.
Transliteration: miniy eferayiim shׇresham vaamalek achareykha vineyamiyn vaamameykha miniy makhiyr yaredu mechokekiym umizevulun moshekhiym veshevet sofer

Hebrew: וְשָׂרַ֤י בְּיִשָּׂשכָר֙ עִם־דְּבֹרָ֔ה וְיִשָּׂשכָר֙ כֵּ֣ן בָּרָ֔ק בָּעֵ֖מֶק שֻׁלַּ֣ח בְּרַגְלָ֑יו בִּפְלַגּ֣וֹת רְאוּבֵ֔ן גְּדֹלִ֖ים חִקְקֵי־לֵֽב׃
Translated:
And Issachar’s chiefs were with Deborah;
As Barak, so was Issachar—
Rushing after him into the valley.
Among the clans of Reuben
Were great decisions of heart.
Transliteration: vesharay veyishashkhar im-devorah veyishashkhar khen varak vaemek shulach veragelayv vifelagvot reuven gedoliym chikekey-lev

Hebrew: לָ֣מָּה יָשַׁ֗בְתָּ בֵּ֚ין הַֽמִּשְׁפְּתַ֔יִם לִשְׁמֹ֖עַ שְׁרִק֣וֹת עֲדָרִ֑ים לִפְלַגּ֣וֹת רְאוּבֵ֔ן גְּדוֹלִ֖ים חִקְרֵי־לֵֽב׃
Translated:
Why then did you stay among the sheepfolds
And listen as they pipe for the flocks?
Among the clans of Reuben
Were great searchings of heart!
Transliteration: lamah yashaveta veyn hamishefetayiim lishemoa sherikvot adariym lifelagvot reuven gedvoliym chikerey-lev

Hebrew: גִּלְעָ֗ד בְּעֵ֤בֶר הַיַּרְדֵּן֙ שָׁכֵ֔ן וְדָ֕ן לָ֥מָּה יָג֖וּר אֳנִיּ֑וֹת אָשֵׁ֗ר יָשַׁב֙ לְח֣וֹף יַמִּ֔ים וְעַ֥ל מִפְרָצָ֖יו יִשְׁכּֽוֹן׃
Translated:
Gilead tarried beyond the Jordan;
And Dan—why did he linger by the ships?
Asher remained at the seacoast
And tarried at his landings.
Transliteration: gilead veever hayareden shakhen vedan lamah yagur oniyyvot asher yashav lechvof yamiym veal miferatsayv yishekhvon

Hebrew: זְבֻל֗וּן עַ֣ם חֵרֵ֥ף נַפְשׁ֛וֹ לָמ֖וּת וְנַפְתָּלִ֑י עַ֖ל מְרוֹמֵ֥י שָׂדֶֽה׃
Translated:
Zebulun is a people that mocked at death,
Naphtali—on the open heights.
Transliteration: zevulun am cheref nafeshvo lamut venafetaliy al mervomey shadeh

Hebrew: בָּ֤אוּ מְלָכִים֙ נִלְחָ֔מוּ אָ֤ז נִלְחֲמוּ֙ מַלְכֵ֣י כְנַ֔עַן בְּתַעְנַ֖ךְ עַל־מֵ֣י מְגִדּ֑וֹ בֶּ֥צַע כֶּ֖סֶף לֹ֥א לָקָֽחוּ׃
Translated:
Then the kings came, they fought:
The kings of Canaan fought
At Taanach, by Megiddo’s waters—
They got no spoil of silver.
Transliteration: vau melakhiym nilechamu az nilechamu malekhey khenaan vetaenakhe al-mey megidvo vetsa khesef lo lakachu

Hebrew: מִן־שָׁמַ֖יִם נִלְחָ֑מוּ הַכּֽוֹכָבִים֙ מִמְּסִלּוֹתָ֔ם נִלְחֲמ֖וּ עִם־סִֽיסְרָֽא׃
Translated:
The stars fought from heaven,
From their courses they fought against Sisera.
Transliteration: min-shamayiim nilechamu hakhvokhaviym mimesilvotam nilechamu im-siysera

Hebrew: נַ֤חַל קִישׁוֹן֙ גְּרָפָ֔ם נַ֥חַל קְדוּמִ֖ים נַ֣חַל קִישׁ֑וֹן תִּדְרְכִ֥י נַפְשִׁ֖י עֹֽז׃
Translated:
The torrent Kishon swept them away,
The raging torrent, the torrent Kishon.
March on, my soul, with courage!
Transliteration: nachal kiyshvon gerafam nachal kedumiym nachal kiyshvon tiderekhiy nafeshiy oz

Hebrew: אָ֥ז הָלְמ֖וּ עִקְּבֵי־ס֑וּס מִֽדַּהֲר֖וֹת דַּהֲר֥וֹת אַבִּירָֽיו׃
Translated:
Then the horses’ hoofs pounded
As headlong galloped the steeds.
Transliteration: az halemu ikevey-sus midaharvot daharvot aviyrayv

Hebrew: א֣וֹרוּ מֵר֗וֹז אָמַר֙ מַלְאַ֣ךְ יְהֹוָ֔ה אֹ֥רוּ אָר֖וֹר יֹשְׁבֶ֑יהָ כִּ֤י לֹֽא־בָ֙אוּ֙ לְעֶזְרַ֣ת יְהֹוָ֔ה לְעֶזְרַ֥ת יְהֹוָ֖ה בַּגִּבּוֹרִֽים׃
Translated:
“Curse Meroz!” said the angel of GOD.
“Bitterly curse its inhabitants,
Because they came not to GOD’s aid
To GOD’s aid among the warriors.”
Transliteration: voru mervoz amar maleakhe yehovah oru arvor yosheveyha khiy lo-vau leezerat yehovah leezerat yehovah vagivvoriym

Hebrew: תְּבֹרַךְ֙ מִנָּשִׁ֔ים יָעֵ֕ל אֵ֖שֶׁת חֶ֣בֶר הַקֵּינִ֑י מִנָּשִׁ֥ים בָּאֹ֖הֶל תְּבֹרָֽךְ׃
Translated:
Most blessed of women be Jael,
Wife of Heber the Kenite,
Most blessed of women in tents.
Transliteration: tevorakhe minashiym yael eshet chever hakeyniy minashiym vaohel tevorakhe

Hebrew: מַ֥יִם שָׁאַ֖ל חָלָ֣ב נָתָ֑נָה בְּסֵ֥פֶל אַדִּירִ֖ים הִקְרִ֥יבָה חֶמְאָֽה׃
Translated:
He asked for water, she offered milk;
In a princely bowl she brought him curds.
Transliteration: mayiim shaal chalav natanah vesefel adiyriym hikeriyvah chemeah

Hebrew: יָדָהּ֙ לַיָּתֵ֣ד תִּשְׁלַ֔חְנָה וִימִינָ֖הּ לְהַלְמ֣וּת עֲמֵלִ֑ים וְהָלְמָ֤ה סִֽיסְרָא֙ מָחֲקָ֣ה רֹאשׁ֔וֹ וּמָחֲצָ֥ה וְחָלְפָ֖ה רַקָּתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Her [left] hand reached for the tent pin,
Her right for the workmen’s hammer.
She struck Sisera, crushed his head,
Smashed and pierced his temple.
Transliteration: yadah layated tishelachenah viymiynah lehalemut ameliym vehalemah siysera machakah roshvo umachatsah vechalefah rakatvo

Hebrew: בֵּ֣ין רַגְלֶ֔יהָ כָּרַ֥ע נָפַ֖ל שָׁכָ֑ב בֵּ֤ין רַגְלֶ֙יהָ֙ כָּרַ֣ע נָפָ֔ל בַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר כָּרַ֔ע שָׁ֖ם נָפַ֥ל שָׁדֽוּד׃
Translated:
At her feet he sank, lay outstretched,
At her feet he sank, lay still;
Where he sank, there he lay—destroyed.
Transliteration: veyn rageleyha khara nafal shakhav veyn rageleyha khara nafal vaasher khara sham nafal shadud

Hebrew: בְּעַד֩ הַחַלּ֨וֹן נִשְׁקְפָ֧ה וַתְּיַבֵּ֛ב אֵ֥ם סִֽיסְרָ֖א בְּעַ֣ד הָאֶשְׁנָ֑ב מַדּ֗וּעַ בֹּשֵׁ֤שׁ רִכְבּוֹ֙ לָב֔וֹא מַדּ֣וּעַ אֶֽחֱר֔וּ פַּעֲמֵ֖י מַרְכְּבוֹתָֽיו׃
Translated:
Through the window peered Sisera’s mother,
Behind the lattice she whined:
“Why is his chariot so long in coming?
Why so late the clatter of his wheels?”
Transliteration: vead hachalvon nishekefah vateyavev em siysera vead haeshenav madua voshesh rikhevvo lavvo madua echeru faamey marekhevvotayv

Hebrew: חַכְמ֥וֹת שָׂרוֹתֶ֖יהָ תַּעֲנֶ֑ינָּה אַף־הִ֕יא תָּשִׁ֥יב אֲמָרֶ֖יהָ לָֽהּ׃
Translated:
The wisest of her ladies give answer;
She, too, replies to herself:
Transliteration: chakhemvot sharvoteyha taaneynah af-hiy tashiyv amareyha lah

Hebrew: הֲלֹ֨א יִמְצְא֜וּ יְחַלְּק֣וּ שָׁלָ֗ל רַ֤חַם רַחֲמָתַ֙יִם֙ לְרֹ֣אשׁ גֶּ֔בֶר שְׁלַ֤ל צְבָעִים֙ לְסִ֣יסְרָ֔א שְׁלַ֥ל צְבָעִ֖ים רִקְמָ֑ה צֶ֥בַע רִקְמָתַ֖יִם לְצַוְּארֵ֥י שָׁלָֽל׃
Translated:
“They must be dividing the spoil they have found:
A woman or two for each man,
Spoil of dyed cloths for Sisera,
Spoil of embroidered cloths,
A couple of embroidered cloths
Round every neck as spoil.”
Transliteration: halo yimetseu yechaleku shalal racham rachamatayiim lerosh gever shelal tsevaiym lesiysera shelal tsevaiym rikemah tseva rikematayiim letsaverey shalal

Hebrew: כֵּ֠ן יֹאבְד֤וּ כׇל־אוֹיְבֶ֙יךָ֙ יְהֹוָ֔ה וְאֹ֣הֲבָ֔יו כְּצֵ֥את הַשֶּׁ֖מֶשׁ בִּגְבֻרָת֑וֹ וַתִּשְׁקֹ֥ט הָאָ֖רֶץ אַרְבָּעִ֥ים שָׁנָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
So may all Your enemies perish, O GOD!
But may Your friends be as the sun rising in might!
And the land was tranquil forty years.
Transliteration: khen yovedu khׇl-voyeveykha yehovah veohavayv khetset hashemesh vigevuratvo vatishekot haarets arevaiym shanah {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲשׂ֧וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל הָרַ֖ע בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיִּתְּנֵ֧ם יְהֹוָ֛ה בְּיַד־מִדְיָ֖ן שֶׁ֥בַע שָׁנִֽים׃
Translated: Then the Israelites did what was offensive to G<small>OD</small>, and G<small>OD</small> delivered them into the hands of the Midianites for seven years.
Transliteration: vayaashu veney-yisherael hara veeyney yehovah vayitenem yehovah veyad-mideyan sheva shaniym

Hebrew: וַתָּ֥עׇז יַד־מִדְיָ֖ן עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל מִפְּנֵ֨י מִדְיָ֜ן עָשׂ֥וּ לָהֶ֣ם ׀ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל אֶת־הַמִּנְהָרוֹת֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בֶּהָרִ֔ים וְאֶת־הַמְּעָר֖וֹת וְאֶת־הַמְּצָדֽוֹת׃
Translated: The hand of the Midianites prevailed over Israel; and because of Midian, the Israelites provided themselves with refuges in the caves and strongholds of the mountains.
Transliteration: vataׇz yad-mideyan al-yisherael mifeney mideyan ashu lahem veney yisherael et-hamineharvot asher vehariym veet-hamearvot veet-hametsadvot

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֖ה אִם־זָרַ֣ע יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְעָלָ֨ה מִדְיָ֧ן וַעֲמָלֵ֛ק וּבְנֵי־קֶ֖דֶם וְעָל֥וּ עָלָֽיו׃
Translated: After the Israelites had done their sowing, Midian, Amalek, and the Kedemites would come up and raid them;
Transliteration: vehayah im-zara yisherael vealah mideyan vaamalek uveney-kedem vealu alayv

Hebrew: וַיַּֽחֲנ֣וּ עֲלֵיהֶ֗ם וַיַּשְׁחִ֙יתוּ֙ אֶת־יְב֣וּל הָאָ֔רֶץ עַד־בּוֹאֲךָ֖ עַזָּ֑ה וְלֹֽא־יַשְׁאִ֤ירוּ מִֽחְיָה֙ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְשֶׂ֥ה וָשׁ֖וֹר וַחֲמֽוֹר׃
Translated: they would attack them, destroy the produce of the land all the way to Gaza, and leave no means of sustenance in Israel, not a sheep or an ox or a donkey.
Transliteration: vayachanu aleyhem vayashechiytu et-yevul haarets ad-vvoakha azah velo-yasheiyru micheyah veyisherael vesheh vashvor vachamvor

Hebrew: כִּ֡י הֵם֩ וּמִקְנֵיהֶ֨ם יַֽעֲל֜וּ וְאׇהֳלֵיהֶ֗ם (יבאו) [וּבָ֤אוּ] כְדֵֽי־אַרְבֶּה֙ לָרֹ֔ב וְלָהֶ֥ם וְלִגְמַלֵּיהֶ֖ם אֵ֣ין מִסְפָּ֑ר וַיָּבֹ֥אוּ בָאָ֖רֶץ לְשַׁחֲתָֽהּ׃
Translated: For they would come up with their livestock and their tents, swarming as thick as locusts; they and their camels were innumerable. Thus they would invade the land and ravage it.
Transliteration: khiy hem umikeneyhem yaalu veׇholeyhem (yvv) [uvau] khedey-areveh larov velahem veligemaleyhem eyn misefar vayavou vaarets leshachatah

Hebrew: וַיִּדַּ֧ל יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל מְאֹ֖ד מִפְּנֵ֣י מִדְיָ֑ן וַיִּזְעֲק֥וּ בְנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל אֶל־יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: Israel was reduced to utter misery by the Midianites, and the Israelites cried out to G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vayidal yisherael meod mifeney mideyan vayizeaku veney-yisherael el-yehovah {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֕י כִּֽי־זָעֲק֥וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל אֶל־יְהֹוָ֑ה עַ֖ל אֹד֥וֹת מִדְיָֽן׃
Translated: When the Israelites cried to G<small>OD</small> on account of Midian,
Transliteration: vayehiy khiy-zaaku veney-yisherael el-yehovah al odvot mideyan

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֧ח יְהֹוָ֛ה אִ֥ישׁ נָבִ֖יא אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיֹּ֨אמֶר לָהֶ֜ם כֹּה־אָמַ֥ר יְהֹוָ֣ה ׀ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל אָנֹכִ֞י הֶעֱלֵ֤יתִי אֶתְכֶם֙ מִמִּצְרַ֔יִם וָאֹצִ֥יא אֶתְכֶ֖ם מִבֵּ֥ית עֲבָדִֽים׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small> sent a certain prophet to the Israelites. He said to them, “Thus said the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Israel: I brought you up out of Egypt and freed you from the house of bondage.
Transliteration: vayishelach yehovah iysh naviy el-veney yisherael vayomer lahem khoh-amar yehovah elohey yisherael anokhiy heeleytiy etekhem mimitserayiim vaotsiy etekhem miveyt avadiym

Hebrew: וָאַצִּ֤ל אֶתְכֶם֙ מִיַּ֣ד מִצְרַ֔יִם וּמִיַּ֖ד כׇּל־לֹחֲצֵיכֶ֑ם וָאֲגָרֵ֤שׁ אוֹתָם֙ מִפְּנֵיכֶ֔ם וָאֶתְּנָ֥ה לָכֶ֖ם אֶת־אַרְצָֽם׃
Translated: I rescued you from the Egyptians and from all your oppressors; I drove them out before you, and gave you their land.
Transliteration: vaatsil etekhem miyad mitserayiim umiyad khׇl-lochatseykhem vaagaresh votam mifeneykhem vaetenah lakhem et-aretsam

Hebrew: וָאֹמְרָ֣ה לָכֶ֗ם אֲנִי֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֔ם לֹ֤א תִֽירְאוּ֙ אֶת־אֱלֹהֵ֣י הָאֱמֹרִ֔י אֲשֶׁ֥ר אַתֶּ֖ם יוֹשְׁבִ֣ים בְּאַרְצָ֑ם וְלֹ֥א שְׁמַעְתֶּ֖ם בְּקוֹלִֽי׃ {פ}
Translated: And I said to you, ‘I the E<small>TERNAL</small> One am your God. You must not worship the gods of the Amorites in whose land you dwell.’ But you did not obey Me.”
Transliteration: vaomerah lakhem aniy yehovah eloheykhem lo tiyreu et-elohey haemoriy asher atem yvosheviym vearetsam velo shemaetem vekvoliy {f}

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֞א מַלְאַ֣ךְ יְהֹוָ֗ה וַיֵּ֙שֶׁב֙ תַּ֤חַת הָֽאֵלָה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּעׇפְרָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר לְיוֹאָ֖שׁ אֲבִ֣י הָעֶזְרִ֑י וְגִדְע֣וֹן בְּנ֗וֹ חֹבֵ֤ט חִטִּים֙ בַּגַּ֔ת לְהָנִ֖יס מִפְּנֵ֥י מִדְיָֽן׃
Translated: An angel of G<small>OD</small> came and sat under the terebinth at Ophrah, which belonged to Joash the Abiezrite. His son Gideon was then beating out wheat inside a winepress in order to keep it safe from the Midianites.
Transliteration: vayavo maleakhe yehovah vayeshev tachat haelah asher veׇferah asher leyvoash aviy haezeriy vegidevon venvo chovet chitiym vagat lehaniys mifeney mideyan

Hebrew: וַיֵּרָ֥א אֵלָ֖יו מַלְאַ֣ךְ יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלָ֔יו יְהֹוָ֥ה עִמְּךָ֖ גִּבּ֥וֹר הֶחָֽיִל׃
Translated: The angel of G<small>OD</small> appeared to him and said to him, “G<small>OD</small> is with you, valiant warrior!”
Transliteration: vayera elayv maleakhe yehovah vayomer elayv yehovah imekha givvor hechayiil

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֵלָ֤יו גִּדְעוֹן֙ בִּ֣י אֲדֹנִ֔י וְיֵ֤שׁ יְהֹוָה֙ עִמָּ֔נוּ וְלָ֥מָּה מְצָאַ֖תְנוּ כׇּל־זֹ֑את וְאַיֵּ֣ה כׇֽל־נִפְלְאֹתָ֡יו אֲשֶׁר֩ סִפְּרוּ־לָ֨נוּ אֲבוֹתֵ֜ינוּ לֵאמֹ֗ר הֲלֹ֤א מִמִּצְרַ֙יִם֙ הֶעֱלָ֣נוּ יְהֹוָ֔ה וְעַתָּה֙ נְטָשָׁ֣נוּ יְהֹוָ֔ה וַֽיִּתְּנֵ֖נוּ בְּכַף־מִדְיָֽן׃
Translated: Gideon said to him, “Please, my lord, if G<small>OD</small> is with us, why has all this befallen us? Where are all those wondrous deeds about which our ancestors told us, saying, ‘Truly G<small>OD</small> brought us up from Egypt’? Now G<small>OD</small> has abandoned us and delivered us into the hands of Midian!”
Transliteration: vayomer elayv gidevon viy adoniy veeish yehovah imanu velamah metsaatenu khׇl-zot veayeh khׇl-nifeleotayv asher siferu-lanu avvoteynu lemor halo mimitserayiim heelanu yehovah veatah netashanu yehovah vayitenenu vekhaf-mideyan

Hebrew: וַיִּ֤פֶן אֵלָיו֙ יְהֹוָ֔ה וַיֹּ֗אמֶר לֵ֚ךְ בְּכֹחֲךָ֣ זֶ֔ה וְהוֹשַׁעְתָּ֥ אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מִכַּ֣ף מִדְיָ֑ן הֲלֹ֖א שְׁלַחְתִּֽיךָ׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small> turned to him and said, “Go in this strength of yours and deliver Israel from the Midianites. I herewith make you My messenger.”
Transliteration: vayifen elayv yehovah vayomer lekhe vekhochakha zeh vehvoshaeta et-yisherael mikhaf mideyan halo shelachetiykha

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֵלָיו֙ בִּ֣י אֲדֹנָ֔י בַּמָּ֥ה אוֹשִׁ֖יעַ אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל הִנֵּ֤ה אַלְפִּי֙ הַדַּ֣ל בִּמְנַשֶּׁ֔ה וְאָנֹכִ֥י הַצָּעִ֖יר בְּבֵ֥ית אָבִֽי׃
Translated: He said to him, “Please, my Sovereign, how can I deliver Israel? Why, my clan is the humblest in Manasseh, and I am the youngest in my father’s household.”
Transliteration: vayomer elayv viy adonay vamah voshiya et-yisherael hineh alefiy hadal vimenasheh veanokhiy hatsaiyr veveyt aviy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֵלָיו֙ יְהֹוָ֔ה כִּ֥י אֶהְיֶ֖ה עִמָּ֑ךְ וְהִכִּיתָ֥ אֶת־מִדְיָ֖ן כְּאִ֥ישׁ אֶחָֽד׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small> replied, “I will be with you, and you shall defeat Midian all at once.”
Transliteration: vayomer elayv yehovah khiy eheyeh imakhe vehikhiyta et-mideyan kheiysh echad

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלָ֔יו אִם־נָ֛א מָצָ֥אתִי חֵ֖ן בְּעֵינֶ֑יךָ וְעָשִׂ֤יתָ לִּי֙ א֔וֹת שָׁאַתָּ֖ה מְדַבֵּ֥ר עִמִּֽי׃
Translated: And he said to him, “If I have gained Your favor, give me a sign that it is You who are speaking to me.
Transliteration: vayomer elayv im-na matsatiy chen veeyneykha veashiyta liy vot shaatah medaver imiy

Hebrew: אַל־נָ֨א תָמֻ֤שׁ מִזֶּה֙ עַד־בֹּאִ֣י אֵלֶ֔יךָ וְהֹֽצֵאתִי֙ אֶת־מִנְחָתִ֔י וְהִנַּחְתִּ֖י לְפָנֶ֑יךָ וַיֹּאמַ֕ר אָנֹכִ֥י אֵשֵׁ֖ב עַ֥ד שׁוּבֶֽךָ׃
Translated: Do not leave this place until I come back to you and bring out my offering and place it before you.” And he answered, “I will stay until you return.”
Transliteration: al-na tamush mizeh ad-voiy eleykha vehotsetiy et-minechatiy vehinachetiy lefaneykha vayomar anokhiy eshev ad shuvekha

Hebrew: וְגִדְע֣וֹן בָּ֗א וַיַּ֤עַשׂ גְּדִֽי־עִזִּים֙ וְאֵיפַת־קֶ֣מַח מַצּ֔וֹת הַבָּשָׂר֙ שָׂ֣ם בַּסַּ֔ל וְהַמָּרַ֖ק שָׂ֣ם בַּפָּר֑וּר וַיּוֹצֵ֥א אֵלָ֛יו אֶל־תַּ֥חַת הָאֵלָ֖ה וַיַּגַּֽשׁ׃ {פ}
Translated: So Gideon went in and prepared a kid, and [baked] unleavened bread from an ephah of flour. He put the meat in a basket and poured the broth into a pot, and he brought them out to him under the terebinth. As he presented them,
Transliteration: vegidevon va vayaash gediy-iziym veeyfat-kemach matsvot havashar sham vasal vehamarak sham vafarur vayyvotse elayv el-tachat haelah vayagash {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֵלָ֜יו מַלְאַ֣ךְ הָאֱלֹהִ֗ים קַ֣ח אֶת־הַבָּשָׂ֤ר וְאֶת־הַמַּצּוֹת֙ וְהַנַּח֙ אֶל־הַסֶּ֣לַע הַלָּ֔ז וְאֶת־הַמָּרַ֖ק שְׁפ֑וֹךְ וַיַּ֖עַשׂ כֵּֽן׃
Translated: the angel of God said to him, “Take the meat and the unleavened bread, put them on yonder rock, and spill out the broth.” He did so.
Transliteration: vayomer elayv maleakhe haElohim kach et-havashar veet-hamatsvot vehanach el-hasela halaz veet-hamarak shefvokhe vayaash khen

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֞ח מַלְאַ֣ךְ יְהֹוָ֗ה אֶת־קְצֵ֤ה הַמִּשְׁעֶ֙נֶת֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּיָד֔וֹ וַיִּגַּ֥ע בַּבָּשָׂ֖ר וּבַמַּצּ֑וֹת וַתַּ֨עַל הָאֵ֜שׁ מִן־הַצּ֗וּר וַתֹּ֤אכַל אֶת־הַבָּשָׂר֙ וְאֶת־הַמַּצּ֔וֹת וּמַלְאַ֣ךְ יְהֹוָ֔ה הָלַ֖ךְ מֵעֵינָֽיו׃
Translated: The angel of G<small>OD</small> held out the staff that he carried, and touched the meat and the unleavened bread with its tip. A fire sprang up from the rock and consumed the meat and the unleavened bread. And the angel of G<small>OD</small> vanished from his sight.
Transliteration: vayishelach maleakhe yehovah et-ketseh hamisheenet asher veyadvo vayiga vavashar uvamatsvot vataal haesh min-hatsur vatokhal et-havashar veet-hamatsvot umaleakhe yehovah halakhe meeynayv

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣רְא גִּדְע֔וֹן כִּֽי־מַלְאַ֥ךְ יְהֹוָ֖ה ה֑וּא וַיֹּ֣אמֶר גִּדְע֗וֹן אֲהָהּ֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה כִּֽי־עַל־כֵּ֤ן רָאִ֙יתִי֙ מַלְאַ֣ךְ יְהֹוָ֔ה פָּנִ֖ים אֶל־פָּנִֽים׃
Translated: Then Gideon realized that indeed it was an angel of G<small>OD</small>; and Gideon said, “Alas, O Sovereign G<small>OD</small>! For I have seen an angel of G<small>OD</small> face to face.”
Transliteration: vayare gidevon khiy-maleakhe yehovah hu vayomer gidevon ahah adonay yehovih khiy-al-khen raiytiy maleakhe yehovah faniym el-faniym

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר ל֧וֹ יְהֹוָ֛ה שָׁל֥וֹם לְךָ֖ אַל־תִּירָ֑א לֹ֖א תָּמֽוּת׃
Translated: But G<small>OD</small> said to him, “All is well; have no fear, you shall not die.”
Transliteration: vayomer lvo yehovah shalvom lekha al-tiyra lo tamut

Hebrew: וַיִּ֩בֶן֩ שָׁ֨ם גִּדְע֤וֹן מִזְבֵּ֙חַ֙ לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה וַיִּקְרָא־ל֥וֹ יְהֹוָ֖ה שָׁל֑וֹם עַ֚ד הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֔ה עוֹדֶ֕נּוּ בְּעׇפְרָ֖ת אֲבִ֥י הָעֶזְרִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: So Gideon built there an altar to G<small>OD</small> and called it Adonai-shalom. To this day it stands in Ophrah of the Abiezrites.
Transliteration: vayiven sham gidevon mizevecha layhovah vayikera-lvo yehovah shalvom ad hayyvom hazeh vodenu veׇferat aviy haezeriy {s}

Hebrew: וַיְהִי֮ בַּלַּ֣יְלָה הַהוּא֒ וַיֹּ֧אמֶר ל֣וֹ יְהֹוָ֗ה קַ֤ח אֶת־פַּר־הַשּׁוֹר֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לְאָבִ֔יךָ וּפַ֥ר הַשֵּׁנִ֖י שֶׁ֣בַע שָׁנִ֑ים וְהָרַסְתָּ֗ אֶת־מִזְבַּ֤ח הַבַּ֙עַל֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לְאָבִ֔יךָ וְאֶת־הָאֲשֵׁרָ֥ה אֲשֶׁר־עָלָ֖יו תִּכְרֹֽת׃
Translated: That night G<small>OD</small> said to him: “Take the young bull belonging to your father and another bull seven years old; pull down the altar of Baal that belongs to your father, and cut down the sacred post that is beside it.
Transliteration: vayehiy valayelah hahu vayomer lvo yehovah kach et-far-hashvor asher leaviykha ufar hasheniy sheva shaniym veharaseta et-mizevach havaal asher leaviykha veet-haasherah asher-alayv tikherot

Hebrew: וּבָנִ֨יתָ מִזְבֵּ֜חַ לַיהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֗יךָ עַ֣ל רֹ֧אשׁ הַמָּע֛וֹז הַזֶּ֖ה בַּמַּעֲרָכָ֑ה וְלָֽקַחְתָּ֙ אֶת־הַפָּ֣ר הַשֵּׁנִ֔י וְהַעֲלִ֣יתָ עוֹלָ֔ה בַּעֲצֵ֥י הָאֲשֵׁרָ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר תִּכְרֹֽת׃
Translated: Then build an altar to the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God, on the level ground on top of this stronghold. Take the other bull and offer it as a burnt offering, using the wood of the sacred post that you have cut down.”
Transliteration: uvaniyta mizevecha layhovah eloheykha al rosh hamavoz hazeh vamaarakhah velakacheta et-hafar hasheniy vehaaliyta volah vaatsey haasherah asher tikherot

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֨ח גִּדְע֜וֹן עֲשָׂרָ֤ה אֲנָשִׁים֙ מֵעֲבָדָ֔יו וַיַּ֕עַשׂ כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר דִּבֶּ֥ר אֵלָ֖יו יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיְהִ֡י כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר יָרֵא֩ אֶת־בֵּ֨ית אָבִ֜יו וְאֶת־אַנְשֵׁ֥י הָעִ֛יר מֵעֲשׂ֥וֹת יוֹמָ֖ם וַיַּ֥עַשׂ לָֽיְלָה׃
Translated: So Gideon took ten of his servants and did as G<small>OD</small> had told him; but as he was afraid to do it by day, on account of his father’s household and the townspeople, he did it by night.
Transliteration: vayikach gidevon asharah anashiym meavadayv vayaash khaasher diver elayv yehovah vayehiy khaasher yare et-veyt aviyv veet-aneshey haiyr meashvot yvomam vayaash layelah

Hebrew: וַיַּשְׁכִּ֜ימוּ אַנְשֵׁ֤י הָעִיר֙ בַּבֹּ֔קֶר וְהִנֵּ֤ה נֻתַּץ֙ מִזְבַּ֣ח הַבַּ֔עַל וְהָאֲשֵׁרָ֥ה אֲשֶׁר־עָלָ֖יו כֹּרָ֑תָה וְאֵת֙ הַפָּ֣ר הַשֵּׁנִ֔י הֹֽעֲלָ֔ה עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ הַבָּנֽוּי׃
Translated: Early the next morning, the townspeople found that the altar of Baal had been torn down and the sacred post beside it had been cut down, and that the second bull had been offered on the newly built altar.
Transliteration: vayashekhiymu aneshey haiyr vavoker vehineh nutats mizevach havaal vehaasherah asher-alayv khoratah veet hafar hasheniy hoalah al-hamizevecha havanuy

Hebrew: וַיֹּֽאמְרוּ֙ אִ֣ישׁ אֶל־רֵעֵ֔הוּ מִ֥י עָשָׂ֖ה הַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֑ה וַֽיִּדְרְשׁוּ֙ וַיְבַקְשׁ֔וּ וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ גִּדְעוֹן֙ בֶּן־יוֹאָ֔שׁ עָשָׂ֖ה הַדָּבָ֥ר הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: They said to one another, “Who did this thing?” Upon inquiry and investigation, they were told, “Gideon son of Joash did this thing!”
Transliteration: vayomeru iysh el-reehu miy ashah hadavar hazeh vayidereshu vayevakeshu vayomeru gidevon ven-yvoash ashah hadavar hazeh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמְר֜וּ אַנְשֵׁ֤י הָעִיר֙ אֶל־יוֹאָ֔שׁ הוֹצֵ֥א אֶת־בִּנְךָ֖ וְיָמֹ֑ת כִּ֤י נָתַץ֙ אֶת־מִזְבַּ֣ח הַבַּ֔עַל וְכִ֥י כָרַ֖ת הָאֲשֵׁרָ֥ה אֲשֶׁר־עָלָֽיו׃
Translated: The townspeople said to Joash, “Bring out your son, for he must die: he has torn down the altar of Baal and cut down the sacred post beside it!”
Transliteration: vayomeru aneshey haiyr el-yvoash hvotse et-vinekha veyamot khiy natats et-mizevach havaal vekhiy kharat haasherah asher-alayv

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יוֹאָ֡שׁ לְכֹל֩ אֲשֶׁר־עָמְד֨וּ עָלָ֜יו הַאַתֶּ֣ם ׀ תְּרִיב֣וּן לַבַּ֗עַל אִם־אַתֶּם֙ תּוֹשִׁיע֣וּן אוֹת֔וֹ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יָרִ֥יב ל֛וֹ יוּמַ֖ת עַד־הַבֹּ֑קֶר אִם־אֱלֹהִ֥ים הוּא֙ יָ֣רֶב ל֔וֹ כִּ֥י נָתַ֖ץ אֶֽת־מִזְבְּחֽוֹ׃
Translated: But Joash said to all who had risen against him, “Do you have to contend for Baal? Do you have to vindicate him? Whoever fights his battles shall be dead by morning! If he is a god, let him fight his own battles, since it is his altar that has been torn down!”
Transliteration: vayomer yvoash lekhol asher-amedu alayv haatem teriyvun lavaal im-atem tvoshiyun votvo asher yariyv lvo yumat ad-havoker im-Elohim hu yarev lvo khiy natats et-mizevechvo

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָא־ל֥וֹ בַיּוֹם־הַה֖וּא יְרֻבַּ֣עַל לֵאמֹ֑ר יָ֤רֶב בּוֹ֙ הַבַּ֔עַל כִּ֥י נָתַ֖ץ אֶֽת־מִזְבְּחֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: That day they named him Jerubbaal, meaning “Let Baal contend with him, since he tore down his altar.”
Transliteration: vayikera-lvo vayyvom-hahu yeruvaal lemor yarev vvo havaal khiy natats et-mizevechvo {s}

Hebrew: וְכׇל־מִדְיָ֧ן וַעֲמָלֵ֛ק וּבְנֵי־קֶ֖דֶם נֶאֶסְפ֣וּ יַחְדָּ֑ו וַיַּעַבְר֥וּ וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּעֵ֥מֶק יִזְרְעֶֽאל׃
Translated: All Midian, Amalek, and the Kedemites joined forces; they crossed over and encamped in the Valley of Jezreel.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-mideyan vaamalek uveney-kedem neesefu yachedav vayaaveru vayachanu veemek yizereel

Hebrew: וְר֣וּחַ יְהֹוָ֔ה לָבְשָׁ֖ה אֶת־גִּדְע֑וֹן וַיִּתְקַע֙ בַּשּׁוֹפָ֔ר וַיִּזָּעֵ֥ק אֲבִיעֶ֖זֶר אַחֲרָֽיו׃
Translated: The spirit of G<small>OD</small> enveloped Gideon; he sounded the horn, and the Abiezrites rallied behind him.
Transliteration: verucha yehovah laveshah et-gidevon vayiteka vashvofar vayizaek aviyezer acharayv

Hebrew: וּמַלְאָכִים֙ שָׁלַ֣ח בְּכׇל־מְנַשֶּׁ֔ה וַיִּזָּעֵ֥ק גַּם־ה֖וּא אַחֲרָ֑יו וּמַלְאָכִ֣ים שָׁלַ֗ח בְּאָשֵׁ֤ר וּבִזְבֻלוּן֙ וּבְנַפְתָּלִ֔י וַֽיַּעֲל֖וּ לִקְרָאתָֽם׃
Translated: And he sent messengers throughout Manasseh, and they too rallied behind him. He then sent messengers through Asher, Zebulun, and Naphtali, and they came up to meet the Manassites.
Transliteration: umaleakhiym shalach vekhׇl-menasheh vayizaek gam-hu acharayv umaleakhiym shalach veasher uvizevulun uvenafetaliy vayaalu likeratam

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר גִּדְע֖וֹן אֶל־הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים אִם־יֶשְׁךָ֞ מוֹשִׁ֧יעַ בְּיָדִ֛י אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבַּֽרְתָּ׃
Translated: And Gideon said to God, “If You really intend to deliver Israel through me as You have said—
Transliteration: vayomer gidevon el-haElohim im-yeshekha mvoshiya veyadiy et-yisherael khaasher divareta

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֣ה אָנֹכִ֗י מַצִּ֛יג אֶת־גִּזַּ֥ת הַצֶּ֖מֶר בַּגֹּ֑רֶן אִ֡ם טַל֩ יִֽהְיֶ֨ה עַֽל־הַגִּזָּ֜ה לְבַדָּ֗הּ וְעַל־כׇּל־הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ חֹ֔רֶב וְיָדַעְתִּ֗י כִּֽי־תוֹשִׁ֧יעַ בְּיָדִ֛י אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבַּֽרְתָּ׃
Translated: here I place a fleece of wool on the threshing floor. If dew falls only on the fleece and all the ground remains dry, I shall know that You will deliver Israel through me, as You have said.”
Transliteration: hineh anokhiy matsiyg et-gizat hatsemer vagoren im tal yiheyeh al-hagizah levadah veal-khׇl-haarets chorev veyadaetiy khiy-tvoshiya veyadiy et-yisherael khaasher divareta

Hebrew: וַיְהִי־כֵ֕ן וַיַּשְׁכֵּם֙ מִֽמׇּחֳרָ֔ת וַיָּ֖זַר אֶת־הַגִּזָּ֑ה וַיִּ֤מֶץ טַל֙ מִן־הַגִּזָּ֔ה מְל֥וֹא הַסֵּ֖פֶל מָֽיִם׃
Translated: And that is what happened. Early the next day, he squeezed the fleece and wrung out the dew from the fleece, a bowlful of water.
