Transliteration: vayehiy-khen vayashekhem mimׇchorat vayazar et-hagizah vayimets tal min-hagizah melvo hasefel mayiim

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר גִּדְעוֹן֙ אֶל־הָ֣אֱלֹהִ֔ים אַל־יִ֤חַר אַפְּךָ֙ בִּ֔י וַאֲדַבְּרָ֖ה אַ֣ךְ הַפָּ֑עַם אֲנַסֶּ֤ה נָּא־רַק־הַפַּ֙עַם֙ בַּגִּזָּ֔ה יְהִי־נָ֨א חֹ֤רֶב אֶל־הַגִּזָּה֙ לְבַדָּ֔הּ וְעַל־כׇּל־הָאָ֖רֶץ יִֽהְיֶה־טָּֽל׃
Translated: Then Gideon said to God, “Do not be angry with me if I speak just once more. Let me make just one more test with the fleece: let the fleece alone be dry, while there is dew all over the ground.”
Transliteration: vayomer gidevon el-haElohimm al-yichar afekha viy vaadaverah akhe hafaam anaseh na-rak-hafaam vagizah yehiy-na chorev el-hagizah levadah veal-khׇl-haarets yiheyeh-tal

Hebrew: וַיַּ֧עַשׂ אֱלֹהִ֛ים כֵּ֖ן בַּלַּ֣יְלָה הַה֑וּא וַֽיְהִי־חֹ֤רֶב אֶל־הַגִּזָּה֙ לְבַדָּ֔הּ וְעַל־כׇּל־הָאָ֖רֶץ הָ֥יָה טָֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: God did so that night: only the fleece was dry, while there was dew all over the ground.
Transliteration: vayaash Elohim khen valayelah hahu vayehiy-chorev el-hagizah levadah veal-khׇl-haarets hayah tal {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּשְׁכֵּ֨ם יְרֻבַּ֜עַל ה֣וּא גִדְע֗וֹן וְכׇל־הָעָם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אִתּ֔וֹ וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ עַל־עֵ֣ין חֲרֹ֑ד וּמַחֲנֵ֤ה מִדְיָן֙ הָיָה־ל֣וֹ מִצָּפ֔וֹן מִגִּבְעַ֥ת הַמּוֹרֶ֖ה בָּעֵֽמֶק׃ {ס}
Translated: Early next day, Jerubbaal—that is, Gideon—and all the troops with him encamped above En-harod, while the camp of Midian was in the plain to the north of him, at Gibeath-moreh.
Transliteration: vayashekhem yeruvaal hu gidevon vekhׇl-haam asher itvo vayachanu al-eyn charod umachaneh mideyan hayah-lvo mitsafvon migiveat hamvoreh vaemek {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־גִּדְע֔וֹן רַ֗ב הָעָם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אִתָּ֔ךְ מִתִּתִּ֥י אֶת־מִדְיָ֖ן בְּיָדָ֑ם פֶּן־יִתְפָּאֵ֨ר עָלַ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר יָדִ֖י הוֹשִׁ֥יעָה לִּֽי׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small> said to Gideon, “You have too many troops with you for Me to deliver Midian into their hands; Israel might claim for themselves the glory due to Me, thinking, ‘Our own hand has brought us victory.’
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-gidevon rav haam asher itakhe mititiy et-mideyan veyadam fen-yitefaer alay yisherael lemor yadiy hvoshiyah liy

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה קְרָ֨א נָ֜א בְּאׇזְנֵ֤י הָעָם֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר מִֽי־יָרֵ֣א וְחָרֵ֔ד יָשֹׁ֥ב וְיִצְפֹּ֖ר מֵהַ֣ר הַגִּלְעָ֑ד וַיָּ֣שׇׁב מִן־הָעָ֗ם עֶשְׂרִ֤ים וּשְׁנַ֙יִם֙ אֶ֔לֶף וַעֲשֶׂ֥רֶת אֲלָפִ֖ים נִשְׁאָֽרוּ׃ {ס}
Translated: Therefore, announce to the men, ‘Let anybody who is timid and fearful turn back, as a bird flies from Mount Gilead.’” Thereupon, 22,000 of the troops turned back and 10,000 remained.
Transliteration: veatah kera na veׇzeney haam lemor miy-yare vechared yashov veyitsefor mehar hagilead vayashׇv min-haam esheriym ushenayiim elef vaasheret alafiym nishearu {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶל־גִּדְע֗וֹן עוֹד֮ הָעָ֣ם רָב֒ הוֹרֵ֤ד אוֹתָם֙ אֶל־הַמַּ֔יִם וְאֶצְרְפֶ֥נּוּ לְךָ֖ שָׁ֑ם וְהָיָ֡ה אֲשֶׁר֩ אֹמַ֨ר אֵלֶ֜יךָ זֶ֣ה ׀ יֵלֵ֣ךְ אִתָּ֗ךְ ה֚וּא יֵלֵ֣ךְ אִתָּ֔ךְ וְכֹ֨ל אֲשֶׁר־אֹמַ֜ר אֵלֶ֗יךָ זֶ֚ה לֹא־יֵלֵ֣ךְ עִמָּ֔ךְ ה֖וּא לֹ֥א יֵלֵֽךְ׃
Translated: “There are still too many troops,” G<small>OD</small> said to Gideon. “Take them down to the water and I will sift them for you there. Anyone of whom I tell you, ‘This one is to go with you,’ that one shall go with you; and anyone of whom I tell you, ‘This one is not to go with you,’ that one shall not go.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-gidevon vod haam rav hvored votam el-hamayiim veetserefenu lekha sham vehayah asher omar eleykha zeh eilekhe itakhe hu eilekhe itakhe vekhol asher-omar eleykha zeh lo-eilekhe imakhe hu lo eilekhe

Hebrew: וַיּ֥וֹרֶד אֶת־הָעָ֖ם אֶל־הַמָּ֑יִם וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶל־גִּדְע֗וֹן כֹּ֣ל אֲשֶׁר־יָלֹק֩ בִּלְשׁוֹנ֨וֹ מִן־הַמַּ֜יִם כַּאֲשֶׁ֧ר יָלֹ֣ק הַכֶּ֗לֶב תַּצִּ֤יג אוֹתוֹ֙ לְבָ֔ד וְכֹ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־יִכְרַ֥ע עַל־בִּרְכָּ֖יו לִשְׁתּֽוֹת׃
Translated: So he took the troops down to the water. Then G<small>OD</small> said to Gideon, “Set apart all those who lap up the water with their tongues like dogs from all those who get down on their knees to drink.”
Transliteration: vayyvored et-haam el-hamayiim vayomer yehovah el-gidevon khol asher-yalok vileshvonvo min-hamayiim khaasher yalok hakhelev tatsiyg votvo levad vekhol asher-yikhera al-virekhayv lishetvot

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י מִסְפַּ֞ר הַֽמְלַקְקִ֤ים בְּיָדָם֙ אֶל־פִּיהֶ֔ם שְׁלֹ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת אִ֑ישׁ וְכֹל֙ יֶ֣תֶר הָעָ֔ם כָּרְע֥וּ עַל־בִּרְכֵיהֶ֖ם לִשְׁתּ֥וֹת מָֽיִם׃ {ס}
Translated: Now those who “lapped” the water into their mouths by hand numbered three hundred; all the rest of the troops got down on their knees to drink.
Transliteration: vayehiy misefar hamelakekiym veyadam el-fiyhem shelosh mevot iysh vekhol yeter haam khareu al-virekheyhem lishetvot mayiim {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶל־גִּדְע֗וֹן בִּשְׁלֹשׁ֩ מֵא֨וֹת הָאִ֤ישׁ הַֽמְלַקְקִים֙ אוֹשִׁ֣יעַ אֶתְכֶ֔ם וְנָתַתִּ֥י אֶת־מִדְיָ֖ן בְּיָדֶ֑ךָ וְכׇ֨ל־הָעָ֔ם יֵלְכ֖וּ אִ֥ישׁ לִמְקֹמֽוֹ׃
Translated: Then G<small>OD</small> said to Gideon, “I will deliver you and I will put Midian into your hands through the three hundred ‘lappers’; let the rest of the troops go home.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-gidevon vishelosh mevot haiysh hamelakekiym voshiya etekhem venatatiy et-mideyan veyadekha vekhׇl-haam eilekhu iysh limekomvo

Hebrew: וַיִּקְח֣וּ אֶת־צֵדָה֩ הָעָ֨ם בְּיָדָ֜ם וְאֵ֣ת שׁוֹפְרֹֽתֵיהֶ֗ם וְאֵ֨ת כׇּל־אִ֤ישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ שִׁלַּח֙ אִ֣ישׁ לְאֹֽהָלָ֔יו וּבִשְׁלֹשׁ־מֵא֥וֹת הָאִ֖ישׁ הֶחֱזִ֑יק וּמַחֲנֵ֣ה מִדְיָ֔ן הָ֥יָה ל֖וֹ מִתַּ֥חַת בָּעֵֽמֶק׃ {פ}
Translated:
So [the lappers] took the provisions and horns that the other men had with them, and he sent everyone else on Israel’s side back to their homes, retaining only the three hundred men.
The Midianite camp was below him, in the plain.
Transliteration: vayikechu et-tsedah haam veyadam veet shvoferoteyhem veet khׇl-iysh yisherael shilach iysh leohalayv uvishelosh-mevot haiysh hecheziyk umachaneh mideyan hayah lvo mitachat vaemek {f}

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ בַּלַּ֣יְלָה הַה֔וּא וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֵלָיו֙ יְהֹוָ֔ה ק֖וּם רֵ֣ד בַּֽמַּחֲנֶ֑ה כִּ֥י נְתַתִּ֖יו בְּיָדֶֽךָ׃
Translated: That night G<small>OD</small> said to him, “Come, attack the camp, for I have delivered it into your hands.
Transliteration: vayehiy valayelah hahu vayomer elayv yehovah kum red vamachaneh khiy netatiyv veyadekha

Hebrew: וְאִם־יָרֵ֥א אַתָּ֖ה לָרֶ֑דֶת רֵ֥ד אַתָּ֛ה וּפֻרָ֥ה נַעַרְךָ֖ אֶל־הַֽמַּחֲנֶֽה׃
Translated: And if you are afraid to attack, first go down to the camp with your attendant Purah
Transliteration: veim-yare atah laredet red atah ufurah naarekha el-hamachaneh

Hebrew: וְשָֽׁמַעְתָּ֙ מַה־יְדַבֵּ֔רוּ וְאַחַר֙ תֶּחֱזַ֣קְנָה יָדֶ֔יךָ וְיָרַדְתָּ֖ בַּֽמַּחֲנֶ֑ה וַיֵּ֤רֶד הוּא֙ וּפֻרָ֣ה נַעֲר֔וֹ אֶל־קְצֵ֥ה הַחֲמֻשִׁ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר בַּֽמַּחֲנֶֽה׃
Translated: and listen to what they say; after that you will have the courage to attack the camp.” So he went down with his attendant Purah to the outposts of the warriors who were in the camp.—
Transliteration: veshamaeta mah-yedaveru veachar techezakenah yadeykha veyaradeta vamachaneh vayered hu ufurah naarvo el-ketseh hachamushiym asher vamachaneh

Hebrew: וּמִדְיָ֨ן וַעֲמָלֵ֤ק וְכׇל־בְּנֵי־קֶ֙דֶם֙ נֹפְלִ֣ים בָּעֵ֔מֶק כָּאַרְבֶּ֖ה לָרֹ֑ב וְלִגְמַלֵּיהֶם֙ אֵ֣ין מִסְפָּ֔ר כַּח֛וֹל שֶׁעַל־שְׂפַ֥ת הַיָּ֖ם לָרֹֽב׃
Translated: Now Midian, Amalek, and all the Kedemites were spread over the plain, as thick as locusts; and their camels were countless, as numerous as the sands on the seashore.—
Transliteration: umideyan vaamalek vekhׇl-veney-kedem nofeliym vaemek khaareveh larov veligemaleyhem eyn misefar khachvol sheal-shefat hayam larov

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֣א גִדְע֔וֹן וְהִ֨נֵּה־אִ֔ישׁ מְסַפֵּ֥ר לְרֵעֵ֖הוּ חֲל֑וֹם וַיֹּ֜אמֶר הִנֵּ֧ה חֲל֣וֹם חָלַ֗מְתִּי וְהִנֵּ֨ה צְלִ֜יל לֶ֤חֶם שְׂעֹרִים֙ מִתְהַפֵּךְ֙ בְּמַחֲנֵ֣ה מִדְיָ֔ן וַיָּבֹ֣א עַד־הָ֠אֹ֠הֶל וַיַּכֵּ֧הוּ וַיִּפֹּ֛ל וַיַּהַפְכֵ֥הוּ לְמַ֖עְלָה וְנָפַ֥ל הָאֹֽהֶל׃
Translated: Gideon came there just as one man was narrating a dream to another. “Listen,” he was saying, “I had this dream: There was a commotion—a loaf of barley bread was whirling through the Midianite camp. It came to a tent and struck it, and it fell; it turned it upside down, and the tent collapsed.”
Transliteration: vayavo gidevon vehineh-iysh mesafer lereehu chalvom vayomer hineh chalvom chalametiy vehineh tseliyl lechem sheoriym mitehafekhe vemachaneh mideyan vayavo ad-haohel vayakhehu vayifol vayahafekhehu lemaelah venafal haohel

Hebrew: וַיַּ֨עַן רֵעֵ֤הוּ וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֵ֣ין זֹ֔את בִּלְתִּ֗י אִם־חֶ֛רֶב גִּדְע֥וֹן בֶּן־יוֹאָ֖שׁ אִ֣ישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל נָתַ֤ן הָאֱלֹהִים֙ בְּיָד֔וֹ אֶת־מִדְיָ֖ן וְאֶת־כׇּל־הַֽמַּחֲנֶֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: To this the other responded, “That can only mean the sword of the Israelite Gideon son of Joash. God is delivering Midian and the entire camp into his hands.”
Transliteration: vayaan reehu vayomer eyn zot viletiy im-cherev gidevon ven-yvoash iysh yisherael natan haElohim veyadvo et-mideyan veet-khׇl-hamachaneh {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִי֩ כִשְׁמֹ֨עַ גִּדְע֜וֹן אֶת־מִסְפַּ֧ר הַחֲל֛וֹם וְאֶת־שִׁבְר֖וֹ וַיִּשְׁתָּ֑חוּ וַיָּ֙שׇׁב֙ אֶל־מַחֲנֵ֣ה יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ק֔וּמוּ כִּֽי־נָתַ֧ן יְהֹוָ֛ה בְּיֶדְכֶ֖ם אֶת־מַחֲנֵ֥ה מִדְיָֽן׃
Translated: When Gideon heard the dream told and interpreted, he bowed low. Returning to the camp of Israel, he shouted, “Come on! G<small>OD</small> has delivered the Midianite camp into your hands!”
Transliteration: vayehiy khishemoa gidevon et-misefar hachalvom veet-shivervo vayishetachu vayashׇv el-machaneh yisherael vayomer kumu khiy-natan yehovah veyedekhem et-machaneh mideyan

Hebrew: וַיַּ֛חַץ אֶת־שְׁלֹשׁ־מֵא֥וֹת הָאִ֖ישׁ שְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה רָאשִׁ֑ים וַיִּתֵּ֨ן שׁוֹפָר֤וֹת בְּיַד־כֻּלָּם֙ וְכַדִּ֣ים רֵיקִ֔ים וְלַפִּדִ֖ים בְּת֥וֹךְ הַכַּדִּֽים׃
Translated: He divided the three hundred men into three columns and equipped them all with a ram’s horn and an empty jar, with a torch in each jar.
Transliteration: vayachats et-shelosh-mevot haiysh sheloshah rashiym vayiten shvofarvot veyad-khulam vekhadiym reykiym velafidiym vetvokhe hakhadiym

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲלֵיהֶ֔ם מִמֶּ֥נִּי תִרְא֖וּ וְכֵ֣ן תַּעֲשׂ֑וּ וְהִנֵּ֨ה אָנֹכִ֥י בָא֙ בִּקְצֵ֣ה הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֔ה וְהָיָ֥ה כַאֲשֶׁר־אֶעֱשֶׂ֖ה כֵּ֥ן תַּעֲשֽׂוּן׃
Translated: “Watch me,” he said, “and do the same. When I get to the outposts of the camp, do exactly as I do.
Transliteration: vayomer aleyhem mimeniy tireu vekhen taashu vehineh anokhiy va viketseh hamachaneh vehayah khaasher-eesheh khen taashun

Hebrew: וְתָֽקַעְתִּי֙ בַּשּׁוֹפָ֔ר אָנֹכִ֖י וְכׇל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר אִתִּ֑י וּתְקַעְתֶּ֨ם בַּשּׁוֹפָר֜וֹת גַּם־אַתֶּ֗ם סְבִיבוֹת֙ כׇּל־הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֔ה וַאֲמַרְתֶּ֖ם לַיהֹוָ֥ה וּלְגִדְעֽוֹן׃ {פ}
Translated: When I and all those with me blow our horns, you too, all around the camp, will blow your horns and shout, ‘For G<small>OD</small> and for Gideon!’”
Transliteration: vetakaetiy vashvofar anokhiy vekhׇl-asher itiy utekaetem vashvofarvot gam-atem seviyvvot khׇl-hamachaneh vaamaretem layhovah ulegidevon {f}

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֣א גִ֠דְע֠וֹן וּמֵאָה־אִ֨ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־אִתּ֜וֹ בִּקְצֵ֣ה הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֗ה רֹ֚אשׁ הָאַשְׁמֹ֣רֶת הַתִּיכוֹנָ֔ה אַ֛ךְ הָקֵ֥ם הֵקִ֖ימוּ אֶת־הַשֹּׁמְרִ֑ים וַֽיִּתְקְעוּ֙ בַּשּׁ֣וֹפָר֔וֹת וְנָפ֥וֹץ הַכַּדִּ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר בְּיָדָֽם׃
Translated: Gideon and the hundred men with him arrived at the outposts of the camp, at the beginning of the middle watch, just after the sentries were posted. They sounded the horns and smashed the jars that they had with them,
Transliteration: vayavo gidevon umeah-iysh asher-itvo viketseh hamachaneh rosh haashemoret hatiykhvonah akhe hakem hekiymu et-hashomeriym vayitekeu vashvofarvot venafvots hakhadiym asher veyadam

Hebrew: וַֽ֠יִּתְקְע֠וּ שְׁלֹ֨שֶׁת הָרָאשִׁ֥ים בַּשּׁוֹפָרוֹת֮ וַיִּשְׁבְּר֣וּ הַכַּדִּים֒ וַיַּחֲזִ֤יקוּ בְיַד־שְׂמֹאולָם֙ בַּלַּפִּדִ֔ים וּ֨בְיַד־יְמִינָ֔ם הַשּׁוֹפָר֖וֹת לִתְק֑וֹעַ וַֽיִּקְרְא֔וּ חֶ֥רֶב לַיהֹוָ֖ה וּלְגִדְעֽוֹן׃
Translated: and the three columns blew their horns and broke their jars. Holding the torches in their left hands and the horns for blowing in their right hands, they shouted, “A sword for G<small>OD</small> and for Gideon!”
Transliteration: vayitekeu sheloshet harashiym vashvofarvot vayisheveru hakhadiym vayachaziyku veyad-shemovlam valafidiym uveyad-yemiynam hashvofarvot litekvoa vayikereu cherev layhovah ulegidevon

Hebrew: וַיַּֽעַמְדוּ֙ אִ֣ישׁ תַּחְתָּ֔יו סָבִ֖יב לַֽמַּחֲנֶ֑ה וַיָּ֧רׇץ כׇּל־הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֛ה וַיָּרִ֖יעוּ (ויניסו) [וַיָּנֽוּסוּ]׃
Translated: They remained standing where they were, surrounding the camp; but the entire camp ran about yelling, and took to flight.
Transliteration: vayaamedu iysh tachetayv saviyv lamachaneh vayarׇts khׇl-hamachaneh vayariyu (vynysv) [vayanusu]

Hebrew: וַֽיִּתְקְעוּ֮ שְׁלֹשׁ־מֵא֣וֹת הַשּׁוֹפָרוֹת֒ וַיָּ֣שֶׂם יְהֹוָ֗ה אֵ֣ת חֶ֥רֶב אִ֛ישׁ בְּרֵעֵ֖הוּ וּבְכׇל־הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֑ה וַיָּ֨נׇס הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֜ה עַד־בֵּ֤ית הַשִּׁטָּה֙ צְֽרֵרָ֔תָה עַ֛ד שְׂפַת־אָבֵ֥ל מְחוֹלָ֖ה עַל־טַבָּֽת׃
Translated: For when the three hundred horns were sounded, G<small>OD</small> turned every man’s sword against his fellow, throughout the camp, and the entire host fled as far as Beth-shittah and on to Zererah—as far as the outskirts of Abel-meholah near Tabbath.
Transliteration: vayitekeu shelosh-mevot hashvofarvot vayashem yehovah et cherev iysh vereehu uvekhׇl-hamachaneh vayanׇs hamachaneh ad-veyt hashitah tsereratah ad shefat-avel mechvolah al-tavat

Hebrew: וַיִּצָּעֵ֧ק אִֽישׁ־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל מִנַּפְתָּלִ֥י וּמִן־אָשֵׁ֖ר וּמִן־כׇּל־מְנַשֶּׁ֑ה וַֽיִּרְדְּפ֖וּ אַחֲרֵ֥י מִדְיָֽן׃
Translated: And now Israel’s side from Naphtali and Asher and from all of Manasseh rallied for the pursuit of the Midianites.
Transliteration: vayitsaek iysh-yisherael minafetaliy umin-asher umin-khׇl-menasheh vayiredefu acharey mideyan

Hebrew: וּמַלְאָכִ֡ים שָׁלַ֣ח גִּדְעוֹן֩ בְּכׇל־הַ֨ר אֶפְרַ֜יִם לֵאמֹ֗ר רְד֞וּ לִקְרַ֤את מִדְיָן֙ וְלִכְד֤וּ לָהֶם֙ אֶת־הַמַּ֔יִם עַ֛ד בֵּ֥ית בָּרָ֖ה וְאֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּ֑ן וַיִּצָּעֵ֞ק כׇּל־אִ֤ישׁ אֶפְרַ֙יִם֙ וַיִּלְכְּד֣וּ אֶת־הַמַּ֔יִם עַ֛ד בֵּ֥ית בָּרָ֖ה וְאֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּֽן׃
Translated: Gideon also sent messengers all through the hill country of Ephraim with this order: “Go down ahead of the Midianites and seize their access to the water all along the Jordan down to Beth-barah.” So Ephraim’s entire contingent rallied and seized the waterside down to Beth-barah by the Jordan.
Transliteration: umaleakhiym shalach gidevon vekhׇl-har eferayiim lemor redu likerat mideyan velikhedu lahem et-hamayiim ad veyt varah veet-hayareden vayitsaek khׇl-iysh eferayiim vayilekhedu et-hamayiim ad veyt varah veet-hayareden

Hebrew: וַֽיִּלְכְּד֡וּ שְׁנֵֽי־שָׂרֵ֨י מִדְיָ֜ן אֶת־עֹרֵ֣ב וְאֶת־זְאֵ֗ב וַיַּהַרְג֨וּ אֶת־עוֹרֵ֤ב בְּצוּר־עוֹרֵב֙ וְאֶת־זְאֵב֙ הָרְג֣וּ בְיֶֽקֶב־זְאֵ֔ב וַֽיִּרְדְּפ֖וּ אֶל־מִדְיָ֑ן וְרֹאשׁ־עֹרֵ֣ב וּזְאֵ֔ב הֵבִ֙יאוּ֙ אֶל־גִּדְע֔וֹן מֵעֵ֖בֶר לַיַּרְדֵּֽן׃
Translated: They pursued the Midianites and captured Midian’s two generals, Oreb and Zeeb. They killed Oreb at the Rock of Oreb and they killed Zeeb at the Winepress of Zeeb; and they brought the heads of Oreb and Zeeb from the other side of the Jordan to Gideon.
Transliteration: vayilekhedu sheney-sharey mideyan et-orev veet-zeev vayaharegu et-vorev vetsur-vorev veet-zeev haregu veyekev-zeev vayiredefu el-mideyan verosh-orev uzeev heviyu el-gidevon meever layareden

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֨וּ אֵלָ֜יו אִ֣ישׁ אֶפְרַ֗יִם מָֽה־הַדָּבָ֤ר הַזֶּה֙ עָשִׂ֣יתָ לָּ֔נוּ לְבִלְתִּי֙ קְרֹ֣אות לָ֔נוּ כִּ֥י הָלַ֖כְתָּ לְהִלָּחֵ֣ם בְּמִדְיָ֑ן וַיְרִיב֥וּן אִתּ֖וֹ בְּחׇזְקָֽה׃
Translated: And those in Ephraim’s contingent said to him, “Why did you do that to us—not calling us when you went to fight the Midianites?” And they rebuked him severely.
Transliteration: vayomeru elayv iysh eferayiim mah-hadavar hazeh ashiyta lanu leviletiy kerovt lanu khiy halakheta lehilachem vemideyan vayeriyvun itvo vechׇzekah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲלֵיהֶ֔ם מֶה־עָשִׂ֥יתִי עַתָּ֖ה כָּכֶ֑ם הֲלֹ֗א ט֛וֹב עֹלְל֥וֹת אֶפְרַ֖יִם מִבְצִ֥יר אֲבִיעֶֽזֶר׃
Translated: But he answered them, “After all, what have I accomplished compared to you? Why, Ephraim’s gleanings are better than Abiezer’s vintage!
Transliteration: vayomer aleyhem meh-ashiytiy atah khakhem halo tvov olelvot eferayiim mivetsiyr aviyezer

Hebrew: בְּיֶדְכֶם֩ נָתַ֨ן אֱלֹהִ֜ים אֶת־שָׂרֵ֤י מִדְיָן֙ אֶת־עֹרֵ֣ב וְאֶת־זְאֵ֔ב וּמַה־יָּכֹ֖לְתִּי עֲשׂ֣וֹת כָּכֶ֑ם אָ֗ז רָפְתָ֤ה רוּחָם֙ מֵֽעָלָ֔יו בְּדַבְּר֖וֹ הַדָּבָ֥ר הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: God has delivered the Midianite generals Oreb and Zeeb into your hands, and what was I able to do compared to you?” And when he spoke in this fashion, their anger against him abated.
Transliteration: veyedekhem natan Elohim et-sharey mideyan et-orev veet-zeev umah-yakholetiy ashvot khakhem az rafetah rucham mealayv vedavervo hadavar hazeh

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֥א גִדְע֖וֹן הַיַּרְדֵּ֑נָה עֹבֵ֣ר ה֗וּא וּשְׁלֹשׁ־מֵא֤וֹת הָאִישׁ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אִתּ֔וֹ עֲיֵפִ֖ים וְרֹדְפִֽים׃
Translated: Gideon came to the Jordan and crossed it. The three hundred men with him were famished, but still in pursuit.
Transliteration: vayavo gidevon hayaredenah over hu ushelosh-mevot haiysh asher itvo aeifiym verodefiym

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ לְאַנְשֵׁ֣י סֻכּ֔וֹת תְּנוּ־נָא֙ כִּכְּר֣וֹת לֶ֔חֶם לָעָ֖ם אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּרַגְלָ֑י כִּֽי־עֲיֵפִ֣ים הֵ֔ם וְאָנֹכִ֗י רֹדֵ֛ף אַחֲרֵ֛י זֶ֥בַח וְצַלְמֻנָּ֖ע מַלְכֵ֥י מִדְיָֽן׃
Translated: He said to the people of Succoth, “Please give some loaves of bread to the troops who are right behind me, for they are famished, and I am pursuing Zebah and Zalmunna, the kings of Midian.”
Transliteration: vayomer leaneshey sukhvot tenu-na khikhervot lechem laam asher veragelay khiy-aeifiym hem veanokhiy rodef acharey zevach vetsalemuna malekhey mideyan

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ שָׂרֵ֣י סֻכּ֔וֹת הֲ֠כַ֠ף זֶ֧בַח וְצַלְמֻנָּ֛ע עַתָּ֖ה בְּיָדֶ֑ךָ כִּֽי־נִתֵּ֥ן לִֽצְבָאֲךָ֖ לָֽחֶם׃
Translated: But the officials of Succoth replied, “Are Zebah and Zalmunna already in your hands, that we should give bread to your army?”
Transliteration: vayomer sharey sukhvot hakhaf zevach vetsalemuna atah veyadekha khiy-niten litsevaakha lachem

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר גִּדְע֔וֹן לָכֵ֗ן בְּתֵ֧ת יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶת־זֶ֥בַח וְאֶת־צַלְמֻנָּ֖ע בְּיָדִ֑י וְדַשְׁתִּי֙ אֶת־בְּשַׂרְכֶ֔ם אֶת־קוֹצֵ֥י הַמִּדְבָּ֖ר וְאֶת־הַֽבַּרְקֳנִֽים׃
Translated: “I swear,” declared Gideon, “when G<small>OD</small> delivers Zebah and Zalmunna into my hands, I’ll thresh your bodies upon desert thorns and briers!”
Transliteration: vayomer gidevon lakhen vetet yehovah et-zevach veet-tsalemuna veyadiy vedashetiy et-vesharekhem et-kvotsey hamidevar veet-havarekoniym

Hebrew: וַיַּ֤עַל מִשָּׁם֙ פְּנוּאֵ֔ל וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר אֲלֵיהֶ֖ם כָּזֹ֑את וַיַּעֲנ֤וּ אוֹתוֹ֙ אַנְשֵׁ֣י פְנוּאֵ֔ל כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר עָנ֖וּ אַנְשֵׁ֥י סֻכּֽוֹת׃
Translated: From there he went up to Penuel and made the same request of them; but the people of Penuel gave him the same reply as the people of Succoth.
Transliteration: vayaal misham fenuel vayedaver aleyhem khazot vayaanu votvo aneshey fenuel khaasher anu aneshey sukhvot

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֛אמֶר גַּם־לְאַנְשֵׁ֥י פְנוּאֵ֖ל לֵאמֹ֑ר בְּשׁוּבִ֣י בְשָׁל֔וֹם אֶתֹּ֖ץ אֶת־הַמִּגְדָּ֥ל הַזֶּֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: So he also threatened the people of Penuel: “When I come back safe, I’ll tear down this tower!”
Transliteration: vayomer gam-leaneshey fenuel lemor veshuviy veshalvom etots et-hamigedal hazeh {f}

Hebrew: וְזֶ֨בַח וְצַלְמֻנָּ֜ע בַּקַּרְקֹ֗ר וּמַחֲנֵיהֶ֤ם עִמָּם֙ כַּחֲמֵ֤שֶׁת עָשָׂר֙ אֶ֔לֶף כֹּ֚ל הַנּ֣וֹתָרִ֔ים מִכֹּ֖ל מַחֲנֵ֣ה בְנֵי־קֶ֑דֶם וְהַנֹּ֣פְלִ֔ים מֵאָ֨ה וְעֶשְׂרִ֥ים אֶ֛לֶף אִ֖ישׁ שֹׁ֥לֵֽף־חָֽרֶב׃
Translated: Now Zebah and Zalmunna were at Karkor with their army of about 15,000; these were all that remained of the entire host of the Kedemites, for the slain numbered 120,000 fighters.
Transliteration: vezevach vetsalemuna vakarekor umachaneyhem imam khachameshet ashar elef khol hanvotariym mikhol machaneh veney-kedem vehanofeliym meah veesheriym elef iysh sholef-charev

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַל גִּדְע֗וֹן דֶּ֚רֶךְ הַשְּׁכוּנֵ֣י בׇאֳהָלִ֔ים מִקֶּ֥דֶם לְנֹ֖בַח וְיׇגְבְּהָ֑ה וַיַּךְ֙ אֶת־הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֔ה וְהַֽמַּחֲנֶ֖ה הָ֥יָה בֶֽטַח׃
Translated: Gideon marched up the road of the tent dwellers, up to east of Nobah and Jogbehah, and routed the camp, which was off guard.
Transliteration: vayaal gidevon derekhe hashekhuney vׇohaliym mikedem lenovach veyׇgevehah vayakhe et-hamachaneh vehamachaneh hayah vetach

Hebrew: וַיָּנֻ֗סוּ זֶ֚בַח וְצַלְמֻנָּ֔ע וַיִּרְדֹּ֖ף אַחֲרֵיהֶ֑ם וַיִּלְכֹּ֞ד אֶת־שְׁנֵ֣י ׀ מַלְכֵ֣י מִדְיָ֗ן אֶת־זֶ֙בַח֙ וְאֶת־צַלְמֻנָּ֔ע וְכׇל־הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֖ה הֶחֱרִֽיד׃
Translated: Zebah and Zalmunna took to flight, with Gideon in pursuit. He captured Zebah and Zalmunna, the two kings of Midian, and threw the whole army into panic.
Transliteration: vayanusu zevach vetsalemuna vayiredof achareyhem vayilekhod et-sheney malekhey mideyan et-zevach veet-tsalemuna vekhׇl-hamachaneh hecheriyd

Hebrew: וַיָּ֛שׇׁב גִּדְע֥וֹן בֶּן־יוֹאָ֖שׁ מִן־הַמִּלְחָמָ֑ה מִֽלְמַעֲלֵ֖ה הֶחָֽרֶס׃
Translated: On his way back from the battle at the Ascent of Heres, Gideon son of Joash
Transliteration: vayashׇv gidevon ven-yvoash min-hamilechamah milemaaleh hechares

Hebrew: וַיִּלְכׇּד־נַ֛עַר מֵאַנְשֵׁ֥י סֻכּ֖וֹת וַיִּשְׁאָלֵ֑הוּ וַיִּכְתֹּ֨ב אֵלָ֜יו אֶת־שָׂרֵ֤י סֻכּוֹת֙ וְאֶת־זְקֵנֶ֔יהָ שִׁבְעִ֥ים וְשִׁבְעָ֖ה אִֽישׁ׃
Translated: captured a young man from among the people of Succoth and interrogated him. The latter drew up for him a list of the officials and elders of Succoth, seventy-seven in number.
Transliteration: vayilekhׇd-naar meaneshey sukhvot vayishealehu vayikhetov elayv et-sharey sukhvot veet-zekeneyha shiveiym veshiveah iysh

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹא֙ אֶל־אַנְשֵׁ֣י סֻכּ֔וֹת וַיֹּ֕אמֶר הִנֵּ֖ה זֶ֣בַח וְצַלְמֻנָּ֑ע אֲשֶׁר֩ חֵרַפְתֶּ֨ם אוֹתִ֜י לֵאמֹ֗ר הֲ֠כַ֠ף זֶ֣בַח וְצַלְמֻנָּ֤ע עַתָּה֙ בְּיָדֶ֔ךָ כִּ֥י נִתֵּ֛ן לַאֲנָשֶׁ֥יךָ הַיְּעֵפִ֖ים לָֽחֶם׃
Translated: Then he came to the people of Succoth and said, “Here are Zebah and Zalmunna, about whom you mocked me, saying, ‘Are Zebah and Zalmunna already in your hands, that we should give your famished men bread?’”
Transliteration: vayavo el-aneshey sukhvot vayomer hineh zevach vetsalemuna asher cherafetem votiy lemor hakhaf zevach vetsalemuna atah veyadekha khiy niten laanasheykha hayeefiym lachem

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּח֙ אֶת־זִקְנֵ֣י הָעִ֔יר וְאֶת־קוֹצֵ֥י הַמִּדְבָּ֖ר וְאֶת־הַֽבַּרְקֳנִ֑ים וַיֹּ֣דַע בָּהֶ֔ם אֵ֖ת אַנְשֵׁ֥י סֻכּֽוֹת׃
Translated: And he took the elders of the city and, [bringing] desert thorns and briers, he punished the people of Succoth with them.
Transliteration: vayikach et-zikeney haiyr veet-kvotsey hamidevar veet-havarekoniym vayoda vahem et aneshey sukhvot

Hebrew: וְאֶת־מִגְדַּ֥ל פְּנוּאֵ֖ל נָתָ֑ץ וַֽיַּהֲרֹ֖ג אֶת־אַנְשֵׁ֥י הָעִֽיר׃
Translated: As for Penuel, he tore down its tower and killed the townspeople.
Transliteration: veet-migedal fenuel natats vayaharog et-aneshey haiyr

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר אֶל־זֶ֙בַח֙ וְאֶל־צַלְמֻנָּ֔ע אֵיפֹה֙ הָאֲנָשִׁ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֲרַגְתֶּ֖ם בְּתָב֑וֹר וַיֹּֽאמְרוּ֙ כָּמ֣וֹךָ כְמוֹהֶ֔ם אֶחָ֕ד כְּתֹ֖אַר בְּנֵ֥י הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: Then he asked Zebah and Zalmunna, “Those men you killed at Tabor, what were they like?” “They looked just like you,” they replied, “like sons of a king.”
Transliteration: vayomer el-zevach veel-tsalemuna eyfoh haanashiym asher haragetem vetavvor vayomeru khamvokha khemvohem echad khetoar veney hamelekhe

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמַ֕ר אַחַ֥י בְּנֵֽי־אִמִּ֖י הֵ֑ם חַי־יְהֹוָ֗ה ל֚וּ הַחֲיִתֶ֣ם אוֹתָ֔ם לֹ֥א הָרַ֖גְתִּי אֶתְכֶֽם׃
Translated: “They were my brothers,” he declared, “the sons of my mother. As G<small>OD</small> lives, if you had spared them, I would not kill you.”
Transliteration: vayomar achay veney-imiy hem chay-yehovah lu hachayitem votam lo haragetiy etekhem

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ לְיֶ֣תֶר בְּכוֹר֔וֹ ק֖וּם הֲרֹ֣ג אוֹתָ֑ם וְלֹא־שָׁלַ֨ף הַנַּ֤עַר חַרְבּוֹ֙ כִּ֣י יָרֵ֔א כִּ֥י עוֹדֶ֖נּוּ נָֽעַר׃
Translated: And he commanded his oldest son Jether, “Go kill them!” But the boy did not draw his sword, for he was timid, being still a boy.
Transliteration: vayomer leyeter vekhvorvo kum harog votam velo-shalaf hanaar charevvo khiy yare khiy vodenu naar

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֜אמֶר זֶ֣בַח וְצַלְמֻנָּ֗ע ק֤וּם אַתָּה֙ וּפְגַע־בָּ֔נוּ כִּ֥י כָאִ֖ישׁ גְּבוּרָת֑וֹ וַיָּ֣קׇם גִּדְע֗וֹן וַֽיַּהֲרֹג֙ אֶת־זֶ֣בַח וְאֶת־צַלְמֻנָּ֔ע וַיִּקַּח֙ אֶת־הַשַּׂ֣הֲרֹנִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֖ר בְּצַוְּארֵ֥י גְמַלֵּיהֶֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: Then Zebah and Zalmunna said, “Come, you slay us; for strength comes with manhood.” So Gideon went over and killed Zebah and Zalmunna, and he took the crescents that were on the necks of their camels.
Transliteration: vayomer zevach vetsalemuna kum atah ufega-vanu khiy khaiysh gevuratvo vayakׇm gidevon vayaharog et-zevach veet-tsalemuna vayikach et-hashaharoniym asher vetsaverey gemaleyhem {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֤וּ אִֽישׁ־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ אֶל־גִּדְע֔וֹן מְשָׁל־בָּ֙נוּ֙ גַּם־אַתָּ֔ה גַּם־בִּנְךָ֖ גַּ֣ם בֶּן־בְּנֶ֑ךָ כִּ֥י הוֹשַׁעְתָּ֖נוּ מִיַּ֥ד מִדְיָֽן׃
Translated: Then those [who fought] on Israel’s side said to Gideon, “Rule over us—you, your son, and your grandson as well; for you have saved us from the Midianites.”
Transliteration: vayomeru iysh-yisherael el-gidevon meshal-vanu gam-atah gam-vinekha gam ven-venekha khiy hvoshaetanu miyad mideyan

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֲלֵהֶם֙ גִּדְע֔וֹן לֹֽא־אֶמְשֹׁ֤ל אֲנִי֙ בָּכֶ֔ם וְלֹא־יִמְשֹׁ֥ל בְּנִ֖י בָּכֶ֑ם יְהֹוָ֖ה יִמְשֹׁ֥ל בָּכֶֽם׃
Translated: But Gideon replied, “I will not rule over you myself, nor shall my son rule over you; G<small>OD</small> alone shall rule over you.”
Transliteration: vayomer alehem gidevon lo-emeshol aniy vakhem velo-yimeshol veniy vakhem yehovah yimeshol vakhem

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֜ם גִּדְע֗וֹן אֶשְׁאֲלָ֤ה מִכֶּם֙ שְׁאֵלָ֔ה וּתְנוּ־לִ֕י אִ֖ישׁ נֶ֣זֶם שְׁלָל֑וֹ כִּֽי־נִזְמֵ֤י זָהָב֙ לָהֶ֔ם כִּ֥י יִשְׁמְעֵאלִ֖ים הֵֽם׃
Translated: And Gideon said to them, “I have a request to make of you: Each of you give me the earring you received as booty.” (The Midianites had golden earrings, for they were Ishmaelites.)
Transliteration: vayomer alehem gidevon eshealah mikhem sheelah utenu-liy iysh nezem shelalvo khiy-nizemey zahav lahem khiy yishemeeliym hem

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֖וּ נָת֣וֹן נִתֵּ֑ן וַֽיִּפְרְשׂוּ֙ אֶת־הַשִּׂמְלָ֔ה וַיַּשְׁלִ֣יכוּ שָׁ֔מָּה אִ֖ישׁ נֶ֥זֶם שְׁלָלֽוֹ׃
Translated: “Certainly!” they replied. And they spread out a cloth, and everyone threw onto it the earring he had received as booty.
Transliteration: vayomeru natvon niten vayifereshu et-hashimelah vayasheliykhu shamah iysh nezem shelalvo

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י מִשְׁקַ֞ל נִזְמֵ֤י הַזָּהָב֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר שָׁאָ֔ל אֶ֥לֶף וּשְׁבַע־מֵא֖וֹת זָהָ֑ב לְ֠בַ֠ד מִן־הַשַּׂהֲרֹנִ֨ים וְהַנְּטִיפ֜וֹת וּבִגְדֵ֣י הָאַרְגָּמָ֗ן שֶׁעַל֙ מַלְכֵ֣י מִדְיָ֔ן וּלְבַד֙ מִן־הָ֣עֲנָק֔וֹת אֲשֶׁ֖ר בְּצַוְּארֵ֥י גְמַלֵּיהֶֽם׃
Translated: The weight of the golden earrings that he had requested came to 1,700 shekels of gold; this was in addition to the crescents and the pendants and the purple robes worn by the kings of Midian and in addition to the collars on the necks of their camels.
Transliteration: vayehiy mishekal nizemey hazahav asher shaal elef usheva-mevot zahav levad min-hashaharoniym vehanetiyfvot uvigedey haaregaman sheal malekhey mideyan ulevad min-haanakvot asher vetsaverey gemaleyhem

Hebrew: וַיַּ֩עַשׂ֩ אוֹת֨וֹ גִדְע֜וֹן לְאֵפ֗וֹד וַיַּצֵּ֨ג אוֹת֤וֹ בְעִירוֹ֙ בְּעׇפְרָ֔ה וַיִּזְנ֧וּ כׇֽל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל אַחֲרָ֖יו שָׁ֑ם וַיְהִ֛י לְגִדְע֥וֹן וּלְבֵית֖וֹ לְמוֹקֵֽשׁ׃
Translated: Gideon made an ephod of this gold and set it up in his own town of Ophrah. There all Israel went astray after it, and it became a snare to Gideon and his household.
Transliteration: vayaash votvo gidevon leefvod vayatseg votvo veiyrvo veׇferah vayizenu khׇl-yisherael acharayv sham vayehiy legidevon uleveytvo lemvokesh

Hebrew: וַיִּכָּנַ֣ע מִדְיָ֗ן לִפְנֵי֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְלֹ֥א יָסְפ֖וּ לָשֵׂ֣את רֹאשָׁ֑ם וַתִּשְׁקֹ֥ט הָאָ֛רֶץ אַרְבָּעִ֥ים שָׁנָ֖ה בִּימֵ֥י גִדְעֽוֹן׃ {פ}
Translated: Thus Midian submitted to the Israelites and did not raise its head again; and the land was tranquil for forty years in Gideon’s time.
Transliteration: vayikhana mideyan lifeney veney yisherael velo yasefu lashet rosham vatishekot haarets arevaiym shanah viymey gidevon {f}

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֛לֶךְ יְרֻבַּ֥עַל בֶּן־יוֹאָ֖שׁ וַיֵּ֥שֶׁב בְּבֵיתֽוֹ׃
Translated: So Jerubbaal son of Joash retired to his own house.
Transliteration: vayelekhe yeruvaal ven-yvoash vayeshev veveytvo

Hebrew: וּלְגִדְע֗וֹן הָיוּ֙ שִׁבְעִ֣ים בָּנִ֔ים יֹצְאֵ֖י יְרֵכ֑וֹ כִּֽי־נָשִׁ֥ים רַבּ֖וֹת הָ֥יוּ לֽוֹ׃
Translated: Gideon had seventy sons of his own issue, for he had many wives.
Transliteration: ulegidevon hayu shiveiym vaniym yotseey yerekhvo khiy-nashiym ravvot hayu lvo

Hebrew: וּפִֽילַגְשׁוֹ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בִּשְׁכֶ֔ם יָֽלְדָה־לּ֥וֹ גַם־הִ֖יא בֵּ֑ן וַיָּ֥שֶׂם אֶת־שְׁמ֖וֹ אֲבִימֶֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: A son was also born to him by his concubine in Shechem, and he named him Abimelech.
Transliteration: ufiylageshvo asher vishekhem yaledah-lvo gam-hiy ven vayashem et-shemvo aviymelekhe

Hebrew: וַיָּ֛מׇת גִּדְע֥וֹן בֶּן־יוֹאָ֖שׁ בְּשֵׂיבָ֣ה טוֹבָ֑ה וַיִּקָּבֵ֗ר בְּקֶ֙בֶר֙ יוֹאָ֣שׁ אָבִ֔יו בְּעׇפְרָ֖ה אֲבִ֥י הָעֶזְרִֽי׃ {פ}
Translated: Gideon son of Joash died at a ripe old age, and was buried in the tomb of his father Joash at Ophrah of the Abiezrites.
Transliteration: vayamׇt gidevon ven-yvoash vesheyvah tvovah vayikaver vekever yvoash aviyv veׇferah aviy haezeriy {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י כַּֽאֲשֶׁר֙ מֵ֣ת גִּדְע֔וֹן וַיָּשׁ֙וּבוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיִּזְנ֖וּ אַחֲרֵ֣י הַבְּעָלִ֑ים וַיָּשִׂ֧ימוּ לָהֶ֛ם בַּ֥עַל בְּרִ֖ית לֵאלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: After Gideon died, the Israelites again went astray after the Baalim, and they adopted Baal-berith as a god.
Transliteration: vayehiy khaasher met gidevon vayashuvu veney yisherael vayizenu acharey havealiym vayashiymu lahem vaal veriyt lelohiym

Hebrew: וְלֹ֤א זָֽכְרוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֶת־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵיהֶ֑ם הַמַּצִּ֥יל אוֹתָ֛ם מִיַּ֥ד כׇּל־אֹיְבֵיהֶ֖ם מִסָּבִֽיב׃
Translated: The Israelites gave no thought to the E<small>TERNAL</small> their God, who saved them from all the enemies around them.
Transliteration: velo zakheru veney yisherael et-yehovah eloheyhem hamatsiyl votam miyad khׇl-oyeveyhem misaviyv

Hebrew: וְלֹא־עָשׂ֣וּ חֶ֔סֶד עִם־בֵּ֥ית יְרֻבַּ֖עַל גִּדְע֑וֹן כְּכׇ֨ל־הַטּוֹבָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשָׂ֖ה עִם־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: Nor did they show loyalty to the house of Jerubbaal-Gideon in return for all the good that he had done for Israel.
Transliteration: velo-ashu chesed im-veyt yeruvaal gidevon khekhׇl-hatvovah asher ashah im-yisherael {f}

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֨לֶךְ אֲבִימֶ֤לֶךְ בֶּן־יְרֻבַּ֙עַל֙ שְׁכֶ֔מָה אֶל־אֲחֵ֖י אִמּ֑וֹ וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר אֲלֵיהֶ֔ם וְאֶל־כׇּל־מִשְׁפַּ֛חַת בֵּית־אֲבִ֥י אִמּ֖וֹ לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: Abimelech son of Jerubbaal went to his mother’s brothers in Shechem and spoke to them and to the whole clan of his mother’s family. He said,
Transliteration: vayelekhe aviymelekhe ven-yeruvaal shekhemah el-achey imvo vayedaver aleyhem veel-khׇl-mishefachat veyt-aviy imvo lemor

Hebrew: דַּבְּרוּ־נָ֞א בְּאׇזְנֵ֨י כׇל־בַּעֲלֵ֣י שְׁכֶם֮ מַה־טּ֣וֹב לָכֶם֒ הַמְשֹׁ֨ל בָּכֶ֜ם שִׁבְעִ֣ים אִ֗ישׁ כֹּ֚ל בְּנֵ֣י יְרֻבַּ֔עַל אִם־מְשֹׁ֥ל בָּכֶ֖ם אִ֣ישׁ אֶחָ֑ד וּזְכַרְתֶּ֕ם כִּֽי־עַצְמְכֶ֥ם וּבְשַׂרְכֶ֖ם אָֽנִי׃
Translated: “Put this question to all the citizens of Shechem: Which is better for you—to be ruled by all seventy sons of Jerubbaal, or to be ruled by one? And remember, I am your own flesh and blood.”
Transliteration: daveru-na veׇzeney khׇl-vaaley shekhem mah-tvov lakhem hameshol vakhem shiveiym iysh khol veney yeruvaal im-meshol vakhem iysh echad uzekharetem khiy-atsemekhem uvesharekhem aniy

Hebrew: וַיְדַבְּר֨וּ אֲחֵי־אִמּ֜וֹ עָלָ֗יו בְּאׇזְנֵי֙ כׇּל־בַּעֲלֵ֣י שְׁכֶ֔ם אֵ֥ת כׇּל־הַדְּבָרִ֖ים הָאֵ֑לֶּה וַיֵּ֤ט לִבָּם֙ אַחֲרֵ֣י אֲבִימֶ֔לֶךְ כִּ֥י אָמְר֖וּ אָחִ֥ינוּ הֽוּא׃
Translated: His mother’s brothers said all this in his behalf to all the citizens of Shechem, and they were won over to Abimelech; for they thought, “He is our kinsman.”
Transliteration: vayedaveru achey-imvo alayv veׇzeney khׇl-vaaley shekhem et khׇl-hadevariym haeleh vayet livam acharey aviymelekhe khiy ameru achiynu hu

Hebrew: וַיִּתְּנוּ־לוֹ֙ שִׁבְעִ֣ים כֶּ֔סֶף מִבֵּ֖ית בַּ֣עַל בְּרִ֑ית וַיִּשְׂכֹּ֨ר בָּהֶ֜ם אֲבִימֶ֗לֶךְ אֲנָשִׁ֤ים רֵיקִים֙ וּפֹ֣חֲזִ֔ים וַיֵּלְכ֖וּ אַחֲרָֽיו׃
Translated: They gave him seventy shekels from the temple of Baal-berith; and with this Abimelech hired some worthless and reckless men, and they followed him.
Transliteration: vayitenu-lvo shiveiym khesef miveyt vaal veriyt vayishekhor vahem aviymelekhe anashiym reykiym ufochaziym vayelekhu acharayv

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֤א בֵית־אָבִיו֙ עׇפְרָ֔תָה וַֽיַּהֲרֹ֞ג אֶת־אֶחָ֧יו בְּנֵי־יְרֻבַּ֛עַל שִׁבְעִ֥ים אִ֖ישׁ עַל־אֶ֣בֶן אֶחָ֑ת וַיִּוָּתֵ֞ר יוֹתָ֧ם בֶּן־יְרֻבַּ֛עַל הַקָּטֹ֖ן כִּ֥י נֶחְבָּֽא׃ {ס}
Translated: Then he went to his father’s house in Ophrah and killed his brothers, the sons of Jerubbaal, seventy in succession on one stone. Only Jotham, the youngest son of Jerubbaal, survived, because he went into hiding.
Transliteration: vayavo veyt-aviyv ׇferatah vayaharog et-echayv veney-yeruvaal shiveiym iysh al-even echat vayivater yvotam ven-yeruvaal hakaton khiy necheva {s}

Hebrew: וַיֵּאָ֨סְפ֜וּ כׇּל־בַּעֲלֵ֤י שְׁכֶם֙ וְכׇל־בֵּ֣ית מִלּ֔וֹא וַיֵּ֣לְכ֔וּ וַיַּמְלִ֥יכוּ אֶת־אֲבִימֶ֖לֶךְ לְמֶ֑לֶךְ עִם־אֵל֥וֹן מֻצָּ֖ב אֲשֶׁ֥ר בִּשְׁכֶֽם׃
Translated: All the citizens of Shechem and all Beth-millo convened, and they proclaimed Abimelech king at the terebinth of the pillar at Shechem.
Transliteration: vayeasefu khׇl-vaaley shekhem vekhׇl-veyt milvo vayelekhu vayameliykhu et-aviymelekhe lemelekhe im-elvon mutsav asher vishekhem

Hebrew: וַיַּגִּ֣דוּ לְיוֹתָ֗ם וַיֵּ֙לֶךְ֙ וַֽיַּעֲמֹד֙ בְּרֹ֣אשׁ הַר־גְּרִזִ֔ים וַיִּשָּׂ֥א קוֹל֖וֹ וַיִּקְרָ֑א וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לָהֶ֗ם שִׁמְע֤וּ אֵלַי֙ בַּעֲלֵ֣י שְׁכֶ֔ם וְיִשְׁמַ֥ע אֲלֵיכֶ֖ם אֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: When Jotham was informed, he went and stood on top of Mount Gerizim and called out to them in a loud voice. “Citizens of Shechem!” he cried, “Listen to me, that God may listen to you.
Transliteration: vayagidu leyvotam vayelekhe vayaamod verosh har-geriziym vayisha kvolvo vayikera vayomer lahem shimeu elay vaaley shekhem veyishema aleykhem Elohim

Hebrew: הָל֤וֹךְ הָֽלְכוּ֙ הָעֵצִ֔ים לִמְשֹׁ֥חַ עֲלֵיהֶ֖ם מֶ֑לֶךְ וַיֹּאמְר֥וּ לַזַּ֖יִת (מלוכה) [מׇלְכָ֥ה] עָלֵֽינוּ׃
Translated: “Once the trees went to anoint a king over themselves. They said to the olive tree, ‘Reign over us.’
Transliteration: halvokhe halekhu haetsiym limeshocha aleyhem melekhe vayomeru lazayiit (mlvkhh) [mׇlekhah] aleynu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לָהֶם֙ הַזַּ֔יִת הֶחֳדַ֙לְתִּי֙ אֶת־דִּשְׁנִ֔י אֲשֶׁר־בִּ֛י יְכַבְּד֥וּ אֱלֹהִ֖ים וַאֲנָשִׁ֑ים וְהָ֣לַכְתִּ֔י לָנ֖וּעַ עַל־הָעֵצִֽים׃
Translated: But the olive tree replied, ‘Have I, through whom God and humans are honored, stopped yielding my rich oil, that I should go and wave above the trees?’
Transliteration: vayomer lahem hazayiit hechodaletiy et-disheniy asher-viy yekhavedu Elohim vaanashiym vehalakhetiy lanua al-haetsiym

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֥וּ הָעֵצִ֖ים לַתְּאֵנָ֑ה לְכִי־אַ֖תְּ מׇלְכִ֥י עָלֵֽינוּ׃
Translated: So the trees said to the fig tree, ‘You come and reign over us.’
Transliteration: vayomeru haetsiym lateenah lekhiy-ate mׇlekhiy aleynu

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֤אמֶר לָהֶם֙ הַתְּאֵנָ֔ה הֶחֳדַ֙לְתִּי֙ אֶת־מׇתְקִ֔י וְאֶת־תְּנוּבָתִ֖י הַטּוֹבָ֑ה וְהָ֣לַכְתִּ֔י לָנ֖וּעַ עַל־הָעֵצִֽים׃
Translated: But the fig tree replied, ‘Have I stopped yielding my sweetness, my delicious fruit, that I should go and wave above the trees?’
Transliteration: vatomer lahem hateenah hechodaletiy et-mׇtekiy veet-tenuvatiy hatvovah vehalakhetiy lanua al-haetsiym

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֥וּ הָעֵצִ֖ים לַגָּ֑פֶן לְכִי־אַ֖תְּ (מלוכי) [מׇלְכִ֥י] עָלֵֽינוּ׃
Translated: So the trees said to the vine, ‘You come and reign over us.’
Transliteration: vayomeru haetsiym lagafen lekhiy-ate (mlvkhy) [mׇlekhiy] aleynu

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֤אמֶר לָהֶם֙ הַגֶּ֔פֶן הֶחֳדַ֙לְתִּי֙ אֶת־תִּ֣ירוֹשִׁ֔י הַֽמְשַׂמֵּ֥חַ אֱלֹהִ֖ים וַאֲנָשִׁ֑ים וְהָ֣לַכְתִּ֔י לָנ֖וּעַ עַל־הָעֵצִֽים׃
Translated: But the vine replied, ‘Have I stopped yielding my new wine, which gladdens God and humans, that I should go and wave above the trees?’
Transliteration: vatomer lahem hagefen hechodaletiy et-tiyrvoshiy hameshamecha Elohim vaanashiym vehalakhetiy lanua al-haetsiym

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֥וּ כׇל־הָעֵצִ֖ים אֶל־הָאָטָ֑ד לֵ֥ךְ אַתָּ֖ה מְלׇךְ־עָלֵֽינוּ׃
Translated: Then all the trees said to the thornbush, ‘You come and reign over us.’
Transliteration: vayomeru khׇl-haetsiym el-haatad lekhe atah melׇkhe-aleynu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר הָאָטָד֮ אֶל־הָעֵצִים֒ אִ֡ם בֶּאֱמֶ֣ת אַתֶּם֩ מֹשְׁחִ֨ים אֹתִ֤י לְמֶ֙לֶךְ֙ עֲלֵיכֶ֔ם בֹּ֖אוּ חֲס֣וּ בְצִלִּ֑י וְאִם־אַ֕יִן תֵּ֤צֵא אֵשׁ֙ מִן־הָ֣אָטָ֔ד וְתֹאכַ֖ל אֶת־אַרְזֵ֥י הַלְּבָנֽוֹן׃
Translated: And the thornbush said to the trees, ‘If you are acting honorably in anointing me king over you, come and take shelter in my shade; but if not, may fire issue from the thornbush and consume the cedars of Lebanon!’
Transliteration: vayomer haatad el-haetsiym im veemet atem moshechiym otiy lemelekhe aleykhem vou chasu vetsiliy veim-ayiin tetse esh min-haatad vetokhal et-arezey halevanvon

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה אִם־בֶּאֱמֶ֤ת וּבְתָמִים֙ עֲשִׂיתֶ֔ם וַתַּמְלִ֖יכוּ אֶת־אֲבִימֶ֑לֶךְ וְאִם־טוֹבָ֤ה עֲשִׂיתֶם֙ עִם־יְרֻבַּ֣עַל וְעִם־בֵּית֔וֹ וְאִם־כִּגְמ֥וּל יָדָ֖יו עֲשִׂ֥יתֶם לֽוֹ׃
Translated: “Now then, if you acted honorably and loyally in making Abimelech king, if you have done right by Jerubbaal and his house and have requited him according to his deserts—
Transliteration: veatah im-veemet uvetamiym ashiytem vatameliykhu et-aviymelekhe veim-tvovah ashiytem im-yeruvaal veim-veytvo veim-khigemul yadayv ashiytem lvo

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁר־נִלְחַ֥ם אָבִ֖י עֲלֵיכֶ֑ם וַיַּשְׁלֵ֤ךְ אֶת־נַפְשׁוֹ֙ מִנֶּ֔גֶד וַיַּצֵּ֥ל אֶתְכֶ֖ם מִיַּ֥ד מִדְיָֽן׃
Translated: considering that my father fought for you and saved you from the Midianites at the risk of his life,
Transliteration: asher-nilecham aviy aleykhem vayashelekhe et-nafeshvo mineged vayatsel etekhem miyad mideyan

Hebrew: וְאַתֶּ֞ם קַמְתֶּ֨ם עַל־בֵּ֤ית אָבִי֙ הַיּ֔וֹם וַתַּהַרְג֧וּ אֶת־בָּנָ֛יו שִׁבְעִ֥ים אִ֖ישׁ עַל־אֶ֣בֶן אֶחָ֑ת וַתַּמְלִ֜יכוּ אֶת־אֲבִימֶ֤לֶךְ בֶּן־אֲמָתוֹ֙ עַל־בַּעֲלֵ֣י שְׁכֶ֔ם כִּ֥י אֲחִיכֶ֖ם הֽוּא׃
Translated: and now you have turned on my father’s household, killed his sons (seventy in succession on one stone!) and set up Abimelech, the son of his handmaid, as king over the citizens of Shechem just because he is your kinsman—
Transliteration: veatem kametem al-veyt aviy hayyvom vataharegu et-vanayv shiveiym iysh al-even echat vatameliykhu et-aviymelekhe ven-amatvo al-vaaley shekhem khiy achiykhem hu

Hebrew: וְאִם־בֶּאֱמֶ֨ת וּבְתָמִ֧ים עֲשִׂיתֶ֛ם עִם־יְרֻבַּ֥עַל וְעִם־בֵּית֖וֹ הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה שִׂמְחוּ֙ בַּאֲבִימֶ֔לֶךְ וְיִשְׂמַ֥ח גַּם־ה֖וּא בָּכֶֽם׃
Translated: if, I say, you have this day acted honorably and loyally toward Jerubbaal and his house, have joy in Abimelech and may he likewise have joy in you.
Transliteration: veim-veemet uvetamiym ashiytem im-yeruvaal veim-veytvo hayyvom hazeh shimechu vaaviymelekhe veyishemach gam-hu vakhem

Hebrew: וְאִם־אַ֕יִן תֵּ֤צֵא אֵשׁ֙ מֵאֲבִימֶ֔לֶךְ וְתֹאכַ֛ל אֶת־בַּעֲלֵ֥י שְׁכֶ֖ם וְאֶת־בֵּ֣ית מִלּ֑וֹא וְתֵצֵ֨א אֵ֜שׁ מִבַּעֲלֵ֤י שְׁכֶם֙ וּמִבֵּ֣ית מִלּ֔וֹא וְתֹאכַ֖ל אֶת־אֲבִימֶֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: But if not, may fire issue from Abimelech and consume the citizens of Shechem and Beth-millo, and may fire issue from the citizens of Shechem and Beth-millo and consume Abimelech!”
Transliteration: veim-ayiin tetse esh meaviymelekhe vetokhal et-vaaley shekhem veet-veyt milvo vetetse esh mivaaley shekhem umiveyt milvo vetokhal et-aviymelekhe

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣נׇס יוֹתָ֔ם וַיִּבְרַ֖ח וַיֵּ֣לֶךְ בְּאֵ֑רָה וַיֵּ֣שֶׁב שָׁ֔ם מִפְּנֵ֖י אֲבִימֶ֥לֶךְ אָחִֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated: With that, Jotham fled. He ran to Beer and stayed there, because of his brother Abimelech.
Transliteration: vayanׇs yvotam vayiverach vayelekhe veerah vayeshev sham mifeney aviymelekhe achiyv {f}

Hebrew: וַיָּ֧שַׂר אֲבִימֶ֛לֶךְ עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל שָׁלֹ֥שׁ שָׁנִֽים׃
Translated: Abimelech held sway over Israel for three years.
Transliteration: vayashar aviymelekhe al-yisherael shalosh shaniym

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֤ח אֱלֹהִים֙ ר֣וּחַ רָעָ֔ה בֵּ֣ין אֲבִימֶ֔לֶךְ וּבֵ֖ין בַּעֲלֵ֣י שְׁכֶ֑ם וַיִּבְגְּד֥וּ בַעֲלֵֽי־שְׁכֶ֖ם בַּאֲבִימֶֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: Then God sent a spirit of discord between Abimelech and the citizens of Shechem, and the citizens of Shechem broke faith with Abimelech—
Transliteration: vayishelach Elohim rucha raah veyn aviymelekhe uveyn vaaley shekhem vayivegedu vaaley-shekhem vaaviymelekhe

Hebrew: לָב֕וֹא חֲמַ֖ס שִׁבְעִ֣ים בְּנֵֽי־יְרֻבָּ֑עַל וְדָמָ֗ם לָשׂ֞וּם עַל־אֲבִימֶ֤לֶךְ אֲחִיהֶם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הָרַ֣ג אוֹתָ֔ם וְעַל֙ בַּעֲלֵ֣י שְׁכֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁר־חִזְּק֥וּ אֶת־יָדָ֖יו לַהֲרֹ֥ג אֶת־אֶחָֽיו׃
Translated: to the end that the crime committed against the seventy sons of Jerubbaal might be avenged, and their blood recoil upon their brother Abimelech, who had slain them, and upon the citizens of Shechem, who had abetted him in the slaying of his brothers.
Transliteration: lavvo chamas shiveiym veney-yeruvaal vedamam lashum al-aviymelekhe achiyhem asher harag votam veal vaaley shekhem asher-chizeku et-yadayv laharog et-echayv

Hebrew: וַיָּשִׂ֣ימוּ לוֹ֩ בַעֲלֵ֨י שְׁכֶ֜ם מְאָֽרְבִ֗ים עַ֚ל רָאשֵׁ֣י הֶהָרִ֔ים וַֽיִּגְזְל֔וּ אֵ֛ת כׇּל־אֲשֶׁר־יַעֲבֹ֥ר עֲלֵיהֶ֖ם בַּדָּ֑רֶךְ וַיֻּגַּ֖ד לַאֲבִימֶֽלֶךְ׃ {פ}
Translated: The citizens of Shechem planted ambuscades against him on the hilltops; and they robbed whoever passed by them on the road. Word of this reached Abimelech.
Transliteration: vayashiymu lvo vaaley shekhem meareviym al rashey hehariym vayigezelu et khׇl-asher-yaavor aleyhem vadarekhe vayugad laaviymelekhe {f}

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֞א גַּ֤עַל בֶּן־עֶ֙בֶד֙ וְאֶחָ֔יו וַיַּעַבְר֖וּ בִּשְׁכֶ֑ם וַיִּבְטְחוּ־ב֖וֹ בַּעֲלֵ֥י שְׁכֶֽם׃
Translated: Then Gaal son of Ebed and his companions came passing through Shechem, and the citizens of Shechem gave him their confidence.
Transliteration: vayavo gaal ven-eved veechayv vayaaveru vishekhem vayivetechu-vvo vaaley shekhem

Hebrew: וַיֵּצְא֨וּ הַשָּׂדֶ֜ה וַֽיִּבְצְר֤וּ אֶת־כַּרְמֵיהֶם֙ וַֽיִּדְרְכ֔וּ וַֽיַּעֲשׂ֖וּ הִלּוּלִ֑ים וַיָּבֹ֙אוּ֙ בֵּ֣ית אֱֽלֹהֵיהֶ֔ם וַיֹּֽאכְלוּ֙ וַיִּשְׁתּ֔וּ וַֽיְקַלְל֖וּ אֶת־אֲבִימֶֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: They went out into the fields, gathered and trod out the vintage of their vineyards, and made a festival. They entered the temple of their god, and as they ate and drank they reviled Abimelech.
Transliteration: vayetseu hashadeh vayivetseru et-kharemeyhem vayiderekhu vayaashu hiluliym vayavou veyt eloheyhem vayokhelu vayishetu vayekalelu et-aviymelekhe

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ׀ גַּ֣עַל בֶּן־עֶ֗בֶד מִֽי־אֲבִימֶ֤לֶךְ וּמִֽי־שְׁכֶם֙ כִּ֣י נַעַבְדֶ֔נּוּ הֲלֹ֥א בֶן־יְרֻבַּ֖עַל וּזְבֻ֣ל פְּקִיד֑וֹ עִבְד֗וּ אֶת־אַנְשֵׁ֤י חֲמוֹר֙ אֲבִ֣י שְׁכֶ֔ם וּמַדּ֖וּעַ נַעַבְדֶ֥נּוּ אֲנָֽחְנוּ׃
Translated: Gaal son of Ebed said, “Who is Abimelech and who are [we] Shechemites, that we should serve him? This same son of Jerubbaal and his lieutenant Zebul once served the entourage of Hamor, the father of Shechem; so why should we serve him?
Transliteration: vayomer gaal ven-eved miy-aviymelekhe umiy-shekhem khiy naavedenu halo ven-yeruvaal uzevul fekiydvo ivedu et-aneshey chamvor aviy shekhem umadua naavedenu anachenu

Hebrew: וּמִ֨י יִתֵּ֜ן אֶת־הָעָ֤ם הַזֶּה֙ בְּיָדִ֔י וְאָסִ֖ירָה אֶת־אֲבִימֶ֑לֶךְ וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ לַאֲבִימֶ֔לֶךְ רַבֶּ֥ה צְבָאֲךָ֖ וָצֵֽאָה׃
Translated: Oh, if only this people were under my command, I would get rid of Abimelech! One would challenge Abimelech, ‘Fill up your ranks and come out here!’”
Transliteration: umiy yiten et-haam hazeh veyadiy veasiyrah et-aviymelekhe vayomer laaviymelekhe raveh tsevaakha vatseah

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֗ע זְבֻל֙ שַׂר־הָעִ֔יר אֶת־דִּבְרֵ֖י גַּ֣עַל בֶּן־עָ֑בֶד וַיִּ֖חַר אַפּֽוֹ׃
Translated: When Zebul, the governor of the city, heard the words of Gaal son of Ebed, he was furious.
Transliteration: vayishema zevul shar-haiyr et-diverey gaal ven-aved vayichar afvo

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֧ח מַלְאָכִ֛ים אֶל־אֲבִימֶ֖לֶךְ בְּתׇרְמָ֣ה לֵאמֹ֑ר הִנֵּה֩ גַ֨עַל בֶּן־עֶ֤בֶד וְאֶחָיו֙ בָּאִ֣ים שְׁכֶ֔מָה וְהִנָּ֛ם צָרִ֥ים אֶת־הָעִ֖יר עָלֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: He sent messages to Abimelech at Tormah to say, “Gaal son of Ebed and his companions have come to Shechem and they are inciting the city against you.
Transliteration: vayishelach maleakhiym el-aviymelekhe vetׇremah lemor hineh gaal ven-eved veechayv vaiym shekhemah vehinam tsariym et-haiyr aleykha

Hebrew: וְעַתָּה֙ ק֣וּם לַ֔יְלָה אַתָּ֖ה וְהָעָ֣ם אֲשֶׁר־אִתָּ֑ךְ וֶאֱרֹ֖ב בַּשָּׂדֶֽה׃
Translated: Therefore, set out at night with the forces you have with you and conceal yourself in the fields.
Transliteration: veatah kum layelah atah vehaam asher-itakhe veerov vashadeh

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֤ה בַבֹּ֙קֶר֙ כִּזְרֹ֣חַ הַשֶּׁ֔מֶשׁ תַּשְׁכִּ֖ים וּפָשַׁטְתָּ֣ עַל־הָעִ֑יר וְהִנֵּה־ה֞וּא וְהָעָ֤ם אֲשֶׁר־אִתּוֹ֙ יֹצְאִ֣ים אֵלֶ֔יךָ וְעָשִׂ֣יתָ לּ֔וֹ כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר תִּמְצָ֥א יָדֶֽךָ׃
Translated: Early next morning, as the sun rises, advance on the city. He and his troops will thereupon come out against you, and you will do to him whatever you find possible.”
Transliteration: vehayah vavoker khizerocha hashemesh tashekhiym ufashateta al-haiyr vehineh-hu vehaam asher-itvo yotseiym eleykha veashiyta lvo khaasher timetsa yadekha

Hebrew: וַיָּ֧קׇם אֲבִימֶ֛לֶךְ וְכׇל־הָעָ֥ם אֲשֶׁר־עִמּ֖וֹ לָ֑יְלָה וַיֶּאֶרְב֣וּ עַל־שְׁכֶ֔ם אַרְבָּעָ֖ה רָאשִֽׁים׃
Translated: Abimelech and all the troops with him set out at night and disposed themselves against Shechem in four hiding places.
Transliteration: vayakׇm aviymelekhe vekhׇl-haam asher-imvo layelah vayeerevu al-shekhem arevaah rashiym

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵא֙ גַּ֣עַל בֶּן־עֶ֔בֶד וַיַּעֲמֹ֕ד פֶּ֖תַח שַׁ֣עַר הָעִ֑יר וַיָּ֧קׇם אֲבִימֶ֛לֶךְ וְהָעָ֥ם אֲשֶׁר־אִתּ֖וֹ מִן־הַמַּאְרָֽב׃
Translated: When Gaal son of Ebed came out and stood at the entrance to the city gate, Abimelech and the troops with him emerged from concealment.
Transliteration: vayetse gaal ven-eved vayaamod fetach shaar haiyr vayakׇm aviymelekhe vehaam asher-itvo min-hamaerav

Hebrew: וַיַּרְא־גַּ֘עַל֮ אֶת־הָעָם֒ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֶל־זְבֻ֔ל הִנֵּה־עָ֣ם יוֹרֵ֔ד מֵרָאשֵׁ֖י הֶהָרִ֑ים וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֵלָיו֙ זְבֻ֔ל אֵ֣ת צֵ֧ל הֶהָרִ֛ים אַתָּ֥ה רֹאֶ֖ה כָּאֲנָשִֽׁים׃
Translated: Gaal saw the troops and said to Zebul, “Look, troops are coming down from the hilltops!” But Zebul said to him, “The shadows of the hills look to you like people.”
Transliteration: vayare-gaal et-haam vayomer el-zevul hineh-am yvored merashey hehariym vayomer elayv zevul et tsel hehariym atah roeh khaanashiym

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨סֶף ע֣וֹד גַּ֘עַל֮ לְדַבֵּר֒ וַיֹּ֕אמֶר הִנֵּה־עָם֙ יֽוֹרְדִ֔ים מֵעִ֖ם טַבּ֣וּר הָאָ֑רֶץ וְרֹאשׁ־אֶחָ֣ד בָּ֔א מִדֶּ֖רֶךְ אֵל֥וֹן מְעוֹנְנִֽים׃
Translated: Gaal spoke up again, “Look, troops are coming down from Tabbur-erez, and another column is coming from the direction of Elon-meonenim.”
Transliteration: vayosef vod gaal ledaver vayomer hineh-am yvorediym meim tavur haarets verosh-echad va miderekhe elvon mevoneniym

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֵלָ֜יו זְבֻ֗ל אַיֵּ֨ה אֵפ֥וֹא פִ֙יךָ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תֹּאמַ֔ר מִ֥י אֲבִימֶ֖לֶךְ כִּ֣י נַעַבְדֶ֑נּוּ הֲלֹ֨א זֶ֤ה הָעָם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר מָאַ֣סְתָּה בּ֔וֹ צֵא־נָ֥א עַתָּ֖ה וְהִלָּ֥חֶם בּֽוֹ׃
Translated: “Well,” replied Zebul, “where is your boast, ‘Who is Abimelech that we should serve him’? Are these not the troops you sneered at? Now go out and fight with them!”
Transliteration: vayomer elayv zevul ayeh efvo fiykha asher tomar miy aviymelekhe khiy naavedenu halo zeh haam asher maasetah vvo tse-na atah vehilachem vvo

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֣צֵא גַ֔עַל לִפְנֵ֖י בַּעֲלֵ֣י שְׁכֶ֑ם וַיִּלָּ֖חֶם בַּאֲבִימֶֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: So Gaal went out at the head of the citizens of Shechem and gave battle to Abimelech.
Transliteration: vayetse gaal lifeney vaaley shekhem vayilachem vaaviymelekhe

Hebrew: וַיִּרְדְּפֵ֣הוּ אֲבִימֶ֔לֶךְ וַיָּ֖נׇס מִפָּנָ֑יו וַֽיִּפְּל֛וּ חֲלָלִ֥ים רַבִּ֖ים עַד־פֶּ֥תַח הַשָּֽׁעַר׃
Translated: But he had to flee before him, and Abimelech pursued him, and many fell slain, all the way to the entrance of the gate.
Transliteration: vayiredefehu aviymelekhe vayanׇs mifanayv vayifelu chalaliym raviym ad-fetach hashaar

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֥שֶׁב אֲבִימֶ֖לֶךְ בָּֽארוּמָ֑ה וַיְגָ֧רֶשׁ זְבֻ֛ל אֶת־גַּ֥עַל וְאֶת־אֶחָ֖יו מִשֶּׁ֥בֶת בִּשְׁכֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: Then Abimelech stayed in Arumah, while Zebul expelled Gaal and his companions and kept them out of Shechem.
Transliteration: vayeshev aviymelekhe varumah vayegaresh zevul et-gaal veet-echayv mishevet vishekhem {s}

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ מִֽמׇּחֳרָ֔ת וַיֵּצֵ֥א הָעָ֖ם הַשָּׂדֶ֑ה וַיַּגִּ֖דוּ לַאֲבִימֶֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: The next day, people went out into the fields, and this was reported to Abimelech.
Transliteration: vayehiy mimׇchorat vayetse haam hashadeh vayagidu laaviymelekhe

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֣ח אֶת־הָעָ֗ם וַיֶּֽחֱצֵם֙ לִשְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה רָאשִׁ֔ים וַיֶּאֱרֹ֖ב בַּשָּׂדֶ֑ה וַיַּ֗רְא וְהִנֵּ֤ה הָעָם֙ יֹצֵ֣א מִן־הָעִ֔יר וַיָּ֥קׇם עֲלֵיהֶ֖ם וַיַּכֵּֽם׃
Translated: So he took his troops, divided them into three columns, and lay in ambush in the fields; and when he saw the people coming out of the city, he pounced upon them and struck them down.
Transliteration: vayikach et-haam vayechetsem lisheloshah rashiym vayeerov vashadeh vayare vehineh haam yotse min-haiyr vayakׇm aleyhem vayakhem

Hebrew: וַאֲבִימֶ֗לֶךְ וְהָֽרָאשִׁים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עִמּ֔וֹ פָּשְׁט֕וּ וַיַּ֣עַמְד֔וּ פֶּ֖תַח שַׁ֣עַר הָעִ֑יר וּשְׁנֵ֣י הָרָאשִׁ֗ים פָּ֥שְׁט֛וּ עַֽל־כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר בַּשָּׂדֶ֖ה וַיַּכּֽוּם׃
Translated: While Abimelech and the column that followed him dashed ahead and took up a position at the entrance of the city gate, the other two columns rushed upon all that were in the open and struck them down.
Transliteration: vaaviymelekhe veharashiym asher imvo fashetu vayaamedu fetach shaar haiyr usheney harashiym fashetu al-khׇl-asher vashadeh vayakhum

Hebrew: וַאֲבִימֶ֜לֶךְ נִלְחָ֣ם בָּעִ֗יר כֹּ֚ל הַיּ֣וֹם הַה֔וּא וַיִּלְכֹּד֙ אֶת־הָעִ֔יר וְאֶת־הָעָ֥ם אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֖הּ הָרָ֑ג וַיִּתֹּץ֙ אֶת־הָעִ֔יר וַיִּזְרָעֶ֖הָ מֶֽלַח׃ {פ}
Translated: Abimelech fought against the city all that day. He captured the city and massacred the people in it; he razed the town and sowed it with salt.
Transliteration: vaaviymelekhe nilecham vaiyr khol hayyvom hahu vayilekhod et-haiyr veet-haam asher-vah harag vayitots et-haiyr vayizeraeha melach {f}

Hebrew: וַֽיִּשְׁמְע֔וּ כׇּֽל־בַּעֲלֵ֖י מִֽגְדַּל־שְׁכֶ֑ם וַיָּבֹ֣אוּ אֶל־צְרִ֔יחַ בֵּ֖ית אֵ֥ל בְּרִֽית׃
Translated: When all the citizens of the Tower of Shechem learned of this, they went into the tunnel of the temple of El-berith.
Transliteration: vayishemeu khׇl-vaaley migedal-shekhem vayavou el-tseriycha veyt el veriyt

Hebrew: וַיֻּגַּ֖ד לַאֲבִימֶ֑לֶךְ כִּ֣י הִֽתְקַבְּצ֔וּ כׇּֽל־בַּעֲלֵ֖י מִֽגְדַּל־שְׁכֶֽם׃
Translated: When Abimelech was informed that all the citizens of the Tower of Shechem had gathered [there],
Transliteration: vayugad laaviymelekhe khiy hitekavetsu khׇl-vaaley migedal-shekhem

Hebrew: וַיַּ֨עַל אֲבִימֶ֜לֶךְ הַר־צַלְמ֗וֹן הוּא֮ וְכׇל־הָעָ֣ם אֲשֶׁר־אִתּוֹ֒ וַיִּקַּח֩ אֲבִימֶ֨לֶךְ אֶת־הַקַּרְדֻּמּ֜וֹת בְּיָד֗וֹ וַיִּכְרֹת֙ שׂוֹכַ֣ת עֵצִ֔ים וַיִּ֨שָּׂאֶ֔הָ וַיָּ֖שֶׂם עַל־שִׁכְמ֑וֹ וַיֹּ֜אמֶר אֶל־הָעָ֣ם אֲשֶׁר־עִמּ֗וֹ מָ֤ה רְאִיתֶם֙ עָשִׂ֔יתִי מַהֲר֖וּ עֲשׂ֥וּ כָמֽוֹנִי׃
Translated: Abimelech and all the troops he had with him went up on Mount Zalmon. Taking an ax in his hand, Abimelech lopped off a tree limb and lifted it onto his shoulder. Then he said to the troops that accompanied him, “What you saw me do—quick, do the same!”
Transliteration: vayaal aviymelekhe har-tsalemvon hu vekhׇl-haam asher-itvo vayikach aviymelekhe et-hakaredumvot veyadvo vayikherot shvokhat etsiym vayishaeha vayashem al-shikhemvo vayomer el-haam asher-imvo mah reiytem ashiytiy maharu ashu khamvoniy

Hebrew: וַיִּכְרְת֨וּ גַם־כׇּל־הָעָ֜ם אִ֣ישׁ שׂוֹכֹ֗ה וַיֵּ֨לְכ֜וּ אַחֲרֵ֤י אֲבִימֶ֙לֶךְ֙ וַיָּשִׂ֣ימוּ עַֽל־הַצְּרִ֔יחַ וַיַּצִּ֧יתוּ עֲלֵיהֶ֛ם אֶֽת־הַצְּרִ֖יחַ בָּאֵ֑שׁ וַיָּמֻ֜תוּ גַּ֣ם כׇּל־אַנְשֵׁ֧י מִֽגְדַּל־שְׁכֶ֛ם כְּאֶ֖לֶף אִ֥ישׁ וְאִשָּֽׁה׃ {פ}
Translated: So each of the troops also lopped off a bough; then they marched behind Abimelech and laid them against the tunnel, and set fire to the tunnel over their heads. Thus all the people of the Tower of Shechem also perished, about a thousand men and women.
Transliteration: vayikheretu gam-khׇl-haam iysh shvokhoh vayelekhu acharey aviymelekhe vayashiymu al-hatseriycha vayatsiytu aleyhem et-hatseriycha vaesh vayamutu gam khׇl-aneshey migedal-shekhem kheelef iysh veishah {f}

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ אֲבִימֶ֖לֶךְ אֶל־תֵּבֵ֑ץ וַיִּ֥חַן בְּתֵבֵ֖ץ וַֽיִּלְכְּדָֽהּ׃
Translated: Abimelech proceeded to Thebez; he encamped at Thebez and occupied it.
Transliteration: vayelekhe aviymelekhe el-tevets vayichan vetevets vayilekhedah

Hebrew: וּמִגְדַּל־עֹז֮ הָיָ֣ה בְתוֹךְ־הָעִיר֒ וַיָּנֻ֨סוּ שָׁ֜מָּה כׇּל־הָאֲנָשִׁ֣ים וְהַנָּשִׁ֗ים וְכֹל֙ בַּעֲלֵ֣י הָעִ֔יר וַֽיִּסְגְּר֖וּ בַּעֲדָ֑ם וַֽיַּעֲל֖וּ עַל־גַּ֥ג הַמִּגְדָּֽל׃
Translated: Within the town was a fortified tower; and men and women took refuge there, including all the citizens of the town. They shut themselves in, and went up on the roof of the tower.
Transliteration: umigedal-oz hayah vetvokhe-haiyr vayanusu shamah khׇl-haanashiym vehanashiym vekhol vaaley haiyr vayisegeru vaadam vayaalu al-gag hamigedal

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֤א אֲבִימֶ֙לֶךְ֙ עַד־הַמִּגְדָּ֔ל וַיִּלָּ֖חֶם בּ֑וֹ וַיִּגַּ֛שׁ עַד־פֶּ֥תַח הַמִּגְדָּ֖ל לְשׇׂרְפ֥וֹ בָאֵֽשׁ׃
Translated: Abimelech pressed forward to the tower and attacked it. He approached the door of the tower to set it on fire.
Transliteration: vayavo aviymelekhe ad-hamigedal vayilachem vvo vayigash ad-fetach hamigedal leshׇrefvo vaesh

Hebrew: וַתַּשְׁלֵ֞ךְ אִשָּׁ֥ה אַחַ֛ת פֶּ֥לַח רֶ֖כֶב עַל־רֹ֣אשׁ אֲבִימֶ֑לֶךְ וַתָּ֖רִץ אֶת־גֻּלְגׇּלְתּֽוֹ׃
Translated: But a woman dropped an upper millstone on Abimelech’s head and cracked his skull.
Transliteration: vatashelekhe ishah achat felach rekhev al-rosh aviymelekhe vatarits et-gulegׇletvo

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֨א מְהֵרָ֜ה אֶל־הַנַּ֣עַר ׀ נֹשֵׂ֣א כֵלָ֗יו וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לוֹ֙ שְׁלֹ֤ף חַרְבְּךָ֙ וּמ֣וֹתְתֵ֔נִי פֶּן־יֹ֥אמְרוּ לִ֖י אִשָּׁ֣ה הֲרָגָ֑תְהוּ וַיִּדְקְרֵ֥הוּ נַעֲר֖וֹ וַיָּמֹֽת׃
Translated: He immediately cried out to his attendant, his arms-bearer, “Draw your dagger and finish me off, that they may not say of me, ‘A woman killed him!’” So his attendant stabbed him, and he died.
Transliteration: vayikera meherah el-hanaar noshe khelayv vayomer lvo shelof charevekha umvoteteniy fen-yomeru liy ishah haragatehu vayidekerehu naarvo vayamot

Hebrew: וַיִּרְא֥וּ אִֽישׁ־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל כִּ֣י מֵ֣ת אֲבִימֶ֑לֶךְ וַיֵּלְכ֖וּ אִ֥ישׁ לִמְקֹמֽוֹ׃
Translated: When those on Israel’s side saw that Abimelech was dead, everyone went home.
Transliteration: vayireu iysh-yisherael khiy met aviymelekhe vayelekhu iysh limekomvo

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣שֶׁב אֱלֹהִ֔ים אֵ֖ת רָעַ֣ת אֲבִימֶ֑לֶךְ אֲשֶׁ֤ר עָשָׂה֙ לְאָבִ֔יו לַהֲרֹ֖ג אֶת־שִׁבְעִ֥ים אֶחָֽיו׃
Translated: Thus God repaid Abimelech for the evil he had done to his father by slaying his seventy brothers;
Transliteration: vayashev Elohim et raat aviymelekhe asher ashah leaviyv laharog et-shiveiym echayv

Hebrew: וְאֵ֗ת כׇּל־רָעַת֙ אַנְשֵׁ֣י שְׁכֶ֔ם הֵשִׁ֥יב אֱלֹהִ֖ים בְּרֹאשָׁ֑ם וַתָּבֹ֣א אֲלֵיהֶ֔ם קִֽלְלַ֖ת יוֹתָ֥ם בֶּן־יְרֻבָּֽעַל׃ {פ}
Translated: and God likewise repaid the people of Shechem for all their wickedness. And so the curse of Jotham son of Jerubbaal was fulfilled upon them.
Transliteration: veet khׇl-raat aneshey shekhem heshiyv Elohim verosham vatavo aleyhem kilelat yvotam ven-yeruvaal {f}

Hebrew: וַיָּ֩קׇם֩ אַחֲרֵ֨י אֲבִימֶ֜לֶךְ לְהוֹשִׁ֣יעַ אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל תּוֹלָ֧ע בֶּן־פּוּאָ֛ה בֶּן־דּוֹד֖וֹ אִ֣ישׁ יִשָּׂשכָ֑ר וְהוּא־יֹשֵׁ֥ב בְּשָׁמִ֖יר בְּהַ֥ר אֶפְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: After Abimelech, Tola son of Puah son of Dodo, of Issachar, arose to deliver Israel. He lived at Shamir in the hill country of Ephraim.
Transliteration: vayakׇm acharey aviymelekhe lehvoshiya et-yisherael tvola ven-fuah ven-dvodvo iysh yishashkhar vehu-yoshev veshamiyr vehar eferayiim

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁפֹּט֙ אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל עֶשְׂרִ֥ים וְשָׁלֹ֖שׁ שָׁנָ֑ה וַיָּ֖מׇת וַיִּקָּבֵ֥ר בְּשָׁמִֽיר׃ {פ}
Translated: He led Israel for twenty-three years; then he died and was buried at Shamir.
Transliteration: vayishefot et-yisherael esheriym veshalosh shanah vayamׇt vayikaver veshamiyr {f}

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣קׇם אַחֲרָ֔יו יָאִ֖יר הַגִּלְעָדִ֑י וַיִּשְׁפֹּט֙ אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל עֶשְׂרִ֥ים וּשְׁתַּ֖יִם שָׁנָֽה׃
Translated: After him arose Jair the Gileadite, and he led Israel for twenty-two years.
Transliteration: vayakׇm acharayv yaiyr hagileadiy vayishefot et-yisherael esheriym ushetayiim shanah

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי־ל֞וֹ שְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים בָּנִ֗ים רֹֽכְבִים֙ עַל־שְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים עֲיָרִ֔ים וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֥ים עֲיָרִ֖ים לָהֶ֑ם לָהֶ֞ם יִקְרְא֣וּ ׀ חַוֺּ֣ת יָאִ֗יר עַ֚ד הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֖ר בְּאֶ֥רֶץ הַגִּלְעָֽד׃
Translated: (He had thirty sons, who rode on thirty burros and owned thirty boroughs in the region of Gilead; these are called Havvoth-jair to this day.)
Transliteration: vayehiy-lvo sheloshiym vaniym rokheviym al-sheloshiym ayariym usheloshiym ayariym lahem lahem yikereu chavot yaiyr ad hayyvom hazeh asher veerets hagilead

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣מׇת יָאִ֔יר וַיִּקָּבֵ֖ר בְּקָמֽוֹן׃ {פ}
Translated: Then Jair died and was buried at Kamon.
Transliteration: vayamׇt yaiyr vayikaver vekamvon {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּסִ֣יפוּ ׀ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל לַעֲשׂ֣וֹת הָרַע֮ בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָה֒ וַיַּעַבְד֣וּ אֶת־הַבְּעָלִ֣ים וְאֶת־הָעַשְׁתָּר֡וֹת וְאֶת־אֱלֹהֵ֣י אֲרָם֩ וְאֶת־אֱלֹהֵ֨י צִיד֜וֹן וְאֵ֣ת ׀ אֱלֹהֵ֣י מוֹאָ֗ב וְאֵת֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י בְנֵֽי־עַמּ֔וֹן וְאֵ֖ת אֱלֹהֵ֣י פְלִשְׁתִּ֑ים וַיַּעַזְב֥וּ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֖ה וְלֹ֥א עֲבָדֽוּהוּ׃
Translated: The Israelites again did what was offensive to G<small>OD</small>. They served the Baalim and the Ashtaroth, and the gods of Aram, the gods of Sidon, the gods of Moab, the gods of the Ammonites, and the gods of the Philistines; they forsook and did not serve G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vayosiyfu veney yisherael laashvot hara veeyney yehovah vayaavedu et-havealiym veet-haashetarvot veet-elohey aram veet-elohey tsiydvon veet elohey mvoav veet elohey veney-amvon veet elohey felishetiym vayaazevu et-yehovah velo avaduhu

Hebrew: וַיִּֽחַר־אַ֥ף יְהֹוָ֖ה בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַֽיִּמְכְּרֵם֙ בְּיַד־פְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים וּבְיַ֖ד בְּנֵ֥י עַמּֽוֹן׃
Translated: And G<small>OD</small>, incensed with Israel, surrendered them to the Philistines and to the Ammonites.
Transliteration: vayichar-af yehovah veyisherael vayimekherem veyad-felishetiym uveyad veney amvon

Hebrew: וַֽיִּרְעֲצ֤וּ וַיְרֹֽצְצוּ֙ אֶת־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל בַּשָּׁנָ֖ה הַהִ֑יא שְׁמֹנֶ֨ה עֶשְׂרֵ֜ה שָׁנָ֗ה אֶֽת־כׇּל־בְּנֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ אֲשֶׁר֙ בְּעֵ֣בֶר הַיַּרְדֵּ֔ן בְּאֶ֥רֶץ הָאֱמֹרִ֖י אֲשֶׁ֥ר בַּגִּלְעָֽד׃
Translated: That year they battered and shattered the Israelites—for eighteen years—all the Israelites beyond the Jordan, in [what had been] the land of the Amorites in Gilead.
Transliteration: vayireatsu vayerotsetsu et-veney yisherael vashanah hahiy shemoneh eshereh shanah et-khׇl-veney yisherael asher veever hayareden veerets haemoriy asher vagilead

Hebrew: וַיַּעַבְר֤וּ בְנֵֽי־עַמּוֹן֙ אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּ֔ן לְהִלָּחֵ֛ם גַּם־בִּיהוּדָ֥ה וּבְבִנְיָמִ֖ין וּבְבֵ֣ית אֶפְרָ֑יִם וַתֵּ֥צֶר לְיִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מְאֹֽד׃
Translated: The Ammonites also crossed the Jordan to make war on Judah, Benjamin, and the House of Ephraim. Israel was in great distress.
Transliteration: vayaaveru veney-amvon et-hayareden lehilachem gam-viyhudah uvevineyamiyn uveveyt eferayiim vatetser leyisherael meod

Hebrew: וַֽיִּזְעֲקוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֶל־יְהֹוָ֖ה לֵאמֹ֑ר חָטָ֣אנוּ לָ֔ךְ וְכִ֤י עָזַ֙בְנוּ֙ אֶת־אֱלֹהֵ֔ינוּ וַֽנַּעֲבֹ֖ד אֶת־הַבְּעָלִֽים׃ {פ}
Translated: Then the Israelites cried out to G<small>OD</small>, “We stand guilty before You, for we have forsaken our God and served the Baalim.”
Transliteration: vayizeaku veney yisherael el-yehovah lemor chatanu lakhe vekhiy azavenu et-eloheynu vanaavod et-havealiym {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל הֲלֹ֤א מִמִּצְרַ֙יִם֙ וּמִן־הָ֣אֱמֹרִ֔י וּמִן־בְּנֵ֥י עַמּ֖וֹן וּמִן־פְּלִשְׁתִּֽים׃
Translated: But G<small>OD</small> said to the Israelites, “[I have rescued you] from the Egyptians, from the Amorites, from the Ammonites, and from the Philistines.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-veney yisherael halo mimitserayiim umin-haemoriy umin-veney amvon umin-felishetiym

Hebrew: וְצִידוֹנִ֤ים וַֽעֲמָלֵק֙ וּמָע֔וֹן לָחֲצ֖וּ אֶתְכֶ֑ם וַתִּצְעֲק֣וּ אֵלַ֔י וָאוֹשִׁ֥יעָה אֶתְכֶ֖ם מִיָּדָֽם׃
Translated: The Sidonians, Amalek, and Maon also oppressed you; and when you cried out to Me, I saved you from them.
Transliteration: vetsiydvoniym vaamalek umavon lachatsu etekhem vatitseaku elay vavoshiyah etekhem miyadam

Hebrew: וְאַתֶּם֙ עֲזַבְתֶּ֣ם אוֹתִ֔י וַתַּעַבְד֖וּ אֱלֹהִ֣ים אֲחֵרִ֑ים לָכֵ֥ן לֹֽא־אוֹסִ֖יף לְהוֹשִׁ֥יעַ אֶתְכֶֽם׃
Translated: Yet you have forsaken Me and have served other gods. No, I will not deliver you again.
Transliteration: veatem azavetem votiy vataavedu Elohim acheriym lakhen lo-vosiyf lehvoshiya etekhem

Hebrew: לְכ֗וּ וְזַֽעֲקוּ֙ אֶל־הָ֣אֱלֹהִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר בְּחַרְתֶּ֖ם בָּ֑ם הֵ֛מָּה יוֹשִׁ֥יעוּ לָכֶ֖ם בְּעֵ֥ת צָרַתְכֶֽם׃
Translated: Go cry to the gods you have chosen; let them deliver you in your time of distress!”
Transliteration: lekhu vezaaku el-haElohimm asher vecharetem vam hemah yvoshiyu lakhem veet tsaratekhem

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֨וּ בְנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֤ל אֶל־יְהֹוָה֙ חָטָ֔אנוּ עֲשֵֽׂה־אַתָּ֣ה לָ֔נוּ כְּכׇל־הַטּ֖וֹב בְּעֵינֶ֑יךָ אַ֛ךְ הַצִּילֵ֥נוּ נָ֖א הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: But the Israelites implored G<small>OD</small>: “We stand guilty. Do to us as You see fit; only save us this day!”
Transliteration: vayomeru veney-yisherael el-yehovah chatanu asheh-atah lanu khekhׇl-hatvov veeyneykha akhe hatsiylenu na hayyvom hazeh

Hebrew: וַיָּסִ֜ירוּ אֶת־אֱלֹהֵ֤י הַנֵּכָר֙ מִקִּרְבָּ֔ם וַיַּעַבְד֖וּ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֑ה וַתִּקְצַ֥ר נַפְשׁ֖וֹ בַּעֲמַ֥ל יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: They removed the alien gods from among them and served G<small>OD</small>; and [God] could not bear the miseries of Israel.
Transliteration: vayasiyru et-elohey hanekhar mikirevam vayaavedu et-yehovah vatiketsar nafeshvo vaamal yisherael {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּצָּֽעֲקוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י עַמּ֔וֹן וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בַּגִּלְעָ֑ד וַיֵּאָֽסְפוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בַּמִּצְפָּֽה׃
Translated: The Ammonites mustered and they encamped in Gilead; and the Israelites massed and they encamped at Mizpah.
Transliteration: vayitsaaku veney amvon vayachanu vagilead vayeasefu veney yisherael vayachanu vamitsefah

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֨וּ הָעָ֜ם שָׂרֵ֤י גִלְעָד֙ אִ֣ישׁ אֶל־רֵעֵ֔הוּ מִ֣י הָאִ֔ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יָחֵ֔ל לְהִלָּחֵ֖ם בִּבְנֵ֣י עַמּ֑וֹן יִֽהְיֶ֣ה לְרֹ֔אשׁ לְכֹ֖ל יֹשְׁבֵ֥י גִלְעָֽד׃ {פ}
Translated: The troops—the officers of Gilead—said to one another, “Let whoever is the first to fight the Ammonites be chieftain over all the inhabitants of Gilead.”
Transliteration: vayomeru haam sharey gilead iysh el-reehu miy haiysh asher yachel lehilachem viveney amvon yiheyeh lerosh lekhol yoshevey gilead {f}

Hebrew: וְיִפְתָּ֣ח הַגִּלְעָדִ֗י הָיָה֙ גִּבּ֣וֹר חַ֔יִל וְה֖וּא בֶּן־אִשָּׁ֣ה זוֹנָ֑ה וַיּ֥וֹלֶד גִּלְעָ֖ד אֶת־יִפְתָּֽח׃
Translated: Jephthah the Gileadite was an able warrior, who was the son of a certain prostitute. Jephthah’s father was Gilead;
Transliteration: veyifetach hagileadiy hayah givvor chayiil vehu ven-ishah zvonah vayyvoled gilead et-yifetach

Hebrew: וַתֵּ֧לֶד אֵֽשֶׁת־גִּלְעָ֛ד ל֖וֹ בָּנִ֑ים וַיִּגְדְּל֨וּ בְֽנֵי־הָאִשָּׁ֜ה וַיְגָרְשׁ֣וּ אֶת־יִפְתָּ֗ח וַיֹּ֤אמְרוּ לוֹ֙ לֹא־תִנְחַ֣ל בְּבֵית־אָבִ֔ינוּ כִּ֛י בֶּן־אִשָּׁ֥ה אַחֶ֖רֶת אָֽתָּה׃
Translated: but Gilead also had sons by his wife, and when the wife’s sons grew up, they drove Jephthah out. They said to him, “You shall have no share in our father’s property, for you are the son of an outsider.”
Transliteration: vateled eshet-gilead lvo vaniym vayigedelu veney-haishah vayegareshu et-yifetach vayomeru lvo lo-tinechal veveyt-aviynu khiy ven-ishah acheret atah

Hebrew: וַיִּבְרַ֤ח יִפְתָּח֙ מִפְּנֵ֣י אֶחָ֔יו וַיֵּ֖שֶׁב בְּאֶ֣רֶץ ט֑וֹב וַיִּֽתְלַקְּט֤וּ אֶל־יִפְתָּח֙ אֲנָשִׁ֣ים רֵיקִ֔ים וַיֵּצְא֖וּ עִמּֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated: So Jephthah fled from his brothers and settled in the Tob country. Men of low character gathered about Jephthah and went out raiding with him.
Transliteration: vayiverach yifetach mifeney echayv vayeshev veerets tvov vayitelaketu el-yifetach anashiym reykiym vayetseu imvo {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֖י מִיָּמִ֑ים וַיִּלָּחֲמ֥וּ בְנֵֽי־עַמּ֖וֹן עִם־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Some time later, the Ammonites went to war against Israel.
Transliteration: vayehiy miyamiym vayilachamu veney-amvon im-yisherael

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֕י כַּאֲשֶׁר־נִלְחֲמ֥וּ בְנֵֽי־עַמּ֖וֹן עִם־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיֵּֽלְכוּ֙ זִקְנֵ֣י גִלְעָ֔ד לָקַ֥חַת אֶת־יִפְתָּ֖ח מֵאֶ֥רֶץ טֽוֹב׃
Translated: And when the Ammonites attacked Israel, the elders of Gilead went to bring Jephthah back from the Tob country.
Transliteration: vayehiy khaasher-nilechamu veney-amvon im-yisherael vayelekhu zikeney gilead lakachat et-yifetach meerets tvov

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ לְיִפְתָּ֔ח לְכָ֕ה וְהָיִ֥יתָה לָּ֖נוּ לְקָצִ֑ין וְנִֽלָּחֲמָ֖ה בִּבְנֵ֥י עַמּֽוֹן׃
Translated: They said to Jephthah, “Come be our chief, so that we can fight the Ammonites.”
Transliteration: vayomeru leyifetach lekhah vehayiytah lanu lekatsiyn venilachamah viveney amvon

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יִפְתָּח֙ לְזִקְנֵ֣י גִלְעָ֔ד הֲלֹ֤א אַתֶּם֙ שְׂנֵאתֶ֣ם אוֹתִ֔י וַתְּגָרְשׁ֖וּנִי מִבֵּ֣ית אָבִ֑י וּמַדּ֜וּעַ בָּאתֶ֤ם אֵלַי֙ עַ֔תָּה כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר צַ֥ר לָכֶֽם׃
Translated: Jephthah replied to the elders of Gilead, “You are the very people who rejected me and drove me out of my father’s house. How can you come to me now when you are in trouble?”
Transliteration: vayomer yifetach lezikeney gilead halo atem shenetem votiy vategareshuniy miveyt aviy umadua vatem elay atah khaasher tsar lakhem

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְרוּ֩ זִקְנֵ֨י גִלְעָ֜ד אֶל־יִפְתָּ֗ח לָכֵן֙ עַתָּה֙ שַׁ֣בְנוּ אֵלֶ֔יךָ וְהָלַכְתָּ֣ עִמָּ֔נוּ וְנִלְחַמְתָּ֖ בִּבְנֵ֣י עַמּ֑וֹן וְהָיִ֤יתָ לָּ֙נוּ֙ לְרֹ֔אשׁ לְכֹ֖ל יֹשְׁבֵ֥י גִלְעָֽד׃
Translated: The elders of Gilead said to Jephthah, “Honestly, we have now turned back to you. If you come with us and fight the Ammonites, you shall be our commander over all the inhabitants of Gilead.”
Transliteration: vayomeru zikeney gilead el-yifetach lakhen atah shavenu eleykha vehalakheta imanu venilechameta viveney amvon vehayiyta lanu lerosh lekhol yoshevey gilead

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יִפְתָּ֜ח אֶל־זִקְנֵ֣י גִלְעָ֗ד אִם־מְשִׁיבִ֨ים אַתֶּ֤ם אוֹתִי֙ לְהִלָּחֵם֙ בִּבְנֵ֣י עַמּ֔וֹן וְנָתַ֧ן יְהֹוָ֛ה אוֹתָ֖ם לְפָנָ֑י אָנֹכִ֕י אֶהְיֶ֥ה לָכֶ֖ם לְרֹֽאשׁ׃
Translated: Jephthah said to the elders of Gilead, “[Very well,] if you bring me back to fight the Ammonites and G<small>OD</small> delivers them to me, I am to be your commander.”
Transliteration: vayomer yifetach el-zikeney gilead im-meshiyviym atem votiy lehilachem viveney amvon venatan yehovah votam lefanay anokhiy eheyeh lakhem lerosh

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֥וּ זִקְנֵֽי־גִלְעָ֖ד אֶל־יִפְתָּ֑ח יְהֹוָ֗ה יִֽהְיֶ֤ה שֹׁמֵ֙עַ֙ בֵּינוֹתֵ֔ינוּ אִם־לֹ֥א כִדְבָרְךָ֖ כֵּ֥ן נַעֲשֶֽׂה׃
Translated: And the elders of Gilead answered Jephthah, “G<small>OD</small> shall be witness between us: we will do just as you have said.”
Transliteration: vayomeru zikeney-gilead el-yifetach yehovah yiheyeh shomea veynvoteynu im-lo khidevarekha khen naasheh

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֤לֶךְ יִפְתָּח֙ עִם־זִקְנֵ֣י גִלְעָ֔ד וַיָּשִׂ֨ימוּ הָעָ֥ם אוֹת֛וֹ עֲלֵיהֶ֖ם לְרֹ֣אשׁ וּלְקָצִ֑ין וַיְדַבֵּ֨ר יִפְתָּ֧ח אֶת־כׇּל־דְּבָרָ֛יו לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה בַּמִּצְפָּֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: Jephthah went with the elders of Gilead, and the people made him their commander and chief. And Jephthah repeated all these terms before G<small>OD</small> at Mizpah.
Transliteration: vayelekhe yifetach im-zikeney gilead vayashiymu haam votvo aleyhem lerosh ulekatsiyn vayedaver yifetach et-khׇl-devarayv lifeney yehovah vamitsefah {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֤ח יִפְתָּח֙ מַלְאָכִ֔ים אֶל־מֶ֥לֶךְ בְּנֵֽי־עַמּ֖וֹן לֵאמֹ֑ר מַה־לִּ֣י וָלָ֔ךְ כִּֽי־בָ֥אתָ אֵלַ֖י לְהִלָּחֵ֥ם בְּאַרְצִֽי׃
Translated: Jephthah then sent messengers to the king of the Ammonites, saying, “What have you against me that you have come to make war on my country?”
Transliteration: vayishelach yifetach maleakhiym el-melekhe veney-amvon lemor mah-liy valakhe khiy-vata elay lehilachem vearetsiy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֩אמֶר֩ מֶ֨לֶךְ בְּנֵֽי־עַמּ֜וֹן אֶל־מַלְאֲכֵ֣י יִפְתָּ֗ח כִּֽי־לָקַ֨ח יִשְׂרָאֵ֤ל אֶת־אַרְצִי֙ בַּעֲלוֹת֣וֹ מִמִּצְרַ֔יִם מֵאַרְנ֥וֹן וְעַד־הַיַּבֹּ֖ק וְעַד־הַיַּרְדֵּ֑ן וְעַתָּ֕ה הָשִׁ֥יבָה אֶתְהֶ֖ן בְּשָׁלֽוֹם׃
Translated: The king of the Ammonites replied to Jephthah’s messengers, “When Israel came from Egypt, they seized the land that is mine, from the Arnon to the Jabbok as far as the Jordan. Now, then, restore it peaceably.”
Transliteration: vayomer melekhe veney-amvon el-maleakhey yifetach khiy-lakach yisherael et-aretsiy vaalvotvo mimitserayiim mearenvon vead-hayavok vead-hayareden veatah hashiyvah etehen veshalvom

Hebrew: וַיּ֥וֹסֶף ע֖וֹד יִפְתָּ֑ח וַיִּשְׁלַח֙ מַלְאָכִ֔ים אֶל־מֶ֖לֶךְ בְּנֵ֥י עַמּֽוֹן׃
Translated: Jephthah again sent messengers to the king of the Ammonites.
Transliteration: vayyvosef vod yifetach vayishelach maleakhiym el-melekhe veney amvon

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ל֔וֹ כֹּ֖ה אָמַ֣ר יִפְתָּ֑ח לֹֽא־לָקַ֤ח יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ אֶת־אֶ֣רֶץ מוֹאָ֔ב וְאֶת־אֶ֖רֶץ בְּנֵ֥י עַמּֽוֹן׃
Translated: He said to him, “Thus said Jephthah: Israel did not seize the land of Moab or the land of the Ammonites.
Transliteration: vayomer lvo khoh amar yifetach lo-lakach yisherael et-erets mvoav veet-erets veney amvon

Hebrew: כִּ֖י בַּעֲלוֹתָ֣ם מִמִּצְרָ֑יִם וַיֵּ֨לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֤ל בַּמִּדְבָּר֙ עַד־יַם־ס֔וּף וַיָּבֹ֖א קָדֵֽשָׁה׃
Translated: When they left Egypt, Israel traveled through the wilderness to the Sea of Reeds and went on to Kadesh.
Transliteration: khiy vaalvotam mimitserayiim vayelekhe yisherael vamidevar ad-yam-suf vayavo kadeshah

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֣ח יִשְׂרָאֵ֣ל מַלְאָכִ֣ים <small>׀</small> אֶל־מֶ֩לֶךְ֩ אֱד֨וֹם <small>׀</small> לֵאמֹ֜ר אֶעְבְּרָה־נָּ֣א בְאַרְצֶ֗ךָ וְלֹ֤א שָׁמַע֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ אֱד֔וֹם וְגַ֨ם אֶל־מֶ֧לֶךְ מוֹאָ֛ב שָׁלַ֖ח וְלֹ֣א אָבָ֑ה וַיֵּ֥שֶׁב יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בְּקָדֵֽשׁ׃
Translated: Israel then sent messengers to the king of Edom, saying, ‘Allow us to cross your country.’ But the king of Edom would not consent. They also sent a mission to the king of Moab, and he refused. So Israel, after staying at Kadesh,
Transliteration: vayishelach yisherael maleakhiym <small></small> el-melekhe edvom <small></small> lemor eeverah-na vearetsekha velo shama melekhe edvom vegam el-melekhe mvoav shalach velo avah vayeshev yisherael vekadesh

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֣לֶךְ בַּמִּדְבָּ֗ר וַיָּ֜סׇב אֶת־אֶ֤רֶץ אֱדוֹם֙ וְאֶת־אֶ֣רֶץ מוֹאָ֔ב וַיָּבֹ֤א מִמִּזְרַח־שֶׁ֙מֶשׁ֙ לְאֶ֣רֶץ מוֹאָ֔ב וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּן בְּעֵ֣בֶר אַרְנ֑וֹן וְלֹֽא־בָ֙אוּ֙ בִּגְב֣וּל מוֹאָ֔ב כִּ֥י אַרְנ֖וֹן גְּב֥וּל מוֹאָֽב׃
Translated: traveled on through the wilderness, skirting the land of Edom and the land of Moab. They kept to the east of the land of Moab until they encamped on the other side of the Arnon; and, since Moab ends at the Arnon, they never entered Moabite territory.
Transliteration: vayelekhe vamidevar vayasׇv et-erets edvom veet-erets mvoav vayavo mimizerach-shemesh leerets mvoav vayachanun veever arenvon velo-vau vigevul mvoav khiy arenvon gevul mvoav

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֤ח יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ מַלְאָכִ֔ים אֶל־סִיח֥וֹן מֶלֶךְ־הָאֱמֹרִ֖י מֶ֣לֶךְ חֶשְׁבּ֑וֹן וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לוֹ֙ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל נַעְבְּרָה־נָּ֥א בְאַרְצְךָ֖ עַד־מְקוֹמִֽי׃
Translated: “Then Israel sent messengers to Sihon king of the Amorites, the king of Heshbon. Israel said to him, ‘Allow us to cross through your country to our homeland.’
Transliteration: vayishelach yisherael maleakhiym el-siychvon melekhe-haemoriy melekhe cheshevvon vayomer lvo yisherael naeverah-na vearetsekha ad-mekvomiy

Hebrew: וְלֹא־הֶאֱמִ֨ין סִיח֤וֹן אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ עֲבֹ֣ר בִּגְבֻל֔וֹ וַיֶּאֱסֹ֤ף סִיחוֹן֙ אֶת־כׇּל־עַמּ֔וֹ וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּיָ֑הְצָה וַיִּלָּ֖חֶם עִם־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: But Sihon would not trust Israel to pass through his territory. Sihon mustered all his troops, and they encamped at Jahaz; he engaged Israel in battle.
Transliteration: velo-heemiyn siychvon et-yisherael avor vigevulvo vayeesof siychvon et-khׇl-amvo vayachanu veyahetsah vayilachem im-yisherael

Hebrew: וַ֠יִּתֵּ֠ן יְהֹוָ֨ה אֱלֹהֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל אֶת־סִיח֧וֹן וְאֶת־כׇּל־עַמּ֛וֹ בְּיַ֥ד יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל וַיַּכּ֑וּם וַיִּירַשׁ֙ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֵ֚ת כׇּל־אֶ֣רֶץ הָאֱמֹרִ֔י יוֹשֵׁ֖ב הָאָ֥רֶץ הַהִֽיא׃
Translated: But the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Israel, delivered Sihon and all his troops into Israel’s hands, and they defeated them; and Israel took possession of all the land of the Amorites, the inhabitants of that land.
Transliteration: vayiten yehovah elohey-yisherael et-siychvon veet-khׇl-amvo veyad yisherael vayakhum vayiyrash yisherael et khׇl-erets haemoriy yvoshev haarets hahiy

Hebrew: וַיִּ֣ירְשׁ֔וּ אֵ֖ת כׇּל־גְּב֣וּל הָאֱמֹרִ֑י מֵֽאַרְנוֹן֙ וְעַד־הַיַּבֹּ֔ק וּמִן־הַמִּדְבָּ֖ר וְעַד־הַיַּרְדֵּֽן׃
Translated: Thus they possessed all the territory of the Amorites from the Arnon to the Jabbok and from the wilderness to the Jordan.
Transliteration: vayiyreshu et khׇl-gevul haemoriy mearenvon vead-hayavok umin-hamidevar vead-hayareden

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֞ה יְהֹוָ֣ה ׀ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל הוֹרִישׁ֙ אֶת־הָ֣אֱמֹרִ֔י מִפְּנֵ֖י עַמּ֣וֹ יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְאַתָּ֖ה תִּירָשֶֽׁנּוּ׃
Translated: “Now, then, the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Israel, dispossessed the Amorites before this covenanted people Israel; and should you possess their land?
Transliteration: veatah yehovah elohey yisherael hvoriysh et-haemoriy mifeney amvo yisherael veatah tiyrashenu

Hebrew: הֲלֹ֞א אֵ֣ת אֲשֶׁ֧ר יוֹרִֽישְׁךָ֛ כְּמ֥וֹשׁ אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ אוֹת֣וֹ תִירָ֑שׁ וְאֵת֩ כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֨ר הוֹרִ֜ישׁ יְהֹוָ֧ה אֱלֹהֵ֛ינוּ מִפָּנֵ֖ינוּ אוֹת֥וֹ נִירָֽשׁ׃
Translated: Do you not hold what Chemosh your god gives you to possess? So we will hold on to everything that the E<small>TERNAL</small> our God has given us to possess.
Transliteration: halo et asher yvoriyshekha khemvosh eloheykha votvo tiyrash veet khׇl-asher hvoriysh yehovah eloheynu mifaneynu votvo niyrash

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה הֲט֥וֹב טוֹב֙ אַתָּ֔ה מִבָּלָ֥ק בֶּן־צִפּ֖וֹר מֶ֣לֶךְ מוֹאָ֑ב הֲר֥וֹב רָב֙ עִם־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אִם־נִלְחֹ֥ם נִלְחַ֖ם בָּֽם׃
Translated: “Besides, are you any better than Balak son of Zippor, king of Moab? Did he start a quarrel with Israel or go to war with them?
Transliteration: veatah hatvov tvov atah mivalak ven-tsifvor melekhe mvoav harvov rav im-yisherael im-nilechom nilecham vam

Hebrew: בְּשֶׁ֣בֶת יִ֠שְׂרָאֵ֠ל בְּחֶשְׁבּ֨וֹן וּבִבְנוֹתֶ֜יהָ וּבְעַרְע֣וֹר וּבִבְנוֹתֶ֗יהָ וּבְכׇל־הֶֽעָרִים֙ אֲשֶׁר֙ עַל־יְדֵ֣י אַרְנ֔וֹן שְׁלֹ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וּמַדּ֥וּעַ לֹֽא־הִצַּלְתֶּ֖ם בָּעֵ֥ת הַהִֽיא׃
Translated: “While Israel has been inhabiting Heshbon and its dependencies, and Aroer and its dependencies, and all the towns along the Arnon for three hundred years, why have you not tried to recover them all this time?
Transliteration: veshevet yisherael vecheshevvon uvivenvoteyha uvearevor uvivenvoteyha uvekhׇl-heariym asher al-yedey arenvon shelosh mevot shanah umadua lo-hitsaletem vaet hahiy

Hebrew: וְאָֽנֹכִי֙ לֹא־חָטָ֣אתִי לָ֔ךְ וְאַתָּ֞ה עֹשֶׂ֥ה אִתִּ֛י רָעָ֖ה לְהִלָּ֣חֶם בִּ֑י יִשְׁפֹּ֨ט יְהֹוָ֤ה הַשֹּׁפֵט֙ הַיּ֔וֹם בֵּ֚ין בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וּבֵ֖ין בְּנֵ֥י עַמּֽוֹן׃
Translated: I have done you no wrong; yet you are doing me harm and making war on me. May G<small>OD</small>, who judges, decide today between the Israelites and the Ammonites!”
Transliteration: veanokhiy lo-chatatiy lakhe veatah osheh itiy raah lehilachem viy yishefot yehovah hashofet hayyvom veyn veney yisherael uveyn veney amvon

Hebrew: וְלֹ֣א שָׁמַ֔ע מֶ֖לֶךְ בְּנֵ֣י עַמּ֑וֹן אֶל־דִּבְרֵ֣י יִפְתָּ֔ח אֲשֶׁ֥ר שָׁלַ֖ח אֵלָֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated: But the king of the Ammonites paid no heed to the message that Jephthah sent him.
Transliteration: velo shama melekhe veney amvon el-diverey yifetach asher shalach elayv {f}

Hebrew: וַתְּהִ֤י עַל־יִפְתָּח֙ ר֣וּחַ יְהֹוָ֔ה וַיַּעֲבֹ֥ר אֶת־הַגִּלְעָ֖ד וְאֶת־מְנַשֶּׁ֑ה וַֽיַּעֲבֹר֙ אֶת־מִצְפֵּ֣ה גִלְעָ֔ד וּמִמִּצְפֵּ֣ה גִלְעָ֔ד עָבַ֖ר בְּנֵ֥י עַמּֽוֹן׃
Translated: Then the spirit of G<small>OD</small> came upon Jephthah. He marched through Gilead and Manasseh, passing Mizpeh of Gilead; and from Mizpeh of Gilead he crossed over [to] the Ammonites.
Transliteration: vatehiy al-yifetach rucha yehovah vayaavor et-hagilead veet-menasheh vayaavor et-mitsefeh gilead umimitsefeh gilead avar veney amvon

Hebrew: וַיִּדַּ֨ר יִפְתָּ֥ח נֶ֛דֶר לַיהֹוָ֖ה וַיֹּאמַ֑ר אִם־נָת֥וֹן תִּתֵּ֛ן אֶת־בְּנֵ֥י עַמּ֖וֹן בְּיָדִֽי׃
Translated: And Jephthah made the following vow to G<small>OD</small>: “If You deliver the Ammonites into my hands,
Transliteration: vayidar yifetach neder layhovah vayomar im-natvon titen et-veney amvon veyadiy

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֣ה הַיּוֹצֵ֗א אֲשֶׁ֨ר יֵצֵ֜א מִדַּלְתֵ֤י בֵיתִי֙ לִקְרָאתִ֔י בְּשׁוּבִ֥י בְשָׁל֖וֹם מִבְּנֵ֣י עַמּ֑וֹן וְהָיָה֙ לַיהֹוָ֔ה וְהַעֲלִיתִ֖יהוּ עֹלָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: then whatever comes out of the door of my house to meet me on my safe return from the Ammonites shall be G<small>OD</small>’s and shall be offered by me as a burnt offering.”
Transliteration: vehayah hayyvotse asher eitse midaletey veytiy likeratiy veshuviy veshalvom miveney amvon vehayah layhovah vehaaliytiyhu olah {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲבֹ֥ר יִפְתָּ֛ח אֶל־בְּנֵ֥י עַמּ֖וֹן לְהִלָּ֣חֶם בָּ֑ם וַיִּתְּנֵ֥ם יְהֹוָ֖ה בְּיָדֽוֹ׃
Translated: Jephthah crossed over to the Ammonites and attacked them, and G<small>OD</small> delivered them into his hands.
Transliteration: vayaavor yifetach el-veney amvon lehilachem vam vayitenem yehovah veyadvo

Hebrew: וַיַּכֵּ֡ם מֵעֲרוֹעֵר֩ וְעַד־בֹּאֲךָ֨ מִנִּ֜ית עֶשְׂרִ֣ים עִ֗יר וְעַד֙ אָבֵ֣ל כְּרָמִ֔ים מַכָּ֖ה גְּדוֹלָ֣ה מְאֹ֑ד וַיִּכָּֽנְעוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י עַמּ֔וֹן מִפְּנֵ֖י בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: He utterly routed them—from Aroer as far as Minnith, twenty towns—all the way to Abel-cheramim. So the Ammonites submitted to the Israelites.
Transliteration: vayakhem mearvoer vead-voakha miniyt esheriym iyr vead avel kheramiym makhah gedvolah meod vayikhaneu veney amvon mifeney veney yisherael {f}

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֨א יִפְתָּ֣ח הַמִּצְפָּה֮ אֶל־בֵּיתוֹ֒ וְהִנֵּ֤ה בִתּוֹ֙ יֹצֵ֣את לִקְרָאת֔וֹ בְּתֻפִּ֖ים וּבִמְחֹל֑וֹת וְרַק֙ הִ֣יא יְחִידָ֔ה אֵֽין־ל֥וֹ מִמֶּ֛נּוּ בֵּ֖ן אוֹ־בַֽת׃
Translated: When Jephthah arrived at his home in Mizpah, there was his daughter coming out to meet him, with hand-drum and dance! She was an only child; he had no other son or daughter.
Transliteration: vayavo yifetach hamitsefah el-veytvo vehineh vitvo yotset likeratvo vetufiym uvimecholvot verak hiy yechiydah eyn-lvo mimenu ven vo-vat

Hebrew: וַיְהִי֩ כִרְאוֹת֨וֹ אוֹתָ֜הּ וַיִּקְרַ֣ע אֶת־בְּגָדָ֗יו וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֲהָ֤הּ בִּתִּי֙ הַכְרֵ֣עַ הִכְרַעְתִּ֔נִי וְאַ֖תְּ הָיִ֣ית בְּעֹֽכְרָ֑י וְאָנֹכִ֗י פָּצִ֤יתִי פִי֙ אֶל־יְהֹוָ֔ה וְלֹ֥א אוּכַ֖ל לָשֽׁוּב׃
Translated: On seeing her, he rent his clothes and said, “Alas, daughter! You have brought me low; you have become my troubler! For I have uttered a vow to G<small>OD</small> and I cannot retract.”
Transliteration: vayehiy khirevotvo votah vayikera et-vegadayv vayomer ahah vitiy hakherea hikheraetiniy veate hayiyt veokheray veanokhiy fatsiytiy fiy el-yehovah velo ukhal lashuv

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלָ֗יו אָבִי֙ פָּצִ֤יתָה אֶת־פִּ֙יךָ֙ אֶל־יְהֹוָ֔ה עֲשֵׂ֣ה לִ֔י כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר יָצָ֣א מִפִּ֑יךָ אַחֲרֵ֡י אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂה֩ לְךָ֨ יְהֹוָ֧ה נְקָמ֛וֹת מֵאֹיְבֶ֖יךָ מִבְּנֵ֥י עַמּֽוֹן׃
Translated: “Father,” she said, “you have uttered a vow to G<small>OD</small>; do to me as you have vowed, seeing that G<small>OD</small> has vindicated you against your enemies, the Ammonites.”
Transliteration: vatomer elayv aviy fatsiytah et-fiykha el-yehovah asheh liy khaasher yatsa mifiykha acharey asher ashah lekha yehovah nekamvot meoyeveykha miveney amvon

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־אָבִ֔יהָ יֵעָ֥שֶׂה לִּ֖י הַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֑ה הַרְפֵּ֨ה מִמֶּ֜נִּי שְׁנַ֣יִם חֳדָשִׁ֗ים וְאֵֽלְכָה֙ וְיָרַדְתִּ֣י עַל־הֶהָרִ֔ים וְאֶבְכֶּה֙ עַל־בְּתוּלַ֔י אָנֹכִ֖י (ורעיתי) [וְרֵֽעוֹתָֽי]׃
Translated: She further said to her father, “Let this be done for me: let me be for two months, and I will go with my companions and lament upon the hills and there bewail my maidenhood.”
Transliteration: vatomer el-aviyha eiasheh liy hadavar hazeh harefeh mimeniy shenayiim chodashiym veelekhah veyaradetiy al-hehariym veevekheh al-vetulay anokhiy (vryty) [verevotay]

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לֵ֔כִי וַיִּשְׁלַ֥ח אוֹתָ֖הּ שְׁנֵ֣י חֳדָשִׁ֑ים וַתֵּ֤לֶךְ הִיא֙ וְרֵ֣עוֹתֶ֔יהָ וַתֵּ֥בְךְּ עַל־בְּתוּלֶ֖יהָ עַל־הֶהָרִֽים׃
Translated: “Go,” he replied. He let her go for two months, and she and her companions went and bewailed her maidenhood upon the hills.
