Transliteration: vayomer lekhiy vayishelach votah sheney chodashiym vatelekhe hiy verevoteyha vatevekhe al-vetuleyha al-hehariym

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֞י מִקֵּ֣ץ ׀ שְׁנַ֣יִם חֳדָשִׁ֗ים וַתָּ֙שׇׁב֙ אֶל־אָבִ֔יהָ וַיַּ֣עַשׂ לָ֔הּ אֶת־נִדְר֖וֹ אֲשֶׁ֣ר נָדָ֑ר וְהִיא֙ לֹא־יָדְעָ֣ה אִ֔ישׁ וַתְּהִי־חֹ֖ק בְּיִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: After two months’ time, she returned to her father, and he did to her as he had vowed. She had never known a man. So it became a custom in Israel
Transliteration: vayehiy mikets shenayiim chodashiym vatashׇv el-aviyha vayaash lah et-nidervo asher nadar vehiy lo-yadeah iysh vatehiy-chok veyisherael

Hebrew: מִיָּמִ֣ים ׀ יָמִ֗ימָה תֵּלַ֙כְנָה֙ בְּנ֣וֹת יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לְתַנּ֕וֹת לְבַת־יִפְתָּ֖ח הַגִּלְעָדִ֑י אַרְבַּ֥עַת יָמִ֖ים בַּשָּׁנָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: for the maidens of Israel to go every year, for four days in the year, and chant dirges for the daughter of Jephthah the Gileadite.
Transliteration: miyamiym yamiymah telakhenah venvot yisherael letanvot levat-yifetach hagileadiy arevaat yamiym vashanah {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּצָּעֵק֙ אִ֣ישׁ אֶפְרַ֔יִם וַֽיַּעֲבֹ֖ר צָפ֑וֹנָה וַיֹּאמְר֨וּ לְיִפְתָּ֜ח מַדּ֣וּעַ ׀ עָבַ֣רְתָּ ׀ לְהִלָּחֵ֣ם בִּבְנֵי־עַמּ֗וֹן וְלָ֙נוּ֙ לֹ֤א קָרָ֙אתָ֙ לָלֶ֣כֶת עִמָּ֔ךְ בֵּיתְךָ֕ נִשְׂרֹ֥ף עָלֶ֖יךָ בָּאֵֽשׁ׃
Translated: Ephraim’s contingent mustered and crossed [the Jordan] to Zaphon. They said to Jephthah, “Why did you march to fight the Ammonites without calling us to go with you? We’ll burn your house down over you!”
Transliteration: vayitsaek iysh eferayiim vayaavor tsafvonah vayomeru leyifetach madua avareta lehilachem viveney-amvon velanu lo karata lalekhet imakhe veytekha nisherof aleykha vaesh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יִפְתָּח֙ אֲלֵיהֶ֔ם אִ֣ישׁ רִ֗יב הָיִ֛יתִי אֲנִ֛י וְעַמִּ֥י וּבְנֵֽי־עַמּ֖וֹן מְאֹ֑ד וָאֶזְעַ֣ק אֶתְכֶ֔ם וְלֹא־הוֹשַׁעְתֶּ֥ם אוֹתִ֖י מִיָּדָֽם׃
Translated: Jephthah answered them, “I and my people were involved in a bitter conflict with the Ammonites; and I summoned you, but you did not save me from them.
Transliteration: vayomer yifetach aleyhem iysh riyv hayiytiy aniy veamiy uveney-amvon meod vaezeak etekhem velo-hvoshaetem votiy miyadam

Hebrew: וָאֶרְאֶ֞ה כִּֽי־אֵינְךָ֣ מוֹשִׁ֗יעַ וָאָשִׂ֨ימָה נַפְשִׁ֤י בְכַפִּי֙ וָֽאֶעְבְּרָה֙ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י עַמּ֔וֹן וַיִּתְּנֵ֥ם יְהֹוָ֖ה בְּיָדִ֑י וְלָמָ֞ה עֲלִיתֶ֥ם אֵלַ֛י הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּ֖ה לְהִלָּ֥חֶם בִּֽי׃
Translated: When I saw that you were no saviors, I risked my life and advanced against the Ammonites; and G<small>OD</small> delivered them into my hands. Why have you come here now to fight against me?”
Transliteration: vaereeh khiy-eynekha mvoshiya vaashiymah nafeshiy vekhafiy vaeeverah el-veney amvon vayitenem yehovah veyadiy velamah aliytem elay hayyvom hazeh lehilachem viy

Hebrew: וַיִּקְבֹּ֤ץ יִפְתָּח֙ אֶת־כׇּל־אַנְשֵׁ֣י גִלְעָ֔ד וַיִּלָּ֖חֶם אֶת־אֶפְרָ֑יִם וַיַּכּוּ֩ אַנְשֵׁ֨י גִלְעָ֜ד אֶת־אֶפְרַ֗יִם כִּ֤י אָֽמְרוּ֙ פְּלִיטֵ֤י אֶפְרַ֙יִם֙ אַתֶּ֔ם גִּלְעָ֕ד בְּת֥וֹךְ אֶפְרַ֖יִם בְּת֥וֹךְ מְנַשֶּֽׁה׃
Translated: And Jephthah gathered all the Gileadites and fought Ephraim. The Gileadites defeated Ephraim; for they had said, “You, Gilead, are nothing but fugitives from Ephraim—being in Manasseh is like being in Ephraim.”
Transliteration: vayikevots yifetach et-khׇl-aneshey gilead vayilachem et-eferayiim vayakhu aneshey gilead et-eferayiim khiy ameru feliytey eferayiim atem gilead vetvokhe eferayiim vetvokhe menasheh

Hebrew: וַיִּלְכֹּ֥ד גִּלְעָ֛ד אֶֽת־מַעְבְּר֥וֹת הַיַּרְדֵּ֖ן לְאֶפְרָ֑יִם וְֽ֠הָיָ֠ה כִּ֣י יֹאמְר֞וּ פְּלִיטֵ֤י אֶפְרַ֙יִם֙ אֶֽעֱבֹ֔רָה וַיֹּ֨אמְרוּ ל֧וֹ אַנְשֵֽׁי־גִלְעָ֛ד הַאֶפְרָתִ֥י אַ֖תָּה וַיֹּ֥אמֶֽר <small>׀</small> לֹֽא׃
Translated: Gilead held the fords of the Jordan against Ephraim. And when any fugitive from Ephraim said, “Let me cross,” the Gileadites would ask him, “Are you an Ephraimite?”; if he said “No,”
Transliteration: vayilekhod gilead et-maevervot hayareden leeferayiim vehayah khiy yomeru feliytey eferayiim eevorah vayomeru lvo aneshey-gilead haeferatiy atah vayomer <small></small> lo

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמְרוּ לוֹ֩ אֱמׇר־נָ֨א שִׁבֹּ֜לֶת וַיֹּ֣אמֶר סִבֹּ֗לֶת וְלֹ֤א יָכִין֙ לְדַבֵּ֣ר כֵּ֔ן וַיֹּאחֲז֣וּ אוֹת֔וֹ וַיִּשְׁחָט֖וּהוּ אֶל־מַעְבְּר֣וֹת הַיַּרְדֵּ֑ן וַיִּפֹּ֞ל בָּעֵ֤ת הַהִיא֙ מֵֽאֶפְרַ֔יִם אַרְבָּעִ֥ים וּשְׁנַ֖יִם אָֽלֶף׃
Translated: they would say to him, “Then say shibboleth”; but he would say “sibboleth,” not being able to pronounce it correctly. Thereupon they would seize him and slay him by the fords of the Jordan. Forty-two thousand from Ephraim fell at that time.
Transliteration: vayomeru lvo emׇr-na shivolet vayomer sivolet velo yakhiyn ledaver khen vayochazu votvo vayishechatuhu el-maevervot hayareden vayifol vaet hahiy meeferayiim arevaiym ushenayiim alef

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁפֹּ֥ט יִפְתָּ֛ח אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל שֵׁ֣שׁ שָׁנִ֑ים וַיָּ֗מׇת יִפְתָּח֙ הַגִּלְעָדִ֔י וַיִּקָּבֵ֖ר בְּעָרֵ֥י גִלְעָֽד׃ {פ}
Translated: Jephthah led Israel six years. Then Jephthah the Gileadite died and he was buried in one of the towns of Gilead.
Transliteration: vayishefot yifetach et-yisherael shesh shaniym vayamׇt yifetach hagileadiy vayikaver vearey gilead {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁפֹּ֤ט אַֽחֲרָיו֙ אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אִבְצָ֖ן מִבֵּ֥ית לָֽחֶם׃
Translated: After him, Ibzan of Bethlehem led Israel.
Transliteration: vayishefot acharayv et-yisherael ivetsan miveyt lachem

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי־ל֞וֹ שְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים בָּנִ֗ים וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֤ים בָּנוֹת֙ שִׁלַּ֣ח הַח֔וּצָה וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים בָּנ֔וֹת הֵבִ֥יא לְבָנָ֖יו מִן־הַח֑וּץ וַיִּשְׁפֹּ֥ט אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל שֶׁ֥בַע שָׁנִֽים׃
Translated: He had thirty sons, and he married off thirty daughters outside the clan and likewise brought in thirty from outside the clan for his sons. He led Israel seven years.
Transliteration: vayehiy-lvo sheloshiym vaniym usheloshiym vanvot shilach hachutsah usheloshiym vanvot heviy levanayv min-hachuts vayishefot et-yisherael sheva shaniym

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣מׇת אִבְצָ֔ן וַיִּקָּבֵ֖ר בְּבֵ֥ית לָֽחֶם׃ {פ}
Translated: Then Ibzan died and was buried in Bethlehem.
Transliteration: vayamׇt ivetsan vayikaver veveyt lachem {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁפֹּ֤ט אַֽחֲרָיו֙ אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֵיל֖וֹן הַזְּבוּלֹנִ֑י וַיִּשְׁפֹּ֥ט אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל עֶ֥שֶׂר שָׁנִֽים׃
Translated: After him, Elon the Zebulunite led Israel; he led Israel for ten years.
Transliteration: vayishefot acharayv et-yisherael eylvon hazevuloniy vayishefot et-yisherael esher shaniym

Hebrew: וַיָּ֖מׇת אֵיל֣וֹן הַזְּבוּלֹנִ֑י וַיִּקָּבֵ֥ר בְּאַיָּל֖וֹן בְּאֶ֥רֶץ זְבוּלֻֽן׃ {פ}
Translated: Then Elon the Zebulunite died and was buried in Aijalon, in the territory of Zebulun.
Transliteration: vayamׇt eylvon hazevuloniy vayikaver veayalvon veerets zevulun {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁפֹּ֥ט אַחֲרָ֖יו אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל עַבְדּ֥וֹן בֶּן־הִלֵּ֖ל הַפִּרְעָתוֹנִֽי׃
Translated: After him, Abdon son of Hillel the Pirathonite led Israel.
Transliteration: vayishefot acharayv et-yisherael avedvon ven-hilel hafireatvoniy

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי־ל֞וֹ אַרְבָּעִ֣ים בָּנִ֗ים וּשְׁלֹשִׁים֙ בְּנֵ֣י בָנִ֔ים רֹכְבִ֖ים עַל־שִׁבְעִ֣ים עֲיָרִ֑ם וַיִּשְׁפֹּ֥ט אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל שְׁמֹנֶ֥ה שָׁנִֽים׃
Translated: He had forty sons and thirty grandsons, who rode on seventy jackasses. He led Israel for eight years.
Transliteration: vayehiy-lvo arevaiym vaniym usheloshiym veney vaniym rokheviym al-shiveiym ayarim vayishefot et-yisherael shemoneh shaniym

Hebrew: וַיָּ֛מׇת עַבְדּ֥וֹן בֶּן־הִלֵּ֖ל הַפִּרְעָתוֹנִ֑י וַיִּקָּבֵ֤ר בְּפִרְעָתוֹן֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ אֶפְרַ֔יִם בְּהַ֖ר הָעֲמָלֵקִֽי׃ {פ}
Translated: Then Abdon son of Hillel the Pirathonite died. He was buried in Pirathon, in the territory of Ephraim, on the hill of the Amalekites.
Transliteration: vayamׇt avedvon ven-hilel hafireatvoniy vayikaver vefireatvon veerets eferayiim vehar haamalekiy {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּסִ֙יפוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת הָרַ֖ע בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיִּתְּנֵ֧ם יְהֹוָ֛ה בְּיַד־פְּלִשְׁתִּ֖ים אַרְבָּעִ֥ים שָׁנָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: The Israelites again did what was offensive to G<small>OD</small>, and G<small>OD</small> delivered them into the hands of the Philistines for forty years.
Transliteration: vayosiyfu veney yisherael laashvot hara veeyney yehovah vayitenem yehovah veyad-felishetiym arevaiym shanah {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִי֩ אִ֨ישׁ אֶחָ֧ד מִצׇּרְעָ֛ה מִמִּשְׁפַּ֥חַת הַדָּנִ֖י וּשְׁמ֣וֹ מָנ֑וֹחַ וְאִשְׁתּ֥וֹ עֲקָרָ֖ה וְלֹ֥א יָלָֽדָה׃
Translated: There was a certain man from Zorah, of the stock of Dan, whose name was Manoah. His wife was infertile and had borne no children.
Transliteration: vayehiy iysh echad mitsׇreah mimishefachat hadaniy ushemvo manvocha veishetvo akarah velo yaladah

Hebrew: וַיֵּרָ֥א מַלְאַךְ־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־הָאִשָּׁ֑ה וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלֶ֗יהָ הִנֵּה־נָ֤א אַתְּ־עֲקָרָה֙ וְלֹ֣א יָלַ֔דְתְּ וְהָרִ֖ית וְיָלַ֥דְתְּ בֵּֽן׃
Translated: An angel of G<small>OD</small> appeared to the woman and said to her, “You are infertile and have borne no children; but you shall conceive and bear a son.
Transliteration: vayera maleakhe-yehovah el-haishah vayomer eleyha hineh-na ate-akarah velo yaladete vehariyt veyaladete ven

Hebrew: וְעַתָּה֙ הִשָּׁ֣מְרִי נָ֔א וְאַל־תִּשְׁתִּ֖י יַ֣יִן וְשֵׁכָ֑ר וְאַל־תֹּאכְלִ֖י כׇּל־טָמֵֽא׃
Translated: Now be careful not to drink wine or other intoxicant, or to eat anything impure.
Transliteration: veatah hishameriy na veal-tishetiy yayiin veshekhar veal-tokheliy khׇl-tame

Hebrew: כִּי֩ הִנָּ֨ךְ הָרָ֜ה וְיֹלַ֣דְתְּ בֵּ֗ן וּמוֹרָה֙ לֹא־יַעֲלֶ֣ה עַל־רֹאשׁ֔וֹ כִּֽי־נְזִ֧יר אֱלֹהִ֛ים יִֽהְיֶ֥ה הַנַּ֖עַר מִן־הַבָּ֑טֶן וְה֗וּא יָחֵ֛ל לְהוֹשִׁ֥יעַ אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מִיַּ֥ד פְּלִשְׁתִּֽים׃
Translated: For you are going to conceive and bear a son; let no razor touch his head, for the boy is to be a nazirite to God from the womb on. He shall be the first to deliver Israel from the Philistines.”
Transliteration: khiy hinakhe harah veyoladete ven umvorah lo-yaaleh al-roshvo khiy-neziyr Elohim yiheyeh hanaar min-havaten vehu yachel lehvoshiya et-yisherael miyad felishetiym

Hebrew: וַתָּבֹ֣א הָאִשָּׁ֗ה וַתֹּ֣אמֶר לְאִישָׁהּ֮ לֵאמֹר֒ אִ֤ישׁ הָֽאֱלֹהִים֙ בָּ֣א אֵלַ֔י וּמַרְאֵ֕הוּ כְּמַרְאֵ֛ה מַלְאַ֥ךְ הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים נוֹרָ֣א מְאֹ֑ד וְלֹ֤א שְׁאִלְתִּ֙יהוּ֙ אֵֽי־מִזֶּ֣ה ה֔וּא וְאֶת־שְׁמ֖וֹ לֹא־הִגִּ֥יד לִֽי׃
Translated: The woman went and told her husband, “An agent of God came to me; he looked like an angel of God, very frightening. I did not ask him where he was from, nor did he tell me his name.
Transliteration: vatavo haishah vatomer leiyshah lemor iysh haElohim va elay umareehu khemareeh maleakhe haElohim nvora meod velo sheiletiyhu ey-mizeh hu veet-shemvo lo-higiyd liy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לִ֔י הִנָּ֥ךְ הָרָ֖ה וְיֹלַ֣דְתְּ בֵּ֑ן וְעַתָּ֞ה אַל־תִּשְׁתִּ֣י ׀ יַ֣יִן וְשֵׁכָ֗ר וְאַל־תֹּֽאכְלִי֙ כׇּל־טֻמְאָ֔ה כִּֽי־נְזִ֤יר אֱלֹהִים֙ יִֽהְיֶ֣ה הַנַּ֔עַר מִן־הַבֶּ֖טֶן עַד־י֥וֹם מוֹתֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated: He said to me, ‘You are going to conceive and bear a son. Drink no wine or other intoxicant, and eat nothing impure, for the boy is to be a nazirite to God from the womb to the day of his death!’”
Transliteration: vayomer liy hinakhe harah veyoladete ven veatah al-tishetiy yayiin veshekhar veal-tokheliy khׇl-tumeah khiy-neziyr Elohim yiheyeh hanaar min-haveten ad-yvom mvotvo {f}

Hebrew: וַיֶּעְתַּ֥ר מָנ֛וֹחַ אֶל־יְהֹוָ֖ה וַיֹּאמַ֑ר בִּ֣י אֲדוֹנָ֔י אִ֣ישׁ הָאֱלֹהִ֞ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר שָׁלַ֗חְתָּ יָבוֹא־נָ֥א עוֹד֙ אֵלֵ֔ינוּ וְיוֹרֵ֕נוּ מַֽה־נַּעֲשֶׂ֖ה לַנַּ֥עַר הַיּוּלָּֽד׃
Translated: Manoah pleaded with G<small>OD</small>. “Oh, my Sovereign!” he said, “please let the agent of God that You sent come to us again, and let him instruct us how to act with the child that is to be born.”
Transliteration: vayeetar manvocha el-yehovah vayomar viy advonay iysh haElohim asher shalacheta yavvo-na vod eleynu veyvorenu mah-naasheh lanaar hayyulad

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֥ע הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים בְּק֣וֹל מָנ֑וֹחַ וַיָּבֹ֣א מַלְאַךְ֩ הָאֱלֹהִ֨ים ע֜וֹד אֶל־הָאִשָּׁ֗ה וְהִיא֙ יוֹשֶׁ֣בֶת בַּשָּׂדֶ֔ה וּמָנ֥וֹחַ אִישָׁ֖הּ אֵ֥ין עִמָּֽהּ׃
Translated: God heeded Manoah’s plea, and the angel of God came to the woman again. She was sitting in the field and her husband Manoah was not with her.
Transliteration: vayishema haElohim vekvol manvocha vayavo maleakhe haElohim vod el-haishah vehiy yvoshevet vashadeh umanvocha iyshah eyn imah

Hebrew: וַתְּמַהֵר֙ הָֽאִשָּׁ֔ה וַתָּ֖רׇץ וַתַּגֵּ֣ד לְאִישָׁ֑הּ וַתֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלָ֔יו הִנֵּ֨ה נִרְאָ֤ה אֵלַי֙ הָאִ֔ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֥א בַיּ֖וֹם אֵלָֽי׃
Translated: The woman ran in haste to tell her husband. She said to him, “The man who came to me before has just appeared to me.”
Transliteration: vatemaher haishah vatarׇts vataged leiyshah vatomer elayv hineh nireah elay haiysh asher-va vayyvom elay

Hebrew: וַיָּ֛קׇם וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ מָנ֖וֹחַ אַחֲרֵ֣י אִשְׁתּ֑וֹ וַיָּבֹא֙ אֶל־הָאִ֔ישׁ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ל֗וֹ הַאַתָּ֥ה הָאִ֛ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־דִּבַּ֥רְתָּ אֶל־הָאִשָּׁ֖ה וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אָֽנִי׃
Translated: Manoah promptly followed his wife. He came to that figure and asked him: “Are you the one who spoke to my wife?” “Yes,” he answered.
Transliteration: vayakׇm vayelekhe manvocha acharey ishetvo vayavo el-haiysh vayomer lvo haatah haiysh asher-divareta el-haishah vayomer aniy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר מָנ֔וֹחַ עַתָּ֖ה יָבֹ֣א דְבָרֶ֑יךָ מַה־יִּהְיֶ֥ה מִשְׁפַּט־הַנַּ֖עַר וּמַעֲשֵֽׂהוּ׃
Translated: Then Manoah said, “May your words soon come true! What rules shall be observed for the boy?”
Transliteration: vayomer manvocha atah yavo devareykha mah-yiheyeh mishefat-hanaar umaashehu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֛אמֶר מַלְאַ֥ךְ יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מָנ֑וֹחַ מִכֹּ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־אָמַ֥רְתִּי אֶל־הָאִשָּׁ֖ה תִּשָּׁמֵֽר׃
Translated: The angel of G<small>OD</small> said to Manoah, “The woman must abstain from all the things against which I warned her.
Transliteration: vayomer maleakhe yehovah el-manvocha mikhol asher-amaretiy el-haishah tishamer

Hebrew: מִכֹּ֣ל אֲשֶׁר־יֵצֵא֩ מִגֶּ֨פֶן הַיַּ֜יִן לֹ֣א תֹאכַ֗ל וְיַ֤יִן וְשֵׁכָר֙ אַל־תֵּ֔שְׁתְּ וְכׇל־טֻמְאָ֖ה אַל־תֹּאכַ֑ל כֹּ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־צִוִּיתִ֖יהָ תִּשְׁמֹֽר׃ {ס}
Translated: She must not eat anything that comes from the grapevine, or drink wine or other intoxicant, or eat anything impure. She must observe all that I commanded her.”
Transliteration: mikhol asher-eitse migefen hayayiin lo tokhal veyayiin veshekhar al-teshete vekhׇl-tumeah al-tokhal khol asher-tsiviytiyha tishemor {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר מָנ֖וֹחַ אֶל־מַלְאַ֣ךְ יְהֹוָ֑ה נַעְצְרָה־נָּ֣א אוֹתָ֔ךְ וְנַעֲשֶׂ֥ה לְפָנֶ֖יךָ גְּדִ֥י עִזִּֽים׃
Translated: Manoah said to the angel of G<small>OD</small>, “Let us detain you and prepare a kid for you.”
Transliteration: vayomer manvocha el-maleakhe yehovah naetserah-na votakhe venaasheh lefaneykha gediy iziym

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֩אמֶר֩ מַלְאַ֨ךְ יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶל־מָנ֗וֹחַ אִם־תַּעְצְרֵ֙נִי֙ לֹא־אֹכַ֣ל בְּלַחְמֶ֔ךָ וְאִם־תַּעֲשֶׂ֣ה עֹלָ֔ה לַיהֹוָ֖ה תַּעֲלֶ֑נָּה כִּ֚י לֹא־יָדַ֣ע מָנ֔וֹחַ כִּֽי־מַלְאַ֥ךְ יְהֹוָ֖ה הֽוּא׃
Translated: But the angel of G<small>OD</small> said to Manoah, “If you detain me, I shall not eat your food; and if you present a burnt offering, offer it to G<small>OD</small>.”—For Manoah did not know that he was an angel of G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vayomer maleakhe yehovah el-manvocha im-taetsereniy lo-okhal velachemekha veim-taasheh olah layhovah taalenah khiy lo-yada manvocha khiy-maleakhe yehovah hu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֧אמֶר מָנ֛וֹחַ אֶל־מַלְאַ֥ךְ יְהֹוָ֖ה מִ֣י שְׁמֶ֑ךָ כִּֽי־יָבֹ֥א (דבריך) [דְבָרְךָ֖] וְכִבַּדְנֽוּךָ׃
Translated: So Manoah said to the angel of G<small>OD</small>, “What is your name? We should like to honor you when your words come true.”
Transliteration: vayomer manvocha el-maleakhe yehovah miy shemekha khiy-yavo (dvrykh) [devarekha] vekhivadenukha

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לוֹ֙ מַלְאַ֣ךְ יְהֹוָ֔ה לָ֥מָּה זֶּ֖ה תִּשְׁאַ֣ל לִשְׁמִ֑י וְהוּא־פֶֽלִאי׃ {פ}
Translated: The angel said to him, “You must not ask for my name; it is unknowable!”
Transliteration: vayomer lvo maleakhe yehovah lamah zeh tisheal lishemiy vehu-feliy {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֨ח מָנ֜וֹחַ אֶת־גְּדִ֤י הָֽעִזִּים֙ וְאֶת־הַמִּנְחָ֔ה וַיַּ֥עַל עַל־הַצּ֖וּר לַֽיהֹוָ֑ה וּמַפְלִ֣א לַעֲשׂ֔וֹת וּמָנ֥וֹחַ וְאִשְׁתּ֖וֹ רֹאִֽים׃
Translated: Manoah took the kid and the grain offering and offered them up on the rock to G<small>OD</small>; and a marvelous thing happened while Manoah and his wife looked on.
Transliteration: vayikach manvocha et-gediy haiziym veet-haminechah vayaal al-hatsur layhovah umafeli laashvot umanvocha veishetvo roiym

Hebrew: וַיְהִי֩ בַעֲל֨וֹת הַלַּ֜הַב מֵעַ֤ל הַמִּזְבֵּ֙חַ֙ הַשָּׁמַ֔יְמָה וַיַּ֥עַל מַלְאַךְ־יְהֹוָ֖ה בְּלַ֣הַב הַמִּזְבֵּ֑חַ וּמָנ֤וֹחַ וְאִשְׁתּוֹ֙ רֹאִ֔ים וַיִּפְּל֥וּ עַל־פְּנֵיהֶ֖ם אָֽרְצָה׃
Translated: As the flames leaped up from the altar toward the sky, the angel of G<small>OD</small> ascended in the flames of the altar, while Manoah and his wife looked on; and they flung themselves on their faces to the ground.—
Transliteration: vayehiy vaalvot halahav meal hamizevecha hashamayemah vayaal maleakhe-yehovah velahav hamizevecha umanvocha veishetvo roiym vayifelu al-feneyhem aretsah

Hebrew: וְלֹא־יָ֤סַף עוֹד֙ מַלְאַ֣ךְ יְהֹוָ֔ה לְהֵרָאֹ֖ה אֶל־מָנ֣וֹחַ וְאֶל־אִשְׁתּ֑וֹ אָ֚ז יָדַ֣ע מָנ֔וֹחַ כִּֽי־מַלְאַ֥ךְ יְהֹוָ֖ה הֽוּא׃
Translated: The angel of G<small>OD</small> never appeared again to Manoah and his wife.—Manoah then realized that it had been an angel of G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: velo-yasaf vod maleakhe yehovah leheraoh el-manvocha veel-ishetvo az yada manvocha khiy-maleakhe yehovah hu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֧אמֶר מָנ֛וֹחַ אֶל־אִשְׁתּ֖וֹ מ֣וֹת נָמ֑וּת כִּ֥י אֱלֹהִ֖ים רָאִֽינוּ׃
Translated: And Manoah said to his wife, “We will surely die, for we have seen a divine being.”
Transliteration: vayomer manvocha el-ishetvo mvot namut khiy Elohim raiynu

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֧אמֶר ל֣וֹ אִשְׁתּ֗וֹ לוּ֩ חָפֵ֨ץ יְהֹוָ֤ה לַהֲמִיתֵ֙נוּ֙ לֹֽא־לָקַ֤ח מִיָּדֵ֙נוּ֙ עֹלָ֣ה וּמִנְחָ֔ה וְלֹ֥א הֶרְאָ֖נוּ אֶת־כׇּל־אֵ֑לֶּה וְכָעֵ֕ת לֹ֥א הִשְׁמִיעָ֖נוּ כָּזֹֽאת׃
Translated: But his wife said to him, “Had G<small>OD</small> meant to take our lives, our burnt offering and grain offering would not have been accepted, nor would we have been shown all these things—and [God] would not have made such an announcement to us.”
Transliteration: vatomer lvo ishetvo lu chafets yehovah lahamiytenu lo-lakach miyadenu olah uminechah velo hereanu et-khׇl-eleh vekhaet lo hishemiyanu khazot

Hebrew: וַתֵּ֤לֶד הָֽאִשָּׁה֙ בֵּ֔ן וַתִּקְרָ֥א אֶת־שְׁמ֖וֹ שִׁמְשׁ֑וֹן וַיִּגְדַּ֣ל הַנַּ֔עַר וַֽיְבָרְכֵ֖הוּ יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: The woman bore a son, and she named him Samson. The boy grew up, and G<small>OD</small> blessed him.
Transliteration: vateled haishah ven vatikera et-shemvo shimeshvon vayigedal hanaar vayevarekhehu yehovah

Hebrew: וַתָּ֙חֶל֙ ר֣וּחַ יְהֹוָ֔ה לְפַעֲמ֖וֹ בְּמַחֲנֵה־דָ֑ן בֵּ֥ין צׇרְעָ֖ה וּבֵ֥ין אֶשְׁתָּאֹֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: The spirit of G<small>OD</small> first moved him in the encampment of Dan, between Zorah and Eshtaol.
Transliteration: vatachel rucha yehovah lefaamvo vemachaneh-dan veyn tsׇreah uveyn eshetaol {f}

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֥רֶד שִׁמְשׁ֖וֹן תִּמְנָ֑תָה וַיַּ֥רְא אִשָּׁ֛ה בְּתִמְנָ֖תָה מִבְּנ֥וֹת פְּלִשְׁתִּֽים׃
Translated: Once Samson went down to Timnah; and while in Timnah, he noticed a certain young Philistine woman.
Transliteration: vayered shimeshvon timenatah vayare ishah vetimenatah mivenvot felishetiym

Hebrew: וַיַּ֗עַל וַיַּגֵּד֙ לְאָבִ֣יו וּלְאִמּ֔וֹ וַיֹּ֗אמֶר אִשָּׁ֛ה רָאִ֥יתִי בְתִמְנָ֖תָה מִבְּנ֣וֹת פְּלִשְׁתִּ֑ים וְעַתָּ֕ה קְחוּ־אוֹתָ֥הּ לִ֖י לְאִשָּֽׁה׃
Translated: On his return, he told his father and mother, “I noticed one of the Philistine women in Timnah; please get her for me as a wife.”
Transliteration: vayaal vayaged leaviyv uleimvo vayomer ishah raiytiy vetimenatah mivenvot felishetiym veatah kechu-votah liy leishah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר ל֜וֹ אָבִ֣יו וְאִמּ֗וֹ הַאֵין֩ בִּבְנ֨וֹת אַחֶ֤יךָ וּבְכׇל־עַמִּי֙ אִשָּׁ֔ה כִּֽי־אַתָּ֤ה הוֹלֵךְ֙ לָקַ֣חַת אִשָּׁ֔ה מִפְּלִשְׁתִּ֖ים הָעֲרֵלִ֑ים וַיֹּ֨אמֶר שִׁמְשׁ֤וֹן אֶל־אָבִיו֙ אוֹתָ֣הּ קַֽח־לִ֔י כִּי־הִ֖יא יָשְׁרָ֥ה בְעֵינָֽי׃
Translated: His father and mother said to him, “Is there no one among the daughters of your own kindred and among all our people, that you must go and take a wife from the uncircumcised Philistines?” But Samson answered his father, “Get me that one, for she is the one that pleases me.”
Transliteration: vayomer lvo aviyv veimvo haeyn vivenvot acheykha uvekhׇl-amiy ishah khiy-atah hvolekhe lakachat ishah mifelishetiym haareliym vayomer shimeshvon el-aviyv votah kach-liy khiy-hiy yasherah veeynay

Hebrew: וְאָבִ֨יו וְאִמּ֜וֹ לֹ֣א יָדְע֗וּ כִּ֤י מֵֽיְהֹוָה֙ הִ֔יא כִּֽי־תֹאֲנָ֥ה הֽוּא־מְבַקֵּ֖שׁ מִפְּלִשְׁתִּ֑ים וּבָעֵ֣ת הַהִ֔יא פְּלִשְׁתִּ֖ים מֹשְׁלִ֥ים בְּיִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: His father and mother did not realize that his request was from G<small>OD</small>, who was seeking a pretext against the Philistines, for the Philistines were ruling over Israel at that time.
Transliteration: veaviyv veimvo lo yadeu khiy meyehovah hiy khiy-toanah hu-mevakesh mifelishetiym uvaet hahiy felishetiym mosheliym veyisherael

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֧רֶד שִׁמְשׁ֛וֹן וְאָבִ֥יו וְאִמּ֖וֹ תִּמְנָ֑תָה וַיָּבֹ֙אוּ֙ עַד־כַּרְמֵ֣י תִמְנָ֔תָה וְהִנֵּה֙ כְּפִ֣יר אֲרָי֔וֹת שֹׁאֵ֖ג לִקְרָאתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
So Samson and his father and mother went down to Timnah.
When he came to the vineyards of Timnah [for the first time], a full-grown lion came roaring at him.
Transliteration: vayered shimeshvon veaviyv veimvo timenatah vayavou ad-kharemey timenatah vehineh khefiyr arayvot shoeg likeratvo

Hebrew: וַתִּצְלַ֨ח עָלָ֜יו ר֣וּחַ יְהֹוָ֗ה וַֽיְשַׁסְּעֵ֙הוּ֙ כְּשַׁסַּ֣ע הַגְּדִ֔י וּמְא֖וּמָה אֵ֣ין בְּיָד֑וֹ וְלֹ֤א הִגִּיד֙ לְאָבִ֣יו וּלְאִמּ֔וֹ אֵ֖ת אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשָֽׂה׃
Translated: The spirit of G<small>OD</small> gripped him, and he tore him asunder with his bare hands as one might tear a kid asunder; but he did not tell his father and mother what he had done.
Transliteration: vatitselach alayv rucha yehovah vayeshaseehu kheshasa hagediy umeumah eyn veyadvo velo higiyd leaviyv uleimvo et asher ashah

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֖רֶד וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר לָֽאִשָּׁ֑ה וַתִּישַׁ֖ר בְּעֵינֵ֥י שִׁמְשֽׁוֹן׃
Translated: Then he went down and spoke to the woman, and she pleased Samson.
Transliteration: vayered vayedaver laishah vatiyshar veeyney shimeshvon

Hebrew: וַיָּ֤שׇׁב מִיָּמִים֙ לְקַחְתָּ֔הּ וַיָּ֣סַר לִרְא֔וֹת אֵ֖ת מַפֶּ֣לֶת הָאַרְיֵ֑ה וְהִנֵּ֨ה עֲדַ֧ת דְּבוֹרִ֛ים בִּגְוִיַּ֥ת הָאַרְיֵ֖ה וּדְבָֽשׁ׃
Translated: Returning the following year to marry her, he turned aside to look at the remains of the lion; and in the lion’s skeleton he found a swarm of bees, and honey.
Transliteration: vayashׇv miyamiym lekachetah vayasar lirevot et mafelet haareeih vehineh adat devvoriym vigeviyat haareeih udevash

Hebrew: וַיִּרְדֵּ֣הוּ אֶל־כַּפָּ֗יו וַיֵּ֤לֶךְ הָלוֹךְ֙ וְאָכֹ֔ל וַיֵּ֙לֶךְ֙ אֶל־אָבִ֣יו וְאֶל־אִמּ֔וֹ וַיִּתֵּ֥ן לָהֶ֖ם וַיֹּאכֵ֑לוּ וְלֹא־הִגִּ֣יד לָהֶ֔ם כִּ֛י מִגְּוִיַּ֥ת הָאַרְיֵ֖ה רָדָ֥ה הַדְּבָֽשׁ׃
Translated: He scooped it into his palms and ate it as he went along. When he rejoined his father and mother, he gave them some and they ate it; but he did not tell them that he had scooped the honey out of a lion’s skeleton.
Transliteration: vayiredehu el-khafayv vayelekhe halvokhe veakhol vayelekhe el-aviyv veel-imvo vayiten lahem vayokhelu velo-higiyd lahem khiy migeviyat haareeih radah hadevash

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֥רֶד אָבִ֖יהוּ אֶל־הָֽאִשָּׁ֑ה וַיַּ֨עַשׂ שָׁ֤ם שִׁמְשׁוֹן֙ מִשְׁתֶּ֔ה כִּ֛י כֵּ֥ן יַעֲשׂ֖וּ הַבַּחוּרִֽים׃
Translated: So his father came down to the woman, and Samson made a feast there, as young men used to do.
Transliteration: vayered aviyhu el-haishah vayaash sham shimeshvon misheteh khiy khen yaashu havachuriym

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֖י כִּרְאוֹתָ֣ם אוֹת֑וֹ וַיִּקְחוּ֙ שְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים מֵרֵעִ֔ים וַיִּהְי֖וּ אִתּֽוֹ׃
Translated: When the people of Timnah saw him, they designated thirty companions to be with him.
Transliteration: vayehiy khirevotam votvo vayikechu sheloshiym mereiym vayiheyu itvo

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לָהֶם֙ שִׁמְשׁ֔וֹן אָחֽוּדָה־נָּ֥א לָכֶ֖ם חִידָ֑ה אִם־הַגֵּ֣ד תַּגִּ֩ידוּ֩ אוֹתָ֨הּ לִ֜י שִׁבְעַ֨ת יְמֵ֤י הַמִּשְׁתֶּה֙ וּמְצָאתֶ֔ם וְנָתַתִּ֤י לָכֶם֙ שְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים סְדִינִ֔ים וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֖ים חֲלִפֹ֥ת בְּגָדִֽים׃
Translated: Then Samson said to them, “Let me propound a riddle to you. If you can give me the right answer during the seven days of the feast, I shall give you thirty linen tunics and thirty sets of clothing;
Transliteration: vayomer lahem shimeshvon achudah-na lakhem chiydah im-haged tagiydu votah liy shiveat yemey hamisheteh umetsatem venatatiy lakhem sheloshiym sediyniym usheloshiym chalifot vegadiym

Hebrew: וְאִם־לֹ֣א תוּכְלוּ֮ לְהַגִּ֣יד לִי֒ וּנְתַתֶּ֨ם אַתֶּ֥ם לִי֙ שְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים סְדִינִ֔ים וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֖ים חֲלִיפ֣וֹת בְּגָדִ֑ים וַיֹּ֣אמְרוּ ל֔וֹ ח֥וּדָה חִידָתְךָ֖ וְנִשְׁמָעֶֽנָּה׃
Translated: but if you are not able to tell it to me, you must give me thirty linen tunics and thirty sets of clothing.” And they said to him, “Ask your riddle and we will listen.”
Transliteration: veim-lo tukhelu lehagiyd liy unetatem atem liy sheloshiym sediyniym usheloshiym chaliyfvot vegadiym vayomeru lvo chudah chiydatekha venishemaenah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לָהֶ֗ם מֵהָֽאֹכֵל֙ יָצָ֣א מַאֲכָ֔ל וּמֵעַ֖ז יָצָ֣א מָת֑וֹק וְלֹ֥א יָכְל֛וּ לְהַגִּ֥יד הַחִידָ֖ה שְׁלֹ֥שֶׁת יָמִֽים׃
Translated:
So he said to them:
“Out of the eater came something to eat,
Out of the strong came something sweet.”
For three days they could not answer the riddle.
Transliteration: vayomer lahem mehaokhel yatsa maakhal umeaz yatsa matvok velo yakhelu lehagiyd hachiydah sheloshet yamiym

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י ׀ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֗י וַיֹּאמְר֤וּ לְאֵֽשֶׁת־שִׁמְשׁוֹן֙ פַּתִּ֣י אֶת־אִישֵׁ֗ךְ וְיַגֶּד־לָ֙נוּ֙ אֶת־הַ֣חִידָ֔ה פֶּן־נִשְׂרֹ֥ף אוֹתָ֛ךְ וְאֶת־בֵּ֥ית אָבִ֖יךְ בָּאֵ֑שׁ הַלְיׇרְשֵׁ֕נוּ קְרָאתֶ֥ם לָ֖נוּ הֲלֹֽא׃
Translated: On the seventh day, they said to Samson’s wife, “Coax your husband to provide us with the answer to the riddle; else we shall put you and your father’s household to the fire; have you invited us here in order to impoverish us?”
Transliteration: vayehiy vayyvom hasheviyiy vayomeru leeshet-shimeshvon fatiy et-iyshekhe veyaged-lanu et-hachiydah fen-nisherof votakhe veet-veyt aviykhe vaesh haleyׇreshenu keratem lanu halo

Hebrew: וַתֵּ֩בְךְּ֩ אֵ֨שֶׁת שִׁמְשׁ֜וֹן עָלָ֗יו וַתֹּ֙אמֶר֙ רַק־שְׂנֵאתַ֙נִי֙ וְלֹ֣א אֲהַבְתָּ֔נִי הַחִידָ֥ה חַ֙דְתָּ֙ לִבְנֵ֣י עַמִּ֔י וְלִ֖י לֹ֣א הִגַּ֑דְתָּה וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לָ֗הּ הִנֵּ֨ה לְאָבִ֧י וּלְאִמִּ֛י לֹ֥א הִגַּ֖דְתִּי וְלָ֥ךְ אַגִּֽיד׃
Translated: Then Samson’s wife harassed him with tears, and she said, “You really hate me, you don’t love me. You asked my people a riddle, and you didn’t tell me the answer.” He replied, “I haven’t even told my father and mother; shall I tell you?”
Transliteration: vatevekhe eshet shimeshvon alayv vatomer rak-shenetaniy velo ahavetaniy hachiydah chadeta liveney amiy veliy lo higadetah vayomer lah hineh leaviy uleimiy lo higadetiy velakhe agiyd

Hebrew: וַתֵּ֤בְךְּ עָלָיו֙ שִׁבְעַ֣ת הַיָּמִ֔ים אֲשֶׁר־הָיָ֥ה לָהֶ֖ם הַמִּשְׁתֶּ֑ה וַיְהִ֣י ׀ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֗י וַיַּגֶּד־לָהּ֙ כִּ֣י הֱצִיקַ֔תְהוּ וַתַּגֵּ֥ד הַחִידָ֖ה לִבְנֵ֥י עַמָּֽהּ׃
Translated: During the rest of the seven days of the feast she continued to harass him with her tears, and on the seventh day he told her, because she nagged him so. And she explained the riddle to her people.
Transliteration: vatevekhe alayv shiveat hayamiym asher-hayah lahem hamisheteh vayehiy vayyvom hasheviyiy vayaged-lah khiy hetsiykatehu vataged hachiydah liveney amah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמְרוּ לוֹ֩ אַנְשֵׁ֨י הָעִ֜יר בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֗י בְּטֶ֙רֶם֙ יָבֹ֣א הַחַ֔רְסָה מַה־מָּת֣וֹק מִדְּבַ֔שׁ וּמֶ֥ה עַ֖ז מֵאֲרִ֑י וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לָהֶ֔ם לוּלֵא֙ חֲרַשְׁתֶּ֣ם בְּעֶגְלָתִ֔י לֹ֥א מְצָאתֶ֖ם חִידָתִֽי׃
Translated:
On the seventh day, before the sunset, the townspeople said to him:
“What is sweeter than honey,
And what is stronger than a lion?”
He responded:
“Had you not plowed with my heifer,
You would not have guessed my riddle!”
Transliteration: vayomeru lvo aneshey haiyr vayyvom hasheviyiy veterem yavo hacharesah mah-matvok midevash umeh az meariy vayomer lahem lule charashetem veegelatiy lo metsatem chiydatiy

Hebrew: וַתִּצְלַ֨ח עָלָ֜יו ר֣וּחַ יְהֹוָ֗ה וַיֵּ֨רֶד אַשְׁקְל֜וֹן וַיַּ֥ךְ מֵהֶ֣ם ׀ שְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים אִ֗ישׁ וַיִּקַּח֙ אֶת־חֲלִ֣יצוֹתָ֔ם וַיִּתֵּן֙ הַחֲלִיפ֔וֹת לְמַגִּידֵ֖י הַחִידָ֑ה וַיִּ֣חַר אַפּ֔וֹ וַיַּ֖עַל בֵּ֥ית אָבִֽיהוּ׃
Translated: The spirit of G<small>OD</small> gripped him. He went down to Ashkelon and killed thirty of its men. He stripped them and gave the sets of clothing to those who had answered the riddle. And he left in a rage for his father’s house.
Transliteration: vatitselach alayv rucha yehovah vayered ashekelvon vayakhe mehem sheloshiym iysh vayikach et-chaliytsvotam vayiten hachaliyfvot lemagiydey hachiydah vayichar afvo vayaal veyt aviyhu

Hebrew: וַתְּהִ֖י אֵ֣שֶׁת שִׁמְשׁ֑וֹן לְמֵ֣רֵעֵ֔הוּ אֲשֶׁ֥ר רֵעָ֖ה לֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated: Samson’s wife then got married to one of those who had been his wedding companions.
Transliteration: vatehiy eshet shimeshvon lemereehu asher reah lvo {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֨י מִיָּמִ֜ים בִּימֵ֣י קְצִיר־חִטִּ֗ים וַיִּפְקֹ֨ד שִׁמְשׁ֤וֹן אֶת־אִשְׁתּוֹ֙ בִּגְדִ֣י עִזִּ֔ים וַיֹּ֕אמֶר אָבֹ֥אָה אֶל־אִשְׁתִּ֖י הֶחָ֑דְרָה וְלֹֽא־נְתָנ֥וֹ אָבִ֖יהָ לָבֽוֹא׃
Translated: Some time later, in the season of the wheat harvest, Samson came to visit his wife, bringing a kid as a gift. He said, “Let me go into the chamber to my wife.” But her father would not let him go in.
Transliteration: vayehiy miyamiym viymey ketsiyr-chitiym vayifekod shimeshvon et-ishetvo vigediy iziym vayomer avoah el-ishetiy hechaderah velo-netanvo aviyha lavvo

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אָבִ֗יהָ אָמֹ֤ר אָמַ֙רְתִּי֙ כִּי־שָׂנֹ֣א שְׂנֵאתָ֔הּ וָאֶתְּנֶ֖נָּה לְמֵרֵעֶ֑ךָ הֲלֹ֨א אֲחוֹתָ֤הּ הַקְּטַנָּה֙ טוֹבָ֣ה מִמֶּ֔נָּה תְּהִי־נָ֥א לְךָ֖ תַּחְתֶּֽיהָ׃
Translated: “I was sure,” said her father, “that you had taken a dislike to her, so I gave her to your wedding companion. But her younger sister is more beautiful than she; let her become your wife instead.”
Transliteration: vayomer aviyha amor amaretiy khiy-shano shenetah vaetenenah lemereekha halo achvotah haketanah tvovah mimenah tehiy-na lekha tacheteyha

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לָהֶם֙ שִׁמְשׁ֔וֹן נִקֵּ֥יתִי הַפַּ֖עַם מִפְּלִשְׁתִּ֑ים כִּי־עֹשֶׂ֥ה אֲנִ֛י עִמָּ֖ם רָעָֽה׃
Translated: Thereupon Samson declared, “Now the Philistines can have no claim against me for the harm I shall do them.”
Transliteration: vayomer lahem shimeshvon nikeytiy hafaam mifelishetiym khiy-osheh aniy imam raah

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֣לֶךְ שִׁמְשׁ֔וֹן וַיִּלְכֹּ֖ד שְׁלֹשׁ־מֵא֣וֹת שׁוּעָלִ֑ים וַיִּקַּ֣ח לַפִּדִ֗ים וַיֶּ֤פֶן זָנָב֙ אֶל־זָנָ֔ב וַיָּ֨שֶׂם לַפִּ֥יד אֶחָ֛ד בֵּין־שְׁנֵ֥י הַזְּנָב֖וֹת בַּתָּֽוֶךְ׃
Translated: Samson went and caught three hundred foxes. He took torches and, turning [the foxes] tail to tail, he placed a torch between each pair of tails.
Transliteration: vayelekhe shimeshvon vayilekhod shelosh-mevot shualiym vayikach lafidiym vayefen zanav el-zanav vayashem lafiyd echad veyn-sheney hazenavvot vatavekhe

Hebrew: וַיַּבְעֶר־אֵשׁ֙ בַּלַּפִּידִ֔ים וַיְשַׁלַּ֖ח בְּקָמ֣וֹת פְּלִשְׁתִּ֑ים וַיַּבְעֵ֛ר מִגָּדִ֥ישׁ וְעַד־קָמָ֖ה וְעַד־כֶּ֥רֶם זָֽיִת׃
Translated: He lit the torches and turned [the foxes] loose among the standing grain of the Philistines, setting fire to stacked grain, standing grain, vineyards, [and] olive trees.
Transliteration: vayaveer-esh valafiydiym vayeshalach vekamvot felishetiym vayaveer migadiysh vead-kamah vead-kherem zayiit

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ פְלִשְׁתִּים֮ מִ֣י עָ֣שָׂה זֹאת֒ וַיֹּאמְר֗וּ שִׁמְשׁוֹן֙ חֲתַ֣ן הַתִּמְנִ֔י כִּ֚י לָקַ֣ח אֶת־אִשְׁתּ֔וֹ וַֽיִּתְּנָ֖הּ לְמֵרֵעֵ֑הוּ וַיַּעֲל֣וּ פְלִשְׁתִּ֔ים וַיִּשְׂרְפ֥וּ אוֹתָ֛הּ וְאֶת־אָבִ֖יהָ בָּאֵֽשׁ׃
Translated: The Philistines asked, “Who did this?” And they were told, “It was Samson, the son-in-law of the Timnite, who took Samson’s wife and gave her to his wedding companion.” Thereupon the Philistines came up and put her and her father to the fire.
Transliteration: vayomeru felishetiym miy ashah zot vayomeru shimeshvon chatan hatimeniy khiy lakach et-ishetvo vayitenah lemereehu vayaalu felishetiym vayisherefu votah veet-aviyha vaesh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לָהֶם֙ שִׁמְשׁ֔וֹן אִֽם־תַּעֲשׂ֖וּן כָּזֹ֑את כִּ֛י אִם־נִקַּ֥מְתִּי בָכֶ֖ם וְאַחַ֥ר אֶחְדָּֽל׃
Translated: Samson said to them, “If that is how you act, I will not rest until I have taken revenge on you.”
Transliteration: vayomer lahem shimeshvon im-taashun khazot khiy im-nikametiy vakhem veachar echedal

Hebrew: וַיַּ֨ךְ אוֹתָ֥ם שׁ֛וֹק עַל־יָרֵ֖ךְ מַכָּ֣ה גְדוֹלָ֑ה וַיֵּ֣רֶד וַיֵּ֔שֶׁב בִּסְעִ֖יף סֶ֥לַע עֵיטָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: He gave them a sound and thorough thrashing. Then he went down and stayed in the cave of the rock of Etam.
Transliteration: vayakhe votam shvok al-yarekhe makhah gedvolah vayered vayeshev viseiyf sela eytam {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲל֣וּ פְלִשְׁתִּ֔ים וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בִּֽיהוּדָ֑ה וַיִּנָּטְשׁ֖וּ בַּלֶּֽחִי׃
Translated: The Philistines came up, pitched camp in Judah and spread out over Lehi.
Transliteration: vayaalu felishetiym vayachanu viyhudah vayinateshu valechiy

Hebrew: וַיֹּֽאמְרוּ֙ אִ֣ישׁ יְהוּדָ֔ה לָמָ֖ה עֲלִיתֶ֣ם עָלֵ֑ינוּ וַיֹּאמְר֗וּ לֶאֱס֤וֹר אֶת־שִׁמְשׁוֹן֙ עָלִ֔ינוּ לַעֲשׂ֣וֹת ל֔וֹ כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר עָ֥שָׂה לָֽנוּ׃
Translated: Those on Judah’s side asked, “Why have you come up against us?” They answered, “We have come to take Samson prisoner, and to do to him as he did to us.”
Transliteration: vayomeru iysh yehudah lamah aliytem aleynu vayomeru leesvor et-shimeshvon aliynu laashvot lvo khaasher ashah lanu

Hebrew: וַיֵּרְד֡וּ שְׁלֹ֩שֶׁת֩ אֲלָפִ֨ים אִ֜ישׁ מִֽיהוּדָ֗ה אֶל־סְעִיף֮ סֶ֣לַע עֵיטָם֒ וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ לְשִׁמְשׁ֗וֹן הֲלֹ֤א יָדַ֙עְתָּ֙ כִּֽי־מֹשְׁלִ֥ים בָּ֙נוּ֙ פְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים וּמַה־זֹּ֖את עָשִׂ֣יתָ לָּ֑נוּ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לָהֶ֔ם כַּֽאֲשֶׁר֙ עָ֣שׂוּ לִ֔י כֵּ֖ן עָשִׂ֥יתִי לָהֶֽם׃
Translated: Thereupon three thousand Judahites went down to the cave of the rock of Etam, and they said to Samson, “You knew that the Philistines rule over us; why have you done this to us?” He replied, “As they did to me, so I did to them.”
Transliteration: vayeredu sheloshet alafiym iysh miyhudah el-seiyf sela eytam vayomeru leshimeshvon halo yadaeta khiy-mosheliym vanu felishetiym umah-zot ashiyta lanu vayomer lahem khaasher ashu liy khen ashiytiy lahem

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמְרוּ לוֹ֙ לֶאֱסׇרְךָ֣ יָרַ֔דְנוּ לְתִתְּךָ֖ בְּיַד־פְּלִשְׁתִּ֑ים וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לָהֶם֙ שִׁמְשׁ֔וֹן הִשָּׁבְע֣וּ לִ֔י פֶּֽן־תִּפְגְּע֥וּן בִּ֖י אַתֶּֽם׃
Translated: “We have come down,” they told him, “to take you prisoner and to hand you over to the Philistines.” “But swear to me,” said Samson to them, “that you yourselves will not attack me.”
Transliteration: vayomeru lvo leesׇrekha yaradenu letitekha veyad-felishetiym vayomer lahem shimeshvon hishaveu liy fen-tifegeun viy atem

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֧אמְרוּ ל֣וֹ לֵאמֹ֗ר לֹ֚א כִּֽי־אָסֹ֤ר נֶאֱסׇרְךָ֙ וּנְתַנּ֣וּךָ בְיָדָ֔ם וְהָמֵ֖ת לֹ֣א נְמִיתֶ֑ךָ וַיַּאַסְרֻ֗הוּ בִּשְׁנַ֙יִם֙ עֲבֹתִ֣ים חֲדָשִׁ֔ים וַֽיַּעֲל֖וּהוּ מִן־הַסָּֽלַע׃
Translated: “We won’t,” they replied. “We will only take you prisoner and hand you over to them; we will not slay you.” So they bound him with two new ropes and brought him up from the rock.
Transliteration: vayomeru lvo lemor lo khiy-asor neesׇrekha unetanukha veyadam vehamet lo nemiytekha vayaaseruhu vishenayiim avotiym chadashiym vayaaluhu min-hasala

Hebrew: הוּא־בָ֣א עַד־לֶ֔חִי וּפְלִשְׁתִּ֖ים הֵרִ֣יעוּ לִקְרָאת֑וֹ וַתִּצְלַ֨ח עָלָ֜יו ר֣וּחַ יְהֹוָ֗ה וַתִּהְיֶ֨ינָה הָעֲבֹתִ֜ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־זְרוֹעוֹתָ֗יו כַּפִּשְׁתִּים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בָּעֲר֣וּ בָאֵ֔שׁ וַיִּמַּ֥סּוּ אֱסוּרָ֖יו מֵעַ֥ל יָדָֽיו׃
Translated: When he reached Lehi, the Philistines came shouting to meet him. Thereupon the spirit of G<small>OD</small> gripped him, and the ropes on his arms became like flax that catches fire; the bonds melted off his hands.
Transliteration: hu-va ad-lechiy ufelishetiym heriyu likeratvo vatitselach alayv rucha yehovah vatiheyeynah haavotiym asher al-zervovotayv khafishetiym asher vaaru vaesh vayimasu esurayv meal yadayv

Hebrew: וַיִּמְצָ֥א לְחִי־חֲמ֖וֹר טְרִיָּ֑ה וַיִּשְׁלַ֤ח יָדוֹ֙ וַיִּקָּחֶ֔הָ וַיַּךְ־בָּ֖הּ אֶ֥לֶף אִֽישׁ׃
Translated: He came upon a fresh jawbone of a donkey and he picked it up; and with it he killed a thousand men.
Transliteration: vayimetsa lechiy-chamvor teriyah vayishelach yadvo vayikacheha vayakhe-vah elef iysh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר שִׁמְשׁ֔וֹן בִּלְחִ֣י הַחֲמ֔וֹר חֲמ֖וֹר חֲמֹרָתָ֑יִם בִּלְחִ֣י הַחֲמ֔וֹר הִכֵּ֖יתִי אֶ֥לֶף אִֽישׁ׃
Translated:
Then Samson said:
“With the jaw of an ass,
Mass upon mass!
With the jaw of an ass
I have slain a thousand men.”
Transliteration: vayomer shimeshvon vilechiy hachamvor chamvor chamoratayiim vilechiy hachamvor hikheytiy elef iysh

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ כְּכַלֹּת֣וֹ לְדַבֵּ֔ר וַיַּשְׁלֵ֥ךְ הַלְּחִ֖י מִיָּד֑וֹ וַיִּקְרָ֛א לַמָּק֥וֹם הַה֖וּא רָ֥מַת לֶֽחִי׃
Translated: As he finished speaking, he threw the jawbone away; hence that place was called Ramath-lehi.
Transliteration: vayehiy khekhalotvo ledaver vayashelekhe halechiy miyadvo vayikera lamakvom hahu ramat lechiy

Hebrew: וַיִּצְמָא֮ מְאֹד֒ וַיִּקְרָ֤א אֶל־יְהֹוָה֙ וַיֹּאמַ֔ר אַתָּה֙ נָתַ֣תָּ בְיַֽד־עַבְדְּךָ֔ אֶת־הַתְּשׁוּעָ֥ה הַגְּדֹלָ֖ה הַזֹּ֑את וְעַתָּה֙ אָמ֣וּת בַּצָּמָ֔א וְנָפַלְתִּ֖י בְּיַ֥ד הָעֲרֵלִֽים׃
Translated: He was very thirsty and he called to G<small>OD</small>, “You Yourself have granted this great victory through Your servant; and must I now die of thirst and fall into the hands of the uncircumcised?”
Transliteration: vayitsema meod vayikera el-yehovah vayomar atah natata veyad-avedekha et-hateshuah hagedolah hazot veatah amut vatsama venafaletiy veyad haareliym

Hebrew: וַיִּבְקַ֨ע אֱלֹהִ֜ים אֶת־הַמַּכְתֵּ֣שׁ אֲשֶׁר־בַּלֶּ֗חִי וַיֵּצְא֨וּ מִמֶּ֤נּוּ מַ֙יִם֙ וַיֵּ֔שְׁתְּ וַתָּ֥שׇׁב רוּח֖וֹ וַיֶּ֑חִי עַל־כֵּ֣ן ׀ קָרָ֣א שְׁמָ֗הּ עֵ֤ין הַקּוֹרֵא֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בַּלֶּ֔חִי עַ֖ד הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: So God split open the hollow that is at Lehi, and the water gushed out of it; he drank, regained his strength, and revived. That is why it is called to this day “En-hakkore of Lehi.”
Transliteration: vayiveka Elohim et-hamakhetesh asher-valechiy vayetseu mimenu mayiim vayeshete vatashׇv ruchvo vayechiy al-khen kara shemah eyn hakvore asher valechiy ad hayyvom hazeh

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁפֹּ֧ט אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל בִּימֵ֥י פְלִשְׁתִּ֖ים עֶשְׂרִ֥ים שָׁנָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: He led Israel in the days of the Philistines for twenty years.
Transliteration: vayishefot et-yisherael viymey felishetiym esheriym shanah {f}

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ שִׁמְשׁ֖וֹן עַזָּ֑תָה וַיַּרְא־שָׁם֙ אִשָּׁ֣ה זוֹנָ֔ה וַיָּבֹ֖א אֵלֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: Once Samson went to Gaza; there he met a prostitute and slept with her.
Transliteration: vayelekhe shimeshvon azatah vayare-sham ishah zvonah vayavo eleyha

Hebrew: לַעַזָּתִ֣ים ׀ לֵאמֹ֗ר בָּ֤א שִׁמְשׁוֹן֙ הֵ֔נָּה וַיָּסֹ֛בּוּ וַיֶּאֶרְבוּ־ל֥וֹ כׇל־הַלַּ֖יְלָה בְּשַׁ֣עַר הָעִ֑יר וַיִּתְחָֽרְשׁ֤וּ כׇל־הַלַּ֙יְלָה֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר עַד־א֥וֹר הַבֹּ֖קֶר וַהֲרַגְנֻֽהוּ׃
Translated: The Gazites [learned] that Samson had come there, so they gathered and lay in ambush for him in the town gate the whole night; and all night long they kept whispering to each other, “When daylight comes, we’ll kill him.”
Transliteration: laazatiym lemor va shimeshvon henah vayasovu vayeerevu-lvo khׇl-halayelah veshaar haiyr vayitechareshu khׇl-halayelah lemor ad-vor havoker vaharagenuhu

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁכַּ֣ב שִׁמְשׁוֹן֮ עַד־חֲצִ֣י הַלַּ֒יְלָה֒ וַיָּ֣קׇם ׀ בַּחֲצִ֣י הַלַּ֗יְלָה וַיֶּאֱחֹ֞ז בְּדַלְת֤וֹת שַֽׁעַר־הָעִיר֙ וּבִשְׁתֵּ֣י הַמְּזֻז֔וֹת וַיִּסָּעֵם֙ עִֽם־הַבְּרִ֔יחַ וַיָּ֖שֶׂם עַל־כְּתֵפָ֑יו וַֽיַּעֲלֵם֙ אֶל־רֹ֣אשׁ הָהָ֔ר אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־פְּנֵ֥י חֶבְרֽוֹן׃ {פ}
Translated: But Samson lay in bed only till midnight. At midnight he got up, grasped the doors of the town gate together with the two gateposts, and pulled them out along with the bar. He placed them on his shoulders and carried them off to the top of the hill that is near Hebron.
Transliteration: vayishekhav shimeshvon ad-chatsiy halayelah vayakׇm vachatsiy halayelah vayeechoz vedaletvot shaar-haiyr uvishetey hamezuzvot vayisaem im-haveriycha vayashem al-khetefayv vayaalem el-rosh hahar asher al-feney chevervon {f}

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ אַחֲרֵי־כֵ֔ן וַיֶּאֱהַ֥ב אִשָּׁ֖ה בְּנַ֣חַל שֹׂרֵ֑ק וּשְׁמָ֖הּ דְּלִילָֽה׃
Translated: After that, he fell in love with a woman in the Wadi Sorek, named Delilah.
Transliteration: vayehiy acharey-khen vayeehav ishah venachal shorek ushemah deliylah

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲל֨וּ אֵלֶ֜יהָ סַרְנֵ֣י פְלִשְׁתִּ֗ים וַיֹּ֨אמְרוּ לָ֜הּ פַּתִּ֣י אוֹת֗וֹ וּרְאִי֙ בַּמֶּה֙ כֹּח֣וֹ גָד֔וֹל וּבַמֶּה֙ נ֣וּכַל ל֔וֹ וַאֲסַרְנ֖וּהוּ לְעַנּוֹת֑וֹ וַאֲנַ֙חְנוּ֙ נִתַּן־לָ֔ךְ אִ֕ישׁ אֶ֥לֶף וּמֵאָ֖ה כָּֽסֶף׃
Translated: The lords of the Philistines went up to her and said, “Coax him and find out what makes him so strong, and how we can overpower him, tie him up, and make him helpless; and we’ll each give you eleven hundred shekels of silver.”
Transliteration: vayaalu eleyha sareney felishetiym vayomeru lah fatiy votvo ureiy vameh khochvo gadvol uvameh nukhal lvo vaasarenuhu leanvotvo vaanachenu nitan-lakhe iysh elef umeah khasef

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֤אמֶר דְּלִילָה֙ אֶל־שִׁמְשׁ֔וֹן הַגִּידָה־נָּ֣א לִ֔י בַּמֶּ֖ה כֹּחֲךָ֣ גָד֑וֹל וּבַמֶּ֥ה תֵאָסֵ֖ר לְעַנּוֹתֶֽךָ׃
Translated: So Delilah said to Samson, “Tell me, what makes you so strong? And how could you be tied up and made helpless?”
Transliteration: vatomer deliylah el-shimeshvon hagiydah-na liy vameh khochakha gadvol uvameh teaser leanvotekha

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֵלֶ֙יהָ֙ שִׁמְשׁ֔וֹן אִם־יַאַסְרֻ֗נִי בְּשִׁבְעָ֛ה יְתָרִ֥ים לַחִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹא־חֹרָ֑בוּ וְחָלִ֥יתִי וְהָיִ֖יתִי כְּאַחַ֥ד הָאָדָֽם׃
Translated: Samson replied, “If I were to be tied with seven fresh tendons that had not been dried, I should become as weak as an ordinary man.”
Transliteration: vayomer eleyha shimeshvon im-yaaseruniy veshiveah yetariym lachiym asher lo-choravu vechaliytiy vehayiytiy kheachad haadam

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲלוּ־לָ֞הּ סַרְנֵ֣י פְלִשְׁתִּ֗ים שִׁבְעָ֛ה יְתָרִ֥ים לַחִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹא־חֹרָ֑בוּ וַתַּאַסְרֵ֖הוּ בָּהֶֽם׃
Translated: So the lords of the Philistines brought up to her seven fresh tendons that had not been dried. She bound him with them,
Transliteration: vayaalu-lah sareney felishetiym shiveah yetariym lachiym asher lo-choravu vataaserehu vahem

Hebrew: וְהָאֹרֵ֗ב יֹשֵׁ֥ב לָהּ֙ בַּחֶ֔דֶר וַתֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלָ֔יו פְּלִשְׁתִּ֥ים עָלֶ֖יךָ שִׁמְשׁ֑וֹן וַיְנַתֵּק֙ אֶת־הַיְתָרִ֔ים כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר יִנָּתֵ֤ק פְּתִֽיל־הַנְּעֹ֙רֶת֙ בַּהֲרִיח֣וֹ אֵ֔שׁ וְלֹ֥א נוֹדַ֖ע כֹּחֽוֹ׃
Translated: while an ambush was waiting in her room. Then she called out to him, “Samson, the Philistines are upon you!” Whereupon he pulled the tendons apart, as a strand of tow comes apart at the touch of fire. So the secret of his strength remained unknown.
Transliteration: vehaorev yoshev lah vacheder vatomer elayv felishetiym aleykha shimeshvon vayenatek et-hayetariym khaasher yinatek fetiyl-haneoret vahariychvo esh velo nvoda khochvo

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֤אמֶר דְּלִילָה֙ אֶל־שִׁמְשׁ֔וֹן הִנֵּה֙ הֵתַ֣לְתָּ בִּ֔י וַתְּדַבֵּ֥ר אֵלַ֖י כְּזָבִ֑ים עַתָּה֙ הַגִּידָה־נָּ֣א לִ֔י בַּמֶּ֖ה תֵּאָסֵֽר׃
Translated: Then Delilah said to Samson, “Oh, you deceived me; you lied to me! Do tell me now how you could be tied up.”
Transliteration: vatomer deliylah el-shimeshvon hineh hetaleta viy vatedaver elay khezaviym atah hagiydah-na liy vameh teaser

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלֶ֔יהָ אִם־אָס֤וֹר יַאַסְר֙וּנִי֙ בַּעֲבֹתִ֣ים חֲדָשִׁ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֛ר לֹא־נַעֲשָׂ֥ה בָהֶ֖ם מְלָאכָ֑ה וְחָלִ֥יתִי וְהָיִ֖יתִי כְּאַחַ֥ד הָאָדָֽם׃
Translated: He said, “If I were to be bound with new ropes that had never been used, I would become as weak as an ordinary man.”
Transliteration: vayomer eleyha im-asvor yaaseruniy vaavotiym chadashiym asher lo-naashah vahem melakhah vechaliytiy vehayiytiy kheachad haadam

Hebrew: וַתִּקַּ֣ח דְּלִילָה֩ עֲבֹתִ֨ים חֲדָשִׁ֜ים וַתַּאַסְרֵ֣הוּ בָהֶ֗ם וַתֹּ֤אמֶר אֵלָיו֙ פְּלִשְׁתִּ֤ים עָלֶ֙יךָ֙ שִׁמְשׁ֔וֹן וְהָאֹרֵ֖ב יֹשֵׁ֣ב בֶּחָ֑דֶר וַֽיְנַתְּקֵ֛ם מֵעַ֥ל זְרֹעֹתָ֖יו כַּחֽוּט׃
Translated: So Delilah took new ropes and bound him with them, while an ambush was waiting in a room. And she cried, “Samson, the Philistines are upon you!” But he tore them off his arms like a thread.
Transliteration: vatikach deliylah avotiym chadashiym vataaserehu vahem vatomer elayv felishetiym aleykha shimeshvon vehaorev yoshev vechader vayenatekem meal zerootayv khachut

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֨אמֶר דְּלִילָ֜ה אֶל־שִׁמְשׁ֗וֹן עַד־הֵ֜נָּה הֵתַ֤לְתָּ בִּי֙ וַתְּדַבֵּ֤ר אֵלַי֙ כְּזָבִ֔ים הַגִּ֣ידָה לִּ֔י בַּמֶּ֖ה תֵּאָסֵ֑ר וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלֶ֔יהָ אִם־תַּאַרְגִ֗י אֶת־שֶׁ֛בַע מַחְלְפ֥וֹת רֹאשִׁ֖י עִם־הַמַּסָּֽכֶת׃
Translated: Then Delilah said to Samson, “You have been deceiving me all along; you have been lying to me! Tell me, how could you be tied up?” He answered her, “If you weave seven locks of my head into the web.”
Transliteration: vatomer deliylah el-shimeshvon ad-henah hetaleta viy vatedaver elay khezaviym hagiydah liy vameh teaser vayomer eleyha im-taaregiy et-sheva machelefvot roshiy im-hamasakhet

Hebrew: וַתִּתְקַע֙ בַּיָּתֵ֔ד וַתֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלָ֔יו פְּלִשְׁתִּ֥ים עָלֶ֖יךָ שִׁמְשׁ֑וֹן וַיִּיקַץ֙ מִשְּׁנָת֔וֹ וַיִּסַּ֛ע אֶת־הַיְתַ֥ד הָאֶ֖רֶג וְאֶת־הַמַּסָּֽכֶת׃
Translated: And she pinned it with a peg and cried to him, “Samson, the Philistines are upon you!” Awaking from his sleep, he pulled out the peg, the loom, and the web.
Transliteration: vatiteka vayated vatomer elayv felishetiym aleykha shimeshvon vayiykats mishenatvo vayisa et-hayetad haereg veet-hamasakhet

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלָ֗יו אֵ֚יךְ תֹּאמַ֣ר אֲהַבְתִּ֔יךְ וְלִבְּךָ֖ אֵ֣ין אִתִּ֑י זֶ֣ה שָׁלֹ֤שׁ פְּעָמִים֙ הֵתַ֣לְתָּ בִּ֔י וְלֹא־הִגַּ֣דְתָּ לִּ֔י בַּמֶּ֖ה כֹּחֲךָ֥ גָדֽוֹל׃
Translated: Then she said to him, “How can you say you love me, when you don’t confide in me? This makes three times that you’ve deceived me and haven’t told me what makes you so strong.”
Transliteration: vatomer elayv eykhe tomar ahavetiykhe velivekha eyn itiy zeh shalosh feamiym hetaleta viy velo-higadeta liy vameh khochakha gadvol

Hebrew: וַ֠יְהִ֠י כִּֽי־הֵצִ֨יקָה לּ֧וֹ בִדְבָרֶ֛יהָ כׇּל־הַיָּמִ֖ים וַתְּאַֽלְצֵ֑הוּ וַתִּקְצַ֥ר נַפְשׁ֖וֹ לָמֽוּת׃
Translated: Finally, after she had nagged him and pressed him constantly, he was wearied to death
Transliteration: vayehiy khiy-hetsiykah lvo videvareyha khׇl-hayamiym vatealetsehu vatiketsar nafeshvo lamut

Hebrew: וַיַּגֶּד־לָ֣הּ אֶת־כׇּל־לִבּ֗וֹ וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לָהּ֙ מוֹרָה֙ לֹא־עָלָ֣ה עַל־רֹאשִׁ֔י כִּֽי־נְזִ֧יר אֱלֹהִ֛ים אֲנִ֖י מִבֶּ֣טֶן אִמִּ֑י אִם־גֻּלַּ֙חְתִּי֙ וְסָ֣ר מִמֶּ֣נִּי כֹחִ֔י וְחָלִ֥יתִי וְהָיִ֖יתִי כְּכׇל־הָאָדָֽם׃
Translated: and he confided everything to her. He said to her, “No razor has ever touched my head, for I have been a nazirite to God since I was in my mother’s womb. If my hair were cut, my strength would leave me and I should become as weak as an ordinary man.”
Transliteration: vayaged-lah et-khׇl-livvo vayomer lah mvorah lo-alah al-roshiy khiy-neziyr Elohim aniy miveten imiy im-gulachetiy vesar mimeniy khochiy vechaliytiy vehayiytiy khekhׇl-haadam

Hebrew: וַתֵּ֣רֶא דְלִילָ֗ה כִּֽי־הִגִּ֣יד לָהּ֮ אֶת־כׇּל־לִבּוֹ֒ וַתִּשְׁלַ֡ח וַתִּקְרָא֩ לְסַרְנֵ֨י פְלִשְׁתִּ֤ים לֵאמֹר֙ עֲל֣וּ הַפַּ֔עַם כִּֽי־הִגִּ֥יד (לה) [לִ֖י] אֶת־כׇּל־לִבּ֑וֹ וְעָל֤וּ אֵלֶ֙יהָ֙ סַרְנֵ֣י פְלִשְׁתִּ֔ים וַיַּעֲל֥וּ הַכֶּ֖סֶף בְּיָדָֽם׃
Translated: Sensing that he had confided everything to her, Delilah sent for the lords of the Philistines, with this message: “Come up once more, for he has confided everything to me.” And the lords of the Philistines came up and brought the money with them.
Transliteration: vatere deliylah khiy-higiyd lah et-khׇl-livvo vatishelach vatikera lesareney felishetiym lemor alu hafaam khiy-higiyd (lh) [liy] et-khׇl-livvo vealu eleyha sareney felishetiym vayaalu hakhesef veyadam

Hebrew: וַתְּיַשְּׁנֵ֙הוּ֙ עַל־בִּרְכֶּ֔יהָ וַתִּקְרָ֣א לָאִ֔ישׁ וַתְּגַלַּ֕ח אֶת־שֶׁ֖בַע מַחְלְפ֣וֹת רֹאשׁ֑וֹ וַתָּ֙חֶל֙ לְעַנּוֹת֔וֹ וַיָּ֥סַר כֹּח֖וֹ מֵעָלָֽיו׃
Translated: She lulled him to sleep on her lap. Then she called in someone else, and she had him cut off the seven locks of his head; thus she weakened him and made him helpless: his strength slipped away from him.
Transliteration: vateyashenehu al-virekheyha vatikera laiysh vategalach et-sheva machelefvot roshvo vatachel leanvotvo vayasar khochvo mealayv

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֕אמֶר פְּלִשְׁתִּ֥ים עָלֶ֖יךָ שִׁמְשׁ֑וֹן וַיִּקַ֣ץ מִשְּׁנָת֗וֹ וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֵצֵ֞א כְּפַ֤עַם בְּפַ֙עַם֙ וְאִנָּעֵ֔ר וְהוּא֙ לֹ֣א יָדַ֔ע כִּ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה סָ֥ר מֵעָלָֽיו׃
Translated: She cried, “Samson, the Philistines are upon you!” And he awoke from his sleep, thinking he would break loose and shake himself free as he had the other times. For he did not know that G<small>OD</small> had departed from him.
Transliteration: vatomer felishetiym aleykha shimeshvon vayikats mishenatvo vayomer etse khefaam vefaam veinaer vehu lo yada khiy yehovah sar mealayv

Hebrew: וַיֹּאחֲז֣וּהוּ פְלִשְׁתִּ֔ים וַֽיְנַקְּר֖וּ אֶת־עֵינָ֑יו וַיּוֹרִ֨ידוּ אוֹת֜וֹ עַזָּ֗תָה וַיַּאַסְר֙וּהוּ֙ בַּֽנְחֻשְׁתַּ֔יִם וַיְהִ֥י טוֹחֵ֖ן בְּבֵ֥ית (האסירים) [הָאֲסוּרִֽים]׃
Translated: The Philistines seized him and gouged out his eyes. They brought him down to Gaza and shackled him in bronze fetters, and he became a mill slave in the prison.
Transliteration: vayochazuhu felishetiym vayenakeru et-eynayv vayyvoriydu votvo azatah vayaaseruhu vanechushetayiim vayehiy tvochen veveyt (hsyrym) [haasuriym]

Hebrew: וַיָּ֧חֶל שְׂעַר־רֹאשׁ֛וֹ לְצַמֵּ֖חַ כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר גֻּלָּֽח׃ {פ}
Translated: After his hair was cut off, it began to grow back.
Transliteration: vayachel shear-roshvo letsamecha khaasher gulach {f}

Hebrew: וְסַרְנֵ֣י פְלִשְׁתִּ֗ים נֶֽאֶסְפוּ֙ לִזְבֹּ֧חַ זֶבַח־גָּד֛וֹל לְדָג֥וֹן אֱלֹהֵיהֶ֖ם וּלְשִׂמְחָ֑ה וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ נָתַ֤ן אֱלֹהֵ֙ינוּ֙ בְּיָדֵ֔נוּ אֵ֖ת שִׁמְשׁ֥וֹן אוֹיְבֵֽנוּ׃
Translated:
Now the lords of the Philistines gathered to offer a great sacrifice to their god Dagon and to make merry. They chanted,
“Our god has delivered into our hands
Our enemy Samson.”
Transliteration: vesareney felishetiym neesefu lizevocha zevach-gadvol ledagvon eloheyhem uleshimechah vayomeru natan eloheynu veyadenu et shimeshvon voyevenu

Hebrew: וַיִּרְא֤וּ אֹתוֹ֙ הָעָ֔ם וַֽיְהַלְל֖וּ אֶת־אֱלֹהֵיהֶ֑ם כִּ֣י אָמְר֗וּ נָתַ֨ן אֱלֹהֵ֤ינוּ בְיָדֵ֙נוּ֙ אֶת־א֣וֹיְבֵ֔נוּ וְאֵת֙ מַחֲרִ֣יב אַרְצֵ֔נוּ וַאֲשֶׁ֥ר הִרְבָּ֖ה אֶת־חֲלָלֵֽינוּ׃
Translated:
When the people saw him, they sang praises to their god, chanting,
“Our god has delivered into our hands
The enemy who devastated our land,
And who slew so many of us.”
Transliteration: vayireu otvo haam vayehalelu et-eloheyhem khiy ameru natan eloheynu veyadenu et-voyevenu veet machariyv aretsenu vaasher hirevah et-chalaleynu

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ (כי טוב) [כְּט֣וֹב] לִבָּ֔ם וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ קִרְא֥וּ לְשִׁמְשׁ֖וֹן וִישַֽׂחֶק־לָ֑נוּ וַיִּקְרְא֨וּ לְשִׁמְשׁ֜וֹן מִבֵּ֣ית (האסירים) [הָאֲסוּרִ֗ים] וַיְצַחֵק֙ לִפְנֵיהֶ֔ם וַיַּעֲמִ֥ידוּ אוֹת֖וֹ בֵּ֥ין הָעַמּוּדִֽים׃
Translated: As their spirits rose, they said, “Call Samson here and let him dance for us.” Samson was fetched from the prison, and he danced for them. Then they put him between the pillars.
Transliteration: vayehiy (khy tvv) [khetvov] livam vayomeru kireu leshimeshvon viyshachek-lanu vayikereu leshimeshvon miveyt (hsyrym) [haasuriym] vayetsachek lifeneyhem vayaamiydu votvo veyn haamudiym

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר שִׁמְשׁ֜וֹן אֶל־הַנַּ֨עַר הַמַּחֲזִ֣יק בְּיָדוֹ֮ הַנִּ֣יחָה אוֹתִי֒ (והימשני) [וַהֲמִישֵׁ֙נִי֙] אֶת־הָֽעַמֻּדִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר הַבַּ֖יִת נָכ֣וֹן עֲלֵיהֶ֑ם וְאֶשָּׁעֵ֖ן עֲלֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: And Samson said to the boy who was leading him by the hand, “Let go of me and let me feel the pillars that the temple rests upon, that I may lean on them.”
Transliteration: vayomer shimeshvon el-hanaar hamachaziyk veyadvo haniychah votiy (vhymshny) [vahamiysheniy] et-haamudiym asher havayiit nakhvon aleyhem veeshaen aleyhem

Hebrew: וְהַבַּ֗יִת מָלֵ֤א הָאֲנָשִׁים֙ וְהַנָּשִׁ֔ים וְשָׁ֕מָּה כֹּ֖ל סַרְנֵ֣י פְלִשְׁתִּ֑ים וְעַל־הַגָּ֗ג כִּשְׁלֹ֤שֶׁת אֲלָפִים֙ אִ֣ישׁ וְאִשָּׁ֔ה הָרֹאִ֖ים בִּשְׂח֥וֹק שִׁמְשֽׁוֹן׃
Translated: Now the temple was full of men and women; all the lords of the Philistines were there, and there were some three thousand men and women on the roof watching Samson dance.
Transliteration: vehavayiit male haanashiym vehanashiym veshamah khol sareney felishetiym veal-hagag khisheloshet alafiym iysh veishah haroiym vishechvok shimeshvon

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֥א שִׁמְשׁ֛וֹן אֶל־יְהֹוָ֖ה וַיֹּאמַ֑ר אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֡ה זׇכְרֵ֣נִי נָא֩ וְחַזְּקֵ֨נִי נָ֜א אַ֣ךְ הַפַּ֤עַם הַזֶּה֙ הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים וְאִנָּקְמָ֧ה נְקַם־אַחַ֛ת מִשְּׁתֵ֥י עֵינַ֖י מִפְּלִשְׁתִּֽים׃
Translated: Then Samson called to G<small>OD</small>, “O Sovereign G<small>OD</small>! Please remember me, and give me strength just this once, O God, to take revenge of the Philistines, if only for one of my two eyes.”
Transliteration: vayikera shimeshvon el-yehovah vayomar adonay yehovih zׇkhereniy na vechazekeniy na akhe hafaam hazeh haElohim veinakemah nekam-achat mishetey eynay mifelishetiym

Hebrew: וַיִּלְפֹּ֨ת שִׁמְשׁ֜וֹן אֶת־שְׁנֵ֣י ׀ עַמּוּדֵ֣י הַתָּ֗וֶךְ אֲשֶׁ֤ר הַבַּ֙יִת֙ נָכ֣וֹן עֲלֵיהֶ֔ם וַיִּסָּמֵ֖ךְ עֲלֵיהֶ֑ם אֶחָ֥ד בִּימִינ֖וֹ וְאֶחָ֥ד בִּשְׂמֹאלֽוֹ׃
Translated: He embraced the two middle pillars that the temple rested upon, one with his right arm and one with his left, and leaned against them;
Transliteration: vayilefot shimeshvon et-sheney amudey hatavekhe asher havayiit nakhvon aleyhem vayisamekhe aleyhem echad viymiynvo veechad vishemolvo

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר שִׁמְשׁ֗וֹן תָּמ֣וֹת נַפְשִׁי֮ עִם־פְּלִשְׁתִּים֒ וַיֵּ֣ט בְּכֹ֔חַ וַיִּפֹּ֤ל הַבַּ֙יִת֙ עַל־הַסְּרָנִ֔ים וְעַל־כׇּל־הָעָ֖ם אֲשֶׁר־בּ֑וֹ וַיִּהְי֤וּ הַמֵּתִים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הֵמִ֣ית בְּמוֹת֔וֹ רַבִּ֕ים מֵאֲשֶׁ֥ר הֵמִ֖ית בְּחַיָּֽיו׃
Translated: Samson cried, “Let me die with the Philistines!” and he pulled with all his might. The temple came crashing down on the lords and on all the people in it. Those who were slain by him as he died outnumbered those who had been slain by him when he lived.
Transliteration: vayomer shimeshvon tamvot nafeshiy im-felishetiym vayet vekhocha vayifol havayiit al-haseraniym veal-khׇl-haam asher-vvo vayiheyu hametiym asher hemiyt vemvotvo raviym measher hemiyt vechayayv

Hebrew: וַיֵּרְד֨וּ אֶחָ֜יו וְכׇל־בֵּ֣ית אָבִ֘יהוּ֮ וַיִּשְׂא֣וּ אֹתוֹ֒ וַֽיַּעֲל֣וּ ׀ וַיִּקְבְּר֣וּ אוֹת֗וֹ בֵּ֤ין צׇרְעָה֙ וּבֵ֣ין אֶשְׁתָּאֹ֔ל בְּקֶ֖בֶר מָנ֣וֹחַ אָבִ֑יו וְה֛וּא שָׁפַ֥ט אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל עֶשְׂרִ֥ים שָׁנָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: His brothers and all his father’s household came down and carried him up and buried him in the tomb of his father Manoah, between Zorah and Eshtaol. He had led Israel for twenty years.
Transliteration: vayeredu echayv vekhׇl-veyt aviyhu vayisheu otvo vayaalu vayikeveru votvo veyn tsׇreah uveyn eshetaol vekever manvocha aviyv vehu shafat et-yisherael esheriym shanah {f}

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי־אִ֥ישׁ מֵהַר־אֶפְרָ֖יִם וּשְׁמ֥וֹ מִיכָֽיְהוּ׃
Translated: There was a man in the hill country of Ephraim whose name was Micah.
Transliteration: vayehiy-iysh mehar-eferayiim ushemvo miykhayehu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לְאִמּ֡וֹ אֶ֩לֶף֩ וּמֵאָ֨ה הַכֶּ֜סֶף אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֻֽקַּֽח־לָ֗ךְ (ואתי) [וְאַ֤תְּ] אָלִית֙ וְגַם֙ אָמַ֣רְתְּ בְּאׇזְנַ֔י הִנֵּה־הַכֶּ֥סֶף אִתִּ֖י אֲנִ֣י לְקַחְתִּ֑יו וַתֹּ֣אמֶר אִמּ֔וֹ בָּר֥וּךְ בְּנִ֖י לַיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: He said to his mother, “The eleven hundred shekels of silver that were taken from you, so that you uttered an imprecation that you repeated in my hearing—I have that silver; I took it.” “Blessed of G<small>OD</small> be my son,” said his mother.
Transliteration: vayomer leimvo elef umeah hakhesef asher lukach-lakhe (vty) [veate] aliyt vegam amarete veׇzenay hineh-hakhesef itiy aniy lekachetiyv vatomer imvo varukhe veniy layhovah

Hebrew: וַיָּ֛שֶׁב אֶת־אֶלֶף־וּמֵאָ֥ה הַכֶּ֖סֶף לְאִמּ֑וֹ וַתֹּ֣אמֶר אִמּ֡וֹ הַקְדֵּ֣שׁ הִקְדַּ֣שְׁתִּי אֶת־הַכֶּ֩סֶף֩ לַיהֹוָ֨ה מִיָּדִ֜י לִבְנִ֗י לַֽעֲשׂוֹת֙ פֶּ֣סֶל וּמַסֵּכָ֔ה וְעַתָּ֖ה אֲשִׁיבֶ֥נּוּ לָֽךְ׃
Translated: He returned the eleven hundred shekels of silver to his mother; but his mother said, “I herewith consecrate the silver to G<small>OD</small>, transferring it to my son to make a sculptured image and a molten image. I now return it to you.”
Transliteration: vayashev et-elef-umeah hakhesef leimvo vatomer imvo hakedesh hikedashetiy et-hakhesef layhovah miyadiy liveniy laashvot fesel umasekhah veatah ashiyvenu lakhe

Hebrew: וַיָּ֥שֶׁב אֶת־הַכֶּ֖סֶף לְאִמּ֑וֹ וַתִּקַּ֣ח אִמּוֹ֩ מָאתַ֨יִם כֶּ֜סֶף וַתִּתְּנֵ֣הוּ לַצּוֹרֵ֗ף וַֽיַּעֲשֵׂ֙הוּ֙ פֶּ֣סֶל וּמַסֵּכָ֔ה וַֽיְהִ֖י בְּבֵ֥ית מִיכָֽיְהוּ׃
Translated: So when he gave the silver back to his mother, his mother took two hundred shekels of silver and gave it to a smith. He made of it a sculptured image and a molten image, which were kept in the house of Micah.
Transliteration: vayashev et-hakhesef leimvo vatikach imvo matayiim khesef vatitenehu latsvoref vayaashehu fesel umasekhah vayehiy veveyt miykhayehu

Hebrew: וְהָאִ֣ישׁ מִיכָ֔ה ל֖וֹ בֵּ֣ית אֱלֹהִ֑ים וַיַּ֤עַשׂ אֵפוֹד֙ וּתְרָפִ֔ים וַיְמַלֵּ֗א אֶת־יַ֤ד אַחַד֙ מִבָּנָ֔יו וַֽיְהִי־ל֖וֹ לְכֹהֵֽן׃
Translated: Now this man Micah had a house of God; he had made an ephod and oracle idols and he had inducted one of his sons to be his priest.
Transliteration: vehaiysh miykhah lvo veyt Elohim vayaash efvod uterafiym vayemale et-yad achad mivanayv vayehiy-lvo lekhohen

Hebrew: בַּיָּמִ֣ים הָהֵ֔ם אֵ֥ין מֶ֖לֶךְ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אִ֛ישׁ הַיָּשָׁ֥ר בְּעֵינָ֖יו יַעֲשֶֽׂה׃ {פ}
Translated: In those days there was no king in Israel; everyone did as they pleased.
Transliteration: vayamiym hahem eyn melekhe veyisherael iysh hayashar veeynayv yaasheh {f}

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי־נַ֗עַר מִבֵּ֥ית לֶ֙חֶם֙ יְהוּדָ֔ה מִמִּשְׁפַּ֖חַת יְהוּדָ֑ה וְה֥וּא לֵוִ֖י וְה֥וּא גָֽר־שָֽׁם׃
Translated: There was a young man from Bethlehem of Judah, from the clan seat of Judah; he was a Levite and had resided there as a sojourner.
Transliteration: vayehiy-naar miveyt lechem yehudah mimishefachat yehudah vehu leviy vehu gar-sham

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֨לֶךְ הָאִ֜ישׁ מֵהָעִ֗יר מִבֵּ֥ית לֶ֙חֶם֙ יְהוּדָ֔ה לָג֖וּר בַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר יִמְצָ֑א וַיָּבֹ֧א הַר־אֶפְרַ֛יִם עַד־בֵּ֥ית מִיכָ֖ה לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת דַּרְכּֽוֹ׃
Translated: This man had left the town of Bethlehem of Judah to take up residence wherever he could find a place. On his way, he came to the house of Micah in the hill country of Ephraim.
Transliteration: vayelekhe haiysh mehaiyr miveyt lechem yehudah lagur vaasher yimetsa vayavo har-eferayiim ad-veyt miykhah laashvot darekhvo

Hebrew: וַיֹּֽאמֶר־ל֥וֹ מִיכָ֖ה מֵאַ֣יִן תָּב֑וֹא וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֵלָ֜יו לֵוִ֣י אָנֹ֗כִי מִבֵּ֥ית לֶ֙חֶם֙ יְהוּדָ֔ה וְאָנֹכִ֣י הֹלֵ֔ךְ לָג֖וּר בַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר אֶמְצָֽא׃
Translated: “Where do you come from?” Micah asked him. He replied, “I am a Levite from Bethlehem of Judah, and I am traveling to take up residence wherever I can find a place.”
Transliteration: vayomer-lvo miykhah meayiin tavvo vayomer elayv leviy anokhiy miveyt lechem yehudah veanokhiy holekhe lagur vaasher emetsa

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֩אמֶר֩ ל֨וֹ מִיכָ֜ה שְׁבָ֣ה עִמָּדִ֗י וֶֽהְיֵה־לִי֮ לְאָ֣ב וּלְכֹהֵן֒ וְאָנֹכִ֨י אֶֽתֶּן־לְךָ֜ עֲשֶׂ֤רֶת כֶּ֙סֶף֙ לַיָּמִ֔ים וְעֵ֥רֶךְ בְּגָדִ֖ים וּמִחְיָתֶ֑ךָ וַיֵּ֖לֶךְ הַלֵּוִֽי׃
Translated: “Stay with me,” Micah said to him, “and be a father and a priest to me, and I will pay you ten shekels of silver a year, an allowance of clothing, and your food.” The Levite went.
Transliteration: vayomer lvo miykhah shevah imadiy veheeih-liy leav ulekhohen veanokhiy eten-lekha asheret khesef layamiym veerekhe vegadiym umicheyatekha vayelekhe haleviy

Hebrew: וַיּ֥וֹאֶל הַלֵּוִ֖י לָשֶׁ֣בֶת אֶת־הָאִ֑ישׁ וַיְהִ֤י הַנַּ֙עַר֙ ל֔וֹ כְּאַחַ֖ד מִבָּנָֽיו׃
Translated: The Levite agreed to stay with the man, and the youth became like one of his own sons.
Transliteration: vayyvoel haleviy lashevet et-haiysh vayehiy hanaar lvo kheachad mivanayv

Hebrew: וַיְמַלֵּ֤א מִיכָה֙ אֶת־יַ֣ד הַלֵּוִ֔י וַֽיְהִי־ל֥וֹ הַנַּ֖עַר לְכֹהֵ֑ן וַיְהִ֖י בְּבֵ֥ית מִיכָֽה׃
Translated: Micah inducted the Levite, and the young man became his priest and remained in Micah’s shrine.
Transliteration: vayemale miykhah et-yad haleviy vayehiy-lvo hanaar lekhohen vayehiy veveyt miykhah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר מִיכָ֔ה עַתָּ֣ה יָדַ֔עְתִּי כִּֽי־יֵיטִ֥יב יְהֹוָ֖ה לִ֑י כִּ֧י הָֽיָה־לִ֛י הַלֵּוִ֖י לְכֹהֵֽן׃ {פ}
Translated: “Now I know,” Micah told himself, “that G<small>OD</small> will make me prosper, since the Levite has become my priest.”
Transliteration: vayomer miykhah atah yadaetiy khiy-eiytiyv yehovah liy khiy hayah-liy haleviy lekhohen {f}

Hebrew: בַּיָּמִ֣ים הָהֵ֔ם אֵ֥ין מֶ֖לֶךְ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וּבַיָּמִ֣ים הָהֵ֗ם שֵׁ֣בֶט הַדָּנִ֞י מְבַקֶּשׁ־ל֤וֹ נַֽחֲלָה֙ לָשֶׁ֔בֶת כִּי֩ לֹא־נָ֨פְלָה לּ֜וֹ עַד־הַיּ֥וֹם הַה֛וּא בְּתוֹךְ־שִׁבְטֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בְּנַחֲלָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: In those days there was no king in Israel, and in those days the tribe of Dan was seeking a territory in which to settle; for to that day no territory had fallen to their lot among the tribes of Israel.
Transliteration: vayamiym hahem eyn melekhe veyisherael uvayamiym hahem shevet hadaniy mevakesh-lvo nachalah lashevet khiy lo-nafelah lvo ad-hayyvom hahu vetvokhe-shivetey yisherael venachalah {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלְח֣וּ בְנֵי־דָ֣ן <small>׀</small> מִֽמִּשְׁפַּחְתָּ֡ם חֲמִשָּׁ֣ה אֲנָשִׁ֣ים מִקְצוֹתָם֩ אֲנָשִׁ֨ים בְּנֵי־חַ֜יִל מִצׇּרְעָ֣ה וּמֵאֶשְׁתָּאֹ֗ל לְרַגֵּ֤ל אֶת־הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ וּלְחׇקְרָ֔הּ וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ אֲלֵהֶ֔ם לְכ֖וּ חִקְר֣וּ אֶת־הָאָ֑רֶץ וַיָּבֹ֤אוּ הַר־אֶפְרַ֙יִם֙ עַד־בֵּ֣ית מִיכָ֔ה וַיָּלִ֖ינוּ שָֽׁם׃
Translated: The Danites sent out five of their number, from their clan seat at Zorah and Eshtaol—valiant men—to spy out the land and explore it. “Go,” they told them, “and explore the land.” When they had advanced into the hill country of Ephraim as far as the house of Micah, they stopped there for the night.
Transliteration: vayishelechu veney-dan <small></small> mimishefachetam chamishah anashiym miketsvotam anashiym veney-chayiil mitsׇreah umeeshetaol leragel et-haarets ulechׇkerah vayomeru alehem lekhu chikeru et-haarets vayavou har-eferayiim ad-veyt miykhah vayaliynu sham

Hebrew: הֵ֚מָּה עִם־בֵּ֣ית מִיכָ֔ה וְהֵ֣מָּה הִכִּ֔ירוּ אֶת־ק֥וֹל הַנַּ֖עַר הַלֵּוִ֑י וַיָּס֣וּרוּ שָׁ֗ם וַיֹּ֤אמְרוּ לוֹ֙ מִֽי־הֱבִיאֲךָ֣ הֲלֹ֔ם וּמָה־אַתָּ֥ה עֹשֶׂ֛ה בָּזֶ֖ה וּמַה־לְּךָ֥ פֹֽה׃
Translated: While in the vicinity of Micah’s house, they recognized the speech of the young Levite, so they went over and asked him, “Who brought you to these parts? What are you doing in this place? What is your business here?”
Transliteration: hemah im-veyt miykhah vehemah hikhiyru et-kvol hanaar haleviy vayasuru sham vayomeru lvo miy-heviyakha halom umah-atah osheh vazeh umah-lekha foh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֔ם כָּזֹ֣ה וְכָזֶ֔ה עָ֥שָׂה לִ֖י מִיכָ֑ה וַיִּשְׂכְּרֵ֕נִי וָאֱהִי־ל֖וֹ לְכֹהֵֽן׃
Translated: He replied, “Thus and thus Micah did for me—he hired me and I became his priest.”
Transliteration: vayomer alehem khazoh vekhazeh ashah liy miykhah vayishekhereniy vaehiy-lvo lekhohen

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמְרוּ ל֖וֹ שְׁאַל־נָ֣א בֵאלֹהִ֑ים וְנֵ֣דְעָ֔ה הֲתַצְלִ֣חַ דַּרְכֵּ֔נוּ אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֲנַ֖חְנוּ הֹלְכִ֥ים עָלֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: They said to him, “Please, inquire of God; we would like to know if the mission on which we are going will be successful.”
Transliteration: vayomeru lvo sheal-na velohiym venedeah hatatselicha darekhenu asher anachenu holekhiym aleyha

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֧אמֶר לָהֶ֛ם הַכֹּהֵ֖ן לְכ֣וּ לְשָׁל֑וֹם נֹ֣כַח יְהֹוָ֔ה דַּרְכְּכֶ֖ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר תֵּלְכוּ־בָֽהּ׃ {פ}
Translated: “Go in peace,” the priest said to them, “G<small>OD</small> views with favor the mission you are going on.”
Transliteration: vayomer lahem hakhohen lekhu leshalvom nokhach yehovah darekhekhem asher telekhu-vah {f}

Hebrew: וַיֵּֽלְכוּ֙ חֲמֵ֣שֶׁת הָאֲנָשִׁ֔ים וַיָּבֹ֖אוּ לָ֑יְשָׁה וַיִּרְא֣וּ אֶת־הָעָ֣ם אֲשֶׁר־בְּקִרְבָּ֣הּ יוֹשֶֽׁבֶת־לָ֠בֶ֠טַח כְּמִשְׁפַּ֨ט צִדֹנִ֜ים שֹׁקֵ֣ט ׀ וּבֹטֵ֗חַ וְאֵין־מַכְלִ֨ים דָּבָ֤ר בָּאָ֙רֶץ֙ יוֹרֵ֣שׁ עֶ֔צֶר וּרְחוֹקִ֥ים הֵ֙מָּה֙ מִצִּ֣ידֹנִ֔ים וְדָבָ֥ר אֵין־לָהֶ֖ם עִם־אָדָֽם׃
Translated: The five men went on and came to Laish. They observed the people in it dwelling carefree, after the manner of the Sidonians, a tranquil and unsuspecting people, with no one in the land to molest them and with no hereditary ruler. Moreover, they were distant from the Sidonians and had no dealings with anybody.
Transliteration: vayelekhu chameshet haanashiym vayavou layeshah vayireu et-haam asher-vekirevah yvoshevet-lavetach khemishefat tsidoniym shoket uvotecha veeyn-makheliym davar vaarets yvoresh etser urechvokiym hemah mitsiydoniym vedavar eyn-lahem im-adam

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֙אוּ֙ אֶל־אֲחֵיהֶ֔ם צׇרְעָ֖ה וְאֶשְׁתָּאֹ֑ל וַיֹּאמְר֥וּ לָהֶ֛ם אֲחֵיהֶ֖ם מָ֥ה אַתֶּֽם׃
Translated: When [the spies] came back to their clans at Zorah and Eshtaol, their fellows asked them, “How did you fare?”
Transliteration: vayavou el-acheyhem tsׇreah veeshetaol vayomeru lahem acheyhem mah atem

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֗וּ ק֚וּמָה וְנַעֲלֶ֣ה עֲלֵיהֶ֔ם כִּ֤י רָאִ֙ינוּ֙ אֶת־הָאָ֔רֶץ וְהִנֵּ֥ה טוֹבָ֖ה מְאֹ֑ד וְאַתֶּ֣ם מַחְשִׁ֔ים אַל־תֵּעָ֣צְל֔וּ לָלֶ֥כֶת לָבֹ֖א לָרֶ֥שֶׁת אֶת־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: They replied, “Let us go at once and attack them! For we found that the land was very good, and you are sitting idle! Don’t delay; go and invade the land and take possession of it,
Transliteration: vayomeru kumah venaaleh aleyhem khiy raiynu et-haarets vehineh tvovah meod veatem macheshiym al-teatselu lalekhet lavo lareshet et-haarets

Hebrew: כְּבֹאֲכֶ֞ם תָּבֹ֣אוּ ׀ אֶל־עַ֣ם בֹּטֵ֗חַ וְהָאָ֙רֶץ֙ רַחֲבַ֣ת יָדַ֔יִם כִּֽי־נְתָנָ֥הּ אֱלֹהִ֖ים בְּיֶדְכֶ֑ם מָקוֹם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אֵֽין־שָׁ֣ם מַחְס֔וֹר כׇּל־דָּבָ֖ר אֲשֶׁ֥ר בָּאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: for God has delivered it into your hand. When you come, you will come to an unsuspecting people; and the land is spacious and nothing on earth is lacking there.”
Transliteration: khevoakhem tavou el-am votecha vehaarets rachavat yadayiim khiy-netanah Elohim veyedekhem makvom asher eyn-sham machesvor khׇl-davar asher vaarets

Hebrew: וַיִּסְע֤וּ מִשָּׁם֙ מִמִּשְׁפַּ֣חַת הַדָּנִ֔י מִצׇּרְעָ֖ה וּמֵאֶשְׁתָּאֹ֑ל שֵֽׁשׁ־מֵא֣וֹת אִ֔ישׁ חָג֖וּר כְּלֵ֥י מִלְחָמָֽה׃
Translated: They departed from there, from the clan seat of the Danites, from Zorah and Eshtaol, six hundred strong, girt with weapons of war.
Transliteration: vayiseu misham mimishefachat hadaniy mitsׇreah umeeshetaol shesh-mevot iysh chagur kheley milechamah

Hebrew: וַֽיַּעֲל֗וּ וַֽיַּחֲנ֛וּ בְּקִרְיַ֥ת יְעָרִ֖ים בִּֽיהוּדָ֑ה עַל־כֵּ֡ן קָרְאוּ֩ לַמָּק֨וֹם הַה֜וּא מַחֲנֵה־דָ֗ן עַ֚ד הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֔ה הִנֵּ֕ה אַחֲרֵ֖י קִרְיַ֥ת יְעָרִֽים׃
Translated: They went up and encamped at Kiriath-jearim in Judah. That is why that place is called “the Camp of Dan” to this day; it lies west of Kiriath-jearim.
Transliteration: vayaalu vayachanu vekireyat yeariym viyhudah al-khen kareu lamakvom hahu machaneh-dan ad hayyvom hazeh hineh acharey kireyat yeariym

Hebrew: וַיַּעַבְר֥וּ מִשָּׁ֖ם הַר־אֶפְרָ֑יִם וַיָּבֹ֖אוּ עַד־בֵּ֥ית מִיכָֽה׃
Translated: From there they passed on to the hill country of Ephraim and arrived at the house of Micah.
Transliteration: vayaaveru misham har-eferayiim vayavou ad-veyt miykhah

Hebrew: וַֽיַּעֲנ֞וּ חֲמֵ֣שֶׁת הָאֲנָשִׁ֗ים הַהֹלְכִים֮ לְרַגֵּל֮ אֶת־הָאָ֣רֶץ לַ֒יִשׁ֒ וַיֹּֽאמְרוּ֙ אֶל־אֲחֵיהֶ֔ם הַיְדַעְתֶּ֗ם כִּ֠י יֵ֣שׁ בַּבָּתִּ֤ים הָאֵ֙לֶּה֙ אֵפ֣וֹד וּתְרָפִ֔ים וּפֶ֖סֶל וּמַסֵּכָ֑ה וְעַתָּ֖ה דְּע֥וּ מַֽה־תַּעֲשֽׂוּ׃
Translated: Here the five men who had gone to spy out the Laish region remarked to their clans, “Do you know, there is an ephod in these houses, and oracle idols, and a sculptured image and a molten image? Now you know what you have to do.”
Transliteration: vayaanu chameshet haanashiym haholekhiym leragel et-haarets layiish vayomeru el-acheyhem hayedaetem khiy eish vavatiym haeleh efvod uterafiym ufesel umasekhah veatah deu mah-taashu

Hebrew: וַיָּס֣וּרוּ שָׁ֔מָּה וַיָּבֹ֛אוּ אֶל־בֵּֽית־הַנַּ֥עַר הַלֵּוִ֖י בֵּ֣ית מִיכָ֑ה וַיִּשְׁאֲלוּ־ל֖וֹ לְשָׁלֽוֹם׃
Translated: So they turned off there and entered the home of the young Levite at Micah’s house and greeted him.
Transliteration: vayasuru shamah vayavou el-veyt-hanaar haleviy veyt miykhah vayishealu-lvo leshalvom

Hebrew: וְשֵׁשׁ־מֵא֣וֹת אִ֗ישׁ חֲגוּרִים֙ כְּלֵ֣י מִלְחַמְתָּ֔ם נִצָּבִ֖ים פֶּ֣תַח הַשָּׁ֑עַר אֲשֶׁ֖ר מִבְּנֵי־דָֽן׃
Translated: The six hundred Danites, girt with their weapons of war, stood at the entrance of the gate,
Transliteration: veshesh-mevot iysh chaguriym kheley milechametam nitsaviym fetach hashaar asher miveney-dan

Hebrew: וַֽיַּעֲל֞וּ חֲמֵ֣שֶׁת הָאֲנָשִׁ֗ים הַהֹלְכִים֮ לְרַגֵּ֣ל אֶת־הָאָ֒רֶץ֒ בָּ֣אוּ שָׁ֔מָּה לָקְח֗וּ אֶת־הַפֶּ֙סֶל֙ וְאֶת־הָ֣אֵפ֔וֹד וְאֶת־הַתְּרָפִ֖ים וְאֶת־הַמַּסֵּכָ֑ה וְהַכֹּהֵ֗ן נִצָּב֙ פֶּ֣תַח הַשַּׁ֔עַר וְשֵׁשׁ־מֵא֣וֹת הָאִ֔ישׁ הֶחָג֖וּר כְּלֵ֥י הַמִּלְחָמָֽה׃
Translated: while the five who had gone to spy out the land went inside and took the sculptured image, the ephod, the oracle idols, and the molten image. The priest was standing at the entrance of the gate, and the six hundred men girt with their weapons of war,
Transliteration: vayaalu chameshet haanashiym haholekhiym leragel et-haarets vau shamah lakechu et-hafesel veet-haefvod veet-haterafiym veet-hamasekhah vehakhohen nitsav fetach hashaar veshesh-mevot haiysh hechagur kheley hamilechamah

Hebrew: וְאֵ֗לֶּה בָּ֚אוּ בֵּ֣ית מִיכָ֔ה וַיִּקְחוּ֙ אֶת־פֶּ֣סֶל הָאֵפ֔וֹד וְאֶת־הַתְּרָפִ֖ים וְאֶת־הַמַּסֵּכָ֑ה וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֲלֵיהֶם֙ הַכֹּהֵ֔ן מָ֥ה אַתֶּ֖ם עֹשִֽׂים׃
Translated: while the others entered Micah’s house and took the sculptured image, the molten image, the ephod, and the oracle idols. The priest said to them, “What are you doing?”
Transliteration: veeleh vau veyt miykhah vayikechu et-fesel haefvod veet-haterafiym veet-hamasekhah vayomer aleyhem hakhohen mah atem oshiym

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֩אמְרוּ֩ ל֨וֹ הַחֲרֵ֜שׁ שִֽׂים־יָדְךָ֤ עַל־פִּ֙יךָ֙ וְלֵ֣ךְ עִמָּ֔נוּ וֶהְיֵה־לָ֖נוּ לְאָ֣ב וּלְכֹהֵ֑ן הֲט֣וֹב ׀ הֱיוֹתְךָ֣ כֹהֵ֗ן לְבֵית֙ אִ֣ישׁ אֶחָ֔ד א֚וֹ הֱיוֹתְךָ֣ כֹהֵ֔ן לְשֵׁ֥בֶט וּלְמִשְׁפָּחָ֖ה בְּיִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: But they said to him, “Be quiet; put your hand on your mouth! Come with us and be our father and priest. Would you rather be priest to one man’s household, or be priest to a tribe and clan in Israel?”
Transliteration: vayomeru lvo hacharesh shiym-yadekha al-fiykha velekhe imanu veheeih-lanu leav ulekhohen hatvov heyvotekha khohen leveyt iysh echad vo heyvotekha khohen leshevet ulemishefachah veyisherael

Hebrew: וַיִּיטַב֙ לֵ֣ב הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וַיִּקַּח֙ אֶת־הָ֣אֵפ֔וֹד וְאֶת־הַתְּרָפִ֖ים וְאֶת־הַפָּ֑סֶל וַיָּבֹ֖א בְּקֶ֥רֶב הָעָֽם׃
Translated: The priest was delighted. He took the ephod, the oracle idols, and the sculptured image, and he joined the people.
Transliteration: vayiytav lev hakhohen vayikach et-haefvod veet-haterafiym veet-hafasel vayavo vekerev haam

Hebrew: וַיִּפְנ֖וּ וַיֵּלֵ֑כוּ וַיָּשִׂ֜ימוּ אֶת־הַטַּ֧ף וְאֶת־הַמִּקְנֶ֛ה וְאֶת־הַכְּבוּדָּ֖ה לִפְנֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: They set out again, placing the children, the cattle, and their household goods in front.
Transliteration: vayifenu vayelekhu vayashiymu et-hataf veet-hamikeneh veet-hakhevudah lifeneyhem

Hebrew: הֵ֥מָּה הִרְחִ֖יקוּ מִבֵּ֣ית מִיכָ֑ה וְהָאֲנָשִׁ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֤ר בַּבָּתִּים֙ אֲשֶׁר֙ עִם־בֵּ֣ית מִיכָ֔ה נִֽזְעֲק֔וּ וַיַּדְבִּ֖יקוּ אֶת־בְּנֵי־דָֽן׃
Translated: They had already gone some distance from Micah’s house, when Micah’s neighbors mustered and caught up with the Danites.
Transliteration: hemah hirechiyku miveyt miykhah vehaanashiym asher vavatiym asher im-veyt miykhah nizeaku vayadeviyku et-veney-dan

Hebrew: וַֽיִּקְרְאוּ֙ אֶל־בְּנֵי־דָ֔ן וַיַּסֵּ֖בּוּ פְּנֵיהֶ֑ם וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ לְמִיכָ֔ה מַה־לְּךָ֖ כִּ֥י נִזְעָֽקְתָּ׃
Translated: They called out to the Danites, who turned around and said to Micah, “What’s the matter? Why have you mustered?”
Transliteration: vayikereu el-veney-dan vayasevu feneyhem vayomeru lemiykhah mah-lekha khiy nizeaketa

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֡אמֶר אֶת־אֱלֹהַי֩ אֲשֶׁר־עָשִׂ֨יתִי לְקַחְתֶּ֧ם וְֽאֶת־הַכֹּהֵ֛ן וַתֵּלְכ֖וּ וּמַה־לִּ֣י ע֑וֹד וּמַה־זֶּ֛ה תֹּאמְר֥וּ אֵלַ֖י מַה־לָּֽךְ׃
Translated: He said, “You have taken my priest and the gods that I made, and walked off! What do I have left? How can you ask, ‘What’s the matter’?”
Transliteration: vayomer et-elohay asher-ashiytiy lekachetem veet-hakhohen vatelekhu umah-liy vod umah-zeh tomeru elay mah-lakhe

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֤וּ אֵלָיו֙ בְּנֵי־דָ֔ן אַל־תַּשְׁמַ֥ע קוֹלְךָ֖ עִמָּ֑נוּ פֶּֽן־יִפְגְּע֣וּ בָכֶ֗ם אֲנָשִׁים֙ מָ֣רֵי נֶ֔פֶשׁ וְאָסַפְתָּ֥ה נַפְשְׁךָ֖ וְנֶ֥פֶשׁ בֵּיתֶֽךָ׃
Translated: But the Danites replied, “Don’t do any shouting at us, or some desperate party might attack you, and you and your family would lose your lives.”
Transliteration: vayomeru elayv veney-dan al-tashema kvolekha imanu fen-yifegeu vakhem anashiym marey nefesh veasafetah nafeshekha venefesh veytekha

Hebrew: וַיֵּלְכ֥וּ בְנֵי־דָ֖ן לְדַרְכָּ֑ם וַיַּ֣רְא מִיכָ֗ה כִּֽי־חֲזָקִ֥ים הֵ֙מָּה֙ מִמֶּ֔נּוּ וַיִּ֖פֶן וַיָּ֥שׇׁב אֶל־בֵּיתֽוֹ׃
Translated: So Micah, realizing that they were stronger than he, turned back and went home; and the Danites went on their way,
Transliteration: vayelekhu veney-dan ledarekham vayare miykhah khiy-chazakiym hemah mimenu vayifen vayashׇv el-veytvo

Hebrew: וְהֵ֨מָּה לָקְח֜וּ אֵ֧ת אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂ֣ה מִיכָ֗ה וְֽאֶת־הַכֹּהֵן֮ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הָֽיָה־לוֹ֒ וַיָּבֹ֣אוּ עַל־לַ֗יִשׁ עַל־עַם֙ שֹׁקֵ֣ט וּבֹטֵ֔חַ וַיַּכּ֥וּ אוֹתָ֖ם לְפִי־חָ֑רֶב וְאֶת־הָעִ֖יר שָׂרְפ֥וּ בָאֵֽשׁ׃
Translated: taking the things Micah had made and the priest he had acquired. They proceeded to Laish, a people tranquil and unsuspecting, and they put them to the sword and burned down the town.
Transliteration: vehemah lakechu et asher-ashah miykhah veet-hakhohen asher hayah-lvo vayavou al-layiish al-am shoket uvotecha vayakhu votam lefiy-charev veet-haiyr sharefu vaesh

Hebrew: וְאֵ֨ין מַצִּ֜יל כִּ֧י רְֽחוֹקָה־הִ֣יא מִצִּיד֗וֹן וְדָבָ֤ר אֵין־לָהֶם֙ עִם־אָדָ֔ם וְהִ֕יא בָּעֵ֖מֶק אֲשֶׁ֣ר לְבֵית־רְח֑וֹב וַיִּבְנ֥וּ אֶת־הָעִ֖יר וַיֵּ֥שְׁבוּ בָֽהּ׃
Translated:
There was none to come to the rescue, for it was distant from Sidon and they had no dealings with anyone; it lay in the valley of Beth-rehob.
They rebuilt the town and settled there,
Transliteration: veeyn matsiyl khiy rechvokah-hiy mitsiydvon vedavar eyn-lahem im-adam vehiy vaemek asher leveyt-rechvov vayivenu et-haiyr vayeshevu vah

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרְא֤וּ שֵׁם־הָעִיר֙ דָּ֔ן בְּשֵׁם֙ דָּ֣ן אֲבִיהֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר יוּלַּ֖ד לְיִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְאוּלָ֛ם לַ֥יִשׁ שֵׁם־הָעִ֖יר לָרִאשֹׁנָֽה׃
Translated: and they named the town Dan, after their ancestor Dan who was Israel’s son. Originally, however, the name of the town was Laish.
Transliteration: vayikereu shem-haiyr dan veshem dan aviyhem asher yulad leyisherael veulam layiish shem-haiyr larishonah

Hebrew: וַיָּקִ֧ימוּ לָהֶ֛ם בְּנֵי־דָ֖ן אֶת־הַפָּ֑סֶל וִ֠יהֽוֹנָתָ֠ן בֶּן־גֵּרְשֹׁ֨ם בֶּן־מְ<sup>נַ</sup>שֶּׁ֜ה ה֣וּא וּבָנָ֗יו הָי֤וּ כֹֽהֲנִים֙ לְשֵׁ֣בֶט הַדָּנִ֔י עַד־י֖וֹם גְּל֥וֹת הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: The Danites set up the sculptured image for themselves; and Jonathan son of Gershom son of Manasseh, and his descendants, served as priests to the Danite tribe until the land went into exile.
Transliteration: vayakiymu lahem veney-dan et-hafasel viyhvonatan ven-gereshom ven-me<sup>na</sup>sheh hu uvanayv hayu khohaniym leshevet hadaniy ad-yvom gelvot haarets

Hebrew: וַיָּשִׂ֣ימוּ לָהֶ֔ם אֶת־פֶּ֥סֶל מִיכָ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֑ה כׇּל־יְמֵ֛י הֱי֥וֹת בֵּית־הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים בְּשִׁלֹֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: They maintained the sculptured image that Micah had made throughout the time that the House of God stood at Shiloh.
Transliteration: vayashiymu lahem et-fesel miykhah asher ashah khׇl-yemey heyvot veyt-haElohim veshiloh {f}

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ בַּיָּמִ֣ים הָהֵ֔ם וּמֶ֖לֶךְ אֵ֣ין בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיְהִ֣י ׀ אִ֣ישׁ לֵוִ֗י גָּ֚ר בְּיַרְכְּתֵ֣י הַר־אֶפְרַ֔יִם וַיִּֽקַּֽח־לוֹ֙ אִשָּׁ֣ה פִילֶ֔גֶשׁ מִבֵּ֥ית לֶ֖חֶם יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: In those days, when there was no king in Israel, a certain Levite residing at the other end of the hill country of Ephraim took to himself a concubine from Bethlehem in Judah.
Transliteration: vayehiy vayamiym hahem umelekhe eyn veyisherael vayehiy iysh leviy gar veyarekhetey har-eferayiim vayikach-lvo ishah fiylegesh miveyt lechem yehudah

Hebrew: וַתִּזְנֶ֤ה עָלָיו֙ פִּֽילַגְשׁ֔וֹ וַתֵּ֤לֶךְ מֵֽאִתּוֹ֙ אֶל־בֵּ֣ית אָבִ֔יהָ אֶל־בֵּ֥ית לֶ֖חֶם יְהוּדָ֑ה וַתְּהִי־שָׁ֕ם יָמִ֖ים אַרְבָּעָ֥ה חֳדָשִֽׁים׃
Translated: Once his concubine deserted him, leaving him for her father’s house in Bethlehem in Judah; and she stayed there a full four months.
Transliteration: vatizeneh alayv fiylageshvo vatelekhe meitvo el-veyt aviyha el-veyt lechem yehudah vatehiy-sham yamiym arevaah chodashiym

Hebrew: וַיָּ֨קׇם אִישָׁ֜הּ וַיֵּ֣לֶךְ אַחֲרֶ֗יהָ לְדַבֵּ֤ר עַל־לִבָּהּ֙ (להשיבו) [לַהֲשִׁיבָ֔הּ] וְנַעֲר֥וֹ עִמּ֖וֹ וְצֶ֣מֶד חֲמֹרִ֑ים וַתְּבִיאֵ֙הוּ֙ בֵּ֣ית אָבִ֔יהָ וַיִּרְאֵ֙הוּ֙ אֲבִ֣י הַֽנַּעֲרָ֔ה וַיִּשְׂמַ֖ח לִקְרָאתֽוֹ׃
Translated: Then her husband set out, with an attendant and a pair of donkeys, and went after her to woo her and to win her back. She admitted him into her father’s house; and when the young woman’s father saw him, he received him warmly.
Transliteration: vayakׇm iyshah vayelekhe achareyha ledaver al-livah (lhshyvv) [lahashiyvah] venaarvo imvo vetsemed chamoriym vateviyehu veyt aviyha vayireehu aviy hanaarah vayishemach likeratvo

Hebrew: וַיַּחֲזֶק־בּ֤וֹ חֹתְנוֹ֙ אֲבִ֣י הַֽנַּעֲרָ֔ה וַיֵּ֥שֶׁב אִתּ֖וֹ שְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת יָמִ֑ים וַיֹּֽאכְלוּ֙ וַיִּשְׁתּ֔וּ וַיָּלִ֖ינוּ שָֽׁם׃
Translated: His father-in-law, the young woman’s father, pressed him, and he stayed with him three days; they ate and drank and lodged there.
Transliteration: vayachazek-vvo chotenvo aviy hanaarah vayeshev itvo sheloshet yamiym vayokhelu vayishetu vayaliynu sham

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הָרְבִיעִ֔י וַיַּשְׁכִּ֥ימוּ בַבֹּ֖קֶר וַיָּ֣קׇם לָלֶ֑כֶת וַיֹּ֩אמֶר֩ אֲבִ֨י הַֽנַּעֲרָ֜ה אֶל־חֲתָנ֗וֹ סְעָ֧ד לִבְּךָ֛ פַּת־לֶ֖חֶם וְאַחַ֥ר תֵּלֵֽכוּ׃
Translated: Early in the morning of the fourth day, he started to leave; but the young woman’s father said to his son-in-law, “Eat something to give you strength, then you can leave.”
Transliteration: vayehiy vayyvom hareviyiy vayashekhiymu vavoker vayakׇm lalekhet vayomer aviy hanaarah el-chatanvo sead livekha fat-lechem veachar telekhu

Hebrew: וַיֵּשְׁב֗וּ וַיֹּאכְל֧וּ שְׁנֵיהֶ֛ם יַחְדָּ֖ו וַיִּשְׁתּ֑וּ וַיֹּ֜אמֶר אֲבִ֤י הַֽנַּעֲרָה֙ אֶל־הָאִ֔ישׁ הוֹאֶל־נָ֥א וְלִ֖ין וְיִיטַ֥ב לִבֶּֽךָ׃
Translated: So the two of them sat down and they feasted together. Then the young woman’s father said to the man, “Won’t you stay overnight and enjoy yourself?”
Transliteration: vayeshevu vayokhelu sheneyhem yachedav vayishetu vayomer aviy hanaarah el-haiysh hvoel-na veliyn veyiytav livekha

Hebrew: וַיָּ֥קׇם הָאִ֖ישׁ לָלֶ֑כֶת וַיִּפְצַר־בּוֹ֙ חֹֽתְנ֔וֹ וַיָּ֖שׇׁב וַיָּ֥לֶן שָֽׁם׃
Translated: The man started to leave, but his father-in-law kept urging him until he turned back and spent the night there.
Transliteration: vayakׇm haiysh lalekhet vayifetsar-vvo chotenvo vayashׇv vayalen sham

Hebrew: וַיַּשְׁכֵּ֨ם בַּבֹּ֜קֶר בַּיּ֣וֹם הַחֲמִישִׁי֮ לָלֶ֒כֶת֒ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ׀ אֲבִ֣י הַֽנַּעֲרָ֗ה סְעׇד־נָא֙ לְבָ֣בְךָ֔ וְהִֽתְמַהְמְה֖וּ עַד־נְט֣וֹת הַיּ֑וֹם וַיֹּאכְל֖וּ שְׁנֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: Early in the morning of the fifth day, he was about to leave, when the young woman’s father said, “Come, have a bite.” The two of them ate, dawdling until past noon.
Transliteration: vayashekhem vavoker vayyvom hachamiyshiy lalekhet vayomer aviy hanaarah seׇd-na levavekha vehitemahemehu ad-netvot hayyvom vayokhelu sheneyhem

Hebrew: וַיָּ֤קׇם הָאִישׁ֙ לָלֶ֔כֶת ה֥וּא וּפִילַגְשׁ֖וֹ וְנַעֲר֑וֹ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ל֣וֹ חֹתְנ֣וֹ אֲבִ֣י הַֽנַּעֲרָ֡ה הִנֵּ֣ה נָא֩ רָפָ֨ה הַיּ֜וֹם לַעֲר֗וֹב לִֽינוּ־נָ֞א הִנֵּ֨ה חֲנ֤וֹת הַיּוֹם֙ לִ֥ין פֹּה֙ וְיִיטַ֣ב לְבָבֶ֔ךָ וְהִשְׁכַּמְתֶּ֤ם מָחָר֙ לְדַרְכְּכֶ֔ם וְהָלַכְתָּ֖ לְאֹהָלֶֽךָ׃
Translated: Then the man, his concubine, and his attendant started to leave. His father-in-law, the young woman’s father, said to him, “Look, the day is waning toward evening; do stop for the night. See, the day is declining; spend the night here and enjoy yourself. You can start early tomorrow on your journey and head for home.”
Transliteration: vayakׇm haiysh lalekhet hu ufiylageshvo venaarvo vayomer lvo chotenvo aviy hanaarah hineh na rafah hayyvom laarvov liynu-na hineh chanvot hayyvom liyn foh veyiytav levavekha vehishekhametem machar ledarekhekhem vehalakheta leohalekha

Hebrew: וְלֹֽא־אָבָ֤ה הָאִישׁ֙ לָל֔וּן וַיָּ֣קׇם וַיֵּ֗לֶךְ וַיָּבֹא֙ עַד־נֹ֣כַח יְב֔וּס הִ֖יא יְרוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וְעִמּ֗וֹ צֶ֤מֶד חֲמוֹרִים֙ חֲבוּשִׁ֔ים וּפִילַגְשׁ֖וֹ עִמּֽוֹ׃
Translated: But the man refused to stay for the night. He set out and traveled as far as the vicinity of Jebus—that is, Jerusalem; he had with him a pair of laden donkeys, and his concubine was with him.
Transliteration: velo-avah haiysh lalun vayakׇm vayelekhe vayavo ad-nokhach yevus hiy yerushala͏im veimvo tsemed chamvoriym chavushiym ufiylageshvo imvo
