Hebrew: הֵ֣ם עִם־יְב֔וּס וְהַיּ֖וֹם רַ֣ד מְאֹ֑ד וַיֹּ֨אמֶר הַנַּ֜עַר אֶל־אֲדֹנָ֗יו לְכָה־נָּ֛א וְנָס֛וּרָה אֶל־עִֽיר־הַיְבוּסִ֥י הַזֹּ֖את וְנָלִ֥ין בָּֽהּ׃
Translated: Since they were close to Jebus, and the day was very far spent, the attendant said to his master, “Let us turn aside to this town of the Jebusites and spend the night in it.”
Transliteration: hem im-yevus vehayyvom rad meod vayomer hanaar el-adonayv lekhah-na venasurah el-iyr-hayevusiy hazot venaliyn vah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֵלָיו֙ אֲדֹנָ֔יו לֹ֤א נָסוּר֙ אֶל־עִ֣יר נׇכְרִ֔י אֲשֶׁ֛ר לֹא־מִבְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל הֵ֑נָּה וְעָבַ֖רְנוּ עַד־גִּבְעָֽה׃
Translated: But his master said to him, “We will not turn aside to a town of aliens who are not of Israel, but will continue to Gibeah.
Transliteration: vayomer elayv adonayv lo nasur el-iyr nׇkheriy asher lo-miveney yisherael henah veavarenu ad-giveah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לְנַֽעֲר֔וֹ לְךָ֥ וְנִקְרְבָ֖ה בְּאַחַ֣ד הַמְּקֹמ֑וֹת וְלַ֥נּוּ בַגִּבְעָ֖ה א֥וֹ בָרָמָֽה׃
Translated: Come,” he said to his attendant, “let us approach one of those places and spend the night either in Gibeah or in Ramah.”
Transliteration: vayomer lenaarvo lekha venikerevah veachad hamekomvot velanu vagiveah vo varamah

Hebrew: וַיַּעַבְר֖וּ וַיֵּלֵ֑כוּ וַתָּבֹ֤א לָהֶם֙ הַשֶּׁ֔מֶשׁ אֵ֥צֶל הַגִּבְעָ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר לְבִנְיָמִֽן׃
Translated: So they traveled on, and the sun set when they were near Gibeah of Benjamin.
Transliteration: vayaaveru vayelekhu vatavo lahem hashemesh etsel hagiveah asher levineyamin

Hebrew: וַיָּסֻ֣רוּ שָׁ֔ם לָב֖וֹא לָל֣וּן בַּגִּבְעָ֑ה וַיָּבֹ֗א וַיֵּ֙שֶׁב֙ בִּרְח֣וֹב הָעִ֔יר וְאֵ֥ין אִ֛ישׁ מְאַסֵּֽף־אוֹתָ֥ם הַבַּ֖יְתָה לָלֽוּן׃
Translated: They turned off there and went in to spend the night in Gibeah. He went and sat down in the town square, but nobody took them indoors to spend the night.
Transliteration: vayasuru sham lavvo lalun vagiveah vayavo vayeshev virechvov haiyr veeyn iysh measef-votam havayetah lalun

Hebrew: וְהִנֵּ֣ה ׀ אִ֣ישׁ זָקֵ֗ן בָּ֣א מִֽן־מַעֲשֵׂ֤הוּ מִן־הַשָּׂדֶה֙ בָּעֶ֔רֶב וְהָאִישׁ֙ מֵהַ֣ר אֶפְרַ֔יִם וְהוּא־גָ֖ר בַּגִּבְעָ֑ה וְאַנְשֵׁ֥י הַמָּק֖וֹם בְּנֵ֥י יְמִינִֽי׃
Translated: In the evening, an old man came along from his property outside the town. (This man hailed from the hill country of Ephraim and resided at Gibeah, where the locals were Benjaminites.)
Transliteration: vehineh iysh zaken va min-maashehu min-hashadeh vaerev vehaiysh mehar eferayiim vehu-gar vagiveah veaneshey hamakvom veney yemiyniy

Hebrew: וַיִּשָּׂ֣א עֵינָ֗יו וַיַּ֛רְא אֶת־הָאִ֥ישׁ הָאֹרֵ֖חַ בִּרְחֹ֣ב הָעִ֑יר וַיֹּ֨אמֶר הָאִ֧ישׁ הַזָּקֵ֛ן אָ֥נָה תֵלֵ֖ךְ וּמֵאַ֥יִן תָּבֽוֹא׃
Translated: He happened to notice the wayfarer in the town square. “Where,” the old man inquired, “are you going to, and where do you come from?”
Transliteration: vayisha eynayv vayare et-haiysh haorecha virechov haiyr vayomer haiysh hazaken anah telekhe umeayiin tavvo

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלָ֗יו עֹבְרִ֨ים אֲנַ֜חְנוּ מִבֵּֽית־לֶ֣חֶם יְהוּדָה֮ עַד־יַרְכְּתֵ֣י הַר־אֶפְרַ֒יִם֒ מִשָּׁ֣ם אָנֹ֔כִי וָאֵלֵ֕ךְ עַד־בֵּ֥ית לֶ֖חֶם יְהוּדָ֑ה וְאֶת־בֵּ֤ית יְהֹוָה֙ אֲנִ֣י הֹלֵ֔ךְ וְאֵ֣ין אִ֔ישׁ מְאַסֵּ֥ף אוֹתִ֖י הַבָּֽיְתָה׃
Translated: He replied, “We are traveling from Bethlehem in Judah to the other end of the hill country of Ephraim. That is where I live. I made a journey to Bethlehem of Judah, and now I am on my way to the House of G<small>OD</small>, and nobody has taken me indoors.
Transliteration: vayomer elayv overiym anachenu miveyt-lechem yehudah ad-yarekhetey har-eferayiim misham anokhiy vaelekhe ad-veyt lechem yehudah veet-veyt yehovah aniy holekhe veeyn iysh measef votiy havayetah

Hebrew: וְגַם־תֶּ֤בֶן גַּם־מִסְפּוֹא֙ יֵ֣שׁ לַחֲמוֹרֵ֔ינוּ וְ֠גַ֠ם לֶ֣חֶם וָיַ֤יִן יֶשׁ־לִי֙ וְלַֽאֲמָתֶ֔ךָ וְלַנַּ֖עַר עִם־עֲבָדֶ֑יךָ אֵ֥ין מַחְס֖וֹר כׇּל־דָּבָֽר׃
Translated: We have both bruised straw and feed for our donkeys, and bread and wine for me and your handmaid, and for the attendant with your servants. We lack nothing.”
Transliteration: vegam-teven gam-misefvo eish lachamvoreynu vegam lechem vayayiin yesh-liy velaamatekha velanaar im-avadeykha eyn machesvor khׇl-davar

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר הָאִ֤ישׁ הַזָּקֵן֙ שָׁל֣וֹם לָ֔ךְ רַ֥ק כׇּל־מַחְסוֹרְךָ֖ עָלָ֑י רַ֥ק בָּרְח֖וֹב אַל־תָּלַֽן׃
Translated: “Rest easy,” said the old man. “Let me take care of all your needs. Do not on any account spend the night in the square.”
Transliteration: vayomer haiysh hazaken shalvom lakhe rak khׇl-machesvorekha alay rak varechvov al-talan

Hebrew: וַיְבִיאֵ֣הוּ לְבֵית֔וֹ (ויבול) [וַיָּ֖בׇל] לַחֲמוֹרִ֑ים וַֽיִּרְחֲצוּ֙ רַגְלֵיהֶ֔ם וַיֹּאכְל֖וּ וַיִּשְׁתּֽוּ׃
Translated: And he took him into his house. He mixed fodder for the donkeys; then they bathed their feet and ate and drank.
Transliteration: vayeviyehu leveytvo (vyvvl) [vayavׇl] lachamvoriym vayirechatsu rageleyhem vayokhelu vayishetu

Hebrew: הֵ֘מָּה֮ מֵיטִיבִ֣ים אֶת־לִבָּם֒ וְהִנֵּה֩ אַנְשֵׁ֨י הָעִ֜יר אַנְשֵׁ֣י בְנֵי־בְלִיַּ֗עַל נָסַ֙בּוּ֙ אֶת־הַבַּ֔יִת מִֽתְדַּפְּקִ֖ים עַל־הַדָּ֑לֶת וַיֹּאמְר֗וּ אֶל־הָ֠אִ֠ישׁ בַּ֣עַל הַבַּ֤יִת הַזָּקֵן֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר הוֹצֵ֗א אֶת־הָאִ֛ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֥א אֶל־בֵּיתְךָ֖ וְנֵדָעֶֽנּוּ׃
Translated: While they were enjoying themselves, the townsmen, a depraved lot, had gathered about the house and were pounding on the door. They called to the aged owner of the house, “Bring out that man who’s come into your house, so that we can be intimate with him.”
Transliteration: hemah meytiyviym et-livam vehineh aneshey haiyr aneshey veney-veliyaal nasavu et-havayiit mitedafekiym al-hadalet vayomeru el-haiysh vaal havayiit hazaken lemor hvotse et-haiysh asher-va el-veytekha venedaenu

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֣א אֲלֵיהֶ֗ם הָאִישׁ֙ בַּ֣עַל הַבַּ֔יִת וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֔ם אַל־אַחַ֖י אַל־תָּרֵ֣עוּ נָ֑א אַ֠חֲרֵי אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֞א הָאִ֤ישׁ הַזֶּה֙ אֶל־בֵּיתִ֔י אַֽל־תַּעֲשׂ֖וּ אֶת־הַנְּבָלָ֥ה הַזֹּֽאת׃
Translated: The owner of the house went out and said to them, “Please, my friends, do not commit such a wrong. Since this fellow has entered my house, do not perpetrate this outrage.
Transliteration: vayetse aleyhem haiysh vaal havayiit vayomer alehem al-achay al-tareu na acharey asher-va haiysh hazeh el-veytiy al-taashu et-hanevalah hazot

Hebrew: הִנֵּה֩ בִתִּ֨י הַבְּתוּלָ֜ה וּפִילַגְשֵׁ֗הוּ אֽוֹצִיאָה־נָּ֤א אוֹתָם֙ וְעַנּ֣וּ אוֹתָ֔ם וַעֲשׂ֣וּ לָהֶ֔ם הַטּ֖וֹב בְּעֵינֵיכֶ֑ם וְלָאִ֤ישׁ הַזֶּה֙ לֹ֣א תַֽעֲשׂ֔וּ דְּבַ֖ר הַנְּבָלָ֥ה הַזֹּֽאת׃
Translated: Look, here is my virgin daughter, and his concubine. Let me bring them out to you. Use them, do what you like with them; but don’t do that outrageous thing to this fellow.”
Transliteration: hineh vitiy havetulah ufiylageshehu votsiyah-na votam veanu votam vaashu lahem hatvov veeyneykhem velaiysh hazeh lo taashu devar hanevalah hazot

Hebrew: וְלֹֽא־אָב֤וּ הָֽאֲנָשִׁים֙ לִשְׁמֹ֣עַֽ ל֔וֹ וַיַּחֲזֵ֤ק הָאִישׁ֙ בְּפִ֣ילַגְשׁ֔וֹ וַיֹּצֵ֥א אֲלֵיהֶ֖ם הַח֑וּץ וַיֵּדְע֣וּ א֠וֹתָ֠הּ וַיִּֽתְעַלְּלוּ־בָ֤הּ כׇּל־הַלַּ֙יְלָה֙ עַד־הַבֹּ֔קֶר וַֽיְשַׁלְּח֖וּהָ (בעלות) [כַּעֲל֥וֹת] הַשָּֽׁחַר׃
Translated: But the others would not listen to him. So the man seized his concubine and pushed her out to them. They raped her and abused her all night long until morning; and they let her go when dawn broke.
Transliteration: velo-avu haanashiym lishemoa lvo vayachazek haiysh vefiylageshvo vayotse aleyhem hachuts vayedeu votah vayitealelu-vah khׇl-halayelah ad-havoker vayeshalechuha (vlvt) [khaalvot] hashachar

Hebrew: וַתָּבֹ֥א הָאִשָּׁ֖ה לִפְנ֣וֹת הַבֹּ֑קֶר וַתִּפֹּ֞ל פֶּ֧תַח בֵּית־הָאִ֛ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־אֲדוֹנֶ֥יהָ שָּׁ֖ם עַד־הָאֽוֹר׃
Translated: Toward morning the woman came back; and as it was growing light, she collapsed at the entrance of the very house where her husband was.
Transliteration: vatavo haishah lifenvot havoker vatifol fetach veyt-haiysh asher-advoneyha sham ad-havor

Hebrew: וַיָּ֨קׇם אֲדֹנֶ֜יהָ בַּבֹּ֗קֶר וַיִּפְתַּח֙ דַּלְת֣וֹת הַבַּ֔יִת וַיֵּצֵ֖א לָלֶ֣כֶת לְדַרְכּ֑וֹ וְהִנֵּ֧ה הָאִשָּׁ֣ה פִֽילַגְשׁ֗וֹ נֹפֶ֙לֶת֙ פֶּ֣תַח הַבַּ֔יִת וְיָדֶ֖יהָ עַל־הַסַּֽף׃
Translated: When her husband arose in the morning, he opened the doors of the house and went out to continue his journey; and there was the woman, his concubine, lying at the entrance of the house, with her hands on the threshold.
Transliteration: vayakׇm adoneyha vavoker vayifetach daletvot havayiit vayetse lalekhet ledarekhvo vehineh haishah fiylageshvo nofelet fetach havayiit veyadeyha al-hasaf

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֧אמֶר אֵלֶ֛יהָ ק֥וּמִי וְנֵלֵ֖כָה וְאֵ֣ין עֹנֶ֑ה וַיִּקָּחֶ֙הָ֙ עַֽל־הַחֲמ֔וֹר וַיָּ֣קׇם הָאִ֔ישׁ וַיֵּ֖לֶךְ לִמְקֹמֽוֹ׃
Translated: “Get up,” he said to her, “let us go.” But there was no reply. So the man placed her on the donkey and set out for home.
Transliteration: vayomer eleyha kumiy venelekhah veeyn oneh vayikacheha al-hachamvor vayakׇm haiysh vayelekhe limekomvo

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֣א אֶל־בֵּית֗וֹ וַיִּקַּ֤ח אֶת־הַֽמַּאֲכֶ֙לֶת֙ וַיַּחֲזֵ֣ק בְּפִֽילַגְשׁ֔וֹ וַֽיְנַתְּחֶ֙הָ֙ לַעֲצָמֶ֔יהָ לִשְׁנֵ֥ים עָשָׂ֖ר נְתָחִ֑ים וַֽיְשַׁלְּחֶ֔הָ בְּכֹ֖ל גְּב֥וּל יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: When he came home, he picked up a knife, and took hold of his concubine and cut her up limb by limb into twelve parts. He sent them throughout the territory of Israel.
Transliteration: vayavo el-veytvo vayikach et-hamaakhelet vayachazek vefiylageshvo vayenatecheha laatsameyha lisheneym ashar netachiym vayeshalecheha vekhol gevul yisherael

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֣ה כׇל־הָרֹאֶ֗ה וְאָמַר֙ לֹֽא־נִהְיְתָ֤ה וְלֹֽא־נִרְאֲתָה֙ כָּזֹ֔את לְמִיּ֞וֹם עֲל֤וֹת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם עַ֖ד הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה שִׂימוּ־לָכֶ֥ם עָלֶ֖יהָ עֻ֥צוּ וְדַבֵּֽרוּ׃ {פ}
Translated: And everyone who saw it cried out, “Never has such a thing happened or been seen from the day the Israelites came out of the land of Egypt to this day! Put your mind to this; take counsel and decide.”
Transliteration: vehayah khׇl-haroeh veamar lo-niheyetah velo-nireatah khazot lemiyyvom alvot veney-yisherael meerets mitserayiim ad hayyvom hazeh shiymu-lakhem aleyha utsu vedaveru {f}

Hebrew: וַיֵּצְאוּ֮ כׇּל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵל֒ וַתִּקָּהֵ֨ל הָעֵדָ֜ה כְּאִ֣ישׁ אֶחָ֗ד לְמִדָּן֙ וְעַד־בְּאֵ֣ר שֶׁ֔בַע וְאֶ֖רֶץ הַגִּלְעָ֑ד אֶל־יְהֹוָ֖ה הַמִּצְפָּֽה׃
Translated: Thereupon all the Israelites—from Dan to Beer-sheba and [from] the land of Gilead—marched forth, and the community assembled as one, before G<small>OD</small> at Mizpah.
Transliteration: vayetseu khׇl-veney yisherael vatikahel haedah kheiysh echad lemidan vead-veer sheva veerets hagilead el-yehovah hamitsefah

Hebrew: וַיִּֽתְיַצְּב֞וּ פִּנּ֣וֹת כׇּל־הָעָ֗ם כֹּ֚ל שִׁבְטֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל בִּקְהַ֖ל עַ֣ם הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים אַרְבַּ֨ע מֵא֥וֹת אֶ֛לֶף אִ֥ישׁ רַגְלִ֖י שֹׁ֥לֵֽף־חָֽרֶב׃ {פ}
Translated: All the leaders of the people [and] all the tribes of Israel presented themselves in the assembly of God’s people, 400,000 fighters on foot.—
Transliteration: vayiteyatsevu finvot khׇl-haam khol shivetey yisherael vikehal am haElohim areva mevot elef iysh rageliy sholef-charev {f}

Hebrew: וַֽיִּשְׁמְעוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י בִנְיָמִ֔ן כִּֽי־עָל֥וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל הַמִּצְפָּ֑ה וַיֹּֽאמְרוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל דַּבְּר֕וּ אֵיכָ֥ה נִהְיְתָ֖ה הָרָעָ֥ה הַזֹּֽאת׃
Translated: The Benjaminites heard that the Israelites had come up to Mizpah.—The Israelites said, “Tell us, how did this evil thing happen?”
Transliteration: vayishemeu veney vineyamin khiy-alu veney-yisherael hamitsefah vayomeru veney yisherael daveru eykhah niheyetah haraah hazot

Hebrew: וַיַּ֜עַן הָאִ֣ישׁ הַלֵּוִ֗י אִ֛ישׁ הָאִשָּׁ֥ה הַנִּרְצָחָ֖ה וַיֹּאמַ֑ר הַגִּבְעָ֙תָה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לְבִנְיָמִ֔ן בָּ֛אתִי אֲנִ֥י וּפִילַגְשִׁ֖י לָלֽוּן׃
Translated: And that Levite, the husband of the murdered woman, replied, “My concubine and I came to Gibeah of Benjamin to spend the night.
Transliteration: vayaan haiysh haleviy iysh haishah haniretsachah vayomar hagiveatah asher levineyamin vatiy aniy ufiylageshiy lalun

Hebrew: וַיָּקֻ֤מוּ עָלַי֙ בַּעֲלֵ֣י הַגִּבְעָ֔ה וַיָּסֹ֧בּוּ עָלַ֛י אֶת־הַבַּ֖יִת לָ֑יְלָה אוֹתִי֙ דִּמּ֣וּ לַהֲרֹ֔ג וְאֶת־פִּילַגְשִׁ֥י עִנּ֖וּ וַתָּמֹֽת׃
Translated: The citizens of Gibeah set out to harm me. They gathered against me around the house in the night; they meant to kill me, and they abused my concubine until she died.
Transliteration: vayakumu alay vaaley hagiveah vayasovu alay et-havayiit layelah votiy dimu laharog veet-fiylageshiy inu vatamot

Hebrew: וָאֹחֵ֤ז בְּפִֽילַגְשִׁי֙ וָֽאֲנַתְּחֶ֔הָ וָֽאֲשַׁלְּחֶ֔הָ בְּכׇל־שְׂדֵ֖ה נַחֲלַ֣ת יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל כִּ֥י עָשׂ֛וּ זִמָּ֥ה וּנְבָלָ֖ה בְּיִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: So I took hold of my concubine and I cut her in pieces and sent them through every part of Israel’s territory. For an outrageous act of depravity had been committed in Israel.
Transliteration: vaochez vefiylageshiy vaanatecheha vaashalecheha vekhׇl-shedeh nachalat yisherael khiy ashu zimah unevalah veyisherael

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֥ה כֻלְּכֶ֖ם בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל הָב֥וּ לָכֶ֛ם דָּבָ֥ר וְעֵצָ֖ה הֲלֹֽם׃
Translated: Now you are all Israelites; produce a plan of action here and now!”
Transliteration: hineh khulekhem veney yisherael havu lakhem davar veetsah halom

Hebrew: וַיָּ֙קׇם֙ כׇּל־הָעָ֔ם כְּאִ֥ישׁ אֶחָ֖ד לֵאמֹ֑ר לֹ֤א נֵלֵךְ֙ אִ֣ישׁ לְאׇהֳל֔וֹ וְלֹ֥א נָס֖וּר אִ֥ישׁ לְבֵיתֽוֹ׃
Translated: Then all the people rose as one and declared, “We will not go back to our homes, we will not enter our houses!
Transliteration: vayakׇm khׇl-haam kheiysh echad lemor lo nelekhe iysh leׇholvo velo nasur iysh leveytvo

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֕ה זֶ֣ה הַדָּבָ֔ר אֲשֶׁ֥ר נַעֲשֶׂ֖ה לַגִּבְעָ֑ה עָלֶ֖יהָ בְּגוֹרָֽל׃
Translated: But this is what we will do to Gibeah: [we will wage war] against it according to lot.
Transliteration: veatah zeh hadavar asher naasheh lagiveah aleyha vegvoral

Hebrew: וְלָקַ֣חְנוּ עֲשָׂרָה֩ אֲנָשִׁ֨ים לַמֵּאָ֜ה לְכֹ֣ל ׀ שִׁבְטֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל וּמֵאָ֤ה לָאֶ֙לֶף֙ וְאֶ֣לֶף לָֽרְבָבָ֔ה לָקַ֥חַת צֵדָ֖ה לָעָ֑ם לַעֲשׂ֗וֹת לְבוֹאָם֙ לְגֶ֣בַע בִּנְיָמִ֔ן כְּכׇ֨ל־הַנְּבָלָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשָׂ֖ה בְּיִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: We will take from all the tribes of Israel ten of every hundred, a hundred of every thousand, and a thousand of every ten thousand to supply provisions for the troops—to prepare for their going to Geba in Benjamin for all the outrage it has committed in Israel.”
Transliteration: velakachenu asharah anashiym lameah lekhol shivetey yisherael umeah laelef veelef larevavah lakachat tsedah laam laashvot levvoam legeva vineyamin khekhׇl-hanevalah asher ashah veyisherael

Hebrew: וַיֵּאָסֵ֞ף כׇּל־אִ֤ישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ אֶל־הָעִ֔יר כְּאִ֥ישׁ אֶחָ֖ד חֲבֵרִֽים׃ {פ}
Translated: So Israel’s entire force, united as one, massed against the town.
Transliteration: vayeasef khׇl-iysh yisherael el-haiyr kheiysh echad chaveriym {f}

Hebrew: וַֽיִּשְׁלְח֞וּ שִׁבְטֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ אֲנָשִׁ֔ים בְּכׇל־שִׁבְטֵ֥י בִנְיָמִ֖ן לֵאמֹ֑ר מָ֚ה הָרָעָ֣ה הַזֹּ֔את אֲשֶׁ֥ר נִהְיְתָ֖ה בָּכֶֽם׃
Translated: And the tribes of Israel sent agents through the whole tribe of Benjamin, saying, “What is this evil thing that has happened among you?
Transliteration: vayishelechu shivetey yisherael anashiym vekhׇl-shivetey vineyamin lemor mah haraah hazot asher niheyetah vakhem

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֡ה תְּנוּ֩ אֶת־הָאֲנָשִׁ֨ים בְּנֵי־בְלִיַּ֜עַל אֲשֶׁ֤ר בַּגִּבְעָה֙ וּנְמִיתֵ֔ם וּנְבַעֲרָ֥ה רָעָ֖ה מִיִּשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְלֹ֤א אָבוּ֙ [בְּנֵ֣י] בִנְיָמִ֔ן לִשְׁמֹ֕עַ בְּק֖וֹל אֲחֵיהֶ֥ם בְּנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Come, hand over those scoundrels in Gibeah so that we may put them to death and stamp out the evil from Israel.” But the Benjaminites would not yield to the demand of their fellow Israelites.
Transliteration: veatah tenu et-haanashiym veney-veliyaal asher vagiveah unemiytem unevaarah raah miyisherael velo avu [veney] vineyamin lishemoa vekvol acheyhem veney-yisherael

Hebrew: וַיֵּאָסְפ֧וּ בְנֵֽי־בִנְיָמִ֛ן מִן־הֶעָרִ֖ים הַגִּבְעָ֑תָה לָצֵ֥את לַמִּלְחָמָ֖ה עִם־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: So the Benjaminites gathered from their towns to Gibeah in order to take the field against the Israelites.
Transliteration: vayeasefu veney-vineyamin min-heariym hagiveatah latset lamilechamah im-veney yisherael

Hebrew: וַיִּתְפָּֽקְדוּ֩ בְנֵ֨י בִנְיָמִ֜ן בַּיּ֤וֹם הַהוּא֙ מֵהֶ֣עָרִ֔ים עֶשְׂרִ֨ים וְשִׁשָּׁ֥ה אֶ֛לֶף אִ֖ישׁ שֹׁ֣לֵֽף חָ֑רֶב לְ֠בַ֠ד מִיֹּשְׁבֵ֤י הַגִּבְעָה֙ הִתְפָּ֣קְד֔וּ שְׁבַ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת אִ֥ישׁ בָּחֽוּר׃
Translated: On that day the Benjaminites mustered from the towns 26,000 fighters, mustered apart from the inhabitants of Gibeah; 700 elite troops
Transliteration: vayitefakedu veney vineyamin vayyvom hahu meheariym esheriym veshishah elef iysh sholef charev levad miyoshevey hagiveah hitefakedu sheva mevot iysh vachur

Hebrew: מִכֹּ֣ל ׀ הָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֗ה שְׁבַ֤ע מֵאוֹת֙ אִ֣ישׁ בָּח֔וּר אִטֵּ֖ר יַד־יְמִינ֑וֹ כׇּל־זֶ֗ה קֹלֵ֧עַ בָּאֶ֛בֶן אֶל־הַֽשַּׂעֲרָ֖ה וְלֹ֥א יַחֲטִֽא׃ {פ}
Translated: of these forces—700 of the best troops—were left-handed. Every one of them could sling a stone at a hair and not miss.
Transliteration: mikhol haam hazeh sheva mevot iysh vachur iter yad-yemiynvo khׇl-zeh kolea vaeven el-hashaarah velo yachati {f}

Hebrew: וְאִ֨ישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל הִתְפָּֽקְד֗וּ לְבַד֙ מִבִּנְיָמִ֔ן אַרְבַּ֨ע מֵא֥וֹת אֶ֛לֶף אִ֖ישׁ שֹׁ֣לֵֽף חָ֑רֶב כׇּל־זֶ֖ה אִ֥ישׁ מִלְחָמָֽה׃
Translated: Those on Israel’s side—other than Benjamin—mustered 400,000 fighters, every one of them a warrior.
Transliteration: veiysh yisherael hitefakedu levad mivineyamin areva mevot elef iysh sholef charev khׇl-zeh iysh milechamah

Hebrew: וַיָּקֻ֜מוּ וַיַּעֲל֣וּ בֵֽית־אֵל֮ וַיִּשְׁאֲל֣וּ בֵאלֹהִים֒ וַיֹּֽאמְרוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל מִ֚י יַעֲלֶה־לָּ֣נוּ בַתְּחִלָּ֔ה לַמִּלְחָמָ֖ה עִם־בְּנֵ֣י בִנְיָמִ֑ן וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יְהֹוָ֖ה יְהוּדָ֥ה בַתְּחִלָּֽה׃
Translated: They proceeded to Bethel and inquired of God; the Israelites asked, “Who of us shall advance first to fight the Benjaminites?” And G<small>OD</small> replied, “Judah first.”
Transliteration: vayakumu vayaalu veyt-el vayishealu velohiym vayomeru veney yisherael miy yaaleh-lanu vatechilah lamilechamah im-veney vineyamin vayomer yehovah yehudah vatechilah

Hebrew: וַיָּק֥וּמוּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בַּבֹּ֑קֶר וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ עַל־הַגִּבְעָֽה׃
Translated: So the Israelites arose in the morning and encamped against Gibeah.
Transliteration: vayakumu veney-yisherael vavoker vayachanu al-hagiveah

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵא֙ אִ֣ישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לַמִּלְחָמָ֖ה עִם־בִּנְיָמִ֑ן וַיַּעַרְכ֨וּ אִתָּ֧ם אִֽישׁ־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל מִלְחָמָ֖ה אֶל־הַגִּבְעָֽה׃
Translated: Israel’s side took the field against the Benjaminites; those on Israel’s side drew up in battle order against them at Gibeah.
Transliteration: vayetse iysh yisherael lamilechamah im-vineyamin vayaarekhu itam iysh-yisherael milechamah el-hagiveah

Hebrew: וַיֵּצְא֥וּ בְנֵי־בִנְיָמִ֖ן מִן־הַגִּבְעָ֑ה וַיַּשְׁחִ֨יתוּ בְיִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֗וּא שְׁנַ֨יִם וְעֶשְׂרִ֥ים אֶ֛לֶף אִ֖ישׁ אָֽרְצָה׃
Translated: But the Benjaminites issued from Gibeah, and that day they struck down 22,000 of the Israelites.
Transliteration: vayetseu veney-vineyamin min-hagiveah vayashechiytu veyisherael vayyvom hahu shenayiim veesheriym elef iysh aretsah

Hebrew: וַיִּתְחַזֵּ֥ק הָעָ֖ם אִ֣ישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיֹּסִ֙פוּ֙ לַעֲרֹ֣ךְ מִלְחָמָ֔ה בַּמָּק֕וֹם אֲשֶׁר־עָ֥רְכוּ שָׁ֖ם בַּיּ֥וֹם הָרִאשֽׁוֹן׃
Translated: Now the army—Israel’s side—rallied and again drew up in battle order at the same place as they had on the first day.
Transliteration: vayitechazek haam iysh yisherael vayosifu laarokhe milechamah vamakvom asher-arekhu sham vayyvom harishvon

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲל֣וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל וַיִּבְכּ֣וּ לִפְנֵי־יְהֹוָה֮ עַד־הָעֶ֒רֶב֒ וַיִּשְׁאֲל֤וּ בַֽיהֹוָה֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר הַאוֹסִ֗יף לָגֶ֙שֶׁת֙ לַמִּלְחָמָ֔ה עִם־בְּנֵ֥י בִנְיָמִ֖ן אָחִ֑י וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יְהֹוָ֖ה עֲל֥וּ אֵלָֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated: For the Israelites had gone up and wept before G<small>OD</small> until evening. They had inquired of G<small>OD</small>, “Shall we again join battle with our kinsmen the Benjaminites?” And G<small>OD</small> had replied, “March against them.”
Transliteration: vayaalu veney-yisherael vayivekhu lifeney-yehovah ad-haerev vayishealu vayhovah lemor havosiyf lageshet lamilechamah im-veney vineyamin achiy vayomer yehovah alu elayv {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרְב֧וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל אֶל־בְּנֵ֥י בִנְיָמִ֖ן בַּיּ֥וֹם הַשֵּׁנִֽי׃
Translated: The Israelites advanced against the Benjaminites on the second day.
Transliteration: vayikerevu veney-yisherael el-veney vineyamin vayyvom hasheniy

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵא֩ בִנְיָמִ֨ן <small>׀</small> לִקְרָאתָ֥ם <small>׀</small> מִֽן־הַגִּבְעָה֮ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשֵּׁנִי֒ וַיַּשְׁחִ֩יתוּ֩ בִבְנֵ֨י יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל ע֗וֹד שְׁמֹנַ֨ת עָשָׂ֥ר אֶ֛לֶף אִ֖ישׁ אָ֑רְצָה כׇּל־אֵ֖לֶּה שֹׁ֥לְפֵי חָֽרֶב׃
Translated: But the Benjaminites came out from Gibeah against them on the second day and struck down 18,000 more of the Israelites, all of them fighters.
Transliteration: vayetse vineyamin <small></small> likeratam <small></small> min-hagiveah vayyvom hasheniy vayashechiytu viveney yisherael vod shemonat ashar elef iysh aretsah khׇl-eleh sholefey charev

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲל֣וּ כׇל־בְּנֵי֩ יִשְׂרָאֵ֨ל וְכׇל־הָעָ֜ם וַיָּבֹ֣אוּ בֵֽית־אֵ֗ל וַיִּבְכּוּ֙ וַיֵּ֤שְׁבוּ שָׁם֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה וַיָּצ֥וּמוּ בַיּוֹם־הַה֖וּא עַד־הָעָ֑רֶב וַֽיַּעֲל֛וּ עֹל֥וֹת וּשְׁלָמִ֖ים לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Then all the Israelites, all the army, went up and came to Bethel and they sat there, weeping before G<small>OD</small>. They fasted that day until evening, and presented burnt offerings and offerings of well-being to G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vayaalu khׇl-veney yisherael vekhׇl-haam vayavou veyt-el vayivekhu vayeshevu sham lifeney yehovah vayatsumu vayyvom-hahu ad-haarev vayaalu olvot ushelamiym lifeney yehovah

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁאֲל֥וּ בְנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בַּיהֹוָ֑ה וְשָׁ֗ם אֲרוֹן֙ בְּרִ֣ית הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים בַּיָּמִ֖ים הָהֵֽם׃
Translated: The Israelites inquired of G<small>OD</small> (for the Ark of God’s Covenant was there in those days,
Transliteration: vayishealu veney-yisherael vayhovah vesham arvon veriyt haElohim vayamiym hahem

Hebrew: וּ֠פִֽינְחָ֠ס בֶּן־אֶלְעָזָ֨ר בֶּֽן־אַהֲרֹ֜ן עֹמֵ֣ד ׀ לְפָנָ֗יו בַּיָּמִ֣ים הָהֵם֮ לֵאמֹר֒ הַאוֹסִ֨ף ע֜וֹד לָצֵ֧את לַמִּלְחָמָ֛ה עִם־בְּנֵֽי־בִנְיָמִ֥ן אָחִ֖י אִם־אֶחְדָּ֑ל וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ עֲל֔וּ כִּ֥י מָחָ֖ר אֶתְּנֶ֥נּוּ בְיָדֶֽךָ׃
Translated: and Phinehas son of Eleazar son of Aaron the priest ministered before [God] in those days), “Shall we again take the field against our kinsmen the Benjaminites, or shall we not?” G<small>OD</small> answered, “Go up, for tomorrow I will deliver them into your hands.”
Transliteration: ufiynechas ven-eleazar ven-aharon omed lefanayv vayamiym hahem lemor havosif vod latset lamilechamah im-veney-vineyamin achiy im-echedal vayomer yehovah alu khiy machar etenenu veyadekha

Hebrew: וַיָּ֤שֶׂם יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ אֹֽרְבִ֔ים אֶל־הַגִּבְעָ֖ה סָבִֽיב׃ {פ}
Translated: Israel set up ambushes against Gibeah on all sides.
Transliteration: vayashem yisherael oreviym el-hagiveah saviyv {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲל֧וּ בְנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל אֶל־בְּנֵ֥י בִנְיָמִ֖ן בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֑י וַיַּעַרְכ֥וּ אֶל־הַגִּבְעָ֖ה כְּפַ֥עַם בְּפָֽעַם׃
Translated: And on the third day, the Israelites went up against the Benjaminites, as before, and engaged them in battle at Gibeah.
Transliteration: vayaalu veney-yisherael el-veney vineyamin vayyvom hasheliyshiy vayaarekhu el-hagiveah khefaam vefaam

Hebrew: וַיֵּצְא֤וּ בְנֵֽי־בִנְיָמִן֙ לִקְרַ֣את הָעָ֔ם הׇנְתְּק֖וּ מִן־הָעִ֑יר וַיָּחֵ֡לּוּ לְהַכּוֹת֩ מֵהָעָ֨ם חֲלָלִ֜ים כְּפַ֣עַם ׀ בְּפַ֗עַם בַּֽמְסִלּוֹת֙ אֲשֶׁ֨ר אַחַ֜ת עֹלָ֣ה בֵֽית־אֵ֗ל וְאַחַ֤ת גִּבְעָ֙תָה֙ בַּשָּׂדֶ֔ה כִּשְׁלֹשִׁ֥ים אִ֖ישׁ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: The Benjaminites dashed out to meet the army and were drawn away from the town onto the roads, of which one runs to Bethel and the other to Gibeah. As before, they started out by striking some of the troops dead in the open field, about 30 of the Israelites.
Transliteration: vayetseu veney-vineyamin likerat haam hׇneteku min-haiyr vayachelu lehakhvot mehaam chalaliym khefaam vefaam vamesilvot asher achat olah veyt-el veachat giveatah vashadeh khisheloshiym iysh veyisherael

Hebrew: וַיֹּֽאמְרוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י בִנְיָמִ֔ן נִגָּפִ֥ים הֵ֛ם לְפָנֵ֖ינוּ כְּבָרִֽאשֹׁנָ֑ה וּבְנֵ֧י יִשְׂרָאֵ֣ל אָמְר֗וּ נָנ֙וּסָה֙ וּֽנְתַקְּנ֔וּהוּ מִן־הָעִ֖יר אֶל־הַֽמְסִלּֽוֹת׃
Translated: The Benjaminites thought, “They are being routed before us as previously.” But the Israelites had planned: “We will take to flight and draw them away from the town to the roads.”
Transliteration: vayomeru veney vineyamin nigafiym hem lefaneynu khevarishonah uveney yisherael ameru nanusah unetakenuhu min-haiyr el-hamesilvot

Hebrew: וְכֹ֣ל ׀ אִ֣ישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל קָ֚מוּ מִמְּקוֹמ֔וֹ וַיַּעַרְכ֖וּ בְּבַ֣עַל תָּמָ֑ר וְאֹרֵ֧ב יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל מֵגִ֥יחַ מִמְּקֹמ֖וֹ מִמַּ֥עֲרֵה גָֽבַע׃
Translated: And while everyone else on Israel’s side had moved away from their positions and had drawn up in battle order at Baal-tamar, the Israelite ambush was rushing out from its position at Maareh-geba.
Transliteration: vekhol iysh yisherael kamu mimekvomvo vayaarekhu vevaal tamar veorev yisherael megiycha mimekomvo mimaareh gava

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֩אוּ֩ מִנֶּ֨גֶד לַגִּבְעָ֜ה עֲשֶׂ֩רֶת֩ אֲלָפִ֨ים אִ֤ישׁ בָּחוּר֙ מִכׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְהַמִּלְחָמָ֖ה כָּבֵ֑דָה וְהֵם֙ לֹ֣א יָדְע֔וּ כִּי־נֹגַ֥עַת עֲלֵיהֶ֖ם הָרָעָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: Thus 10,000 of the best troops from all Israel came to a point south of Gibeah, and the battle was furious. Before they realized that disaster was approaching,
Transliteration: vayavou mineged lagiveah asheret alafiym iysh vachur mikhׇl-yisherael vehamilechamah khavedah vehem lo yadeu khiy-nogaat aleyhem haraah {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּגֹּ֨ף יְהֹוָ֥ה <small>׀</small> אֶֽת־בִּנְיָמִן֮ לִפְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵל֒ וַיַּשְׁחִ֩יתוּ֩ בְנֵ֨י יִשְׂרָאֵ֤ל בְּבִנְיָמִן֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֔וּא עֶשְׂרִ֨ים וַחֲמִשָּׁ֥ה אֶ֛לֶף וּמֵאָ֖ה אִ֑ישׁ כׇּל־אֵ֖לֶּה שֹׁ֥לֵֽף־חָֽרֶב׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small> routed the Benjaminites before Israel. That day the Israelites slew 25,100 of the Benjaminites, all of them fighters.
Transliteration: vayigof yehovah <small></small> et-vineyamin lifeney yisherael vayashechiytu veney yisherael vevineyamin vayyvom hahu esheriym vachamishah elef umeah iysh khׇl-eleh sholef-charev

Hebrew: וַיִּרְא֥וּ בְנֵֽי־בִנְיָמִ֖ן כִּ֣י נִגָּ֑פוּ וַיִּתְּנ֨וּ אִֽישׁ־יִשְׂרָאֵ֤ל מָקוֹם֙ לְבִנְיָמִ֔ן כִּ֤י בָֽטְחוּ֙ אֶל־הָ֣אֹרֵ֔ב אֲשֶׁר־שָׂ֖מוּ אֶל־הַגִּבְעָֽה׃
Translated: Then the Benjaminites realized that they were routed. Now the rest of Israel’s side had yielded ground to the Benjaminites, for they relied on the ambush that they had laid against Gibeah.
Transliteration: vayireu veney-vineyamin khiy nigafu vayitenu iysh-yisherael makvom levineyamin khiy vatechu el-haorev asher-shamu el-hagiveah

Hebrew: וְהָאֹרֵ֣ב הֵחִ֔ישׁוּ וַֽיִּפְשְׁט֖וּ אֶל־הַגִּבְעָ֑ה וַיִּמְשֹׁךְ֙ הָאֹרֵ֔ב וַיַּ֥ךְ אֶת־כׇּל־הָעִ֖יר לְפִי־חָֽרֶב׃
Translated: One ambush quickly deployed against Gibeah, and the other ambush advanced and put the whole town to the sword.
Transliteration: vehaorev hechiyshu vayifeshetu el-hagiveah vayimeshokhe haorev vayakhe et-khׇl-haiyr lefiy-charev

Hebrew: וְהַמּוֹעֵ֗ד הָיָ֛ה לְאִ֥ישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל עִם־הָאֹרֵ֑ב הֶ֕רֶב לְהַעֲלוֹתָ֛ם מַשְׂאַ֥ת הֶעָשָׁ֖ן מִן־הָעִֽיר׃
Translated: A time had been agreed upon by the rest of Israel’s side with those in ambush: When a huge column of smoke was sent up from the town,
Transliteration: vehamvoed hayah leiysh yisherael im-haorev herev lehaalvotam masheat heashan min-haiyr

Hebrew: וַיַּהֲפֹ֥ךְ אִֽישׁ־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בַּמִּלְחָמָ֑ה וּבִנְיָמִ֡ן הֵחֵל֩ לְהַכּ֨וֹת חֲלָלִ֤ים בְּאִֽישׁ־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ כִּשְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים אִ֔ישׁ כִּ֣י אָֽמְר֔וּ אַךְ֩ נִגּ֨וֹף נִגָּ֥ף הוּא֙ לְפָנֵ֔ינוּ כַּמִּלְחָמָ֖ה הָרִאשֹׁנָֽה׃
Translated: the rest of Israel’s side was to turn about in battle. Benjamin had begun by striking dead about 30 men on Israel’s side, and they thought, “They are being routed before us as in the previous fighting.”
Transliteration: vayahafokhe iysh-yisherael vamilechamah uvineyamin hechel lehakhvot chalaliym veiysh-yisherael khisheloshiym iysh khiy ameru akhe nigvof nigaf hu lefaneynu khamilechamah harishonah

Hebrew: וְהַמַּשְׂאֵ֗ת הֵחֵ֛לָּה לַעֲל֥וֹת מִן־הָעִ֖יר עַמּ֣וּד עָשָׁ֑ן וַיִּ֤פֶן בִּנְיָמִן֙ אַחֲרָ֔יו וְהִנֵּ֛ה עָלָ֥ה כְלִיל־הָעִ֖יר הַשָּׁמָֽיְמָה׃
Translated: But when the column, the pillar of smoke, began to rise from the city, the Benjaminites looked behind them, and there was the whole town going up in smoke to the sky!
Transliteration: vehamasheet hechelah laalvot min-haiyr amud ashan vayifen vineyamin acharayv vehineh alah kheliyl-haiyr hashamayemah

Hebrew: וְאִ֤ישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ הָפַ֔ךְ וַיִּבָּהֵ֖ל אִ֣ישׁ בִּנְיָמִ֑ן כִּ֣י רָאָ֔ה כִּֽי־נָגְעָ֥ה עָלָ֖יו הָרָעָֽה׃
Translated: And now Israel’s side turned about, and Benjamin’s side was thrown into panic, for they realized that disaster had overtaken them.
Transliteration: veiysh yisherael hafakhe vayivahel iysh vineyamin khiy raah khiy-nageah alayv haraah

Hebrew: וַיִּפְנ֞וּ לִפְנֵ֨י אִ֤ישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ אֶל־דֶּ֣רֶךְ הַמִּדְבָּ֔ר וְהַמִּלְחָמָ֖ה הִדְבִּיקָ֑תְהוּ וַֽאֲשֶׁר֙ מֵהֶ֣עָרִ֔ים מַשְׁחִיתִ֥ים אוֹת֖וֹ בְּתוֹכֽוֹ׃
Translated: They retreated before Israel’s force along the road to the wilderness, where the fighting caught up with them; meanwhile those from the towns were massacring them in it.
Transliteration: vayifenu lifeney iysh yisherael el-derekhe hamidevar vehamilechamah hideviykatehu vaasher meheariym mashechiytiym votvo vetvokhvo

Hebrew: כִּתְּר֤וּ אֶת־בִּנְיָמִן֙ הִרְדִיפֻ֔הוּ מְנוּחָ֖ה הִדְרִיכֻ֑הוּ עַ֛ד נֹ֥כַח הַגִּבְעָ֖ה מִמִּזְרַח־שָֽׁמֶשׁ׃
Translated: They encircled the Benjaminites, pursued them, and trod them down [from] Menuhah to a point opposite Gibeah on the east.
Transliteration: khiteru et-vineyamin hirediyfuhu menuchah hideriykhuhu ad nokhach hagiveah mimizerach-shamesh

Hebrew: וַֽיִּפְּלוּ֙ מִבִּנְיָמִ֔ן שְׁמֹנָֽה־עָשָׂ֥ר אֶ֖לֶף אִ֑ישׁ אֶת־כׇּל־אֵ֖לֶּה אַנְשֵׁי־חָֽיִל׃
Translated: That day 18,000 of the Benjaminites fell, all of them brave men.
Transliteration: vayifelu mivineyamin shemonah-ashar elef iysh et-khׇl-eleh aneshey-chayiil

Hebrew: וַיִּפְנ֞וּ וַיָּנֻ֤סוּ הַמִּדְבָּ֙רָה֙ אֶל־סֶ֣לַע הָרִמּ֔וֹן וַיְעֹלְלֻ֙הוּ֙ בַּֽמְסִלּ֔וֹת חֲמֵ֥שֶׁת אֲלָפִ֖ים אִ֑ישׁ וַיַּדְבִּ֤יקוּ אַֽחֲרָיו֙ עַד־גִּדְעֹ֔ם וַיַּכּ֥וּ מִמֶּ֖נּוּ אַלְפַּ֥יִם אִֽישׁ׃
Translated: They turned and fled to the wilderness, to the Rock of Rimmon; but [the Israelites] picked off another 5,000 on the roads and, continuing in hot pursuit of them up to Gidom, they slew 2,000 more.
Transliteration: vayifenu vayanusu hamidevarah el-sela harimvon vayeoleluhu vamesilvot chameshet alafiym iysh vayadeviyku acharayv ad-gideom vayakhu mimenu alefayiim iysh

Hebrew: וַיְהִי֩ כׇל־הַנֹּ֨פְלִ֜ים מִבִּנְיָמִ֗ן עֶשְׂרִים֩ וַחֲמִשָּׁ֨ה אֶ֥לֶף אִ֛ישׁ שֹׁ֥לֵֽף חֶ֖רֶב בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֑וּא אֶת־כׇּל־אֵ֖לֶּה אַנְשֵׁי־חָֽיִל׃
Translated: Thus the Benjaminite fighters who fell that day numbered 25,000, all of them brave men.
Transliteration: vayehiy khׇl-hanofeliym mivineyamin esheriym vachamishah elef iysh sholef cherev vayyvom hahu et-khׇl-eleh aneshey-chayiil

Hebrew: וַיִּפְנ֞וּ וַיָּנֻ֤סוּ הַמִּדְבָּ֙רָה֙ אֶל־סֶ֣לַע הָרִמּ֔וֹן שֵׁ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת אִ֑ישׁ וַיֵּֽשְׁבוּ֙ בְּסֶ֣לַע רִמּ֔וֹן אַרְבָּעָ֖ה חֳדָשִֽׁים׃
Translated: But 600 others turned and fled to the wilderness, to the Rock of Rimmon; they remained at the Rock of Rimmon four months.
Transliteration: vayifenu vayanusu hamidevarah el-sela harimvon shesh mevot iysh vayeshevu vesela rimvon arevaah chodashiym

Hebrew: וְאִ֨ישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל שָׁ֣בוּ אֶל־בְּנֵ֤י בִנְיָמִן֙ וַיַּכּ֣וּם לְפִי־חֶ֔רֶב מֵעִ֤יר מְתֹם֙ עַד־בְּהֵמָ֔ה עַ֖ד כׇּל־הַנִּמְצָ֑א גַּ֛ם כׇּל־הֶעָרִ֥ים הַנִּמְצָא֖וֹת שִׁלְּח֥וּ בָאֵֽשׁ׃ {פ}
Translated: Those on Israel’s side, meanwhile, turned back to the rest of the Benjaminites and put them to the sword—towns, people, cattle—everything that remained. Finally, they set fire to all the towns that were left.
Transliteration: veiysh yisherael shavu el-veney vineyamin vayakhum lefiy-cherev meiyr metom ad-vehemah ad khׇl-hanimetsa gam khׇl-heariym hanimetsavot shilechu vaesh {f}

Hebrew: וְאִ֣ישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל נִשְׁבַּ֥ע בַּמִּצְפָּ֖ה לֵאמֹ֑ר אִ֣ישׁ מִמֶּ֔נּוּ לֹא־יִתֵּ֥ן בִּתּ֛וֹ לְבִנְיָמִ֖ן לְאִשָּֽׁה׃
Translated: Now Israel’s side had taken an oath at Mizpah: “None of us must ever give his daughter in marriage to a Benjaminite.”
Transliteration: veiysh yisherael nisheva vamitsefah lemor iysh mimenu lo-yiten vitvo levineyamin leishah

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֤א הָעָם֙ בֵּֽית־אֵ֔ל וַיֵּ֤שְׁבוּ שָׁם֙ עַד־הָעֶ֔רֶב לִפְנֵ֖י הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים וַיִּשְׂא֣וּ קוֹלָ֔ם וַיִּבְכּ֖וּ בְּכִ֥י גָדֽוֹל׃
Translated: The people came to Bethel and sat there before God until evening. They wailed and wept bitterly,
Transliteration: vayavo haam veyt-el vayeshevu sham ad-haerev lifeney haElohim vayisheu kvolam vayivekhu vekhiy gadvol

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ לָמָ֗ה יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל הָ֥יְתָה זֹּ֖את בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל לְהִפָּקֵ֥ד הַיּ֛וֹם מִיִּשְׂרָאֵ֖ל שֵׁ֥בֶט אֶחָֽד׃
Translated: and they said, “O E<small>TERNAL</small> God of Israel, why has this happened in Israel, that one tribe must now be missing from Israel?”
Transliteration: vayomeru lamah yehovah elohey yisherael hayetah zot veyisherael lehifaked hayyvom miyisherael shevet echad

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ מִֽמׇּחֳרָ֔ת וַיַּשְׁכִּ֣ימוּ הָעָ֔ם וַיִּבְנוּ־שָׁ֖ם מִזְבֵּ֑חַ וַיַּעֲל֥וּ עֹל֖וֹת וּשְׁלָמִֽים׃ {פ}
Translated: Early the next day, the people built an altar there, and they brought burnt offerings and offerings of well-being.
Transliteration: vayehiy mimׇchorat vayashekhiymu haam vayivenu-sham mizevecha vayaalu olvot ushelamiym {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּֽאמְרוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל מִ֠י אֲשֶׁ֨ר לֹא־עָלָ֧ה בַקָּהָ֛ל מִכׇּל־שִׁבְטֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל אֶל־יְהֹוָ֑ה כִּי֩ הַשְּׁבוּעָ֨ה הַגְּדוֹלָ֜ה הָיְתָ֗ה לַ֠אֲשֶׁ֠ר לֹא־עָלָ֨ה אֶל־יְהֹוָ֧ה הַמִּצְפָּ֛ה לֵאמֹ֖ר מ֥וֹת יוּמָֽת׃
Translated: The Israelites asked, “Is there anyone from all the tribes of Israel who failed to come up to the assembly before G<small>OD</small>?” For a solemn oath had been taken concerning anyone who did not go up to G<small>OD</small> at Mizpah: “He shall be put to death.”
Transliteration: vayomeru veney yisherael miy asher lo-alah vakahal mikhׇl-shivetey yisherael el-yehovah khiy hashevuah hagedvolah hayetah laasher lo-alah el-yehovah hamitsefah lemor mvot yumat

Hebrew: וַיִּנָּֽחֲמוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֶל־בִּנְיָמִ֖ן אָחִ֑יו וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ נִגְדַּ֥ע הַיּ֛וֹם שֵׁ֥בֶט אֶחָ֖ד מִיִּשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: The Israelites now relented toward their kin the Benjaminites, and they said, “This day one tribe has been cut off from Israel!
Transliteration: vayinachamu veney yisherael el-vineyamin achiyv vayomeru nigeda hayyvom shevet echad miyisherael

Hebrew: מַה־נַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה לָהֶ֛ם לַנּוֹתָרִ֖ים לְנָשִׁ֑ים וַאֲנַ֙חְנוּ֙ נִשְׁבַּ֣עְנוּ בַֽיהֹוָ֔ה לְבִלְתִּ֛י תֵּת־לָהֶ֥ם מִבְּנוֹתֵ֖ינוּ לְנָשִֽׁים׃
Translated: What can we do to provide wives for those who are left, seeing that we have sworn by G<small>OD</small> not to give any of our daughters to them in marriage?”
Transliteration: mah-naasheh lahem lanvotariym lenashiym vaanachenu nishevaenu vayhovah leviletiy tet-lahem mivenvoteynu lenashiym

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ מִ֗י אֶחָד֙ מִשִּׁבְטֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֲשֶׁ֛ר לֹא־עָלָ֥ה אֶל־יְהֹוָ֖ה הַמִּצְפָּ֑ה וְ֠הִנֵּ֠ה לֹ֣א בָא־אִ֧ישׁ אֶל־הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֛ה מִיָּבֵ֥ישׁ גִּלְעָ֖ד אֶל־הַקָּהָֽל׃
Translated: They inquired, “Is there anyone from the tribes of Israel who did not go up to G<small>OD</small> at Mizpah?” Now no one from Jabesh-gilead had come to the camp, to the assembly.
Transliteration: vayomeru miy echad mishivetey yisherael asher lo-alah el-yehovah hamitsefah vehineh lo va-iysh el-hamachaneh miyaveysh gilead el-hakahal

Hebrew: וַיִּתְפָּקֵ֖ד הָעָ֑ם וְהִנֵּ֤ה אֵֽין־שָׁם֙ אִ֔ישׁ מִיּוֹשְׁבֵ֖י יָבֵ֥שׁ גִּלְעָֽד׃
Translated: For, when the roll of the troops was taken, not one of the inhabitants of Jabesh-gilead was present.
Transliteration: vayitefaked haam vehineh eyn-sham iysh miyyvoshevey yavesh gilead

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלְחוּ־שָׁ֣ם הָעֵדָ֗ה שְׁנֵים־עָשָׂ֥ר אֶ֛לֶף אִ֖ישׁ מִבְּנֵ֣י הֶחָ֑יִל וַיְצַוּ֨וּ אוֹתָ֜ם לֵאמֹ֗ר לְ֠כ֠וּ וְהִכִּיתֶ֞ם אֶת־יוֹשְׁבֵ֨י יָבֵ֤שׁ גִּלְעָד֙ לְפִי־חֶ֔רֶב וְהַנָּשִׁ֖ים וְהַטָּֽף׃
Translated: So the assemblage dispatched 12,000 of the warriors, instructing them as follows: “Go and put the inhabitants of Jabesh-gilead to the sword, women and children included.
Transliteration: vayishelechu-sham haedah sheneym-ashar elef iysh miveney hechayiil vayetsauu votam lemor lekhu vehikhiytem et-yvoshevey yavesh gilead lefiy-cherev vehanashiym vehataf

Hebrew: וְזֶ֥ה הַדָּבָ֖ר אֲשֶׁ֣ר תַּעֲשׂ֑וּ כׇּל־זָכָ֗ר וְכׇל־אִשָּׁ֛ה יֹדַ֥עַת מִשְׁכַּב־זָכָ֖ר תַּחֲרִֽימוּ׃
Translated: This is what you are to do: Proscribe every male, and every woman who has known a man carnally.”
Transliteration: vezeh hadavar asher taashu khׇl-zakhar vekhׇl-ishah yodaat mishekhav-zakhar tachariymu

Hebrew: וַֽיִּמְצְא֞וּ מִיּוֹשְׁבֵ֣י ׀ יָבֵ֣ישׁ גִּלְעָ֗ד אַרְבַּ֤ע מֵאוֹת֙ נַעֲרָ֣ה בְתוּלָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֧ר לֹא־יָדְעָ֛ה אִ֖ישׁ לְמִשְׁכַּ֣ב זָכָ֑ר וַיָּבִ֨אוּ אוֹתָ֤ם אֶל־הַֽמַּחֲנֶה֙ שִׁלֹ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֖ר בְּאֶ֥רֶץ כְּנָֽעַן׃ {פ}
Translated: They found among the inhabitants of Jabesh-gilead 400 maidens who had not known a man carnally; and they brought them to the camp at Shiloh, which is in the land of Canaan.
Transliteration: vayimetseu miyyvoshevey yaveysh gilead areva mevot naarah vetulah asher lo-yadeah iysh lemishekhav zakhar vayaviu votam el-hamachaneh shiloh asher veerets khenaan {f}

Hebrew: וַֽיִּשְׁלְחוּ֙ כׇּל־הָ֣עֵדָ֔ה וַֽיְדַבְּרוּ֙ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י בִנְיָמִ֔ן אֲשֶׁ֖ר בְּסֶ֣לַע רִמּ֑וֹן וַיִּקְרְא֥וּ לָהֶ֖ם שָׁלֽוֹם׃
Translated: Then the whole community sent word to the Benjaminites who were at the Rock of Rimmon, and offered them terms of peace.
Transliteration: vayishelechu khׇl-haedah vayedaveru el-veney vineyamin asher vesela rimvon vayikereu lahem shalvom

Hebrew: וַיָּ֤שׇׁב בִּנְיָמִן֙ בָּעֵ֣ת הַהִ֔יא וַיִּתְּנ֤וּ לָהֶם֙ הַנָּשִׁ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר חִיּ֔וּ מִנְּשֵׁ֖י יָבֵ֣שׁ גִּלְעָ֑ד וְלֹא־מָצְא֥וּ לָהֶ֖ם כֵּֽן׃
Translated: Thereupon the Benjaminites returned, and they gave them the maidens who had been spared from the women of Jabesh-gilead. But there were not enough of them.
Transliteration: vayashׇv vineyamin vaet hahiy vayitenu lahem hanashiym asher chiyyu mineshey yavesh gilead velo-matseu lahem khen

Hebrew: וְהָעָ֥ם נִחָ֖ם לְבִנְיָמִ֑ן כִּֽי־עָשָׂ֧ה יְהֹוָ֛ה פֶּ֖רֶץ בְּשִׁבְטֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Now the people had relented toward Benjamin, for G<small>OD</small> had made a breach in the tribes of Israel.
Transliteration: vehaam nicham levineyamin khiy-ashah yehovah ferets veshivetey yisherael

Hebrew: וַיֹּֽאמְרוּ֙ זִקְנֵ֣י הָֽעֵדָ֔ה מַה־נַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה לַנּוֹתָרִ֖ים לְנָשִׁ֑ים כִּֽי־נִשְׁמְדָ֥ה מִבִּנְיָמִ֖ן אִשָּֽׁה׃
Translated: So the elders of the community asked, “What can we do about wives for those who are left, since the women of Benjamin have been killed off?”
Transliteration: vayomeru zikeney haedah mah-naasheh lanvotariym lenashiym khiy-nishemedah mivineyamin ishah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ יְרֻשַּׁ֥ת פְּלֵיטָ֖ה לְבִנְיָמִ֑ן וְלֹא־יִמָּחֶ֥ה שֵׁ֖בֶט מִיִּשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: For they said, “There must be a saving remnant for Benjamin, that a tribe may not be blotted out of Israel;
Transliteration: vayomeru yerushat feleytah levineyamin velo-yimacheh shevet miyisherael

Hebrew: וַאֲנַ֗חְנוּ לֹ֥א נוּכַ֛ל לָתֵת־לָהֶ֥ם נָשִׁ֖ים מִבְּנוֹתֵ֑ינוּ כִּֽי־נִשְׁבְּע֤וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר אָר֕וּר נֹתֵ֥ן אִשָּׁ֖ה לְבִנְיָמִֽן׃ {ס}
Translated: yet we cannot give them any of our daughters as wives,” since the Israelites had taken an oath: “Cursed be anyone who gives a wife to Benjamin!”
Transliteration: vaanachenu lo nukhal latet-lahem nashiym mivenvoteynu khiy-nisheveu veney-yisherael lemor arur noten ishah levineyamin {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֡וּ הִנֵּה֩ חַג־יְהֹוָ֨ה בְּשִׁל֜וֹ מִיָּמִ֣ים ׀ יָמִ֗ימָה אֲשֶׁ֞ר מִצְּפ֤וֹנָה לְבֵֽית־אֵל֙ מִזְרְחָ֣ה הַשֶּׁ֔מֶשׁ לִ֨מְסִלָּ֔ה הָעֹלָ֥ה מִבֵּֽית־אֵ֖ל שְׁכֶ֑מָה וּמִנֶּ֖גֶב לִלְבוֹנָֽה׃
Translated: They said, “The annual feast of G<small>OD</small> is now being held at Shiloh.” (It lies north of Bethel, east of the highway that runs from Bethel to Shechem, and south of Lebonah.)
Transliteration: vayomeru hineh chag-yehovah veshilvo miyamiym yamiymah asher mitsefvonah leveyt-el mizerechah hashemesh limesilah haolah miveyt-el shekhemah uminegev lilevvonah

Hebrew: (ויצו) [וַיְצַוּ֕וּ] אֶת־בְּנֵ֥י בִנְיָמִ֖ן לֵאמֹ֑ר לְכ֖וּ וַאֲרַבְתֶּ֥ם בַּכְּרָמִֽים׃
Translated: So they instructed the Benjaminites as follows: “Go and lie in wait in the vineyards.
Transliteration: (vytsv) [vayetsauu] et-veney vineyamin lemor lekhu vaaravetem vakheramiym

Hebrew: וּרְאִיתֶ֗ם וְ֠הִנֵּ֠ה אִם־יֵ֨צְא֥וּ בְנוֹת־שִׁילוֹ֮ לָח֣וּל בַּמְּחֹלוֹת֒ וִֽיצָאתֶם֙ מִן־הַכְּרָמִ֔ים וַחֲטַפְתֶּ֥ם לָכֶ֛ם אִ֥ישׁ אִשְׁתּ֖וֹ מִבְּנ֣וֹת שִׁיל֑וֹ וַהֲלַכְתֶּ֖ם אֶ֥רֶץ בִּנְיָמִֽן׃
Translated: As soon as you see the daughters of Shiloh coming out to join in the dances, come out from the vineyards; let each of you seize a wife from among the daughters of Shiloh, and be off for the land of Benjamin.
Transliteration: ureiytem vehineh im-eitseu venvot-shiylvo lachul vamecholvot viytsatem min-hakheramiym vachatafetem lakhem iysh ishetvo mivenvot shiylvo vahalakhetem erets vineyamin

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֡ה כִּֽי־יָבֹ֣אוּ אֲבוֹתָם֩ א֨וֹ אֲחֵיהֶ֜ם (לרוב) [לָרִ֣יב ׀] אֵלֵ֗ינוּ וְאָמַ֤רְנוּ אֲלֵיהֶם֙ חׇנּ֣וּנוּ אוֹתָ֔ם כִּ֣י לֹ֥א לָקַ֛חְנוּ אִ֥ישׁ אִשְׁתּ֖וֹ בַּמִּלְחָמָ֑ה כִּ֣י לֹ֥א אַתֶּ֛ם נְתַתֶּ֥ם לָהֶ֖ם כָּעֵ֥ת תֶּאְשָֽׁמוּ׃ {ס}
Translated: And if their fathers or brothers come to us to complain, we shall say to them, ‘Be generous to them for our sake! We could not provide any of them with a wife on account of the war, and you would have incurred guilt if you yourselves had given them [wives].’”
Transliteration: vehayah khiy-yavou avvotam vo acheyhem (lrvv) [lariyv ] eleynu veamarenu aleyhem chׇnunu votam khiy lo lakachenu iysh ishetvo vamilechamah khiy lo atem netatem lahem khaet teeshamu {s}

Hebrew: וַיַּֽעֲשׂוּ־כֵן֙ בְּנֵ֣י בִנְיָמִ֔ן וַיִּשְׂא֤וּ נָשִׁים֙ לְמִסְפָּרָ֔ם מִן־הַמְּחֹלְל֖וֹת אֲשֶׁ֣ר גָּזָ֑לוּ וַיֵּלְכ֗וּ וַיָּשׁ֙וּבוּ֙ אֶל־נַ֣חֲלָתָ֔ם וַיִּבְנוּ֙ אֶת־הֶ֣עָרִ֔ים וַיֵּשְׁב֖וּ בָּהֶֽם׃
Translated: The Benjaminites did so. They took to wife, from the dancers whom they carried off, as many as they themselves numbered. Then they went back to their own territory, and rebuilt their towns and settled in them.
Transliteration: vayaashu-khen veney vineyamin vayisheu nashiym lemisefaram min-hamecholelvot asher gazalu vayelekhu vayashuvu el-nachalatam vayivenu et-heariym vayeshevu vahem

Hebrew: וַיִּתְהַלְּכ֨וּ מִשָּׁ֤ם בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ בָּעֵ֣ת הַהִ֔יא אִ֥ישׁ לְשִׁבְט֖וֹ וּלְמִשְׁפַּחְתּ֑וֹ וַיֵּצְא֣וּ מִשָּׁ֔ם אִ֖ישׁ לְנַחֲלָתֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated: Thereupon the Israelites dispersed to their own tribes and clans; everyone departed for their own territory.
Transliteration: vayitehalekhu misham veney-yisherael vaet hahiy iysh leshivetvo ulemishefachetvo vayetseu misham iysh lenachalatvo {f}

Hebrew: בַּיָּמִ֣ים הָהֵ֔ם אֵ֥ין מֶ֖לֶךְ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אִ֛ישׁ הַיָּשָׁ֥ר בְּעֵינָ֖יו יַעֲשֶֽׂה׃
Translated: In those days there was no king in Israel; everyone did as they pleased.
Transliteration: vayamiym hahem eyn melekhe veyisherael iysh hayashar veeynayv yaasheh
